Everyone is back in this character-driven and delightfully charming tale and I can’t wait to see what new opportunities and adventures will present itself to Ella Mae and the people of Havenwood in the next book in this wonderfully terrific series.

I was really excited about trying this after reading other reviews, but it seemed a little weak. We have a small apartment with old renters' smoke smell clinging to to the walls, even after installing new carpet and painting every room. We only used one room shocker in the main room. This room seems to have most of the smoke residue removed. We had it open and treating the room for about 3 days. After throwing the treatment away, the faint chlorine smell disappeared. The main room seems to have a better smell right around where the room shocker was, but the other side of the room still smells like smoke, albeit better than before. I think we will buy these again, but next time put two in each room, on each side of the room. From all the warnings and having to be out of the house during the duration of the treatment, I assumed it would be a powerful, overwhelming change. It wasn't this strong--next time I would put several out around the house while we were away for the treatment to be more effective.

This air mattress exceeded our expectations. The pump is so simple and has a nice storage dish for the cord. It inflated fully in about 3 minutes. It's nice and tall off the floor and the top is soft and sturdy material. My fitted Queen sheets fit it snuggly, there's a groove around the base for sheets to cling to, so we didn't have the bedding slipping off during the night. It is surprisingly comfy! You can add or deflate air to make it as soft or hard as you prefer. My husband opted to sleep on the mattress instead of our own bed the night after our guests left because he could fill it up to make a super firm bed for his back (he thinks our usual mattress is too soft). Deflating was quick and easy--I just switched the panel to 'deflate' and in 3 minutes, the entire mattress was flat and compressed, ready to be folded and slipped into the storage bag they provided. It's small enough to stick in the cupboard with some of our other storage items. This is one of the best purchases we've ever made, and I think it will last a long time, it seems to be made of very durable materials.

Great reviews, easy setup for WLAN or LAN with good connectivity, quiet and efficient while printing, and doesn't install all the garbage and updating software that HP does. We've had it for about 6 months now and there's never been a hiccup. I love black and white printers because there's minimal waste and you know ink isn't being wasted to print black when you forget to toggle the settings.You only need to buy one ink cartridge--as opposed to sometimes 4 with color printers--when it's empty and they run about $50 on Amazon. However, the ink cartridge of "500" prints is vastly over-exaggerating, but I don't care. Also it will tell you it can't print 3/4 through but if you go online with the IP address you can easily fix it.Would highly recommend and will buy another Brother when we need a color printer.

Recently ran out of the ink provided with the Brother Printer HL 2270DW with it's (questionable) 500-page ink cartridge,so we bought this one as a replacement. Arrived promptly, well packaged (came in a thermal sleeve to protect--I assume--from temperature vacillations,and also came with postage to send our old cartridge back. I thought that clever to think of the consumer AND recycling their product, where both point to a responsible business. I'll be ordering this again after 2500 (hopefully not-so-questionable) prints.

I bought my wife a pack of Scharffen Berger for her birthday even though a few of the reviews warned of poor packaging/delivery and a disappointingly average taste. However, one of my teachers raved about it so we had to give it a try. Before eating it, we read all about how they preserve the older chocolate-making traditions so that the chocolate keeps all the subtle flavors it inherently has--which put us both in a hungry mood! And we LOVED it. The chocolate is the healthy medium between brittle and soft. Also, there are so many  subtle, citrus-y flavors in the chocolate bar, we easily devoured three bars in two days!! The chocolate bars are about half a centimeter thick, 3 in x 8 in rectangles, patterned into easily breakable triangles that don't quite fit into your mouth for one bite. The most wonderful part of eating this chocolate is how nibbling only a small amount of the chocolate triangle releases a big taste, enabling you to enjoy small pieces for longer.The flavor is not quite American and not quite European, but you definitely have to try it at least once!

What you need if you order this break pad: 1) Allen wrenches: in order to tighten the pad in place; 2) an understanding of brake replacement: there are no instructions; 3) A sense of humor: there're four pieces to help fill the empty space between the brake and the wheel but it was already tight on my road bike so I had to stack all four on the outside of the brake chassis BECAUSE it so happens that the screw threads only go down so far (horrible idea for brake pad design). The first time I tightened it--with my hands, I might add, not Allen wrenches--one of the four plastic spacers had already cracked.The brakes work well enough but they could've simplified the design a lot to aid in installment and the four spacers should've been made out of metal rather than out of a cheap plastic; nevertheless, they are appropriately priced so I gave them a 3/5.

Living in Korea, we didn't have a dryer, so we bought two of these and kept them out in the mudroom. Now, in Philly, the clothes stay damp in the dryer we have (due to the humidity?? Probably just the old dryer dying...). So this was a cheap, practical way dry our clothes without driving to the laundromat. It's well-made and light. I keep it folded down behind the closet door, and then set it out by the window when in use. One drying rack will only hold about one load of laundry, so if you plan on long-term use for drying ALL your clothes, you'll need two.  It will last you FOREVER. The ones we had in Korea were years old and still in perfect condition.

I love this scent and was very happy and surprised when my husband bought me a brand new, beautiful bottle for Christmas. This perfume is a grown-up, lightly floral, romantic scent. If your lady likes sweet, but not over-powering smells, she'll like this. It makes me feel fresh and beautiful. High-quality, scent warms to the skin, subtle and perfect.

I've always used Tide detergent, happily. So when I  noticed these boosters at the store, I was eager to try them. However, they failed to have any effect on the brightness of our laundry. Also, they don't completely dissolve and leave bits of white debris on the clothes. I have a top loader washer. I used the boost packs with Tide detergent. I tried them on colored loads, white loads, large loads, small loads. It was a waste of money. They didn't work and they left messes in my washer and in my clothes.

Robert Newton Peck wrote A Day No Pigs Would Die as a tribute to his father in a fictional auto-biographical style where he is a young farm boy in Vermont. His father, Haven Peck, a slow, pious farmer, slaughters pigs in order to supplement his meager income as a farmer; however, he slowly gets sicker and sicker. Meanwhile, young Robert fills his bright childhood days roving, exploring, avoiding chores, and playing with his newly-acquired piglet, Pinky. The excitement of Robert’s innocent life is enabled only by an active imagination and appreciation for the world’s beauty while his life is also punctuated by jarring events that teach him of life’s harshness. One such event is a horrible winter where food for the family runs scarce and Pinky might be the only option. You need to read it to find out what happens!The book’s length runs around 170 pages, but even though it’s slim, the book introduces rich characters with poignant dialogue. Haven Peck, the father, is one of my favorite characters since he so beautifully portrays a noble farmer—perhaps in another age or circumstance he would be Scipio. He’s a character who beautifies humility, which is a welcome relief to our modern day obsession with success.You can read this book in a day and then want to reread it a week later because there’s a lot of ruminating and insights into your own personal life. My wife and I reread it every year! It’s perfect for teenagers and those who are impressionable and need a solid foundation to build a life on, but all persons can learn from it.

Leonardo DiCaprio stars in the blockbuster “Inception,” set in a semi-futuristic world where the subconscious is accessible even to those who want to cause harm. He plays the role of an “extractor,” someone who enters people’s dreams to take information without them knowing, and is put up to the unheard of challenge to deposit, instead of steal, an idea.“Inception” presents a variation on a Matrix theme where the mind houses a perhaps preferable abode than reality. Despite some big names like DiCaprio to advertise the movie, there is considerable fodder for thought about topics like dreams, reality, time, and the power of thoughts. The movie ends up more action than cerebral—and kind of unreal, GI Joe action sequences as well—to cover all possible viewer preferences. Fortunately though, the fun doesn’t detract from the insight and stops your mind from day-dreaming about the gravity of Inception’s “reality.”

A gut-wrenching tale of harsh reality colliding with childhood, “Kid with a Bike” presents a young boy who is abandoned by his neglectful father; the heartache comes from the fact that the boy still believes his father is a hero and attempts to reconcile with him at all costs, never accepting his father’s desertion, believing only that other people are keeping them apart.Initially, the boy resolutely searches for his missing father and bicycle. Along the way he meets a warm woman who somehow feels his pain and his sincerity. After witnessing the father refuse any communication with the boy, she agrees to adopt him. Nevertheless, true to the maxim “There’s no rest for the weary” a neighborhood boy of poor reputation sucks the orphan-like kid in by lavishing him with almost patriarchal favors and attention. This scenario threatens his new-fangled peace with the woman who patiently cares for him despite his acting out. Only the viewer can see how the neighborhood boy wields friendship as a lever for crime. You’ll have to watch the rest to see how it resolves!Poignant themes resound throughout of family vs. peers and anger vs. forgiveness while the ultimate question posed is: Can a broken child be mended?Beautifully acted and the boy actor does a tremendous job characterizing how the detrimental seed of neglect grows inside youth. I highly recommend this movie to all who like to feel a character’s plight instead of just observe.

A friend of mine used to say "Poor people cannot afford to be cheap." Well... it's true. This charger might be deemed "affordable" by some, but it really is CHEAP.Battery chargers should be 2-3x more expensive than this one for one sufficient reason: fires. However, I gave this charger 3/5 because I'm using it: A. as little as possible while my new laptop is arriving and I have to do homework and B. I'm keeping a close eye on the heat of the charger and my laptop. I initially left my T400 charging for half an hour and it resulted in my laptop fan running on all cylinders (which it has never done before even during demanding video games) and the charger itself climbing to the temperatures of a lizard's hot rock. On the plus side, it charges my laptop quickly.So NEVER LEAVE CHARGER PLUGGED INTO THE WALL UNATTENDED (not just your laptop!) if you have to buy this battery charger for a quick fix. As a permanent replacement, NEVER use this battery charger and the subsequent rating would be 0/5.

Axis and Allies is one of the ultimate military games because it so smoothly integrates probability into strategy—whereas Risk has a measure of strategy but it’s ultimately a matter of luck whether you win a battle or not. It is (mostly) a matter of preparation and insight in Axis and Allies... the dice simply makes it interesting. In this version it is three Allies (US, UK, Russia) against the Axis (Germany, Japan). Other versions exist where Italy is an additional Axis power.This is the real genius of Axis and Allies: the dice is rolled for a unit to hit another unit (e.g. tanks attack on a 3 so rolling a 3, 2, or 1 is a hit) so attacker and defender roll for hits and then choose which units take the hits. On top of that, units attack and defend at different rolls. Within the waging of war, the player must weigh the advantage of units within the imminent battle, the difference in attack/defense (e.g. bombers attack on a 4 but defend on a 1 whereas tanks attack and defend on a 3) and the production cost of the unit.As for history, Axis and Allies tries to closely mimic the theaters of war in the European and Pacific zones during 1941 (WWII). The game setup urges players to actually initiate those decisive battles: Nazis try to take Moscow for production points, Japanese attack Pearl Harbor in Hawaii because of an exposed ship.I never liked probability based games as a kid—Monopoly, Yahtzee, card games—so playing Axis and Allies would’ve been a great opportunity as a child.If you like Stratego, Settlers of Catan, or Risk, you’ll thoroughly enjoy this game. However setup and gameplay is fairly advanced and scenario-dependent with lots of subtleties specific to battles so make sure prospective players are ready to commit to learning and are also patient (perhaps ages 11+) . Additionally, game play can take up to four hours, especially when beginning, so set aside a chunk of time and make sure you play between two meals like lunch and dinner!

I waited so long for "You Will Be My Son" to come to the U.S. and I was NOT disappointed!!!!Summary: A father continues a successful international wine business when his grown son believes he is under-appreciated and under-utilized. The son is ready for more responsibility--in hopes for taking over the business one day--but the father sees only shortcomings and disaster. A neighbor down the road (who works for the father) contracts cancer, which fetches his son from America. In an odd twist, the neighbor's son excels in the wine industry (although he is not yet established), which the wealthy father notices. I won't mention anything else since the developments are fascinating!Reflection: I've never seen a movie broach the balance between family and business before, and it does a wonderful job showing the perversity of rejecting family for business. The Gilles Legrand's fictional lesson is well-timed in this modern era where one might find posthumous renown/success in industry more alluring than success in the family unit. Of course (like in a lot of French cinema), the acting is phenomenal, and Lorant Deutsch (the wealthy father's son) powerfully portrays the passion and confusion boiling in a neglected son. The themes require honest reflection and digestion. Well worth watching. And buying :)

I loved these knight figures as a kid! I called them "Munchkin Knights" and had a collection of about 40. The arms are the only move-able parts, and the figures are fun-looking because you can only see their noses.Kids between 5 and 11 really enjoy them, and I have to hide them every time a kid goes to my parents house. These knights are so rare now because they were discontinued and replaced with a newer generation of knights which are smaller (unfortunately). My collection--after 25 years or so--is still in good condition so the figures are extremely durable although the paint wears off after a while; especially with hard playing.Although the price is a little steep, it might be appropriate since you can't find them anywhere else!

For the average, non-tech savvy young professional, Motorola's Surfboard cable modem has worked great. I refuse to pay money to a cable company to rent (e.g. Comcast charges $5/mth), so I went out and purchased a modem and router. (I was nervous about buying a modem/router combo because of the expensive) Installation/setup was a quick transition by the cable guy, and I bought a Netgear router for wireless access as well. Streaming, downloading, online classes all work fine. There have been a few connection problems but they are ALWAYS the routers fault and as long as you're patient and have an ethernet cable nearby, it's fine.If you want more dependability and speed, then maybe a more expensive machine'd work; but I don't see what more you could want from a modem as an average internet user...

For the average, non-tech savvy young professional, Netgear has worked out well. I bought a modem since I don't want to pay the $5/mth fee to rent, and I like the modem/router I purchased. Now there are a lot of people unhappy with the Netgear N300, and it's understandable--knocks you off, sometimes bad connection, daily resets, etc. But honestly, if I'm patient and have an ethernet cable nearby when it lags, I have no problems. There are two on/off buttons (one for power and the other for wifi), but I'd be wary resetting the machine a lot. People include it in their daily routine when if you simply wait it out or use the ethernet cable, it resolves itself.A few circumstances worsen the connectivity with the router. I've noticed that Apple products don't mix well with PC products on the router, too many products jam the connectivity (a collection of iPad, iPhone, laptops, desktops), and the connection varies with products: I have an older Lenovo laptop (loses wireless connection three times a week) and my wife has an Asus (loses connection once a month). Although I haven't noticed a difference in signal if it is positioned horizontal or vertical.If you live an intense life where not a moment can be wasted without wireless, don't get a Netgear. If you can wait a few bugs out and not explode at a cheaper machine in a market dominated by high prices, it's a good deal.

No complaints: good lube requiring only a few drops into the spokes. I had a lot of rust accumulating and it was all gone after one application. Costs a little bit more than I would hope for a simple lube. Try it out.

I'm not an avid bicycler, but I do commute to school everyday (16 miles total) in a densely populated, and therefore dirty, area. The winter's arriving so I wanted new tires, andI was also tired of replacing tubes since my other tires weren't thick enough for the urban debris. After all the rave reviews, I thought this tire could possibly save me if I were drowning so I gave it a try.I have replaced tires before, but NOTHING came close to the level of difficulty of putting these tires on the rims. I initially thought I ordered the wrong tire but that wasn't it. It took an hour and a half to successfully wrench the tires onto the rim--deploying sundry metal items as levers since the classic plastic tire levers weren't working--and two busted tubes as I tried to fit them on with the tire and the tire pinched a hole in them from the tight fit. After letting the tires stretch for a while, it still was just as difficult to put the tires on the rim in order to replace the tubes.Nevertheless, the inauspicious beginning ended, and I love the new tires. I, out of necessity, must sometimes ride over garbage and glass, and these tires don't flinch. Rain, no problem. Uneven gravely roads, no worries. Good traction even though it's a simple design. And the best part: Made in Germany. I love German quality (I lived there for a while), and these tires have already proven themselves. However, the winter and ice are yet to come, so I might amend my review in a few months time...

"The Intouchables" (as titled in the U.S.) is a French movie about the magic that ensues when two individuals open up to each other--especially diametrically opposite individuals. Neither one leads his dream life and initially focuses on present unhappiness. However, Philippe, a wealthy quadriplegic, hires a black ex-criminal, Driss, to serve as his hands after a spate of highly-educated Frenchmen fail to meet Philippe's true need: humanity. Driss, uneducated yet fun-loving, pulls Philippe into a "baser" but more thrilling mentality of adventure and excitement; in essence, Driss leads Philippe back to living, rather than waiting out, life. Despite some vulgar language (it's an adolescent to adult movie after all!), the movie pulls off an emotive, artistic and personal effect to leave my wife and me rejoicing in the healing capabilities of the human spirit.

I heard about Kraft Recipe Makers via several crock-pot blogs, so I decided to try it. I was delighted how tasty our meal turned out! It's very simple: there are two sauces inside. You put a chuck beef roast in your crock-pot, pour in marinading sauce, then let your house fill up with the wonderful aromas (it's a vinegar-y, spice smell--my husband loves it). Afterwards, the meat falls apart upon shredding, it's so tender. Then you add the second sauce, which is a tangy BBQ sauce. My husband usually doesn't like beef roast, he thinks it's dry; he loved this dish and said it was very moist and delicious. For dinner, we put the finished meat on potato rolls with coleslaw (it's a Southern thing!). We later made it for a group of teenage girls from church, and THEY loved it, and devoured it. Since then, I've tried a few of the other Recipe Makers line, but this one is by far the best. Now I stock a few boxes in the pantry and keep a couple frozen beef roasts in the freezer; when there's a craving, I take one out and thaw it overnight for the next day. This meal is quick, easy and equally flavorful and satisfying.Made life easier, and everyone's definitely full and happy!

I didn't buy this toaster on Amazon but at BB&B for $20-25 and although it is the same series(PS77401), it doesn't look like the toaster pictured here. It was a quick, uninformed buy and my wife and I LOVE it. For us, it toasts bread perfectly at a 2 (haven't used all the fancy other functions). The ONLY complaint is the obligatory burnt plastic smell when you first use a toaster.From the reviews though, it seems this is not an actual PS77401, but do go to BB&B to buy one because it was well worth it. Therefore, the horrible rating is from this product and NOT the PS77401 you can buy at BB&B.

I'm an adult (mid-20's) learning the violin without a violin teacher, and I've really enjoyed this book. A lot of foundational information is covered: parts of violin, 1st position notes on all strings, notes, and simple conventions for violin playing. The authors selected initially very rudimentary pieces and progress to somewhat more exciting pieces like "Simple Gifts." Practicing about an hour a day I got through the book in 2-3 weeks when I then switched to Suzuki. So you won't need the book for long!Essential Elements instilled confidence early on as I progressed through songs and played along with the music CDs. I would heartily recommend to all beginners but make sure the internet's available for some questions unaddressed in the work book.

Initially skeptical and wary, I switched over from a more expensive brand because I moved to the city and will have more popped tubes with the glass and uneven roads around every corner (had one just last month). The tire inflated easily and are staying functional after 5 day a week usage (appx. 2 hours a day). Awesome replacement from more expensive, and I like the longer heads of the presta nozzle because they are easier to notice and work with for me. Shipped quickly as well. One surprise, though, is that sometimes the inner viscous fluid will ooze out after inflating the tire.

Small torx (6lobe) wrench with 4 inserts having two sides each (8 total sizes as described above). Inserts easy to interchange yet solid placement for higher torque (I used it to open my wife's laptop for some problems). Open top of wrench for storage of the 3 unused inserts.I bought it only recently and already admire its simplicity and usefulness. I tend to put too much force behind wrenches but this one handles it well since the screws and the heads didn't show ANY signs of stripping. Good buy but go to Home Depot for exact wrench for less than six dollars...hence the 4/5 rating.

Just recently used Netters Atlas 5e for my block of anatomy during first year of medical school. Lots of medical schools require this book for medical with good reason: it's comprehensive, it's detailed, it's easy to understand, and there's NO TEXT, only labelling; so it's an awesome resource--second only to the cadaver. Anatomical relationships also wonderfully depicted. I had the option to order Netters in an undergraduate anatomy class but, specifically for me, I'm glad I didn't. There's a lot of information and unless you have a class to point out relationships (like anastomoses) you might not quite appreciate the amount of effort and knowledge that went into some of the pictures/plates. There is perhaps minor discussion on a few details between my school and what's portrayed in Netters but, like said, it's minor. If you're in undergraduate and really thirsting after something more detailed and complex, then it would be a good purchase (it's relatively cheap on Amazon); however, even if you aren't quite driven to learn outside of class it will be useful for medical school and a career in medicine later on!

Since I'm a college student, I need close and far vision for about 12 hours a day and the length of use coupled with the generic rub solution (like Opti-Free) caused an unnatural itchy, bloodshot look in my eyes. Optometrist said I need to improve my eye care and eventually bought the Clear Care kind to try out. After only a week of use, a noticeable difference occurred: eyes felt healthier, looked healthier, and no irritation present throughout my 5-days-a-week-for-12-hour use. In fact, I have 2-week contacts but I make sure to let them soak well overnight (and also use my glasses a bit more) and have comfortable contacts for up to 2 months--though I wouldn't suggest that money-saving tactic to all.Look at Clear Care if you want a good contact solution. However, if you want to save money, and you use your contacts sparingly this kind is OK.

I use this product for:-greasing a pan when baking cakes or cookies-grilling chicken or veggies in a skillet-as a substitution for butter in pasta recipes and saladsThe coconut flavor is slight; you won't notice it much at all. It's very healthy for you and EASY to use--I keep mine on the counter next to the stove because I use it every time I cook.The nozzle gets clogged if you don't use it frequently--check before you spray! A quick run under warm water unclogs it easily and it will spray straight and clean again.Highly recommended.

I buy the same product from bhphotovideo.com. It's $14.50, plus about $4 shipping. One Twin Pack gets you two cartridges. Each cartridge has 10 film strips. So buying this product (on Amazon or at B&H) will get you 20 photos.

My mother is a boggl-a-holic, so I bought her the 5x5 "Big Boggle" last Christmas and she loves it. We found a greater variety of words during each round we played and challenged each other to find longer words than we ever had on the smaller version (we have a four-letter minimum in our house, even on the 4x4). Now married and living in another city, I inherited the 4x4. It felt constraining to downgrade! While we still enjoy playing, we miss the 5x5 for its capacity for longer words and more creative plays, while still being just as challenging.It's also easier for younger players to find more words they recognize. This means the kids feel involved, practice spelling words, and the adults still have fun searching for bigger words. They also like shaking the box in between rounds. It's a great game to play as a family.

One of my all time favorites; it's inspiring and insightful. Three brothers stem from a profligate hedonist, Fyodor Karamazov, who also happens to have accrued a fortune by his unscrupulous ways. The three brothers present three extremes: Alyosha, the kind, thoughtful and spiritually inclined brother; Dmitri, the rash and daring brother, who often erupts in paroxysms of passion; and Ivan, the cool, brilliant, yet severe-toward-man-and-himself brother. A surmised illegitimate son, Smerdyakov is the faint, patient and venomous brother. While all endeavor to discover their true character and life's expectations, Fyodor Karamazov is discovered dead and Dmitri looks conspicuously guilty...The detail of the characters elicits feelings of both awe and shame in the reader, which is important since we all have deeds to provoke those feelings as well. The plot teaches to see the good and hope for the best in all individuals. You want Dmitri to live even though he's famous for reveling in drink and orgies; you want Alyosha to find peace despite his unfaltering simplicity; you want Ivan to get the girl although he's dispassionate and self-deprecating. No matter how dismal society--or even the person himself--envisions the future, hope from one source can reignite the flame of life.Dostoevsky writes to match his historical name. His choice topics of science versus religion, sin, happiness, family, and love betoken his depth of thought since they remain relevant and lucid in our day of age. Clever plot line, realistic--though mentally demanding--repartee, famous anecdotes like the "Grand Inquisitor," and the Russian manner of discerning good and bad in all, The Brothers Karamazov has it all.Fyodor Dostoevsky provides a vision of what you can attain in this life--the consequences and the blessings. For me, it ultimately helped me see the gravity of what I choose to include or disregard in my own personality.

My husband likes a firm bed--I almost think he could sleep on the floor! I love a soft, plush, sink-into-a-million-pillows sleeping situation. This mattress is a good fit for the two of us.The foam on top of the springs allows my body to "sink" enough that I feel comfy.The springs give really good support for my husband and he says he's plenty comfortable. He prefers not to use a pillow with this mattress because he feels good, natural support from the mattress alone.We've been sleeping on it for a month and like it a lot. We paid $500, plus tax, with free delivery.

The board game of all board games, it is evidence of modern-day progress. The simplest analogy for the game's premise: where in Risk you take over the world through military might, in Settlers of Catan you take over through economic prowess. Involved are: trading, luck (from the die), strategy, and wisdom with money.Initially the game is for up to four players, and you build settlements, cities, and streets to earn points. The first player to reach the point value wins. Each settlement, city, or streets requires resource cards (Wood, Sheep, Wheat, Clay, and Stone) to buy, and you gain resource cards by building a settlement near a resource on the map (which has a number on it) and the die must role your number. It's a simple premise, learned in 10 minutes of playing, so even some children can play along--although there are children's editions to the game.I bought Settlers of Catan in Germany about five years ago and have played it regularly EVER SINCE. In addition to purchasable fifth and sixth players (brown and green), three expansions were developed to make the game continually exciting and interesting. Whenever I move to college or to home or to a travel for a while in a different country, I bring Settlers of Catan. You must acquire this game for a well-rounded life.

As a religious, politically skeptical--i.e. affiliated with no party--pro-Capitalist ephebe, I found myself either enlightened or cringing depending on what page of Atlas Shrugged lay before my eyes. Never before had such an inner conflict arisen in me by an author--except perhaps Nietzsche who, not surprisingly, influenced much of Ayn Rand's ideology. Yet the personal reaction and tumult, overall, delighted my curiosity and aided my understanding of a whole class of people in our society who zealously subscribe to Ayn Randish theories.The book follows the protagonist and train tycoon Dagny Taggart, and a cadre of business-minded super elite, who fight a demeaning, socialistic government intent on taking over all business models for personal gain. Weighing heavily in philosophy and economics, the novel introduces many of Rand's ideas, which function in a fictitious, primitive world but blatantly not this civilized one.Although the book earned my general approbation, there are many instances where I vehemently disagree with Rand--and her cohort who helped her write the book--and find her annoying or difficult. One main point of exasperation is her need to repeat. Rand displays repetition as the first weapon in her armament to the point of silliness and even embarrassment to the reader. This degree of inculcation would allow me to jokingly suggest cutting out and reading John Galt's speech--toward the end of the book--21 times and you'll have read Atlas Shrugged while also sparing muscle from lugging the voluminous entirety around. In her book, I also feel she's guilty of rewriting (American) history, inconsistently redefining prosaic words, and offending a mighty slew of persons--including intellectuals, government officials, the religiously affiliated, and liberals--to discomfit, or even anger, the majority of readers.On the other hand, her Nietzschean, anti-Communist, anti-religion (she sides with Nietzsche over anti-Communism here) thought experiment offers a fresh breath of man-celebrating air. It's a fight against atrophy, apathy with several "-pathies," entropy, and all other powers not focused on progress or self. Her reveling and admiration for man's work refreshes my taste for the world and what we can accomplish in it. It's true she over-exaggerates the beauty in competition, but she also produces salient opinions on work ethic. The ideas can resonate even in the most hopelessly and unapologetically liberal of Democrats. Of course, the fictional work also serves as a bulwark for modern-day Republicans--for example, distrust for press, accessibility of guns, and a dramatic apocalyptical end of the world if government gets too big.You will disagree with many ideas, but also agree with many. It's definitely worth reading for the few ideas you agree with and to understand your fellow business man's views--even if you find it unappealing.

I looked for a reliable, classy-looking Polaroid camera as a wedding reception guest book. After thorough research, I determined Instax was cheaper and just as reliable, if not more, than the new Polaroid instant cameras. Both cameras function similarly and use the same film; yet Instax has better reviews and is cheaper. The 8S has a few extra bells and whistles: a clip-on lens for close-up pictures, light/dark and indoor/outdoor settings, the mirror on the front of the camera, and two shutter buttons for either landscape or portrait photographs. Also, the lithium batteries are not hard to find for sale online; I haven't had to replace ours yet, but we know that availability and price would afford on inconvenience. I have loved it; it was perfect for the party and I still use it frequently. The film is fairly inexpensive, so we continue to use it. The pictures are the size of a credit card with white borders, and the camera comfortably fits in a small purse. On our honeymoon, the good quality allowed us to take pictures of us in front of landmarks and beautiful areas. Also, a little mirror resides on the front of the camera to facilitate quick self-portraits, which can be taped later into journals as keepsakes. Learning which lighting settings work best in certain conditions took some trial and error, but every picture turned out vintage-y and fun, so no film was wasted.One last word on durability: I didn't have the wrist strap around my arm and accidentally dropped the camera on a ceramic-tiled floor. The film flew out of the back of the camera, but nothing broke off or dented. The camera still looks great and functions optimally, and I only lost the top film, the rest of the cartridge still printed great pictures. That was a while ago, and I haven't had any problems at all!

My wife and I continuously return to Bananagrams for its originality and speed. Players are given several letters and make words out of the all the given existing letters upon which the player says, "Peel." Every player receives several new letter tiles until they are likewise used up in words and the player says, "Peel." The process continues until all the tiles from the draw pile are gone, when the first player to use all the letters says, "Bananagrams" instead of "Peel." Game over.The game requires quick problem solving, a wide vocabulary, the ability to adapt, and the ability to start over if you can't fit in the newly acquired tiles. It's lots of fun amongst two people or a large group of friends; it doesn't become boring; and it is fast if you have a hankering for a quick word game! Any family or guest-entertainer needs it!

Game over.The game requires quick problem solving, a wide vocabulary, the ability to adapt, and the ability to start over if you can't fit in the newly acquired tiles. It's lots of fun amongst two people or a large group of friends; it doesn't become boring; and it is fast if you have a hankering for a quick word game! Any family or guest-entertainer needs it!

The word game, by the way it looks and by the way it plays, resembles Bananagrams and Scrabble, yet is more simplistic and predictable--for older players at least. However, it could be a challenging and educational game for kids and individuals learning English. It allows some diversity in the gamut of word games, but my wife and I probably won't play it again until we have a four or five year old.

Now in my mid-twenties, I've used "Original Scent" Old Spice since I was fifteen. At times I've tried Old Spice's other scents, but this one is by far the best. Goes on clear, doesn't hurt if you sweat, doesn't stain, and all--yes, that's 100%--of my significant others have loved it and are bound to say at least once, "That's your smell" because of its unique yet fresh fragrance. Also, I play soccer and basketball frequently, and the deodorant has a way of smelling better the more you sweat. Go figure.I will probably never change my deodorant though, so it has my vote.

For most of my life I've used the Old Spice High Endurance Deodorant, so I tried the Classic / Original for kicks. It's not the worst experience had with a deodorant, but I won't buy it again. There's a strange acidic smell (it even sometimes hurts when you first apply it) and it's not meant for someone who sweats a lot like I do--hence the High Endurance I normally use. I'm a big proponent of High Endurance so try that kind.

NRGized USB 3.0 4-Port Portable Hub with 2-Foot USB 3.0 Cable - It is a lightweight, compact 4-Port Aluminum Hub.  It is very simple to use and doesn't require any software to use it.This is portable hub is lightweight and measures about 3.5 inches long and about 3/4 of an inch in diameter.  It is a classy silver looking design. There are 4 USB ports, which you will find two on each side.  The USB cord is already built into the hub and it can plug into your computer.  It is compatible with Windows XP or later and Mac OS x 10.6 or later computers.I tested this portable hub with two of my smartphones - my Samsung Note 4 and my HTC.  I have pictures below.  First, I plugged the portable hub into my Windows computer.  Then, I plugged my Samsung Note into the hub to see how it works. As soon as I plugged my Samsung Note into the portable hub, I noticed on my computer screen in the lower right corner a pop up message.  If you follow the easy to read manual, it will let you know what will take place once you plug the portable hub into your computer.  The message says, "Generic USB Hub - Device driver software installed successfully.  Then, I clicked COMPUTER under the START button on my computer and there I noticed "Stacy Perez (Galaxy Note4)" with my other hard disk drives.  I clicked on "Stacy Perez (Galaxy Note4)"  and it brought up every file that is on my smartphone.  For the heck of it, I clicked the folder that has my pictures and I took a picture which you can see below.I then decided to go ahead and plug into the portable hub my HTC smartphone.  Now, when I click on COMPUTER under the START button you will notice "HTC6435LVW" and "Stacy Perez (Galaxy Note4)".  Now, I can access the files from both devices on my computer without having to unplug one to view the other.Now, I see the real benefit of this portable hub.  Recently, my son needed to upgrade the amount of disk space on his PlayStation 4.  It was a real pain because he had about 500 gigs of gaming content on his PS4.  I had to buy a portable disk 1 TB to hold all of his gaming content while he manually upgraded the hard disk in his PS4, so he wouldn't lose it all.  Then, I was manually saving files to my computer and then moving the files to another place.  Well, if I would have had the portable 4-port hub I could have saved a TON of my time.  I spent way too much time unplugging a device and saving content to my computer and then plugging in another device to move it.  This 4--port portable hub would have given me access to the two devices without having to unplug one and plug in another and keep repeating the process.Seeing that I can see two devices at the same time on my computer, tells me this is going to be quite the valuable tool! This portable 4-port hub is giving you THREE extra USB ports.  You plug in the hub in one of your USB ports on your computer and it gives you 3 more!  I have my wireless mouse in one of my two front USB ports, so I technically have ONLY 1 useful and available USB port in the front of my computer.  NOW, I can plug the portable hub into my extra front USB port and having 4 at my disposable which is basically three extra ports.Now, I can plug in let's say my son's iPad into the portable hub, an external drive also int he portable hub and let's say one of our smart phones and access it ALL through my computer!  This hub can be plugged into PC's laptops and tablets.  No software or drivers needed. Just plug it in and you are ready to go.  Additionally, it will charge ALL the devices that are plugged into the hub.  My two smartphone are charging right now and the percentage's have increased.  So, basically you can charge up to 4 devices through the hub as long as it is plugged into a PC, table or laptop with your own charging cable plugged into your phone and the hub.From the product description:  "USB 3.0 saves on syncing time with data transfer rates of up to 5 Gbps (much faster than USB 2.0). Backward compatible with USB 2.0 and 1.1"  This is also what makes this an even more valuable device because your syncing time is much faster!I really hope I made this as easy to understand as possible!!  If you have any questions, feel free to ask me in the comments.Overall, this is valuable and useful tool that can add 3 extra USB ports utilizing while utilizing your open USB port on your computer.  I will get quite a bit of use out of this now moving forward.  I wish I new this existed before getting this now.  Highly recommend this 4-port hub.  The price is ABSOLUTELY perfect and very affordable!  This would make an excellent gift and addition to anyone that has a computer, laptop or tablet.  Would also make an excellent stocking stuffer!!!  received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

RFID Blocking Leather Wallet for Women is a well-made zip wallet.  The wallet is just gorgeous!  There are two zip pockets.  One is for change anything else as the pocket is pretty big. The other zip pocket is to hold 12 credit cards or bank cards!  This is lady's RFID wallet is made of genuine soft leather and made well.Nowadays, nothing is as bad as having your credit card number stolen while it is still in your possession.  There are electronic thieves that easily purchase these RFID machines and steal your RFID enabled credit card information.  RFID stands for Radio Frequency IDentification chips.  This is a serious problem, and I have personally become victim to it three times with my checking account bank card.  White honestly, I am tired of it!  I am tired of disputing with the bank charges that I clearly did not make.It was recently that I started hearing more about the RFID blocking wallets and became interested!  Any card that is easy susceptible to RFID thieves will likely have:  PayPass on MasterCards, payWave on Visa Cards, Zip on Discover Cards and  ExpressPay on American Express Cards.  Even many company ID cards have the chip.  Regardless, I protect ALL my credit cards, bank cards, driver's licence and anything else that has a strip or chip.You can easily test an RFID blocking sleeve or wallet by having the card you can use in the sleeve or wallet and try to swipe/scan/wave it.  Some gas pumps have this swiping/waving technology, some fast food, some employers and public transportation.  If you can wave your card in front of a scanner inside a RFID blocking sleeve or wallet and it doens't read it, you are good to go.  If it does read it, you may want to consider better RFID blocking protection.I tested this RFID wallet by having my gas card that I wave at the pump.  I waved it using the wallet with my card in it, and it didn't read it.  I was relieved!!!!  This is a good quality RFID blocking wallet and I highly recommend EVERYONE getting protected with good RFID blocking protection like this RFID wallet by Leopardd.  The price is very affordable and well worth the investment.  Think Christmas gifts and get your family and friends protected!  That is exactly what my friends and family are getting this holiday!  I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Armband with Headphones Organizer and Key Holder Apple 4.7" iPhone 6 is a nice quality made armband.  Not only do you get the armband, but you also get a microfiber cleaning cloth, too.I own a few different armbands and this is by far the better quality of all of the ones I have.  It is well made of quality material. The compartment size is just 5 4/5" x 2 7/8" x 1/2", so it can fit the iPhone 3 or 6S or even the Samsung 6 without an issue.  The armband is adjustable  to fit around 8-14 inches around the arm.  The material is very soft and durable.Overall, this is a very nice quality armband for the most recent smartphones like iPhone 6 or Samsung 6.  The price is pretty reasonable, too!  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Stainless Steel Flatware Sets, 25-piece, Service for 5 is really a great value flatware set!There are 25 pieces included in this set. There are 5 knives, 5 dinner forks, 5 salad/dessert forks and 5 teaspoons. Each type of flatware is comes separated in its own bag. The flatware is stainless steal and just simple looking, no design on them. These are sturdy and good quality overall.Overall, this is a really nice 25 piece, sturdy and simple flatware set to serve 5 people. They are dishwasher safe and should last a long time. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

2X LOHAS 4W Not-Dimmable GU10 LED Spotlight.Pack of 2 units LED Spotlight 4W GU10 Not-Dimmable, Soft White(3000K),35W Equivalent, 30 degree beam angle.Easy to use and produce sufficient amount of light for my living room spot lights.  They were very easy to install and a great value for the price,Personally, I have not had any issues with them after using for several weeks.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Manuka Lane Face Moisturizer Lift Cream with Anti Wrinkle and Anti Aging is an interesting moisturizer made of bee venom and Manuka honey and made in New Zealand. Product also has Jojoba oil in it as well as other natural oil ingredients.  This anti-aging moisturizer is recommend recommended to be used daily.It is interesting because supposedly bee venom will lightly stimulate your facial muscles to tighten and firm the skin.  This is the first time I have ever used a product with these two key ingredients, bee venom and Manuka honey.I have been using this moisturizer for a short time, and it does nicely absorb into the skin leaving it feel softer and healthier.  I look forward to long time using this product to see how it will change my skin for the better.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Gorgeous white 2 pack of Curtain Sheers!  Each panel is 108" x 108".These are pretty for a patio door or window!  Actually, we chose to use these in my daughters room to cover up her closet.  It is a perfect fit.  We had curtain type of thing in the past to cover her opened closet, but since we changed her room to black and white, these are PERFECT to cover her closet.  This way instead of using closet doors, we use the sheers and it works just as nice.  We may move the sheers to the patio door when we remove the vertical blinds!These are very pretty and because they are sheer and if on a window, it will let in enough light but cover the window to prevent people from seeing inside.Overall, the quality of these window sheers is really nice and will look gorgeous on any window or are even great as a closet covering like we are doing for right now.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Army Trucks Missile Launcher Defend Series 3 in 1 Building Blocks 89pc set Compatible to Lego Parts.  There are three different military vehicles in their own boxes, and each has about 30 pieces to build a neat looking military vehicle toy.These building toys are for ages 6+ and each has instructions for those who like to look at instructions.  Because each toy only has about 30 pieces, it really isn't complicated and looks easy to assemble.  Very simple quality to building blocks or LEGOS.  Once the military vehicles are assembled you can play with them because there are wheels on them.Overall, these are really a nice building toy for kids.  These would make excellent stocking stuffers or a great gift.  The price is very good for this quality of a building toy.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Cedarwood Essential Oil comes in a brown glass bottle (10ml). Natural Acres uses 100% pure Cedarwood oil. The bottle had a protective, plastic seal to protect the contents from tampering.Cedarwood Essential Oil can be used for Acne, arthritis, bronchitis, coughing, cystitis, dandruff, dermatitis and stress. This is based on my research, the ACTUAL benefits of the oils next to each name. Of course, you can always do your own research about this oil and its benefits, too. Plus, it is a good idea to research about any of them before applying anything directly to your skin or ingesting as it may or may not be recommended.Essential Oils can be used as follows, depending the type of oil it is:- Diffusers - This is what I use mixed with water to fill my room with the aroma.- Soaps- Perfumes- Massage Oils- Cleaning Products- Bath Oils- Wound Care- Skincare- Room Deodorizers- and more!Overall, this Cedarwood Essential Oil is a 100% pure product contained in a brown, glass bottle. The price is pretty comparable to other essential oils being sold on the market. I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Ozeri BP01K CardioTech Pro Series Digital Blood Pressure Monitor with Heart Health and Hypertension Indicator.  I like that this is compact and doesn't take up much space. I have a blood pressure monitor where you wrap it around your arm and have to plug it in.  This particular wrist cuff blood pressure monitor is compact and can easily be stored.I wasn't sure how accurate a wrist blood pressure cuff would be compared to a typical arm cuff, but when comparing the two, they pretty much came up with the same readings.  What is nice about the wrist cuff is that it doesn't suffocate your wrist like the arm one does.This Digital Blood Pressure Monitor comes with the monitor, the plastic storage case, 2 AA batteries and the manual.This digital blood pressure monitor is easy to use.  Once you put the cuff on your wrist where the digital display is facing on the inside of your wrist and you have your wrist relaxed, you push the on button.  In just a couple of minutes it will read your blood pressure and heartbeat.  This device holds up to 180 readings with date and time or for two people 90 per person.  If someone has an irregular heartbeat, it will detect it too.Overall, this is an accurate digital blood pressure monitor that I have compared with an existing arm cuff.  The price is very reasonable compared to other ones I have seen at my local stores.  This is a compact and effective device.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a really nice PS4 vertical charging stand with cooling fan.  Anyone who has a PS4, to help preserve the life of the PS4, this is an affordable option to help preserve it!When I saw this product, I was very interested because I know these consoles can overheat and get ruined.  My son did just that with his laptop.  Unfortunately because he left it on all the time and ruined his laptop because he didn't use some sort of cooling fan or something.Out of any of his consoles or electronic gadgets, his PS4 is his prized possession and he doesn't like to leave it on when not in use at all.I knew he would be thrilled if I purchased this vertical stand with a cooling fan for his PS4. When it arrived, he was excited!!!  This little stand can do a lot!Once, you put your PS4 on the stand, you can plug the USB cable that is attached to the stand into the PS4.  There is an ON/OFF button that you can control and turn it on when you want.  When you turn it on, the cooling fans turn on.  He said you can turn it on when you start hearing the PS4 getting louder or when you are using the PS4, turn on the cooling fans.  I told him it makes more logical sense to turn the fans on WHEN he turn son the PS4 so it doesn't get to the point of getting louder and overheating.The stand is also a place you can plug your wireless controllers in for charging.  It holds up to two controllers and effectively charges the controllers.Not only is this a nice stand to keep your PS4 cooled, your game controllers charged, but it is also a space safer.  This saves my son space on his messy desk.  He now has extra space to load on his desk because of the PS4 standing vertical.Overall, we highly recommend this PS4 vertical stand with cooling fans.  It is not only VERY afforably-priced but it saves space, keeps your PS4 cooled and is a holding and charging place for game controllers.  If you have or know someone who has a PS4, this is a great investment!  The company sent me this product directly from their warehouse.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

UberPower by NRGized Flat Multi-Color Premium Lightning to USB Cable [Apple MFi Certified] 3ft  - Excellent quality Apple MFi Certified charging cable!I love this Apple MFi Certified charging cable!  I love the color stripes and that it stands out.  It is a flat cable that is 3 feet long.  This cable is compatiable with most Apple devices like the iPhone 6 / 6 Plus / 5s / 5c / 5, iPad Air / Air 2, iPad mini / mini 2 / mini 3, iPad (4th generation), iPod nano (7th generation), and iPod touch (5th generation).This works perfectly with my kids iPhone 6 phones and my son's iPad.  It charges quickly without any issues.  The issue is both my kids want this cool looking Apple flat multi-colored lighting cable!Overall, it is a high-quality charging cable that is compatible with most Apple devices.  It is unique and perfect for anyone or would even make a nice unique gift or stocking stuffer.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

ZealSound HDE-100 In-ear Noise-isolating Wood Headphones with Mic, Fiber Cable -Black are very nice quality headphones.  With these headphones you get the headphones, three soft silicone ear tips, cord clip, carrying pouch and the manual.  It is great these are compatible with the iPhone and iPad as this is what my son will be using them with.We in my househould have always loved in-ear noise-isolating wood headphones. The quality of the sound is really crisp and clear.  For the music my son listens too, he said the sound quality is good. My son in particular only likes these types of headphones versus wireless and other types of corded headphones.  The silicone ear tips are comfortable and do not fall out of the ears.We have reviewed a lot of different kinds of headphones over time and these are better than many we have tested.  For the price of under $22, you can't beat it!  Locally, I have spent $20 on other headphones that didn't last or didn't have the wood quality like these.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

iPhone 6s Case - This case is made by Mosiso and is a red vintage looking book style.The iPhone just snaps into the right side securely and the case can be used as a stand for the phone.  This is more of a decorative type of case and is not one that would protect the phone if it were to be dropped by accident.Overall, it is a nice quality leather book style case that has a vintage look.  Mosiso, in general has high-quality products.  For this type of product the price is reasonably competitive.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

iPhone 6s Case, HaloVa® High Quality Aluminum Bumper Case Hollow Design Full Signal Metal Frame Cover Smooth Skin for iPhone 6s 4.7" - GoldI got this for my daughter's iphone.  It is elegant, delicate and pretty on the phone without any doubt.  But, it is not a quick process to install.  There are two frame pieces, 4 tiny screws and the small Allen wrench.  It wasn't quite what I expected.  My daughter was a bit nervous about it scratching her phone because of the metal frame.  She was more assured when she saw there was cushion on the inside of the frame.While they say it is a bumper case, which really is beautiful on the phone, I am not sure this is a great case for a teenager because my teen tends to drop her phone occasionally and I question how well it would protect her phone from the screen cracking or any internal damage.  This would be nice for sure for someone who is an adult and takes care of their phone.  My daughter thought it was beautiful on her phone but me as a parent prefers her to use a shock absorbent case that will protect her phone if it drops.Overall, it is a really nice bumper metal frame cover and does highlight the iPhone.  The price is reasonable, but probably can be a little less because of what you are getting.  I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

One of my favorite authors of all time is Neil Gaiman, and the first book of his that I read was Stardust. The story of fairy-like gypsies takes a backseat to the main story line in his book, but with Quickbane, they are front and center in the form of Pyxies. The horse-loving, nomadic people have magic weaved into their culture so deeply that it is second nature to them and they cannot be separated from it, and I love how the author immerses us into the culture of their kind so completely, that we understand the character motivations from the start.Jesobel Vine has been chosen since birth for a destiny she has no idea she's a part of. She and her horse, Firefly, are kindred spirits that were even born on the same day. Together they have a connection that makes them inseparable. If you are a horse-lover, this book will definitely draw you in with the relationship created between Jesobel and Firefly. Luckily, I'm a horse lover as well as a lover of Fantasy, and this intricately woven story grabbed me from the beginning and left me wanting more. This will be a series to watch for!

4.5 Stars - Spiritual warfare, demon-possession, and romance wrapped up in a sci-fi/Fantasy multiverse that was surprisingly easy to follow. I am a reader who loves good characters and a romance that makes sense. This book makes the reader care instantly for the characters and makes their romance perfectly understandable and intense quickly. Although the book is not billed for romance, and is full of action-packed scenes, the romance dominated at least the first half of the book for me, so female audiences should enjoy that aspect. The author did a great job of keeping things mysterious and slowly unfolding each element of the story so that the reader wasn't bogged down with huge info-dumps. Overall, this is a fun read and I'll be looking for the sequel.

4.5 Stars. What starts out as a contemporary apocalyptic novel takes a sharp turn toward dark fantasy with unexpected twists and turns that will make the reader's head spin. A fun read in an environment that I want to learn more about - but ugh! The cliffhangers...hurry up with Harvesting #2 already!

Nora is older than she looks, but she still remembers how to live and how to love. But that’s the problem. The one she gave her heart to tore it from her chest in a horrid betrayal, and just when she starts putting her life back together, the facade of her world shatters like thin ice.Soulless is a promising start to a YA Paranormal. It’s mysteries will keep you guessing and turning pages. There is non-stop action and plenty of hormone-charged romance. Overall it’s a fun read that builds an interesting world of Wardens and Hunters who battle each other in our realm while living in their own worlds. The author does a good job of keeping things simple and is a gentle guide through this multi-dimensional dark fantasy. Consider making this one your next read!

A great starting point for authors who don't already know Twitter, linked in, Google plus, Facebook pages. Not much info to glean if you're pretty savvy already. Creative chapter titles though. Love how each network is likened to a great literary figure.

Is there any color more vibrant than blue? And is there any character more vivid? In this urban fantasy novel, Blue starts out rough and bitter, jaded by the whole world — so for most young people who have grown up during this “Great Recession,” she’s very easy to relate to. But her character is much more complex than that, and when she meets Kasey, not only does she start to open up, time literally stops.This gradually unfolding story will draw you in and keep the pages turning, the characters are both interesting and charismatic. They will make you feel like they are long lost friends instead of just characters in the story. YA readers will find the underpinning of the story both recognizable as a thread common among the generation today and original enough to stand on its own. Once the last page turns, you’ll be watching the clock for the next book!

4.5 Stars - A band of unlikely characters must learn to band together in this mixture of fantasy and dystopian. The characters have to learn who they can trust, and the importance of each person in their group. For those who love a strong Christian worldview with their fantasy, with the addition of the oppressive governing structure of a dystopian society will enjoy this book immensely. Fans of Hunger Games and LOTR would not be disappointed by picking this one up.

I was blessed with being one of the first readers of this novella. It is a short but emotional tale about a young couple struggling with the emotional turmoil and changes that had to occur immediately after the bombing of Pearl Harbor. This time period is especially fascinating. I love that this book stands fine on its own, but is a perfect companion for the series.

I only just recently heard that bees have become endangered. Because the bee is beneficial to the environment, and necessary to farmers, the government (at least here in Virginia) is offering start up bee keepers a stipend for setting up hives. We have seriously been considering doing this to lend a hand in helping these fascinating and much-needed creatures. So when I saw this book available to review, I jumped in, hoping for an entertaining and possibly educational read.I was spot on.Honey Queen is one of the most original reads I’ve had the pleasure of reviewing in a while. The story weaves in enough greek/roman mythology to make fans of Percy Jackson squeal like a fan girl, especially those who would have liked a little romance with their demi-god story. Overall, this was a highly fun, quick read with enough mystery to keep the reader guessing and turning pages!

It's so difficult to find a clean romance, even in the YA Genre, that is interesting, believable, and and not based on appearances. But Beth Honeycutt succeeds. In this well written story, we have a dreamy (literally) new boy who sets his sites on shy, reserved Ellie, even as all the most popular and pretty girls in school throw themselves at him. But why? Why does he give Ellie his complete and focused attention?And why does he keep reminding her of the imaginary friend she's had since she was little?As the story unfolds, we discover a love based on true emotional security rather than lust or love at first sight. This is the sort of love that grows slowly over time as people learn to trust one another with their hearts...and is rare among hormone-driven teens. The sort of love that changes people for the better and gives them confidence. Highly recommended read, particularly for any insecure teen.

Marah and Nathan have no idea what they are getting into when they move into their new home. And no one seems willing to tell them. In a creepy read from start to finish, they battle to save their home, their marriage, and their lives. For anyone who loves a ghost story that will inspire them to think deeper, this is a great addition to their library.
Using clever insights into daily life, and inspirational stories of her faith and development, the author has produced a devotional fitting for everyone, not just writers!

A solid start to a serial novella series. The parallels to Sherlock Holmes have me wondering what direction the series will take. As a New Adult series, there are some steamy but clean moments that will please the lovers of the romance genre, with enough hints at mystery to keep the pages turning.

Ever just want to grab a character by the collar and scream in their face that they are stupid and making the wrong decision? Yeah. Hindsight is the intricate tale of Walker's regrets, and as the tale begins to unfold in this second book in the three part series, a reader can't help but wish Kelly could write a little faster!

Words are a powerful thing. They can help or hurt...even more than sticks and stones at times. But the worst kind of words that hurt are the ones we repeat to ourselves. If we keep telling ourselves negative thoughts about how we're not good enough or pretty enough or whatever, sooner or later we believe them so hard no one can tell us differently.Teenagers have it the worst. Because they are just developing into a separate entity from their parents and learning independence, they are in the midst of determining who they are. In Entertaining Angels, Maddie is an overweight teen. She has told herself that she is not pretty enough or thin enough to be worthy of anyone. Her defeatist self talk has caused her to go about as low as she can. This story is her journey of self discovery that will leave the reader inspired while still having a few surprises through the story. *I received an advance copy of this book in exchange for an honest review*

4.5 Stars - a sweet romance that shows two sides of a coin...the life of a farmer, and the life of a carnie - and those two opposites show the how different things can be for both a small town girl and a boy with no roots, and whose life constantly takes him to a new town. I appreciate this clean, emotionally pinging read that will strike at your heart chords, and make you fall in love with the characters - sometimes just before pulling the rug out from underneath you. *I received a copy of this book for free from the publisher in exchange for an honest review*

When Hannah and Rory's teen love is split apart by circumstances beyond their control, they spend nearly the next decade pining over each other. Who would have thought they'd find each other once more when both are thrown into deepest Africa?  This imaginative sweet romance is the an amalgam of daydream, "wish-fulfillment," and nightmarish circumstances. It's a fun, romantic read with enough twists and turns to keep those who love a good suspense happy as well. And as one character learns the true meaning of grace, the story becomes inspiring.

A solid, faithful view of World War 2 from the eyes of a Jewish family, who through a series "coincidences," narrowly avoids death in a concentration camp. The distant, omniscient point of view in the book is necessary so that the reader can follow the wide cast of characters. Considering the sheer number of people, and my poor memory, I was surprised at how easily I kept them all apart. It's a credit to the author for giving each one of them such distinct personalities and voices. As some of the characters deal with jealousy, conscience, madness, betrayal, and loyalty, they each make realistic, believable decisions that give the story the feel of being a true story, rather than fiction.

A unique and refreshing look at a human with the powers of an angel. I love how the author emphasized the necessary change of heart within each person to truly overcome their problems. A hand out or hand up would have been much too easy of a solution -- true change comes when one changes their mind and attitudes. And sometimes it seems we all need a guiding angel to help us find the right path. This story was a rare find - it makes the reader consider how to change their own path and inspires a willingness to help others. This is an original urban fantasy that sticks with the reader long after the last page is turned.

A very fun, engrossing read. At nearly 40, Addison's story is an excellent combination of romance and "hen lit" -- in her search to find herself, she finds a lasting love as well. Even though this is the second book in a series, it works perfectly as a stand-alone. I haven't yet read book one, but didn't feel like I missed much in reading this one first.It's a feel good romance, one that will leave you misty-eyed in places and possibly needing a hanky. The author writes so well, that even though it's a full-length novel, I finished it in one day and didn't want to put it down. It was better than watching a movie. And I love this sort of romantic comedy. Inspirational and motivating, this story will leave you with the feeling that all things are possible with love...and with God.*A free copy of this book was given to me in exchange for an honest, not necessarily positive, review.*

A poignant tale of a woman who, because of her low-self esteem, finds herself attracted to the wrong sort of guy. She ends up living the life of a prodigal son, but with the help of praying parents and a couple of godly friends, she finds a way back to the right path...or so she thinks.

Why did it take until nearly the end of December for me to find my favorite read of 2013. Because after reading more than 120 books this year (a good year, by the way) I have found that book. And yes, it’s this one. Under Different Stars was not at all what I thought it would be. The cover is STUNNING, but I didn’t know that this book would be sci-fantasy by the cover – I thought it would be chick-lit or something. But when the book finally hit Amazon and I found out that it was listed in sci-fi, my curiosity was piqued.And this book. It rocks.It started a bit slow for me, getting to know the characters takes time, so I’m cool with that. Then after about 15% of the book, it takes off like a rocket and it’s hard to find a place to put it down. When explaining what this book is to the avid-reading teens I mentor, I explained that the book has all the action of Divergent or Hunger Games, but with a real romance that you can feel in your chest–like Twilight. And yes, these kids have read all those books, too, so they know exactly what I mean. Now they are all dying to read the book too, and I’m telling you, it’s worth it. This will be another book that I have to buy the paperback of when it comes out so that those without ereaders can borrow it.

A solid sequel to the first book in the series, but switching up some of the main characters POVs and introducing new, lovable characters as well. The tangled web caused by prophecy - and those who succumb to it as well as those who try to change it keeps the reader on their toes in this high stakes, adrenaline pumping read. 4.5 stars.

Compared to the first book, Merlin's Shadow was even more of an intricately woven cord. It took unexpected twists and turns, showing loss of hope...and hope regained. Over and over again. No one was immune to this relentless struggle against faith and confidence. My son and I began to think of Bedwir as a forgotten and well abused rag doll. Merlin's struggles in this book were mirrored with his sister, Ganieda. Each character grappled against seen (or unseen) demons which battled for their favor...or their death. Both brother and sister are hunted, enslaved, and given choices which will determine the course of each life, as well as the fate of all Briton. Both my son and I are huge fans of this series now, and impatiently await the next installment!

And the story continues...making me love this kick-butt babe even more. This story brings the last part to a thrilling conclusion, making me wonder where the author is going to take us in part 4 ~ regardless, I'll be along for the ride! :)

A well-written discourse on human life. Life is pain, but when you keep a positive outlook and rely upon God, you find that you can go from that life of pain to a life of praise through the pain. The author uses personal stories, poetry, and even private prayers to show that the reader is not alone in their pain, and that there is a light at the end of the tunnel. Highly recommended. *I received a copy of this book for free in exchange for an honest review.*

Fascinating concepts about the Fae, gnomes, and young adult love. The Arthurian legends were a bit twisted in this tale but they were handled well,and kept the book fun. Well rounded characters kept the book interesting. *I received a copy of this book for free in exchange for an honest review*

A touch of romance is added to this high adrenaline urban fantasy that has more ups than downs and keeps the reader turning pages because the action just doesn't stop - reminds me of a Die Hard movie that way. I want to know more about the culture these people live in and would like to see more of the world built around them. I'm heading into book two and look forward to it!

Science Fiction melds with Fantasy when tech-savvy elves travel intergalactically. The mash-up between the two genres work well in this middle grade novel which is a safe, fun read for the age group. Great, descriptive world-building and characters that are both well-rounded and memorable. This book is full of fun gadgets and adventure enough to help even a reluctant reader turn pages. *I received a free copy of this book in exchange for an honest review*

Lily Stargazer is an unforgettable anti-heroine. She was an orphan with a troubled past that has made her tough and talented, but has left her drowning in drug addiction and debauchery to ease her pain. But when a silent Harlequin stuffs an object down her pants and leaps to his death, it sets in motion an adventure that will make Lily face the ghosts of her past in order to see the love that has been waiting at her fingertips.Her story takes us on a tour of Europe and the Mediterranean by way of airship. There are sky pirates and fortune hunters who join the ghosts of her past in pursuit of her. An interesting band of characters surround her, from a tinkerer to a temple "prostitute" to a warrior poet.I actually "read" this book entirely by audio in my car on a long trip - there and back again (it's not a short read). But I was so immersed in the world the author built that it was a good thing that I was following another car the whole time, or I might have missed an exit and gotten lost... The author's use of setting and costumes build a world that the reader can see, hear, and touch. As a reader of clean fiction, I'd have to rate this book "R" for drug use and sexual situations. But, this is a very good story with a great character arc. It's inspiring, charming, and keeps you thinking about the characters long after you've set it aside. This book is easily a stand alone with a TREMENDOUS and complete feel in the end, although the author promises more!Interesting side note...I googled "Chasing the Star Garden" and "Youtube" and was treated with She Walks in Beauty by Lord Byron...what's awesome, is that Lord Byron is a character in the book ~ and his description here could easily fit Lily Stargazer. :)

So it's October, and half of me is only waiting for The Walking Dead to start, you know? So I've started on a little zombie reading kick. This book fit the bill perfectly. It was short - so I got what I needed and quickly. It has a strong female protagonist, and quite a little badass she is. Likeable, strong, and heroic. I'm on to book two just so I can see what happens next. And the author had better be nearly finished with book 3...because I'm impatient! :)

This is my third book by YI Lee, and it is by far my favorite. And not just because of the horses. Although I've never seen a glass horse quite like the author describes, her rich use of senses and descriptions make me feel like I have. YI Lee is a master of dark allegorical fantasy. Like CS Lewis or Lewis Carroll, her character finds herself falling into another, stranger, fantastical world, where she must complete a task, because she is the only one who can do it. But then unlike Lewis or Carroll the world built beyond the glass is not silly or childish, it is dark and scary with creatures that screech in the night and threaten to steal your heart and soul. And it's not a child who is chosen to overcome herself, it is a full-fledged adult with deadlines to meet and a wee bit of a drinking problem.All these things make Through a Glass more real for me. A less than perfect person finding the strength within herself to do incredible, self-sacrificing things and becoming more than she ever thought she was. Lovers of Dark Fantasy do not want to miss this one, especially if they like a spark of inspiration added in.

Often when we deal with being imperfect, of struggling against ourselves or our situation, we can think we're alone in that part of life. And if we're alone, then we also can feel insignificant.
