But in this book, Ayotte shows the reader step by step that there is "nothing new under the sun." What struggles you're going through now, others are going through as well. But as Christians, we have help. And her gentle reminder through anecdotes and stories about her personal life help the reader to gain a feeling of kinship and healing.This book can be a hand of help to those who just keep trying harder. It's a call to rest and trust both in yourself and in the God who helps. Highly Recommended.

Sometimes it's hard to commit to a daily walk. We get caught up in life and forget whats truly important. This Bible is like taking a morning walk with Jesus every day. The NLT is written in everyday English in a nearly conversational tone, so that takes the "work" out of reading it for a lay person like me. A 31-day commitment is long enough to start a habit. I highly recommend starting it today!

Dystopian novels are all the rage, and yes, I jump on that bandwagon, too. I've read most of the popular ones, and many by indies as well. It seems so rare these days to find one that has an original vein in it. The Woodlands succeeds. With a smart, snarky, and heroic main character and a swoon-worthy love interest, the book will draw in many readers of the YA/NA crowd. But then pepper in the dystopian part - the world our dynamic duo live in is cruel and unyielding. Completely and utterly unyielding. Surprisingly unyielding. Yes, I said unyielding three times - because it's that ruthless.And as a reader, I'm left heartbroken for these characters...through the first half.Then we get to the second half. And the hope and love takes a strange, confusing turn. The characters find themselves on an unexpected journey, that seems sort of aimless at first. And they are surrounded by a sketchy bunch of people that aren't quite friends, but not really foes. I had a hard time getting into the journey part as I'm not much of one for an undirected, wanton journey. We know who they are escaping from, but I didn't get where they were going. Then Rosa, the MC, makes some bad, selfish choices and became a little less likable for me. Of course, it just made me love Joseph even more.Overall, the book is a solid 4.5-5 star read. The author's use of color to represent the characters is poetic. Each character is dynamic, and they compliment one another like a well conducted orchestra. The read brings into focus many issues that plague young people today who have broken homes or find themselves with an unwanted teen pregnancy, but placed in a non-confrontational dystopian atmosphere that really works well.

*This book was given to me by the author in exchange for an honest review.*The opening scene of "The Doctor" takes us through a typical teenage horror movie troupe. A group of teens visit an amusement park - at night - on Halloween. Something bad happens...of course. But then the story takes an interesting turn and introduces Jack, Paranormal Investigator, and becomes an amalgam of X-files meets M. Night Shyamalan - without the fixation on the color red.Okay, I admit it, I chose to read this book because I miss Doctor Who, and anything that reminds me of the show gets a longing sigh from me. Additionally, I'm a Stephen King fan, so picking up a thriller/horror novel was right up my alley. I was not disappointed. Creepy but clean--not a lot of blood, but lots of mind twisting, psychologically bent suspense. The novel is ideal for Older YA, 14+ readers, and adults who don't want a lot of graphic gore or sex with their violence.***Review has been done in conjunction with Nerd Girl Official. For more information regarding our reviews please visit our Fansite: [...] ***

Using caricatures of modern Christian society, Brad Francis has created an edgy, clever, and convicting read. It is ha-ha funny at times, and at other times, it pierces the heart. It skates on the edge of inappropriate at times, and is much too edgy for children. But the book is real. Hard and real, like a snapshot of life.Either way, I doubt that anyone can walk away from this book without feeling some sort of emotional response. Many may even find their fight or flight response kick in over this one. Overall I feel it's a much needed read for the majority of American Christians, and ought to be required reading for the clergy.

This was the first book by bestselling indie author Elle Casey that I've read, but I'm sure it won't be the last. The edge of your seat love story found within these pages is hard to put down. Then when you realize that events in the story are based on a true story, it wrenches your heart. As a victim of sexual abuse, I could connect with the victimized mental state the main character is plagued by. All of this brought on another layer of depth to the story.Although the first few chapters made me feel as though I'd fallen into the middle of the action where a lot of back story was involved, it didn't take me long to catch up. The slow-growing love story between Nicole and her "superhero" was well done, and Nicole's slow growth of welcoming her new family's acceptance after a history of abuse was set and a realistic pace. From a reader of clean fiction, the smattering of curse words and one fairly graphic sex scene didn't do much to bluster the story or detract from it. The scenes of violence were necessary to the story line, and not terribly gratuitous.

What I love about the NIV is that it's easy to read, and this devotional does not disappoint. Christians are made to be leaders, when we follow the shepherd, and we make that our focus, others will follow our lead.  We don't have to be outspoken or have alpha personalities, we just need to focus on our leader.  This short devotional helps renew that focus. Highly recommended.

*This book was given to me by the author in exchange for an honest review.*For me, this book would be one of the examples of why I should never read the prologue. The prologue opens with a vampire on the hunt, and the entire scene turned me off to the book. The first chapter follow-up wasn't much better. I was confused, I felt as if there was a lot going on and I was dropped into the middle of it - like someone who didn't know how to swim being dropped in the deep end of the pool. But the writing is solid, and I pressed on, hoping that the book would live up to the promise made on the beautiful cover.And boy, did it. It's not long before we are introduced to the incredibly honorable and loveable pirate captain, Nate Sutton. Swoonworthy like Gerard Butler, his self-sacrificing mannerisms endear him to the reader long before Ilka even becomes aware of her own feelings. The author deserves the title of "Champion of the Anti-hero." The book became a fast-paced, easy read, and I found myself immersed in a fantasy world I was loathe to leave by the last page. Although there is a satisfying ending, there are still many loose ends, leaving me longing for the next in the series!***Review has been done in conjunction with Nerd Girl Official. For more information regarding our reviews please visit our Fansite: [...] ***

This works great for my tech supplies to keep handy in the living room instead of having cords and stuff all over the place in every drawer and on every counter, on the couch, plugged into every plug etc. All the cords are wrapped with "Gear Ties" by Nite Ize when not plugged into a jack and charging, but all the different kinds are handy in here, plus the little screwdriver set for tech repairs and all the little extras, memory cards, screen cleaner spray, little screen cleaner wipes, styluses, everything you always need but are searching for and have sitting everywhere but never where you look for it.As a tool box, really? Maybe for your first tool box when you don't have many tools and you don't have anything big. Also, it has compartments around the edges of the inside but many are really skinny and maybe fit a screwdrive but that's it.  As for the middle portion, its pitch black in there so when you fill it with tools, it is one big pile of tools in a dark bag where you cannot see anything.It works great for my purposes and if I can get it on sale again, I have ideas for a few other uses. It is a great bag - but not for a soft sided tool box bag.

I really love this feeder and have bought several.  It is lightweight, very nice looking, inexpensive, and longer-lasting than many. I am quite surprised that it can be plastic and look so much like pewter - really nice looking. It also lasts over a year and still going.  I bought this one for my dad because mine have been going strong for a year and another for less than a year.  Usually, cheap and plastic cannot survive the weather in Florida much past the summer.  Buy it in March and it's done by September, but you stretch it out until January if you can and then you give up  - hopefully because you got a feeder for Christmas to replace it. I got a feeder for Christmas YAY but now I get to hang an extra feeder because this one from last year is still going and the one from the previous year Is still surviving.

It is the perfect size for a toddler to use in the car with magnets. I was putting together a set for Christmas for a toddler (almost 4 yrs)  and wanted a magnetic sheet that was big enough for use with magnetized paper dolls, but not too big for her lap. and... cheap.  This fit the bill in every way and she was soooo happy with it ( though I think it was all about the plastic alphabet pieces, not the entire set)

My wild ducks,geese, and birds of many types absolutely love these. I actually put them in the water dishes for the ducks and whatever spills into the lawn gets picked up by the birds when they are waiting for a spot on the feeder. Only issue I have is my dreaded flock of Ibis' who turn feeding time into chaos and madness when I put these out and therefore I have to wait until they are gone or turn on the sprinkler/sprayer because they will not cross over air-borne water. But this is a problem with a flock of birds, not the worms.  They are high quality and do not have a pile of worm powder at the bottom of the bag like some other brands do.  Somehow, they have found the proper way to package and store these with air in the bag etc. so they are not turned to powder.I WOULD ABSOLUTELY CHANGE THE BAG THOUGH - I AM PAYING  FOR A BAG THAT IS POORLY DESIGNED WHEN I WOULD RATHER THEY WERE CHEAPER AND I HAD TO STORE THEM IN A ZIPLOCK OR SOMETHING.  THE BAG IS A RE-SEALABLE BAG THAT IS USUALLY NOT RESEALABLE IN ANY WAY.  IT NEVER WORKS. I have bought probably hundreds of these bags, because I get a lot when they go on sale and I love my ducks.... I maybe had one or two bags that re-sealed.  These are VERY expensive for us average people so if you could use the same bag without the resealable part, the product would be cheaper and I would have the same situation I have now, I store them in a container anyway.

The picture is beautiful - they do not look like this at all.  They were horrible on the tree, although I can see how they zoomed into one spot and it looked good.  I tried one on a wreath and it was okay - it gave it lights, but the gold glitter wire is the problem, it comes like a slinky in the box but not curved over....when you pull it out and try to stretch it or just drop one end and hold up the other, it is not firm enough to stretch it out and have it keep the even spiral shape like the picture so it ends up with uneven spacing and doesn't look nice. However, it does have semi-permanent spiral shape and therefore if you try to wrap it around a wreath or anything else, you cannot really make it shape itself the way you want it. You cannot wrap it like you can wire battery lights.But it does not keep the even spaced spiral shape either.  It is a great idea that was not well executed. It gets three stars because I could be beautiful if you could find the right way to use it....which I haven't yet. It is not cheap and blingy looking, it is a nice spiral-ish wire and the glitter is not over-done but is obviously glitter.  It really could have been fabulous.  BUT it is not, not yet anyway.

These had the worst after taste of any baking product I have ever used.  Not only should they be SUGAR -as in tasting like sugar - they could also have NO flavor! But instead they are absolutely horrible. I really cannot believe they are a name brand, especially Wilton.  I will be a bit more careful buying wilton crystals in the future if they are a color I have not used before. Clear, red, green, and bright blue are fine, like normal coarse sugar crystals.  These are horrendous.

Hunting nephew absolutely loved it, has worn it several times already.  The fit was good, though he is slim and I got a large - I am not sure if it would fit a person wearing a large who is wearing it for reasons other than being tall.Quality fabric, not too heavy for Florida and not too light so it will wear fast.  Absolutely hilarious also.  It was a hit.

I suppose it is what it was supposed to be, and just wasn't what I thought. But I am being pretty generous. I thought it would be phrases associated with flipping someone off, to the extreme. There's about a third of the phrases that are absolutely hilarious, and the rest were so vulgar or mean spirited that the three possible thoughts for this to be used for something really funny, would make it unacceptable. I have no problem with the F-bomb, and this was expected to be a vulgar item - so if every single phrase had it, I would not complain.  However, the worst part of this item is not the swearing, which I would expect, it was the mean phrases of which none will be repeated here because they aren't funny, they are beyond crude and vulgar. I am sorry I cannot explain further, but this is not telling someone to "shut the F up" or "f Off" this is way beyond that, I can't believe with all the people I know, none of which are offended by anything, ever, I cannot come up with one person that would find it funny if they walked past it enough times to hear all the phrases. My husband even grimaced multiple times and said we cannot use that.

Made great Christmas ornaments for the purpose of marking a big family vacation, where the one thing in common for everyone was fishing. I had lots of great ideas but it seemed many of them either applied to the girls or the guys but not both, or they were too expensive to get 6 ornaments.  This worked out perfectly, the kids each got one and the couples each got one, and they hung on the tree nicely - a bit big for an ornament but I have a few ornaments even bigger and heavier so it was actually fine, everyone loved the idea.
Ridiculously adorable, positively hilarious to look at, makes your day brighter - if you are a stuffed animal person! Great personality too.

This is the second book in the Silver Star Ranch series. It's about the Slatter brothers, Merik who is married to Challis, Maverick, and Marvel. They live on their grandfathers ranch with him. This book does contain profanity and sex scenes so it isn't for everyone. This book centers on Maverick and his forever sweetheart, Ella James. Maverick has loved Ella ever since grade school. He can never see himself with anyone else, ever. After graduation Ella left Maverick for the city. Maverick always said she didn't love him enough to stay. Ten years later when Ella's mother dies she comes back to town to bury her mother. Her mother and her were never close and for some unknown reason Ella hated her. Maverick runs into Ella in the grocery store. He can't believe he still loves her as much as ever. She tells him she really has always loved him. Maverick would like a second chance with Ella but something is holding her back from staying and she won't let him know what it is. This book also leads us into a small cliffhanger so now I am waiting for the next book.

Please if you can't read about child abuse, sexual abuse, and a controlling personality Don't read this.This book is wonderful. It takes you on a journey with Lily. Lily lives with her father and he is a drunk. His favorite pastime is drinking and telling Lily she is ugly, worthless, stupid , and will never amount to anything and that no one will want her.She is left hungry and scared most of the time.She meets a nice boy at seventeen and they get together and when her father beats her very badly,Trent goes and gets her and takes her with him. She lives in their home for a while. Then she finds out her abusive father was maybe better than Trent. He is a monster and very controlling. This story will make you cry, scream, and hurt for this girl.That's why you have to be able to handle this story.The author takes you on Lily's journey and the one she goes on as she tries to heal and want to live a life again.It does have a happy ending and I thank the author for that.Sometimes what we think we want isn't all its cracked up to be.This book contains profanity and sex scenes. I commend the author on the trip this book took me on. WOW

Brad Marsh and Ollie Clinton are best friends.  They have been for quite a long time.  Sophie Clinton is Ollie's sister and we all know that's a line you don't cross.  A few years earlier, however Sophie and Brad got together and she can't forget their night together.  Neither can Brad.  When Sophie returns to town escaping an abusive relationship she is afraid to see Brad again.  She doesn't want Brad or Ollie to know about her ex boyfriends behavior.  Sophie gets a job at a book store working with Brad's mother, she has always loved Sophie and hoped her son would settle down.  Brad was known for his love them and leave them attitude.  He didn't do relationships.  A week is about as long as he had any relationship and he never slept with the woman.  Sophie was different and he longed to be with her but was stopped because of his best friend.  We know what happens when you resist each other.  When he found out she felt the same they started to see each other.  Sophie had told him about the abuse she took from ex and he longed to get his hands on him.  When her ex shows up and cons Ollie he leaves Sophie with him and Brad knows she is in danger.  He has taught her how to fight to defend herself, but is that enough.  This story does contain profanity and sex scenes so it isn't for everyone.  The story is great and will want you to keep reading

Reagan, Dalton, and Striker were best friends from the time they were young. Reagan and Dalton were only a year apart in age but Striker was a few years older than them. On Reagan's eighteenth birthday Striker planned a surprise for her. He had always had feelings for her and he waited until she was old enough to let her know how he felt. He was glad when he found out she had always felt a connection to him, also. They started to see one another and he promised he would never leave her. Dalton was still their best friend. Then things changed and a misunderstanding on Striker's part drives him away from Reagan and he joins the military to escape. Reagan is broken hearted and slips into a deep depression. Dalton is there to pick up the pieces and help her go on. A few months later Reagan and Dalton get married. Eleven years later some things are uncovered to bring Striker back into their lives. Reagan doesn't know how she feels when Dalton asks Striker to take care of his wife and three boys while he is away on business. Reagan doesn't know if she will be able to handle it, plus Dalton always promised he wouldn't leave her.Now she finds she is being lied to once again. This story made me cry and scream. It is a cliffhanger plus it contains profanity and sex scenes. I so hate cliffhangers, now I have to remember what happens by the time the next one comes out next year. This book is a fantastic read, just fustrating I received an ARC of this book for an honest review

This book does contain profanity and sex as well as violence, so it isn't for everyone. Hadley Rivers is a well known country singer. She is used to being in the spotlight but lately she has been getting threats. Her agents brother, Nick, agrees to be her temporary boyfriend to ward off the threats. It works for awhile and with her bodyguard, Scott they seem to have it under control until one night they return to her home and someone is inside. Scott gets killed and Nick is seriously hurt. They decide to wisk Hadley away to Montana with a new identity. There she meets Blake Evans a former cop gone cowboy on a ranch training horses. He is a ladies man when he needs attention but doesn't do any relationships. He doesn't want to protect Hadley he thinks she is a spoiled rich girl, that is until he gets to know her better. He starts to see she is a very down to earth girl and will do whatever is necessary to protect the people she loves. This is a good romance and it has some suspense in it as you will find out when the plan to get Hadley takes a turn. Will Blake find her in time? A good read

Wyatt opened a sex club in Dublin. Fiona is his very sexy and beautiful accountant. That's all your getting from me. Cali's books always make my blood pressure go up and I have to blush, this book was no exception. Any fan of Cali's will love this book, also. Congratulations Cali

Travis is a bad boy and Alexis is his wild girl friend. After two years together she finds out he has been cheating on her for a while. Grant is a preppy goodie guy from high school. When he comes back home he finds Alexis and when she breaks up with Travis he figures its his turn. He persues Alexis but she feels even though she really likes Grant that she isn't good enough for him. Then when things start to happen, which puts her in danger Grant is there for her. Nice story. Some profanity and sex

Jonas Barnes is a rancher is Carlston, Montana. Autumn Lavin is a chef and she moves to Carlston. She is pregnant and her mother through her out of the house and told her she disowned her. Autumn felt so alone but she was determined to start over for her baby. She bought a bar and grill is is opening a vegetarian resturant and juice bar. This could be a problem in cattle country. Jonas stops to meet her and tells her so but he is stopped by her beauty. This is a really sweet romance. You will love it. I did

This book isn't for everyone. It does contain profanity and sex scenes. Georgia Phillips is a librarian and a dear friend of Suzy's ( Sunshine to her friends) she is City's wife. City owns a P I agency and has a lot of former friends and military working for him. Fresco Jones is one of the men who work there. He has sworn off relationship because his girl of two years cheated on him. Georgia also had sworn off relationship because her boyfriend was a big bore and only wanted one thing. Suzy thought they would be perfect for one another so she introduced them at her daughters birthday party. Frisco thought she was lovely but too young for him. She told him that was her decision. 'They finally did start seeing each other. The story is so good. I especially laughed really hard when Frisco's mom met Georgia's parents and the mothers got drunk on wine. I laughed so hard and also when Frisco and Georgia were making out in his office and in walked Bear and Frisco's mom. I laughed so hard. Well done Chelle you have another winner

Jenna Stone was a broken woman and she was moving to start her life over with her two children, Megan and Alex. Her husband was very verbally abusive and he spend years cheating on her then he was killed in a car accident. On a way to a job interview in a new town her car breaks down. Along comes Jake Traynor and he couldn't drive by when she needs help so he stops. Jenna is so mad she doesn't notice him at first she is too busy cursing at her phone, which isn't working either. Jenna's job in Baltimore had been for a construction company. She had been fired for false accusations made about her. Jake is quite amused by her temper and red hair. When she finally notices him he offers her help. He winds up giving her a ride home. They talk while in the truck so he finds out what she does for a living and he tells her to check with his company, Speciality, to see if they are hiring. He drops her off and she gives him a copy of her resume. He notices she is very experienced and he needs an assistant to help him. He also notices the wedding ring. Jenna wears it so people show her some respect for what she does in a mans business world of construction. This is a great story as Jenna continues to let everyone believe her husband travels and is never home. You will enjoy reading this one. I couldn't put it down. It does contain some profanity and sex scenes so it isn't for everyone. It is a good read
Under normal circumstances I HATE cliff hangers.  Book #2 just made me want to go and nuy Book #3 in this series!
I am not going to do a great "tell all" but all I will say is this is surely among the best books I have read for a LONG time------  it has EVERYTHING in it!!!I am now going to look for Book #2

The BEST I have ever purchased.  Just had an afternoon "cream" tea ---made blueberry scones and also made my own Devonshire cream.  This lemon curd and natural blueberry jam and a bowl of fresh fruit completed the table'Rave reviews on the curd - just the right amount of "snap" - just delicious
I just finished Book #2 in the Miami series and I must say I love this author's style and am going on to get Book #3.  Very, very enjoyable reading.
This was a great, light hearted "detective" story.  Loved the plot, loved the characters.  At times I chuckled out loud!  Good read !

Oh my--some of the books in this series were "interesting"..The 2 fat detectives, even tho that got REALLY old and fairly disgusting.  Now it seems they are thinner and retired.  They need to REALLY retire and not be heard from, ever again.This was the most BORING book I have read in a long time.  It's a travel brochure with insipid dialogue  a real waste of time
These dryer sheets, along with my Gain detergent make for a clean and fresh laundry!

This was the most incredibly boring book I have ever read (and not finished).  I tried for about 2 - 3 hours and finally stopped and deleted it.There are 2 story lines going--the one in Iran is boring beyond words---the other story line with Hassom picks it up a bit---but not enough to waste time reading.How this book got 5 stars is a puzzle -for syre

Had a sample pack of the Classic chicken and vegetables......my cat(s)  LOVED it---never picked up their heads until it was gone ---I poured it over their pate'-which generally takes them for EVER to eat....sadly however, the cost is prohibitive (for me)

Page after page of senseless and descriptive gore----I kept waiting for something that would make me want to continue reading -but could NOT.If you like disgusting gore--have at it..I question the author's mental health --truly

I seldom if ever - more like NEVER read a book with this type of plot.  But, it was free, it was short and I wanted light reading.I was completely delighted with this book -- I enjoyed every minute of it.  Yes, the ending was 100% predictable - had it ended any other way-I would have been so disappointed.Loved Precious!

Hard to imagine a book that contains both "gore" and comedy-but this one does.  I cringed in places and really LAUGHED in others.I began the book late afternoon and never went to bed until I finished it!  Loved it

Just received 2 of these from a friend--they arrived via Amazon---very happy.  I tend to a large colony of feral cats and this will provide an ample supply of water--I refresh every day---so very happyI can leave one and clean one on a daily basis - thanks Birdie!!

I couldn't decide if this was a 2 or 3 star book--then decided on the 2 as my final assessment after I read the last page was...I do NOT like this.I enjoyed the characters and the plot - even got a chuckle here and there- but when I turned a page - the book was OVER -end of story -nada!! It didn't reach a CONCLUSION - it just stopped. If the author thinks this is the way to get me to purchase the next book - to finish reading the story--it is NOT!

I LOVE a long book...lots of hours and many page; unfortunately this author used up time to drag on and on---I stuck with it until the end - but it certainly wasn't the best book I have ever read.Lots of time wasted in this saga!

I ordered these, but could NOT wait---went to Ace and bought 3 boxes of 4 each (cheaper also) ---I have been putting them all over the house---I have no CLUE where all the flies came from, but they are big and ugly!!I have screens on the doors and the windows! I was just sticking one trap in my kitchen window and before I moved my hand away--I watched 3 little buggers walk right in!!  These are wonderful!!!  I also stuck one on the corner of my TV---last night the TV screen was DISGUSTING.....and it was even worse when I got up this morning to all the dead bodies on the floor as I had been swatting them all night!!!I may put one on the corner of my PC monitor also----YES I have a problem!  This has NEVER happened in my home before --EVER!***Update""" April 2the traps are just full of flies---I have one or 2 buzzing about-as opposed to DOZENS.  I have one issue with the traps---the little TINY sticky tab on the back is quite ineffective...I had to Mickey Mouse scotch tape tabs to keep them up---they kept falling off the windows-other than that---these things are MIRACULOUS!
I really liked this--but NOT as much as Book 5.  Let's get real - WOLF should have been in a basket by the end of the book ---for real ---in a basket, in peces.  BUT - it was a pretty fair read!

This was a great read.  It was light enough to pass the time enjoyable and yet it was a murder mystery, without the blood and gore.  This is a perfect "womans" read.  All the references to vintages clothes and fashion would more than likely be a put off to a man.Have to say tho--the heroine was a little "light" in the smarts department.Great book

Why this writer kept bouncing back and forth and all over the place from one POV to another is beyond me.  You would find yourself reading and 2 paragraphs in, find the narration was by a different person than half a minute ago----very disruptiveAlso, the author had the PI using less than perfect grammar and it was quite unsettling.  The constant use of nothin'  somethin' and anything else that ended in a missing "G" were but one of her writing techniques.  There were many others but this was the most blatant.The plot was fairly good, but the writing style erased the points in the review.
As a mystery it held my interest 100% ---I thought I knew who the "bad guy" was ---but failed.  With murder the entire length of the book ---it ended in a beautiful love story ---REALLY!
This is my most favorite scent in the world---slightly spicy, just  a bit of citrus----I have a diffuser in almost every room -  but NOT at THIS PRICE-this is 2X's the normal cost -
Super bags--tired of throwing out plastic.  One thing tho' -  you can get TWO for less money from Grab Bag and free shipping and handling
Silly premise - couldn't even begin to get into this book --it was a waste of time--deleted it after 10 minutes -sorry

A very enjoyable read on a rainy and gray afternoon.  The plot moved along at a nice clip and I stayed fully engrossed in the characters.Yes, the plot was "nasty", but some how it didn't dwell on the gore----a good read!
They are lovely--exactly what I was looking (for)
A very entertaining and interesting read!  Liked it!

This particular book has been sitting, unread on my Kindle for about 7 months.  I finally got to it.At first I thought -"here we go, another post 9-11 novel",  I really was considering just dumping it - until I read a couple of chapters..then I couldn't put it down.The plot is gripping and held my interest until the last word.  Thoroughly enjoyed this book!
this was a graphically GRUESOME COMEDY.  Unique to say the least.  Would I recommend it...NO
Oh for PETE'S SAKE!!  The book practically ends in the middle of a SENTENCE!  HAte that !

I pretty much enjoyed this book-however I skimmed page after page after page of "back" story...others may enjoy reading stuff like that, but I just wanted the plot to go FORWARD.The last few chapters had a lot more meat than the book had midway thru it. The drama finally got a lot more interesting.  It was an "okay" read.

I pretty much enjoyed this "sister act".  Interesting group of characters -the youngest being the last "victim".  I felt the over all attitude of people regarding her was a bit much---she being the "special one".The ending left us all hanging---and I hate that after reading a long book!

First of all--I simply cannot believe all the 5 star reviews are written by ADULTS.  I kept wondering how I stumbled into a kiddie/early teen genre' of books.  The theme of this book is quite juvenile and the writing pretty much matches (it)If you have a 13 year old who likes to read - possibly this is the book ---however I doubt very much if my 13 year old grand would read more than a couple of chapters.I will be going NO further in this series.

I was just getting into the plot of this book---Gabriel is possessive and mentally abusive---could easily be physically abusive..a bat #*#@ crazy mother and a young women who is addicted to Gabriel.There is one plot and several minor plots and all of a sudden the book STOPS---just QUITS! No resolution to anything!If this author thinks this is going to encourage me to buy the next book - she is SO SO wrong!

This was recommended by my optometrist exactly one year as I was a candidate for cataract surgery.  I began taking them 2 days after my exam.  The change in my eyes has been somewhat astounding.... for the better.I find I can even watch TV now without glasses-quite impossible a year ago!

I did not purchase this thru Amazon (I forgot to look!) -I got it in a store and paid a LOT more for it---I am HERE to get MORE!  I truly do NOT understand the negative reviews.1. the product performed as described...I used the Light Auburn Brown2. It covered my gray COMPLETELY3. It left my hair soft and shiny4. It was extremely easy to apply5. I had enough left to touch up roots after a haircut6. It was NOT stickyWhat more could you possibly ask of a product?

I have been faithfully PURCHASING the books in this series--one at a time--and I found this one to be VERY disappointing.  I didn't need to read nearly 500 pages  (albeit it was a decent plot) to see where Joe and Louis were headed.  I wanted to read another novel based on LOUIS KINCAID.  This wasn't it.....to me this was a waste of money for a book in a seriesSorry--I will be reading a lot of reviews before I purchase #9

I have just completed Book 7 in this series (have read all of them so far) and now I am on to #8.I am truly addicted to the author and this character...I will write NO spoilers - I'll just say----try it-you'll like it!

I cannot believe this is L'oreal's version of coral...it's BROWN--the pencil is BROWN, the lipliner is BROWN.  The photo clearly shows a coral pencil--and coral liner.  I even went outside to check in full day light to make sure my indoor lighting wasn't deceiving me.I would NEVER line my lips in this dark stuffHUGE FAIL - nothing to do with the vendor-it's L'oreal !

This is a commonly purchased (by me) multi-use ophthalmic gel for my very "blinky" mini-poodle.  It works.  It soothes and calms down his dry eyes ---which are affected greatly by our Santa Ana winds.The think I am NOT happy with is the EXPIRATION DATE...I purchased this in Jan 2014 and it has now EXPIRED Jan 2015) ---I never looked at the EXPIRE date when I got the bottle---my groomer noticed it - as I always send it along to moisten his eyes before grooming.  Not happy - at all considering the purchase price !
This is most definitely worth the read.  I found myself almost racing thru the pages to see what was next.  The reality is - this really could happen!!!

I’ve been a fan of this series since I found it by chance, and each book just keeps getting better and better for me!  I completely loved Sprite in this book! Seriously, Sprite made the book so enjoyable for me personally.I really enjoyed how even though this is a shorter book, Eight is able to pack a bunch of information into the story but it doesn’t feel like it is overwhelming to me.  All the information that was added was important to the story.  I do also enjoy that even though this is the fourth book in the series, I don’t feel like you have to read the rest of the series.  But there is enough information given that will entice you to read the other books.I did love being able to follow along with the relationship between Sprite and Keir form and develop into something real.  Their relationship was one that formed slowly and ended up being something powerful and wonderful.Overall, I can’t get enough of this series and if your looking for a paranormal story that will draw you in, then I would recommend this one.Reviewed by Crystal Marie for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

This book completely blew me away.  In more ways that one.  I’ve been a fan of Banks writing every since I found this series awhile ago and each book that I have read is just so much better than the previous one.I do want to be honest and say that the beginning of this book was a bit slow for me.  However, I really do think that that works best for this story because there is so much action and suspense that is happening in the rest of the book that the slow start was great.Honor’s character was one that just … I don’t know what to say about her besides the fact that I wish that I had even a quarter of the courage and strength that she had.  Banks wrote a heroine that is so inspiring and amazing, and it is so different that the types of books that I have been reading lately.  Honor stands on her own and really, she made the book so great for me.Watching as the relationship between Honor and Hancock was also great.  I loved how they both battled the relationship right from the start.  The whole thing was just amazing.  Hancock’s personality was one that was perfect for this book because he really needed Honor to be there for him, and Honor was more than willing to give everything up to help him achieve his goal.I would really recommend this book to anyone who is looking to read a book that will give you strength and the courage to stand up for what you believe in.Oh, and make sure you have a lot of tissues because holy wowzer, this book was great!Reviewed by Crystal Marie for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

This is a very strange book for me to review.  When I started it, it had the feel of the Sleeping Beauty trilogy from Anne Rice, but as I got further into the story, it went a completely different way.  Which I enjoyed a lot.This was a very quick read, I would say that it would be a really good lunchtime read if your looking for something that has smutty times, as well as will keep you on the edge of your seat wondering what is going to happen next.The twists and turns that Greenwood added to the story certainly made it their own.  And it kept my attention and left me wanting to read more.There is a cliffhanger at the end of this story, at least for me there was, and so I hope that Greenwood will be continuing on with this series in the future.Reviewed by Crystal Marie for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

Once again, SeRine blows me away with the story telling!  I was completely drawn into this story once I started it and I couldn’t put it down no matter what.  The drama and suspense that was on these pages just drew me in completely and I was drawn into a world that I didn’t want to leave.SeRine gave us a hint of what this family (The Dawson family) was about in the novella in the Way of the Warrior bundle.  I will say this, you don’t have to read that novella to fully understand what is going on in this book, but it does give you a bit of back information between one of the couples.There is a lot of stuff happening in this book, and while at times I felt like my head was twisting around trying to keep up, I didn’t get lost.  I was still able to follow along with everything and that is part of what made this book that great for me.  The smutty scenes in this book only added to the story, they didn’t detract from it.  Don’t get me wrong, they were great, but I loved how there was still a story there even if those scenes would have been removed.The chemistry between Kyle and Abby was off the charts, as well as the relationships between Kyle and his family.  That added a “real” feeling to the story that was able to bring me even further into what was going on.This is a great start to a new series and I really can’t wait to read more into the Dawnson family in the future.  I really feel like SerRine has a new hit series with this one!Reviewed by Crystal Marie for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

This was an interesting bundle for me to read. I am a fan of Douglas’ works, and have loved every one that I have read in the past, however I have never read anything by Arthur in the past. I started this bundle with the expectations that no matter what, I would still enjoy at least 1 of the stories.That was not the case in the slightest though because even though, once again I was blown away by Douglas’ story, I was equally blown away by Arthur’s story as well. I am a total paranormal junkie and I love reading paranormal books. I do think that Arthur did a great job at creating a world, and the characters, in the book that drew me in and kept me wanting to know more about what was going on. But not only that, I was drawn into the character’s stories and didn’t want the book to end. I do hope that Arthur will continue on with this story and turn it into a series. If that is the case, I will be sure to be reading them once they release.Douglas brought another great new book to this bundle as well. One thing that I loved about it is it is set up for a series, and I do have my fingers crossed that that will be the case. The Feral Passions resort was described in such a way that it was almost as though I was there, and I was so disappointed when the book ended because I didn’t want it to leave. Being a fan of Douglas’ work, there weren’t that many twists or shocks that actually shocked me, but that didn’t deter me from enjoying the story at all.Overall, I would say if you’re looking for a great paranormal bundle, then this is one for you.Reviewed by Crystal Marie for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

Having been a fan of Hunter’s work in the past, I couldn’t resist getting to read the next novella in the vampire series.  I do have to say that while the fully length novels are great, Hunter’s novellas are also equally great.  It takes extreme skill from an author to be able to write an action packed story into a novella size.  And that is something that Hunter has been able to pull off quite well.I loved the characters and the way I could see and feel how they all interact with each other.  No matter how small of a role a character had, they were given a completely different voice than the others.  Tom and Josephine’s relationship was one that amused me because of how it was very typical for that time frame, yet at the same time it was great to see how they came to care about each other – and eventually love each other.Once again Hunter has crafted an amazing story that even if you haven’t read any of the other books in the series in the past, I would say that this will give you a great tease and make you want to read more.  I couldn’t get enough of this story and I can’t wait for the next one to be released!Reviewed by Crystal Marie for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

It’s been awhile since I’ve visited Mossy Glenn Ranch, but I can say that I was very glad to go back there!  Bradford sure does great with the series because even though this is book 7 in the series, we are still given updates on what is happening with the other couples that have already gotten together throughout the series.As a reader, I really enjoy that because when you get wrapped up in a series, you can’t help but wonder what has happened to the other couples.But onto the couple in this book, I have to say that Dan really tugged on my heartstrings! I couldn’t help but feel sorry for him and wanted to give him a hug for everything he had been through – and was still going through throughout the book.  I did like how Bradford though allowed Dan to grow, and it wasn’t an instant overnight change with him, no it was gradual and very realistic.  Now Hector’s character was one that I was instantly drawn to for the simple fact that I liked how cheerful he was.  He really lite up the story in more ways than one.  Being a friend to Dan, and just being an overall great man.Two things that I always know when I read a book by Bradford is that there’s going to be a fair bit of smut, and there’s always a HEA.  Well, I can say that Bradford really threw me for a twist with this one because there is something that happens that just caused me to almost throw my kindle.I won’t say anything else, but this.  Trust me, you wanna read this one!Reviewed by Crystal Marie for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

I kind of have a love/hate feeling toward this story because I both liked it and was totally and completely frustrated by it. First off, it took until 40% of the way through the story to hook me and to finally figure out what the storyline actually was. Second, this was a slow read. Third, it was written in my least favorite format: 1st person present tense.Daniel, our protagonist and who is our window into the world of Holiday, is kind of all over the place. His family, well, what a bunch of jerks is all I can say, is one of the reasons he is who he is. While his best friend Ginger and his love interest Rex leapt out of the pages at me, Daniel was a little harder to figure out, which was kind of annoying at first considering he is the one telling the story. However, as ‘who’ he is came out around 40% of the way through, that began to make sense. If a character isn’t even sure of who he is and he is telling the story in 1st person, it makes it hard for the reader to know.My harshest complaint is that this story left the reader with a huge cliffhanger. If I’m already hooked into a series, then a cliffhanger doesn’t bother me as much, but in the first book which was difficult to get through in the first place? It does not make me want to read on. Instead, it makes me growl. There was no sense of completion, or that the hero and his man may someday ride off into the sunset. Instead, I was left with this feeling of “it’s all gonna go to H*LL about five pages after the book is done”.However, there is definitely an audience for this book – so if you enjoy 1st person present tense, a character who is all over the place and doesn’t know where he’s at let alone where he’s going, and a slow bleed of a romance which seems the lesser part of the story, then this might be the book for you. Get your own “The Daniel” (a coffee created in our hero’s honor by a local coffee shop), sit down, and prepare to read.Reviewed by a-nony-mouse for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy provided for review*

I grabbed this book because it was free. To be honest, I didn’t even read the blurb. I just saw it was M/M, that it was a decent length and thought, why not? Let me just say, I’m glad I got it.Lucas has issues. After a bad breakup with his girlfriend, he’s aimless and has no idea what to do – until seeing an ad in a paper for an acting gig in the Caribbean. He leaps at the opportunity. What nobody tells him until he’s on the island and moved into the cottage with three other guys is that he is part of a gay pirate sex show.You would think that would be difficult enough, wouldn’t you? No, in addition, he loves the place so much he doesn’t want to leave. However, before he has even blinked, he has an enemy in the boyfriend of the pirate captain and has to prove himself if he wants to stay. Also, he’s confused because of the way he feels around Adam – the pirate captain.Turning a straight guy gay stories are usually either great or awful in my opinion. This story was so well written that even though I hated Tyler and cringed for Lucas, as soon as the story was done, I bought the second book to read along. Because – be warned. The story doesn’t end. It gives you a cliffhangar and you need to move on to the next book.Aces to the secondary characters, especially Kip, Ben, and Orinth. They were so well-written and the kind that really stick with you. You will notice if you look up the book on several different eRetail sites, that the cover changes. A lot. That confused me, but believe me. The story is worth it. Don’t expect any full-on anal sex, but there’s a lot of teasing, and one hot 3-way scene as well. This book I think sets up the main storyline for the series, so there’s less sex and a lot of teasing.Now, I must get back to the island. I would love to be the towel girl on that pirate ship. I’m tellin’ ya~!Reviewed by a-nony-mouse for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy BOUGHT for review*

Anyone who knows me knows I hate heavy angst in a book. Hate it. Hate it. Hate it. So why do I love Fever Pitch? If you had asked me how I felt about the book during the first 50%, well, I almost put it down several times. Only one problem. The author brought in one of my ABSOLUTE favorite characters from her first book in the series – Walter. And anything with Walter is good, obviously.So, what’s this one about? Aaron and Giles are from the same home town, only Aaron has only barely noticed Giles in high school and while Giles thinks Aaron is drop-dead cute, he also thinks the guy kind of hates him. Until a unique meeting at a party where they both hide in the laundry room to get away from it all. This starts off the angst…Why? Aaron decides after one moment of extreme happiness with Giles to follow him to college. Only both guys are nervous and assume things about the other that isn’t true, but they think it is. It takes half the book –let me repeat that – half the book for that part of the angst to go bye-bye. Of course a new kind of angst takes its place with religious extremism, one of the students on campus being kicked out of his parents’ house for not doing what his parents told him to do; not even allowing him to take his clothes or shoes. And the angst ratchets up with Aaron’s roommate who is a bit of an oddball from the beginning, but when we find out why, well, I couldn’t blame the guy for his offish behavior.This particular book has romance, angst, gunshots, religious zealots, bad parents, good parents, and Walter. Can I just say I have a bit of a crush on Walter :)5 Stars all the way for book 2 of Love Lessons. But I have just learned there is a Book 1.5, so I’m off to read that next.Reviewed by a-nony-mouse for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*Copy BOUGHT for review*

This small photo printer packs a punch!  Great for kids school projects and homework, which unlike the olden days, often ask for color pictures.  Having one of these at home sure beats running down to the local drugstore to pick up a print.  The price per print  - at this writing anywhere from $.34 -$.53 depending on where you purchase your supplies - is quite reasonable considering the convenience.  I found that the lowest price for the 320P print packs, which include both ink and photo paper, was on the Epson website. I was able to find a discount code with a quick web search and shipping was free, with no tax charged to my location.

This colorful, oversized book is chock full of interesting facts.  Read about robot jockeys, dragon blood trees and more!  Each country gets one page and 203 countries are represented, but Hong Kong gets its own page rather than having to share with China.  Although this is a kids book, I guarantee the parents will want to read it first!

This keyboard case is indeed very light but does not compromise on performance.  The keys are spaced about the same as the Apple wireless keyboard, so for me it was an easy transition. The key press is a little softer and less clicky than the Apple keyboard, but not unpleasant, just different.  I really like how the case snaps easily into either of two preset positions with the help of magnets, and the auto on/off is great.  This keyboard has fewer keys than other keyboards, and some of the keys on the right side of the keyboard do triple duty to compensate.  It takes a little getting used to but is a small price to pay for a such a lightweight and well made keyboard case.  The case charges with an included micro USB cable, and one charge is supposed to last up to 6 months, assuming two hours of usage per day.  The only thing I wish it had is backlit keys, but that would probably result in the battery draining much more quickly.  Even without the backlighting, this is an awesome case!
This family fun pack is an excellent companion to the games of murder and mayhem so favored by my younger gamer.  It's nice to have something the whole family can play together!

The step by step photos in his book are extremely helpful!  Although the main focus of the book is sushi with raw fish, you can easily substitute any and all manner of cooked meats.  The inner spiral binding of the book allows to lay flat while you follow each step.  Extremely user friendly.

The eb5 facial treatment cream has the similar feel as Nivea and Nutregena with a clean, evenly spread application and no oily residue.  Scent is minimal - in not existent.  However, my skin did feel smooth and supple, revitalized but not greasy.  4/5 stars.
I have several of these cables and think they are an incredibly elegant solution.  They are just the right length for charging device via a port on a laptop, alarm clock, or battery.

There is a picture for each recipe in this cookbook, which is great for someone unfamiliar with the cuisine.  The name of each dish is given in both English and Japanese.  This a lovely touch because the written Japanese language, which is a mixture of Chinese characters and two Japanese alphabets, is in itself an art form.Despite the step by step photographs provided for most recipes, this book manages not to feel busy or crowded.  If feel like as much attention has been paid to the layout of the book as to the recipes, with plenty of white space for balance.  The recipes that include step by step pictures are laid out so that the instructions are on facing pages.  You will not have to turn the page, you can see it all at once.  This kind of attention to layout in cookbooks has become increasingly rare.The recipes themselves give amounts by weight in both imperial and metric.  The recipe for ukishima - floating island - looks at once sophisticated and simple.  It's a square shaped, two layer, steamed cake; the bottom layer is matcha flavored and thus green, and the top layer is plain or egg flavored if you will.  Ukishima looks like the perfect lunchbox snack so I can hardly wait to try it!

This case does a great job of showcasing the beauty of the iPhone.  The overall slimness of the case is a plus as well,  Although not as protective as the Otterbox Defender, it is a lot prettier.  Snaps on easily and feels secure.  Recommended.

This is a very well made case, and fits my phone perfectly.  I left on the glass screen protector I already had on my phone, and the case still fit well.  Of course, with two separate screen protectors there is a noticable difference in sensitivity of the touch screen, but that is to be expected.The buttons for power and volume line up and work just fine, but it takes a lot more pressure to activate the buttons since the the slight squishiness of the case absorbs most of the force of the button press.  I cannot activate the buttons with the hand I am holding the phone with.  I have to hold the phone with one hand, and depress the buttons with the other hand. That is basically my only complaint, and perhaps if I had larger hands tha would not be an issue. The port covers feel sturdy and like they be be able to take a lot of use.  Overall it is a great case that leaves my phone feeling well protected.
Very delicate and lovely necklace.  Makes a wonderful, budget friendly present.  Love the infinity symbol!
My YA reader LOVED this book and described it has full of unexpected twists and turns.  Highly recommended!
Very easy to set up and use.  Great for practicing alone!

This product has a very nice, subtle aroma that doesn't linger unlike its other lower-end competitor creams and lotions.  I noticed I had to use two normal size applications as the cream seemed to diminish to an unsubstantial layer when I spread it over my face.  I was not comfortable enough with only one application as I was apprehensive of my razor catching while shaving against the grain.  On a positive note, the cream did rinse off cleanly without a pesky oily or foamy residue nor did it dry out my skin.  Would recommend however caution that consumption rate will be higher than other cheaper brands.

My Paperwhite has the unfortunate tendency to skip foward a number of pages on a random basis.  When I then try to return to the page I was on, instead of going back, the Paperwhite gets stuck and displays the same few pages over and over again even though I am pressing "back."  A recent software update has not helped.  I do enjoy having the light, but may have to do an exchange and see if I luck out on the replacement.

This beautiful, oversized book is a wonderful introduction to Israeli cuisine.  If you already own the Ottolenghi cookbooks many of the ingredients will be familiar to you, from pomegranate molasses, tahini and harissa to the reliance on fresh herbs such as parsley and mint.  For those new to Israeli cuisine I recommend starting with Chapter 6, Live Fire.  This chapter includes a number of fairly simple kebab recipes that feature various meats - salmon, beef, lamb, pork, chicken, duck - marinated in the distinctive flavors of this cuisine.  It is hard to go wrong with grilled meats!The dessert chapter, Milk & Honey,  is highly approachable.  The recipes do not require a ton of ingredients, and they feature nuts, dried fruit, cinnamon, cardamom, lemon, honey, coffee and chocolate.  The Cashew Baklava Cigars are a different take on baklava than what I have made before, with small "cigars" of phyllo enclosing a filling of cashews, sugar and other spices.  The result is more finger food friendly, and perfect for bringing in to share during a class on the foods of Middle East!I will have less use for the recipes involving sweetbreads and pilaf, since I already know I am not a fan of those foods, but I am looking forward to trying the borekas, a savory pastry made with a variety of fillings, and the laffa, a flatbread that is drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with za-atar.  In all, there is lots to try and plenty of beautiful pictures to motivate you in this lovely cookbook.

My YA reader loved this book!  Was hesitant to get it because of the romance in the storyline, but my reader reports that the romance was not gross, nor a major part of the story.  Rather typical dystopian society within a fence in area, and what happens when you leave the perimeter.  Had to get the first book of series since this one was so good!
My YA reader really enjoyed this book.  I thought it a good way to educate her about the perils of pharmaceuticals, in this day and age when drugs are advertised on TV like candy.  Recommended.
I have this same cover for the Mini, but the Mini version fits better.
This is a great product for surveillance.  It was easy to set up and the number of cameras was perfect for my needs.  The white cameras blend in well with my decor and picture qualtiy is good.
Bright, cheerful color.  This shelf is meant for full sized lockers. Very sturdy!
Very nice color and fit.
Nice fit and very nice dark color.

Excellent product for the paranoid (I am in that camp), or for those who actually have bedbugs.  If you or someone in your family travels often, this product brings some piece of mind.  Coming home from a trip, you can toss all manner of items in this heater and zap any unwanted critters dead.  Tumbling in a dryer is not good for all items, and this heater is perfect for those items that should not be tumbled.
I view this primarily as calories.  If you are serious about vegan protein Vega brand protein powder has a better list of ingredients on the side.  Especially at this price!

Good sound for the price.  I liked the sound even better when I adjusted the sound settings in my device.  The speaker is powerful and definitely fills the room.  The only real negative for me was that the sticker on the front of the speaker was impossible to remove cleanly.  Even after removing all the paper, which was not easy because the stickier ripped repeatedly, there was adhesive residue that remained.  Eventually I was able to remove it all using an even sticker tape as a tool, but it was a pain.  Otherwise, a decent speaker.

BoomCo does it again, taking it to the next level with the battery powered blaster.  Wow!  We are already fans of the amazing pump action Rapid Madness - which blasts out darts at a pace you have to see to believe - but this eliminates the need to pump.  Honestly puts every Nerf we've ever owned to shame.
Very small and portable, and does not block the other outlet.  The sliding dust covers are great!
Very serious but important topic for younger generations to learn about.  Never Forget.
Wish I could say that I enjoyed the taste of this protein powder, but no.  However, I am impressed with the healthy ingredients.  A unique choice to say the least.
Absolutely delicious!  Make flouride mouthwash part of your morning and evening routine, however, if you're eating this much candy.
I learned a great deal about different types of capstone courses and what they can involve.  Writing was a bit dull but still an informative book.
Leaves my hair smelling fresh and feeling soft. Great shampoo!
Excellent sound that I expect from Bose, and love the carrying case for on the go.  They stay in place easily and are comfortable over for long usage.  Great accessory for my IOS devices!

This nicely finished neoprene case is a good choice for protecting your device when it is inside a bag, or for general storage.  It will definitely not protect against drops.  It holds my iPad and Apple keyboard perfectly.  The purple is an understated deep plum, and the zipper opens halfway around the case, extending from one corner to the the diagonal corner, in an "L" shape. The inside is a contrasting shade of lavender. Very pretty.

This alarm clock has all the features I expect, such as battery backup, daylight savings time switch, dimmable display, USB charging port, snooze and dual alarms.  What I didn't expect was the removable lithium battery, which of course has its own USB port, so you can charge two devices via this alarm clock each night. Then in the morning, grab your fully charged phone and the fully charged battery, and you're ready for a long day.  Great feature!

So easy to use, my grade schooler was able to set it up all by himself. Simply plug the receiver in the back of the Xbox, turn on the headset, and it automatically syncs.  Sound is good and controls are intuitive.  A standard micro USB cable is included for charging.  It is possible to play and charge at the same time.  This headset is completely wireless, not attached to the controller like some other headsets.

This compact alarm clock is prefect for a tight space, such as a window sill.  For its size and price, it is very full featured with a built in audio cable, USB port, dual alarms, battery backup, and adjustable brightness. It can be powered with either the supplied AC adaptor or with 4 AA batteries.  A great choice for someone who has space contraints or for travel.

The Suave line for men is an excellent value.  It take multiple showers a day and I need a product that smells great, gets me clean, and is price sensitive.  Suave meets all those qualifications.  Highly recommended.

My son loves this Nerf!  We have an entire arsenal of brightly colored blasters but it's never enough.  This one distinguishes itself with the drums that allow you to fire a whole bunch of darts without having to reload.  The green and orange color theme is a nice addition to the other colors we own.  Excellent for neighborhood wars!

This is my second Dolce Gusto machine. I am an absolute convert to the Dolce Gusto drinks, which are much better than any K-cup I have ever had. This machine is semi-automatic, meaning that you set the fluid level, flip a lever, then press start. On my fully automatic Dolce Gusto machine, I only have to set the fluid level and press start, nearly the same process.The only reason to buy this machine is if you love the drinks. I personally do - whether it is the higher quality coffee Nestle uses, or the 15 bar brewing pressure, or some combination of the both, it works for me! There is nowhere to taste test the drinks before you buy this machine, which is a huge drawback for someone new to Dolce Gusto.I also suspect that Nestle is planning to discontinue their Dolce Gusto line in the USA now that they have the Nespresso Vertuoline. That is their new machine that makes both coffee and expresso, similar to the Dolce Gusto. The Vertuoline does not use a 15 bar pressure mechanism (which is necessary for "real" crema) but it has more varieties of coffee and espresso available for purchase than the Dolce Gusto.Milk based espresso drinks are only available for the Dolce Gusto, not the Vertuoline or the Nespresso.  Dolce Gusto also offers coffee, espresso, tea drinks, and hot chocolate.  Additional selections are marketed in other countries and you can usually find them on Amazon if you want to try them out.If you enjoy milk based espresso drinks, the Dolce Gusto is your most convenient option. If you are a bit of a coffee snob, you'll be happier with the Nespresso. If you want the convenience of a machines that makes coffee, espresso, and milk based espresso drinks, the Dolce Gusto is the best choice. I woudn't go with the Vertuoline unless you are willing to do without the 15 bar pressure system.  Since it lacks pressure, the Vertuoline is similar to a Keurig but with higher quality coffees.  That's okay for coffee, but not okay for brewing espresso. I love the 15 bar pressure of the Dolce Gusto - it gives all the drinks you make a thick layer of froth on top!The only thing that holds me back from a five star recommendation is the possibility that the Dolce Gusto line may be discontinued soon.  They closed their online store in June 2015, and now the only place to purchase the full line of capsules is on Amazon or BBB.  Target also sells the capsules, but not the full line.

I read Ms. Slaughter's article in the Atlantic when it came out, and was delighted to read this book.  She writes bluntly about the challenges that women face in the workplace not only at the top where she resides, but also at the lower rungs.  The honesty with which she describes the obstacles and prejudices women encounter is refreshing.  A must read for every women, or anyone who has a daughter.
This easy to use grill takes what would be an ordinary picnic to the next level!  I have always disliked using communal bbq grills, and with grill, there is no need.  Love this grill!
Very pretty!  The chain is very fine  but the pendant itself is solid, and the amethyst is a very pretty shade of purple.  Nicely presented in a blue box.
Easy to use, durable, color coded organization tool.  Will easily last the entire school year!
Fun toy for girls and boys whose parents do not want them to actually pick up bugs.  Works well, and my little boy gets a kick out of using this!
Get my hair clean and smells great!

This entry level video camera is a great choice for someone who wants a basic device for recording videos.  Perhaps someone who feels limited by the memory on their phone or is looking for a video camera that is easier to hold than a phone.  This video camera takes up to a 64GB micro SDXC class 10 memory card, enough for hours of recording even if the highest quality is selected.When I held this camera for the first time, my initial impression was of how light it is.  It literally feels like a toy, with none of the heft I was expecting of a video camera.  There is an adjustable velcro strap that, once properly sized to your hand, makes holding the camera very comfortable and secure.Recording is easy, requiring just the touch of a thumb.  I was disappointed that were not more recording options, such as a slow motion option, but at the entry level perhaps I should not be surprised.  There is a playback option called motion shot video which allows you to view the trajectory of an object (for instance a golf swing) but motion shot videos cannot be saved.I had no issue at all connecting my iPad to the video camera.  There are two separate modes - one for controlling the camera from your phone/tablet, and one for playback and transferring videos to your phone/tablet.To control the camera from your phone/tablet:- In recording mode, press Menu.- Select Wireless, then select Ctrl With Smartphone- The video camera will display its SSID and password.  It is generating its own wifi network, and you use the SSID and password information to connect your phone/tablet to this network.To playback or transfer files from the camera to your phone/tablet:- Select Playback Function, then Menu, then Wireless.- Select Send to Smartphone- The video camera is now creating its own wifi network and will display the information that allows you to connect.  You only have to enter the password on your phone/tablet one time.  After that it should be saved, and in the future you will only need to select the camera's SSID in order to connect.- You have the choice of whether to select the videos/pics you want to transfer/playback from the video camera or from your phone/tablet.  I found it easier to select from my tablet.Low light recording is exceptionally grainy, so consider yourself forewarned.  You will need excellent lighting for crisp video, even if using the Low Lux setting.  At the entry level price point, this is not particularly surprising.In all, I think this video camera is a good product for its price point.  One thing I really like is the built in USB cable so you are never unprepared.  A 5V, 1.5 amp USB wall charger is included, but you can use a common 5V 1 amp smartphone charger as well, it will just take a little longer to get a full charge.Also included in the box are an HDMI cable and a USB extension cable.  There is also an Operating Guide, but it is not very detailed or helpful.  A slightly more informative online resource is located at:http://helpguide.sony.net/cam/1440/v1/en/index.html

Great air purifier for the bedroom!  On its lowest setting it is quiet enough that you can sleep in the same room with the purifier on.  The hepa filter is about 1" thick and has a foam gasket on the back to create a seal.  There is also carbon pre-filter which extends the life of the hepa filter while absorbing odors.  Air is drawn in from the front and expelled from the top of the purifier, so you can put it anywhere, even against a wall.  At this size, you could easily put it on a dresser.
Sturdy case, just the right size for a small hard drive.  The zipper pulls smoothly, and the color is a very nice blue.

Unlike so many middle grade books that are formulaic and not the least bit creative, The Thing About Jellyfish really resonated with my young reader.  There were so many things going on in this book that held her attention. Lots of layers - the trials and tribulations of middle school girl friendships, coping with the death of a friend, selective mutism, learning about jellyfish, and how to travel internationally - just to name a few of the things that my young reader found interesting.  Fantastic book!
This pan is seriously hefty.  Much heavier than I expected it to be based on its size.  It definitely feels like quality!

Very enjoyable suspenseful novel about an island in which one day lasts 28 years, with 14 years of day and 14 years of night.  As night approaches, residents of the island have to depart, bringing all of their possessions with them and leaving their homes spotless for the creatures who will inhabit them during the night.  It's never really explained why the residents have to live on the island to begin with, but it was a great story and my YA reader enjoyed it!

Looks like a iPod, but of course it is not!  However does have some useful funtionality to it.  I particularly like the radio!  Now I can stop hitting the "still listening" button on my Pandora app.  I do enjoy using I Heart Radio, but it doesn't provide all my local stationss, so having a radio like this on hand is perfect for my needs.  Hooked up to my Bose it sounds just fine, and it would be fine with quality headphones as well.This device comes with a USB cable (mini, not the standard micro connection) and headphones.  You can listen to music, and supposedly view videos, pictures and ebooks.  I think all of those functions are a bit of a stretch with a screen so small, but it does radio just fine.

This keyboard is very useful for things such as entering passwords, passcodes, and of course texting.  It also linked up immediately with the Xbox One, with no need to fiddle with settings and no batteries necessary.  Just plug the receiver into the back of the Xbox you're done.  There are a couple of things that could be improved. The keyboard does not stay firmly attached to the controller, and also found that I sometimes have to press a key more than once to get it to regsister.  At other times I get a double letter showing up even though I pressed the key just once.  Despite these issues, this keyboard can be a very useful accessory.

Super nice hard drive - I hardly believe how thin it is! Very modern and sleek.  The packaging which has foam padding and a magnetic closure, easily doubles as a hard drive case.  It even has a storage space for the USB cable.

Works great.  I like the look of the stainless steel, and while I did not expect the handle to be separate and not permanently attached, the grinder does store easily in the provided pouch because of this configuration.  I think if you plan to use a grinder on a frequent basis, you will want one with a handle that is more securely attached.  Otherwise a great product that is appropriate for occasional use.
Didn't really appeal to my YA reader, who found it confusing.
Would have been 5 stars but the story dragged from the middle towards the end.  Will be a fun read for fans of dystopian fiction.
Too realistic for my young reader.  I understand that it's meant to be historical fiction in a sense, but it just did not resonate with my reader.

Reminded my younger reader of The Secrets We Keep (in which twins were in an accident but only one survived and there is confusion about the identity of the survivor), but unfortunately not as good.  Seemed unoriginal and derivative.  Would recommend The Secrets We Keep over this book.

Full featured spiral notebook, with moveable folder/dividers.  The spiral is covered with a piece of sewn on nylon fabric, and there is an elastic pen loop as well.  It's more of a binder/notebook hybrid, the main difference being that you cannot add additional paper.
Action packed addition to the series. The illustrations are helpful if you have a reluctant reader.

Attractive serving board.  It's only 1/2 inch thick but a nice looking piece.  In a pinch I would be tempted to use this as an additonal cutting board, though not without oiling first, and it's unclear how the stain would hold up in that situation.  As a serving piece, it's very nice.
This book was so sad but I loved it.  The protagonist grapples with a terrible disease and finds friends who can support him and help him.  A tragic but touching and amazing story.

Riveting story about a girl whose older sister drowned, and who is now receiving creepy stalker notes.  There's a side story about the girl's ambitions to be a baker and attend a culinary institute, and the at the end of the book all the loose ends are tied up.  How the sister died, who is writing the notes - all is explained.  Good story.

Written in the same style as When You Reach Me, this was a great book.  It was cool to find out who the mystery person was.  Story had a moral, but wasn't as annoying as moral filled stories normally are.
The sky ships and the bird human were confusing.  Kept reading all the way to the end in the hope that it would get better, but it did not.  The disease the girl had was interesting, however.

The clasp is very difficult to use.  My wife had to help me put it on!  Maybe it gets easier with practice, and if you leave it on all the time it is probably less of an issue.  I did like the data on the quality of my sleep, and found that the tracker was accurate when I was engaged in high intensity exercise.  The tracker would be more useful to me if it had a display.

This spiralizer works great!  I was initially taken aback by the plastic parts, which seem like an afterthought to shave costs and for that reason quite tacky at this price point.  I cannot help but think that the plastic will eventually separate from the metal, a planned obsolescence.But that said, the spiralizer works perfectly.  Spiral cut apples are a revelation of a snack, and cucumber noodles are perfection in salad.  There are other popular spiral cutters on the market for less, but this one will have cult appeal for KitchenAid fans.  I know I certainly love it!

In "The Nightingale Before Christmas," Donna Andrews returns to her home-town writing with many of  our favorite characters.  And while continuing to keep Meg constantly tired and sleepless, at least she didn't bash, stab, or brutalize her.  In fact, the one "dire straight" that Meg finds herself in, is a bit of a giggle considering how battered she has been in previous novels.  Let's just say she was, for a short time, restrained by "passementerie."Andrews knows how to build a character and she does very well with a house full of competing decorators.  Each one stands out and is memorable.  She is also the queen of the red herring, which I love.  She offers so many possible solutions to the murder that it builds suspense and whets your appetite for what is to come.In this book, Meg's husband, Michael, is slightly more than just Meg's handmaiden.  He has his own stage to stand upon (literally). And the twins have moved from being totally obnoxious to behaving much more like simple lively boys with good imaginations.  I hope they continue to make this transition to civilization.  As for Michael, very odd.  Such a potentially fascinating character, yet Andrews doesn't seem to know what to do with him.  Perhaps he is too good to be true.  Perhaps, like all the other "loveable characters" in the family (Rob, Rose Noir, Dad and Grampa spring immediately to mind), Michael needs a few flaws to humanize him, and, of course, flaws are the engines that motivate action in any character.Andrews excels in description in this book.  You can clearly envision each of the rooms being decorated differently in the show house and see how it matches up with the decorator.
