He stresses Thoreau's humorous and sociable sides, necessary to a well-rounded picture.

I agree with the other reviewers. If you have a modicum of French, this is the translation to go for -- plain, prose, with an excellent introduction to basic issues involving French poetry (syllable-ization, tone, word choice, etc.).  The introduction alone is masterful. There are many other facing page translations -- I have used Fowlie and Richardson in the past -- but I would now go with this one.

An excellent book, with first rate essays. There are a million things that could be written about Ruskin, and these are all sensible and well illustrated. The only slight flaw is that some of the pictures are in black and white (not all).  But it is certainly worth it -- I particularly liked Newall's essay specifically on drawing.

This is a pretty good biography, not great. There are chunks of it that are unnecessary filler, ostensibly "background".  I don't have any trouble, as other reviewers have had,  with the discussions of Melville's sexuality -- Delbanco seems to be fair and judicious about the assumptions of the period, and the displacements of metaphor. Pierre (as just one example) is seriously strange/incestuous -- you have to be blind not to see that.  The evaluations of Moby Dick and Billy Budd are the centre pieces of the book, and are done well.  Overall, I did feel that with someone like Melville the writing should have been more something -- deeper, more exciting, maybe? Perhaps D.H. Lawrence, Leslie Fiedler and others have just raised the bar too high.  Or perhaps Melville's later life was just so dreary  that we are inevitably disappointed by the protracted waning of his thunderous vastness.

This is an elegant little book, mostly about Spinoza's life and times. There is hardly any philosophy in it (the Ethics is summed up in a few pages), but what there is is very deftly done (the Ethics is placed in the context of a review of neo-Platonic/kabbalistic emanationism).  The best thing about it is the judicious discussion of the complex Jewish and Dutch history of the period, and the strange array of new believers of various sorts who probably/possibly intersected with Spinoza.This is not the book I would give to anyone who wants to work through the philosophy, but, as mentioned already, it is good on the life and times; and the references to various recent articles and books on the context of Spinoza are valuable.

Claire Tomalin is up and down as a biographer (her Dickens bio is dreary) but this one is great. It is beautifully written, with just the right balance between life and literature. You can tell (as she states in her Acknowledgements) that she has been marinated in Hardy for many years.  Her special treatment of the poems is particularly welcome -- the sea change in their assessment over the past half century (a tip of the hat to Philip Larkin) shows itself here.  Of course Millgate is the standard, but this is a terrific short(isn) biography.No index though (at least in the Kindle edition).

This is one of a number of recent guides to Spinoza's Ethics. It is solid, and straightforward -- it moves through the text from the beginning, making good points and clarifying as it goes. It doesn't cover the whole range of complexities (for example, it doesn't deal with the crux in IP5 concerning attributes that prompted Leibniz to argue that Spinoza has committed a logical fallacy), but it is a good book to start with.  Almost any aid to the Ethics has something of use. So, the more the merrier.  My recommendation would be to graduate from here to Nadler's Introduction which is more detailed.

This is a very strange book, which (as a seriously besotted Piero fan) I eagerly pounced on. On the good side, there is a lot of erudition (especially in the notes) and a strong narrative, intermingled with interesting material on the rise of neo-Platonism in Renaissance Italy. On the other side, there are all kinds of problems. First, the author is trying to make a deep connection between Piero's work (especially the mathematical) and Platonism, which is perhaps fair, but there is no hard evidence for this. The author admits (in a footnote) that nowhere in Piero's writings is there any mention of Plato or Platonism.  What we get is a lot of maybe's and perhaps, and "Alberti was in X at possibly the same time, and Piero could have been drinking at the same cafe" kind of writing.  Large portions of the text are about other people and other events -- all the way up to the burning of Giordano Bruno 100 years later, and then Isaac Newton.  The second half of the book is about the rediscovery of Piero, and not about Piero at all.  Lastly, the book title is misleading: there is nothing significant about Piero and Light together in the book, except that Piero's paintings are in this cool light (in fact, a great deal more could have been made about the relationship between light and dark in paintings like Constantine's dream).  I did learn a few things, for which I am grateful.  Most importantly, it led me to an interactive web site showing, in great detail, the entire sequence of frescos in Arezzo, which is a fabulous resource (Amazon doesn't seem to allow links), but a little searching will bring it up.

This is a model of science writing for the layperson.  It gives the reader a solid introduction to aspects of soil ecology, and takes us around to various scientists and their projects at work.  I have one or two quibbles (there should have been a glossary), and we should have been given more on the different kinds of soils and soil types, but it is nevertheless a fine read.  The reader comes away with (1) a better sense of the deep complexity of soil and the creatures that complexify together in it; and (2) continuing grim amazement at the unholy mess human beings are making of this lovely planet.

Terrible, terrible title for this book; but it's an amazing, totally enjoyable tour de force (and I mean force).  I hated the first few pages, because of the mosaic/kaleidoscope approach, but it grew on me, and eventually it seems to be the only way to deal with the myriadness of D'annunzio. Unbelievable life. The man was clearly priapic, insane, delusional, and yet it all worked for him. Not for others: they all got killed or left behind, but it worked for him!

I've been reading this translation along with the classic Suzuki translation and the Cleary translation. This is obviously the most reader friendly, with notes and glossary, and straightforward English (sometimes a little too straightforward). Red Pine and Cleary are somewhat easier to read and smoother than Suzuki (mostly because they translate the vast-sounding names and technical jargon), but occasionally Cleary's translation is not in anything like readable English (see below). It is worth noting that the Cleary translation has no apparatus, and no introduction, etc. I would certainly advise having the Suzuki translation (which has a long introduction) to hand as a complement, if you are really going at this sutra. Even better would be to have the Suzuki "Studies in the LS", because in the back of it is a substantive glossary to his translation. The Red Pine translation has extensive notes, many of which refer to the Sanskrit original (Red Pine's is from the Chinese), that Red Pine admits he is at dictionary level reading ability. For the interested reader, here are three versions of the same piece (from section VIII of Chapter II, in the Suzuki numbering):Seeing the three realms of existence as caused by the impressions of mistaken ideas elaborated since beginningless time, by mindfulness of the non-origination of the imageless stage of buddhahood, having attained the ultimate truth first hand, the master of one's mind, having attained effortless practice, like a jewel of all colours, maintains certainty in the orderly combination of the steps of the stages by means of subtle created forms entering the minds of beings, through understanding mind alone. - ClearyWho sees that the habit-energy of projections of the beginningless past is the cause of the three realms and who understands that the tathagata stage is free from projections or anything that arises, attains the personal realization of buddha knowledge and effortless mastery over their own minds. And like gems capable of reflecting every colour, they enter the subtlest thoughts of other beings and in their apparation bodies teach them `nothing but mind' while establishing them in the sequence of stages. -Red PinePerceiving that the triple existence is by reason of the habit-energy of erroneous discrimination and false reasoning that has been going on since beginningless time, and also thinking of the state of Buddhahood which is imageless and unborn, [the Bodhisattva] will become thoroughly conversant with the noble truth of self-realization, will become a perfect master of his own mind, will conduct himself without effort, will be like a gem reflecting a variety of colours, will be able to assume the body of transformation, will be able to enter into the subtle minds of all beings, and, because of his belief in Mind-only, will, by, gradually ascending the stages, become established in Buddhahood. - SuzukiIt is noticeable that there are different choices (e.g. is there one 'being' established in Buddhahood, or many?) being made here. Finally, it is worth noting that the Red Pine translation does not include the final chapters that were added on later to the core. Having slogged through the Sagathakam -- a miscellaneous grab bag of earlier sections and some additional thoughts that are somewhat intriguing -- I don't miss it. But the added chapter on meat-eating is interesting.

This is a much expanded version of an earlier book and set of ideas of Takamaro Shigaraki's, long out of print.  His is a profound re-interpretation of Shin Buddhism, taking into account the Mahayana background and references to Zen, etc.  Perhaps the strongest element of it is the dismantling of interpretations of Shin that assume dualism, and especially a faith in a completely separate power, etc., as if Amida was some kind of deity. The first half of the book is stronger than the second half (particularly for non Shin Buddhists, like this reviewer), because of its focus on this dismantling.  The second half is fairly straightforward Shin/Pure Land teaching.  Among the profound discussions in the book is the interconnection between deep evil and deep mind (roughly, that it is in the graininess of our deepest evil that we discover and are discovered by our spirituality (the darkest shadow we cast is an oblique expression of the brightest light).  Such was Shinran's insight.Parts of this book are on the same level as D.T. Suzuki's old Shin Buddhism book (an entry into the Shin 'mind world" for Zen practioners) -- one of the great spiritual books of the 20th century.
Needed something to powder baby powder.May need cheesecloth or some finer filter to make the powder finer when dispensing.

Used this in my Z170 Mini-ITX build.CASE: Silverstone Tek Mini SG13BMOTHERBOARD: Gigabyte LGA1151 Z170 GA-Z170N-Gaming 5GRAPHICS CARD:Gigabyte GeForce GTX 970 4GBCPU: i7 6700kCPU COOLER: H80i GTRADIATOR REPLACEMENT FANS: Corsair SP120 Quiet Edition Twin Pack FanDDR4 RAM: Crucial Ballistix Sport 16GB Kit (8GBx2)SSD STORAGE: Samsung 850 2.5in 500gbHDD STORAGE: HGST 7K100 2.5in 1TB 7200 RPMPOWER SUPPLY: Corsair CX Series 750 WattHas No issues with any of the parts and works well.Fans were not for Case Airflow but for Radiator of the H80i GT in a Pull Airflow Configuration.Due to size limitations only one was used.With some modding it would be possible to fit the second SP120 fan in PUSH by Cutting/Drilling the 4 screw holes through the mesh.

Used this in my Z170 Mini-ITX build.CASE: Silverstone Tek Mini SG13BMOTHERBOARD: Gigabyte LGA1151 Z170 GA-Z170N-Gaming 5GRAPHICS CARD:Gigabyte GeForce GTX 970 4GBCPU: i7 6700kCPU COOLER: H80i GTRADIATOR REPLACEMENT FANS: Corsair SP120 Quiet Edition Twin Pack FanDDR4 RAM: Crucial Ballistix Sport 16GB Kit (8GBx2)SSD STORAGE: Samsung 850 2.5in 500gbHDD STORAGE: HGST 7K100 2.5in 1TB 7200 RPMPOWER SUPPLY: Corsair CX Series 750 WattHas No issues with any of the parts and works well.System posted fine on First assembly.Samsing 850 SSD was pre-installed with Win 10  before assemble.I had so much fun cramming all the parts into this build.Comes with a bag of screws for HDD/SSD installation, PSU screws, and extras in case of loss.Somethings to point out:The front panel USB 3.0 connectors to the motherboard seemed a bit short and just barely fit after zigzagging under the H80i GT and over the Crucial Ballistix Elite DDR4 ram.All other HDD LED, LED +, LED -, PWR, RST were long enough and had no issues.Even after zigzagging I had over 5 inches left over to reroute if needed.I wanted to put the FULL H80i GT into the chassis with the Corsair CX750 but the cramming would eliminate 1 of the DDR4 ram.So I had to remove one of the Fans, now the Radiator is in a PULL fan configuration.The CX750 sits ~1.5" inch above the H80i GT CPU "water block".Currently is what I believe is to be the smallest case on the market.Only thing that sucks is that there's only 1 fan in the entire system (excluding PSU fan).Highly recommend this case.

A must have for any Moe Chronicle fan.incredibly illustrated pictures of characters from the game.I would sincerely say this is a Collector's Edition Art book.There are two versions of Full Sized Art books for Moe Chronicles at the moment and this is one of them, the other is by Genkai.Each Art book is unique and covers things not mentioned or illustrated in teh other art book.All in Japanese.

Was not explicitly stated but the instructions says that only a TOTAL of 6 ounces could be used at a given time.Because Part 1 Resin and Part 2 Hardener needs to be used in EQUAL Volume, only 3 total ounces of each could be used for a total of 6 ounces.This makes larger casting projects really difficult.Other than that everything is very straightforward in terms of preparation and letting it finalize. Really expensive.

Prices:Yellow/Orange ~$39.95Assortment/White/Blue/Grey/Lime ~$49 +The $10 diff did not justify the color change so I stuck with Yellow as I could see it from a glance easily.Fantastic alternative to using Yellow Masking tape and ending up with gooey sticky wires.Fits up to 2mm thick wires to ~< 0.5 inch wires.Don't use on wires too thin (under 2mm) or else the "auto-fit cone" will chafe the wire and cut it.Specifically bought these to label the USB 3.0 wires from External HDD bays so I will not accidentally unplug the wrong one.Paper inserts are optional and included.Comes with 100 Dotz Cord ID pro cable caps.Comes with 2 sized paper inserts with 50 tabs on each. #1-50 is repeated for teh second card.2 more sticker sheets #1-50.This means the numbering system will not exceed 50.Was really tempted to but the rainbow assortment, but the price did not justify the need to buy it.The color offering is significant to quickly pinpoint certain wires/cables rom a glance if color coded.Do not expect the section of teh wire that is capped to bend, it won't bend, and WILL damage your cable.Plan accordingly especially when Zip-tieing cables to avoid cable damage.Highly recommend having teh Dotz Caps roughly 1/4" to 1/2" away from the USB connections to allow some play and flexibility.Will buy more if needed.

Fits Fiskars 12 Inch Titanium SureCut Paper Trimmer (01-005454).Had the trimmer cut KAPCO EZ Covers II for over 400 books or a total of 800x 1mil ply plastic coverings until the edge has dulled.These blades are amazing, even with a dulled edge can still slice through paper elegantly.Bought these as spares in case the blades ultimately fail due to loss of durability.Triple track as described.

Bought two of these as gifts for Friends @ $17.99 Prime, this was a good deal. At the same or less quality, other Brick n' mortar stores sold for around ~$30-$40 for the same size.My friends recently bought a HP 17.3 inch laptop and wanted to help them out with new Laptop bags.I had it shipped to me, personally inspected the quality, and was satisfied with what Amazon branded product was selling.Great as a College bag alternative.Highly recommended if buying on a budget.Don't expect too much from the shoulder-strap, it's typical borderline quality.

Great Quality. Smooth Black Matte Exterior Finish. Plug'n'play.Bought these to replace my old HP desktop mouse and as hardware backups in case my Razer Naga 2014 dies on me.Literally Plug and play. Can use the mouse while the drivers install in teh background.The USB cable is thin, almost thinner than my old HP mouse but is more flexible and you feel less mouse drag from the cable.Mouse function of left/right click and Up/down Scroll Wheel.Very basic at a great cost @ $6.99 Prime.FRY's was selling the HP USB wired mouse for ~$15.

My original Desk Setup from left to right is Razer Orbweaver Elite, Logitech K750 Keyboard, and Razer Naga 2014.Bought: Perixx PERIBOARD-407BHowever, because the K750 is a full size keyboard, its length intrudes half of my mouse mat limiting the movement of the mouse.I no longer use the Numkey pad too much when i play games, so I needed a "mini" keyboard to accommodate the limited space of my pull-out desk try.This perixx is awesome and does just that.ONE THING TO NOTE: I initially thought the keyboard was faulty but the built in NumKey covers the letters from "Q" to "P" on the QWERTY keyboard layout. The manual said nothing about NUmkey so i thought it wasn't included and actually thought my Perixx was defective. After pressing the keys, I found out there was a FN + NumLock in Blue and corrected the simple mistake.Highly recommend.I wanted to but the Preixx one with Back-lit, however due to overwhelming negative reviews on build quality and bleeding light, I decided to opt for this model as my previous keyboard K750 was not Back-lit so I am not missing out much.

Originally bought this for transferring files from my Xperia Z tablet to my Xperia Z Phablet.However, even though SanDisk purposely made teh Micro USB 2.0 longer than conventional USB 2.0 Micro, it still has a hard time connecting due to the size of Cases interfering with the connection. The case on both devices only extrude out by 5 mm (silicone and plastic).Also the slide mechanism for choosing the USB 2.0 or USB 2.0 Micro is weak and breaks out of the internal lock if more than 2 lb of force is applied.If I were to remove the cases for the tablet/phablet, i have no issues with the connection.The metal loop is permanently attached to the SD Ultra and is NOT part of the locking Mechanism.I now use it as a Flash Drive between PCs and Android Devices.

TL:DR; I wish it came with a rack. Inner Curved handle bar area takes some getting used to.Incredible Barbell.Barbell on a Pound Scale weighs 10 pounds by itself. Think of a Solid Steel ROD.The two caps on opposite ends have Rubber O-Rings and the Barbell has two Rubber O-Ring inserts. This ensures the Weights added will be gripped in place when caps are screwed on tight.I had to make a Wooden rack for the Barbell as replacing the weights was quite difficult if not held up off the ground.The inner curved handle bar area takes some getting used to but is great for beginners (like me) to help correct posture and breaking down into the basics.Despite teh curved handle, can still do overhead and most of all weight lifting barbell techniques.Depending on your style, preference may prefer the Solid Straight Rod instead of this curled one.Haven been using it for 2 weeks now but due to my own weight-lifting limit, I only load 7.5 lb. on each end for a current total of (7.5 x 2 + 10) = 25 lb.s
Needed this for my Black Satin CrossTech 2 as replacement tips.Fits and works as promised. No lack of quality.

Great book. I also own "Black & Decker The Complete Guide to Wiring 5th Edition", and "Wiring a House 4th Edition: Completely Revised and Updated." and "Home Improvement 1-2-3 [Large Print]"As a comparison:Home Depot 123 is like a manual for quick easy jobs.For people who think receptacles shoot lightning and great for beginners as its simple and easy to understand. Basically the Basics but intermediate enough to mess with circuit breakers and not get electrocuted to death by them.Black & Decker is HARDCORE!They assume you know what you are doing and you won't electrocute yourself with a metal ladder on of a puddle of water while running HOT electric lines. This book goes straight into advanced wiring designs and circuits for projects, electrical codes you need to know to be up to standards, and installing therm-electric floor-warming systems. It also goes lightly into electric appliance repair such as disassembling a burned out lamp circuitry to integrating a back-up power supply to your house.Wiring a House For Pros by Pros (The name says it all)This book teaches you the experience to be an electrician. It emphasizes the difference between an electrician that came fresh out of school and an electrician that has been On-the-job for 30+ years. Words cannot simply describe the ESSENTIAL information in this book. If Black & Decker is hardcore, this book is for Journey Men and Masters of the Trade. However this book does not go in-depth in planning home electrical projects. It makes you a smarter, wiser, and a more experienced electrician.Complete Home Improvement is right between B&D and Pros By Pros. This book contains some information regarding screw sizes a machine bolts that the other books just don't talk about.Other than screws and various perspectives of how to install a toilet, the rest of the book quite remains the same as the others.Still glad I got this book so I can use screws more efficiently.

The reason I am only giving this +3 Stars is because of the bad implementation.What I used, ALL are Android Based obviously:-Xperia Z (Phone, 1st Gen) 5" FUll-HD Display-Xperia Z Ultra (Phablet) 6.4" FUll-HD Display-Xperia Z Tablet (Tablet) 10.1" FUll-HD DisplayBut First, here's why it got +3 Stars.THE GOOD: [+3 Stars]-Supports any Device running Android.-With Amazon Prime you have access to all movies associated with the Prime Account. Watched all the Season of Archer in it's HD quality.-Video Quality based on Quality of Video Standard Definition [SD], or High Definition [HD].-Worked on all 3 of my Xperia Devices Flawlessly. Video streams scaled with each devices screens with no issues.THE BAD: [-1 Star]-Initially requires Side loading of the Amazon APP via Amazon's Webpage. DO NOT SIDE LOAD the Amazon App from another website besides Amazon, due to Virus/Phishing/Malware.-After Installing Amazon's Marketplace APP, then requires installing the Amazon Prime Instant Video APP.THE UGLY: [-1 Star]-It's just an APP shortcut to Amazons Prime instant Video.For Example, if you loaded up Android Chrome or Android Firefox, and went to Amazons Homepage via the browser then navigated to Amazon Prime Video, That's exactly what it looks like.The only difference is a few buttons like "BUY NOW" or "NEXT SEASON" are bigger compared to the PC Internet Browser version.FINAL THOUGHTS:Then again, what's isn't broken shouldn't be fixed.It just felt kinda  cheap how the Amazon Copy and pasted the PC internet version of the Amazon webpage and used it as the final product as an APP. There were some noticeable differences, but not enough to make a difference.The more simple shortcut would have been to make a Android Shortcut from Amazon's Prime Instant Video Webpage and dropped the shortcut onto the home screen of the Android Device.Amazon's Fire Stick TV was waaaaaaay better than this. But the bottom line is that it works, just feels like the APP itself wasn't a necessity and I could have used Android Firefox and navigated to the Amazon Webpage.

Got this as a Gift for a friend into Crystal collections.The black shine was really gorgeous. It is hard to see in the image but the striations and light reflections off the Obsidian glass like surface was really beautiful.Friend told me it has to be worn outside of a shirt as the rock itself isn't polished and is really abrasive to the skin.Because my friend is into Crystal collection and Jewelry making, the included Silver interlocking necklace chain was scrapped for a more personalized necklace.Also the Necklace attachment to the Black Tourmeline is really interesting, it is dipped into molten metal.Originally I thought (based on the product image) that a metal smith made a custom metal bracket and Super-glued/Epoxy it to the top of the crystal.However upon receiving the Crystal and inspecting it, it appears the the rock was DIPPED into molten metal and had the Necklace Hoop casted  into the top of the crystal for a very custom, tight, and unique fit.The only con is if the Crystal wasn't properly cleaned before the molten dipping.Otherwise the Metal casted cap might fall off, but from the looks of the finished product, it seemed to be really solid.There was no flaking of black Tourmeline on this necklace.I suppose that it was lightly tumbled/cleaned before it was made into a pendant.Due to Superior Workmanship in Metal Dipping I had to give it [+2 stars].Because this was a gift for a friend, And was very pleased [+2 Stars].Product itself was well packaged and came with a Silver interlocking necklace Chain [+1 Star]

Great book and very detailed in labeling and diagramming the internal mechanisms of a "Typical" Home door lock.I have a good 2 year experience at assembling locks and switching the cores for new key replacements and reshaping the metal nubs. This book was a good refresher on some techniques I missed out on.I mainly got this book to get a better understanding of how to open door locks more efficiently with power tools, and be more aware of the variety of locks available out there. Some of the locks illustrated in the book are almost 10 years old and some people say those locks are outdated. But just because a certain lock is outdated doesn't mean it's no longer in use. Some people are resistant to changing their locks, and the longer they keep their old locks means lock smiths need to have a good variety of knowledge of all the locks out there in circulation.A great book to read. Its spread out like a Physics Textbook starting off with vectors and then bringing you into the meat of the lock. No actual Physics Math required, but some knowledge on torque is a must.I have considered other books such as:>>>Practical Lock Picking, Second Edition: A Physical Penetration Tester's Training GuideHOWEVER, the reviews were very contradictory and seems to convince readers into buying "specialty" tools made by the author or some specific lock maker with tools up to $300.TL:DR; For Power-drilling through locks, a certain sized drill-bit is required and long enough to go "almost" straight through. The Idea is to destroy how it can "ID" a key. I won't spoil too much of the fun of breaking through locks this way, as the book explains it more thoroughly in context and technique.LOVE THIS BOOK.

Used this with:AMACO 25 -Pound Air Dry Clay, Moist, White (Water-based clay)Sargent Art Plastilina Modeling Clay, 5-Pound, Cream (Oil-based Clay)Favorite tool in the bag is the Knife Shaped one. Good for puttying and shaping features.Some of the tools look like it came right out of factory and into the packaging so there is some loose wood shavings and some parts like the "Fork" one has ~1mm wood splinters still between the forks. Not a deal-breaker, and works fine overall.If the tool is too dry, I soak the tools in water before using. This works exceptionally well when smoothing water-based clays. Not so well with oil based clays.

Non-Air Dry Polymer Clay. Each "Slab" is roughly 1 pound.$16.56 for this pack of 5 pounds so roughly ~$3.31 per pound.Was by far the cheapest and most Well-reviewed clay I could find on Amazon.PROS:-At roughly ~$3.12 per pound.-Easy to use right out of the plastic Bag.-Really mud rock hard when room temperature cold.-Good for imprinting without dirtying or damaging the object.-Almost similar to earthquake clay (stuff used to prevent objects from sliding during earthquakes)-Works with wood and metal tools.-Easy to sculpt with.CONS:-The longer you use it, the softer it gets. The more kneading, sweat from hands, and application of body heat causes the clay to become soft like cookie dough.-TO Quickly set the clay to "re-harden" so it's not cookie dough soft, it needs to be chilled (i.e. in a freezer or with Ice in a bag), or some way to let it sit in a cool place. The polymer clay won't turn to stone but will "set" itself to its mud rock hard touch.FINAL THOUGHTS:-A completely different clay compared to water based clays. No silicone dust flying around and no loss of clay when being worked with.-Almost like Silly putty but much denser and harder.My Actual usage was to use this stuff in Resin Casting. The polymer clay helps reduce water-damage and clean up when Rubber casting the objects with this polymer based clay. Stuff works wonderfully well. FYI, I still need to use Mold Release Spray, it is a necessity regardless of what clay I use.

I needs male DC power jack adapters to hook up a 12V battery Adapter (8x 1.5v AA batteries in Series) to power my 3528 LED strip.Worked like a charm.The screw down screws were a bit tricky to use as I was slipping in 22 gauge wire and had to fold the ends to make it thicker so the Screw can hold the wire down.The screw when "screwed" pushes down a metal sheet inside that clips or bites the wire.THere are + and - signs on top to indicate the HOT and neutral wire for insertion.Bag came with 10 pcs, I have tried 2 and both worked fine.

Ingenious Design!This is the 1735790 Ultra Fine Tip: BLACKAll Sharpies have a cap to prevent the small felt tip from drying out. So I was puzzled about this but having a retractable tip is great as I don't have to constantly pop off the cap. The old version had such a tight cap, I had to use two hands to pop them open.There is a little circle plastic flap in the inside that seals the felt tip from exposure to the outside air.When the retractable pen tip is protracted, the mechanism causes the circle flap to retrace while protracting the felt tip.This ensures that the tip is not damaged from long term clicking or over-clicking miss-use.For $15.91 for 12 of the black Ultra fine tips, this was a moderately better deal over the newer Pen Stylos which cost almost $2 each.The old trusty standard of pop-caps go for around $7.49 for 12 making it much cheaper but the extra cost for the retractable function is worth the price.As always, Sharpies can be written on anything. I use Acetone to wash the Sharpie off of Glass or Impermeable Surfaces.There is Bleed through.Notable points of where it bleeds is the first time the tip touches the paper making a circle blot and anytime the felt tip goes through a slow drag across paper. This will be noticeable on the back side of the paper.Though this may depend on the thickness of paper and how much pressure is applied when writing.Highly suggest testing the Pen on a scrap piece of paper before using it as a main pen.I highly recommend this and will be buying more if I run out!

Poor sound, impossible to hear the CD. The broadcast is interesting but not a these price. Is like the old bootleg , the bad bootleg . If you like Return to Forever try another record.

After the success of his records Black Radio Volume 1 and 2, Glasper come back to the acoustic world. It not a classic trio album, is different , is jazz but in a very personal way. The trio is excellent, Vicente Archer on bas and the incredible Damion Reid on drums, was recorded life in the famous Capitol studios with this usual musicians in his previous trio albums. He play songs of Radiohead, Joni Mitchell , John Legend … and his own compositions, but ant the end is the same, the sound is the Glasper sounds. He is a great piano player but for me is more important that is completely different to the rest of the piano player. A exceptional live album. Is not a straight jazz album, is the way how Robert Glasper feel the music.PS. Very emotive the collaboration of Harry Belafonte

New album, new songs after 13th years and  and still the same great old friends beside us. Is something familiar, simple but  full of feelings. The same old feelings..but who wants that James Taylor changes? This CD is great, the voice is great, the arrange are great…Taylor is part of America sound, from Vietnam to Afganistan, to the 60 to 2015. You will love this album. sure that this will be part of your life in seven days or less. For me Taylor and his greatest albums, included this, are like the John Ford films. eternal, natural like life, and near, very near of the essential things.This edition include a DVD "there we were: The recording of James Taylor's Before this World" 35 minutes that show how he make the music and how is the man who makes the music. Great

Finally Terence found the way to a new career . Forget the classic Terence Blanchard and hear this new and breathless CD. Fusion music, electric jazz, hip hop... I think all Blanchard's fan expected this change. Produced by Don Was and with a incredible group Ecollective, Blanchard get the better trumpet sound  in years. Also is a album to connected with the new generation of jazz lovers. Is not a commercial album, is a new way to make jazz for bigger audience. A impresive collection of songs. Great.

To celebrate the 50th anniversary of the first edition of John Coltrane's A LOVE SUPREME, Branford Marsalis have decided to re- edit the incredible concert in Amsterdam from 2003 where Marsalis and his quartet decided play all A love supreme in live. Is a great concert, really historic session. The complete quartet create a magic moment a superb concert. This edition have 1 audio CD (48,,45) and a splendid DVD with all the concert, very well edited and with a very good sound. This DVD incluyed interviews with Alice Coltrane, musicians and bonus tour footage, (running time 110,23) . The price is fantastic and the covert to. A very good occasion to make a special tribute to the Master John Coltrane. essential of all jazz lovers.

The Bad Plus plus Joshua Redman make a exquisite album, full of good ideas a plenty of real good music. Is nice to hear and with a real important structure that make possible that Bas Plus still with his classic Bad Plus Sound and Redman still be Redman, there is not big innovatattions but a lot of god moments. Great solos and a special sense of feelings. A great album with only one problem with this musicians they could make a different album, with a little big risk

This is a solid album, like the four Allen previous CD. Is jazz, pure jazz. Only three elements, bass with Gregg August, drums with Rudy Royston and Allen in tenor saxophone. For me JD Allen is one of the greatest tenor in this moment. Powerful, intensive . and very spiritual. Is in the same line of John Coltrane, when I heard him my mind blow up.Is really a great event each new Allen CD. Probably for some people is a little  old fashion, for me is pure. Another great album from JD Allen, probably his best trio album until now

Bill Carrothers is a really good and sensitive jazz musician but this CD is something different . Is not jazz, no gospel not quite classical music but work. Is a collection of classical church music, singing by his wife and with different musicians, cello, clarinets, double bass and one choir. In fact is a exercises of memory trough the songs that he uses to hear on sundays in a lutheran church. Probably for american audience will be more interesting, in fact for me is very nice and simple, very good arranged and remembering me the childhood. I don't know  if is correct the term "white gospel"but for me this album discover to me the connection between european church music and american gospel, very interesting. Is very frail and nice. Also this work connected with his previous albums like "Excelcior " or "The Blues and the Greys: Music of the Civil War" or even "Armistice 1918" or "Civil War Diaries" all of them about the relevant of recent history in the music. Great work, very selective and nice

This is the new concept for a most important Coleman idea in years. Probably this concept will change the idea of orcheschestration in jazz in the future. Steve Coleman make a really revolutionary innovation in music, like Coltrane or Ornette Coleman did before. Steve explain the idea in the boocklet but this is great. This new Coleman CD is probably one of his gratest album, easy to hear . complacate to do . 22 greats mussicians and a incredible sense of music. This album can change the jazz. Please hear it you will not forget it. Many things will change after this work, really essential.

Thessaloniki was one's of these citys essencial for the cross culture between Europe and Asia. This is the sound of these facts. The ,incredible voice f Savina Yannatou with Primavera Salonica, six greats  musicians. presents songs from differents cultures, and differents idionms, that live toguether in this town, sefardíes songs, greeck music, armenians, Salv-macedonian, bulgarian, turkish.., fron differents epoques..Differents ways to understand the world but only One City . Beautiful music, beautiful traditional sounds. A CD to understads better our world in changes

From Koln Concert until now have been passed too many years. During threes decades Jarret have recorded a lot of solo-improvitation albums, always with the complete concert , now in his 70th anniversary had decided make another solo album but selected only parts of differents concerts.  All the material is from his 2014 tour , in concrete from Tokio, Toronto, Paris and Rome, during april-july, and all the parts are  unrecorded before. All is new material the difference is the was selected by Jarret himself and all together is like a improvisation  suite . Is really beautiful, more intense, more private, if you prefer have more structure and less lost times. You will find IX Parts really exquisite really inspired. For me is one of the finest example of solo improvisation pieces of all his career . The serenity is the rule of this CD. Jarret play only for you, create music only for you. A great album. Jarret still on the top.

How many great music we have lost during this years from Bill Fay?. Too may. After he was lost during 30 years, he make in 2012 a great album, but this one is better. Deep, melodic, romantic and beautiful. Who is the sender is probably his better album. Bill Fay is exquisite, out of the time, eternal. Is a estrange case to discover, how the company can forget this genius? Great recorder, great songs, great album. Is especially sensible the strings arranged and incredible his voice. In this times we need record like this, when the the time is really TIME, when all people needs a personal space to think. A mater piece.

Since 2011 Pat Martino and High Notes had edited a collection of private recordings with a very high level of quality from Martino. The duos edited are greats but this one probably is the best .Martino on guitar and Jim Rild on keyboards present here a very personal and intimate session . Brilliant touch and good to understand the perfect way to play of both. Some standards and other songs, are the perfect way to love the Pat Martino guitar. Martino is one of the greatest guitar in jazz scene, even now. A very, very nice CD with a really master, you can't be wrong buying this album. Deep and fascinated encounter

What are you locking for ? If you try to hear a great new jazz album this is you record. Two master, Joe Lovano and Dave Douglas under the influence of Wayne Shorter, with a great drummer Joey Baron and two splendid musicians, Linda Oh on bass and a marvelous pianist ,Lawrence Fields, all play in live Monterey Jazz Festival on september of 2013. Great solos and beautiful compositions from Lovano, Douglas and Shorter. The  influence of Shorter is clear in all the album and I love Shorter, conclusion; I love the album. Instead if you are locking for other class of jazz forget it. The album is  a exploration of the real meaning of jazz. Fantastic. I know that you can't find good critics, but I can't understand this. For me is one of the finest jazz live albums of this year. Try to hear it and give  you opinion. Is another great jazz adventure . I love it. This is not a free jazz album, is  a incredible jazz music session.

Since 1992 Lloyd had edited his music in ECM but this new album is from Blue Note but this no mean that his music have changed-This is a very lyrical and emotive suite that in certain way is a a total looking back to old influences, oriental  music, lyrical jazz…and many more. If you see the musicians you can understand more what I say. Joe Sanders and bass, Gerald Cleaver on drums, Gerald Clayton on piano, all of them, great jazz musicians, but also includes Sokratis Sinopulos in lyra and Miklos Lucaks on Cymbalon. Orient and occident. He is now in the top of his game, technically and sentimental. This is a live recording in Wroclaw on november 2013, the sound is very good and the production too /(Don Was). The suite have a VI movements and are really good., more of 70 minutes of pure Charles Lloyd, of all kind the Charles Lloyd of his history. Very nice to hear and very exiting. Lloyd still on great conditions, less abstract than in his ECM period but great,  in fact a masterpiece

Play in the Royal Albert Hall could be the perfect occasion to make a serious concert, with serious songs. eels play his darkness songs and forget his rocker side. This is a concert for tie and suit, for make something serious an great.  Is a classic concert with a classic Eels material. This edition have 2CD and 1 DVD. This one is great filming and have a incredible sound. The band is perfect and he too. There is no place for eccentricity or something different, but is great,

The Grateful Dead is much more that a great band, is part of the pop,psicodelic, country or even jazz history, is the greatest adventure in american music during 50 years. This is the perfect collection to know the studio career of the band. If you know his music here you will found in perfect sound all his better songs, if you din't know well his music this is the perfect guide to de a real Deadheads. This album is addictive, is a very special drogue. This music never die. Great, spectacular collection of Dead songs. Special recommended for new audiences

Wilson make another great album. Some great songs and very nice production. Sometimes you can find some vintage arranged but is ok. Some times you remember the best times of Beach Boys, but always you can find a very sophisticated album, elegant and nice. Brian Wilson hit again with a album out of this time. Pure Wiison ¡PS After several auditions is even better

Cassandra come back to his best. In this album she re-invented some all the best material of Billie Holiday. The title of the CD is the english title of the ancient Egyptian "Book of the Dead"and is a memorial to the deep feeling of Cassandra to the work of Billie. Is a fantastic album and the better thing, that you didn't find canonic versions, you hear the real spirit of Holliday today. Lady Day still live trough this versions. This isn't a standard version, is much more. Cassandra sing incredible and the musicians are great. Produced by Nick Launay, the eternal producer of Nick Cave with the rhythm section of Bad Seeds, T Bone Burnett and the incredible string arranged of Van DYke Parks.Is a jazz album with no exactly jazz musicians. I love the album, love the voice and the way that she spell every words of the songs. Great¡¡¡. Direct from the heart to the darknessPS. One month later I don't understand why some people don't like the production, Is great and different . Ok  it no traditional arrangements but this is the real good thing. Cassandra don,t try to be Billie , try to capture her spirit today.

Probably is the last session of Sonic Youth, Part of this music was used for a french film "Simon Werner a Disparu" but after recorders the track for the film they coming again to studio to makes some arranged , the final result is this splendid CD. You can find beautiful sounds very intimate and interest. This is the final code to great band. Forget the film and only hear this incredible sound. After many years together they make this CD to make a resume of his glorious career.

Here come again the incredible atmospheres of Dalvid Sylvian. This is a "spoken word " CD. The words came from one of my favorites american poet in this moments; Franz Wright, more exactly from "Kinderstotenwald" from 2011. He put also the voice. Strange beauty, something between light and dark. The sound is the elegant sound make for David Sylvian with Christian Fennesz on guitar and John Tilbury on additional piano. Is only one 63 minutes theme, but for me, fantastic. I know this is no a record for big audience, but is fascinating. It's not obscure music, is another thing. Take time and hear it your mind will different after hear it. David Sylvian still discovering new sensation . Thanks

This is a powerful album from Al Kooper, the problem is that the most part of the album is not with Al Kooper voice. It's true that no al Kooper voice no means no album, like same critic say, but is important. Anyway, is a good album for Al fans but no for the rest of the audience. Is a curiosity but nothing more. The musicians are all right, the production is OK, but at least is not a Al Kooper album 100%

The same great music, a good concert, probably the last act of four original Byrds together  but nothing more..and nothing less. Pour sound, typical bootleg but you can hear echoes of other times. Only for Byrds Maniax.

A doble CD to know a very special  musician. For young people could be the perfect way to know him. The Disc 1. "Ex Machina " to know the past, the second one "Bening Dictatorships" is a compilation of rarities from Robert Wyatts collaborations with Bjork, Hot Chip, John Cage and Nick Mason. And the end you have the perfect image of a musician that fight always with life and with invention of real music. Is a real good album to prepare new audience for Wyatt music.PS. Please read the book  DIFFERENT EVERY TIME: THE AUTHORISED BIOGRAPHY OF ROBEET ROBERT WYATT" OF MARCUS O'DAIR

It is a film documentary about devotion for the goddess Raha in India., directed by Prashant Bahargava. Colorful and beauty ,but for me the more import  thing is the beautiful music of Vijay Iyer and the International Contemporary Ensemble. Is also an homenage to Igor Stravisky and Nijinsky's "Le scare du Piemtemps" . He used the same twelve episode to conduct us for diferents stages. The film include the performance of Nawazuddin Siddqui and Beatrice Ordeix.  There is also a documentary was directed by Ross Karre and produced by ECM. Is really incredible, a beautiful experience of sound and colorPS. You can buy in DVD or in Blue Ray version. Total time 53:34

After Charlie Haden pass away is more easy to find the records of him. This one is a piano-bass duo with John Taylor, one's of the finest ad pure piano on UK. Is the perfect pianist to join with sensible musicians. He always play a very few notes, but always excellent. You can find CD of Taylor in ECM , with Garbarek, Norma Winston, and with his group Azimut. In this album play several songs of Haden and also own composition. Is a very introspective music, very soft, elegant and immaculate. Great album

This box contains two albums, Torture Garden and Leng Tch'e. For me this two albums are the best from Naked City. Extremes, violence, with a incredible artwork. 20th years after are even better. Is not only music, is a life experience. The 32 minutes of Leng Tch'e are incredible, brutal, magic. Is the sound of terror. After hear this music probably you live will change forever. Never before Bill Frisell was so intensive and brutal. After this all the rash album are simple games. Torture Garden is the typical Nacked City with 42 tracks combing free jazz, bepbop, funk, rokabilly, surf, metal... a great album, this edition some extra material from another Naked City album, "Grand Guiñol" . This black box is necessary to understand the music today, but take care is excessive for to many people, like the art cover. If you don't have yet please buy it as soon as you can.PS. Naked City are Jon Zorn, Bill Frisell, Wayne Horvitz, Fred Frith, Joey Baron and Yamatsuka Eye

This is the end of the Moonchild septology. In this case with the same group of In the Sacred Blood. I think ithis is better but I did''t like at all. Mike Patton, John Medesky (great), Trevor Dunn and Joey Baron. Like te others one is a mix between heavy-music and some gotic things. This one is more near to King Crimson music, but for me is too simple. The people who loves "In sacred Blood" will be appasionate to this one. The sound is great if you play a full volume but all the metaphisic about templar is nasty. Anyway, is a good final for this septology, powerfull and essential for the people who loves Moonchild puzzlesPS, The Cover art is great, probably one of the best from Zorn

The music in heaven must be similar than this. This album is inspired in Gnostic philosophies of de Nag Hammadi library about the transmigration of the souls after dead. Lou Reed was a friend of John Zorn and after one year of his dead,Zorn make this memorial tribute to him. Is sweat and very lyrical . The musician are Bill Frisell, John Medeski, Kenny Wollesen, Carol Emanuel, Bridges Kibbet and Al Uroski. The combination of instruments is very special and the music too. Transmigration of a Magus is a memorial tribute to Lou Reed but have nothing to do with Reed music, but is ok. Fisell and Medeski are great, and compositions also. You need listen this album several times before take the meaning of this. At the begriming all the parts like the same but after..you found this great. Please take time before denied this work, is more deep that you think after the first listen

Beautiful  music, incredible musicians and same special feelings. It is folk? Jazz folk?, Americana?. I think is all at the same time. Basically is folk but the collaboration of Bill  Frisell give a special touch to the album. Is great, peaceful and different. The only thing that I can't understand is the cover. Is a great photograph of a hippie family in the country with a group of talibans faraway ,What is the meaning? Ok, this is not important. the really important thing is the music, and this is perfect. Great session a really good production.

This is a excellent opportunity to hear again King Crimson.A collection of extracts elements from studio recordings, alternate takes, live tracks, rehearsals and finished recordings from 1969-2014, Two CD, 29 tracks, 18 previously unreleased, and another way to know the different elements that have take part in this incredible adventure call King Crimson. Very good remastared and in a very nice box. The Elements show perfectly how work Robert Fripp during this years. Special edited for fans, is a a great excuse to hear again King Crimson and also could be a experience for young people. You can feel the several elements that make possible the different period of KC. Is no expensive and you can hear difference versions of his classic songs. Is not the traditional Hits album, is more...

Surrealistic flamenco film. Two big star, Lola Flores and Manolo Caracol , in his best period , with incredible scenario. Buñuel, Dali, Vertov,  all together in a very strange film. Try, you will love it. Don't think is a simple folklore film is much more. A bizarre experience.

Beautiful CD. Carrothiers is a wonderful pianist but practically unknown and don't know why? This CD is a pleasure. Bill alone with piano and he sing most of the theme. His voice is very nice and is a perfect session. Is a record for all the times. A special music with a touch of class. Great, you must buy it. Inner and very close. High recommended

Jarret, Motian and Haden, a incredible trio in a perfect moment. Is the beginning of Jarret and this group, there is only  3 albums with this trio,just before his first record with his American Quartet, with Dewey Redman. Is a typical concert of this time. Jarret play piano, flute,percussion  and soprano saxophone. Paul Motian drums and percussion and Haden double bass. Is a live recording by NDR, june 1972 in Hamburg. I personally love this period, is  very open to many influences. The recording is great Except two songs, one from Margor Jarret and one for Charlie Haden, the beautiful Song for Che, the rests are composition of Jarret, there is not standards. A very good album that bring me sounds for another times. Is a pleasure for Jarret fans and also for people that did not discover yet this trio. Great concert for discover the old Jarret and the perfect connection between this  three great masters. Pure jazz of the 70. Full of imagination and creativity. After more than 40 years , the trio sound still fresh and modern. Perfect !!!

Avishai Cohen is now one of the best tumpet in jazz, his sound is clear and warm, and his technics is exellent. Have a strong personality and good taste. This is the third album of his group Triveni, with Omer Avital y Nasheet Watts. A trio pianoless and is very easy to see the evident progression of Avishai. Like his previous album the music is pure bop or hard bop, but in a modern way. Is a combination of same standars and own material , but sound fresh and new. I think this album is great, a really pleasure to hear. Jazz on his better version. Pure and simply. In this album he introduced some electrics touch but in essential is acustic. After the ECM of Mark Turner "Lathe of Heaven" this album is the consecration on Avishai Cohen like one of the best musician in jazz today. You must hear it.

The Marsalis Brothers are great musicians but always are a little pretentious. Is a great solo concert in a Cathedral, in live concert will be perfect, for sure, but not to hear in one recording of this, is more difficult. He say that try to get the attention to the public but this is very difficult on record. The sound is perfect, you can hear the space and the incredible solos from Branford, but this is not enough . Even the solo sax album from Sonny Rollins is hard to listen, this is not so hard but is boring. You can hear two o for themes but no more. The music is eclectic, classical, improvisation, standard, but a solo album is difficult to make. If you like Branford this is a great record but I think you will hear complete in a very few time except if you are looking for a very spirituals sounds.

Dylan- Costello, a incredible paar. Costello put some of the new music for the old Basements Tapes lyrics. A strange experiments but great. At the end is a homenage to Dylan trough Costello music. You can find folk, rock and the more important; the spirit of the Dylan and The Band music. Costello have fund a great bunch of musicians, who's also compose some themes for put new music to old songs. Now is very simple to know that Dylan is a great poet, and Costello and the band are a big composers. Is great idea but risky, thanks a Allen Trousseau this mixture is possible. Now with the edition of the complete edition of the Dylan tapes  all this proposition have more sense. Very peculiar but excellent.PS. If you are interested in this kind of things, please try the excellent record from 1974 of McGuinnes Flint  call "Lo and Behold" they make a album of unknown songs, in those  times, from Dylan. Is a very good album from a british group.Is the perfect complement of the Basements Tapes

This is history, babe. This is a complete recording that in same way change change the music. Is the complete adventure of a man that try to find his way. He was a super star that try to find his roots. Probably is so much to many people but not for Dylan's fans. Is a great adventure. I know thats include some not very good  versions, but thats is all the Complete Basements Tapes, all tapes. If you are a Dylan fans you need it. Also you can understand how then work  each song. Is a great experience. Thanks Dylan and CBS to do it. Probably is the mod personal recording of Dylan.PS. This edition have a very nice presentation. Not only the very nice book with photos, also the cover of the 6 CD, in another book splendid edited. A excellent design.

Lou Donaldson have a fantastic record call "Alligator Boogaloo" in his moment was a surprise, is a mix between jazz, funk and easy listening and groove. This album have the same texture. MSMW have collaborate in three occasions before plus the Sccofield album " A Go Go". This one is the more fresh and pure. Is jazz only for fun. More live than a live recording, a fantastic solos. and a very good mood. You can find everything, include a Dylan's version. Great. Is jazz for taste in any moments. No intellectual music but the musical technics is great. Enjoy with this record.PS. The cover is horrible but the contents is great

Ron Miles, Bill Frisel and Brian Blade make a very special album, very intesive and depth . There is always something magic in the air, a special sensibility. In this moment you can found a important number of jazz musicians that take the folk , or something call americana to make music. In this case is something more complicate but this roots are inside the music. Ron Miles is a perfect companion of Bill Frisell and Blade is the point of junction of all this things. Is not coincidence that this guys are interesred in the music of Jimmy Giuffre, like Dave Douglas, or Charles Mingus, like this new generation of jazz player. Each new record of Ron Miles is a gift for the audience.

I love that this company donates a leash to rescues when you buy one. That is what made me want to purchase this! So congrats Max and Neo and thank you for caring! I also love that you know who they are donating to and that they change it up monthly! As for the quality of the leash... It is a great quality leash for the money. Their price is right in line with what I would expect to pay, and the leash seems to pretty durable. I will be buying another when this one goes..

As always Viva labs products are some of the best products. They are all natural organic and Non GMO. As long as Viva keeps the non gmo and organic they will have my business. This Quinoa was delicious. My wife and I made a bunch of recipes with this Quinoa and love it. I will get more when we run out!! Thanks for not supporting Monsanto and Dupont with their cancerous GMO food!!!! :) I received a complimentary sample of this product for my honest and unbiased feedback

I have owned a few sets of pruning shears in the past, and these so far have been the best. They are very sharp from the factory, cut extremely smooth, and feel very durable. The build quality is excellent on these shears, and I feel they will last a while with proper care. I followed the advice by the company and put WD-40 on the shears after the first use. I would recommend these shears so far for anyone in the market. Disclaimer: Item received to free or lesser price in return for an unbiased review.

These bottles are excellent quality. They seem very durable and I love the sleeves that come with them. I think the sleeves will be thick enough to help save the bottle if it is dropped. I love that these are glass and are not plastic. I feel more comfortable drinking out of these daily than plastic.

Awesome all natural wipe for pets! We use this product on our pups feet which they always seem to walk through something which then gets everywhere! These wipes are reasonable and best of all they are all natural. They have a clean scent to them. I would highly recommend these over "Commercial" chemical wipes. I will be buying these again!

This product is made extremely well. I wish everything I bought was of this quality. My wife loved the bag! It is the perfect size, and has ample room in it for other items. I would highly recommend this bag.

We use these cards for CAD and Revit use. They are by no means powerhouse cards for rendering, but they work extremely well for AutoCAD and Revit use. The price point is just right for what we are using them for.
We get a ton of prints out of 1 of these toners. The original HP toner prints very crisp and lasts a long time. We so far are extremely happy with our purchase of the printer and replacement toner.

This 1 u blank panel works perfectly for what I needed it for. It helps to keep airflow going into the front of the servers, and keeps our rack in our office looking much nicer. This is a great product at a great price

My teeth look whiter, but maybe not as much as whitening strips. It does help immensely with keeping your teeth clean and healthy. I love the clean feeling after using this product. I would say the best bet would to be whiten with strips in conjunction with this product to maintain the whiteness level you want. Overall its a great product. I did receive this product from the manufacturer to do an unbiased review.
Perfect glass carboy. Came in one piece :)!! I was nervous buying this online, but the price was awesome. So glad i got it!
I use this daily to charge my Ecig batteries. I love that it has a voltage display to show where my batteries are at. It charges quickly and efficiently.
Worked on my glass carboy. They are perfect in quality just as I would expect.
I bought these for my wife on a lightning deal. She loved them. She said they were extremely comfortable, and didnt bunch up or move while she wore them throughout the day

We use this camera for engineers to go on surveys. I love it because its cheap, takes a great picture, and has replaceable AA batteries. The cheap helps because our engineers tend to drop them, but they hold up for awhile. I really like this camera for this purpose.

I bought this from another store due to the outrageous price currently that the seller is asking.. I wouldn't pay more than 20 dollars for this.. Even then its not worth it. The eyes belt and some other parts are STICKERS! Pieces break easily on him and he doesn't stand very well at all. It is sad since i have the blow up bumble i wanted him to go with it, but I would save your cash!PURE GARBAGE from china

It appears to be built very well, but mine ripped in less than 2 months.. Although its a small rip it still is defective. Im going to try contacting the company. If I get a replacement I will update my review. As of right now I would not recommend it for larger dogs. A small dog should be fine with this, but any pup over 50 LBS will most likely rip it. We also keep our dogs nails very short to help keep our hardwood floors safe inside..As a side not it fits perfectly in my wifes 2011 Honda CRV and looks nice in it as well. I sent an email to warranty claims to see what they say. I will update.

Awesome little spiral. This is built very well. Cleaning it is an absolute breeze! This is a great little compact kitchen tool that you will not regret purchasing. The 3 in 1 features all work great. We made some homemade pasta with this. Although it takes some time it came out awesome. We also made some cold pasta noodles that were great.I would highly recommend this product.

This is a perfect little herb grinder that works extremely well. The build quality on this grinder is superior and it has held up so far through everything my wife and I tried it on. It grinds with ease, grinds spices perfectly, and works amazing with herbs. I would highly recommend this product to anyone in the market for a herb grinder.

This charger is perfect for multiple devices and only 1 outlet in the front of my car. This easily charges my phone and my wifes phone while we travel. It charges extremely fast (As if plugged in almost) and looks really sleek. I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of this device!I would recommend this product!

This little speaker is awesome for the money! It sounds great, looks great, and is built very nicely. The battery life in the unit is very good. I connected it to my iPhone via Bluetooth in 2 seconds and it sounds so clear! I had the previous version of the Bolse speaker and this one is even nicer. Although I loved the other one, this one is my new favorite. The range on it is clear, and there is not an extreme amount of bass. (There is just enough bass for me and I like more bass)I would highly recommend this product to anyone in the market for a small speaker with powerful audio.

This headphones are absolutely amazing! I compared them to my Bose QC-15 headphones and the sound from the Brainwavz was much better! I replaced my Bose with these, and haven't looked back. I have been using them for over 3 months now and still love them. They come with a nice case and extra cords which is a huge plus. They are rock solid and extremely comfortable!I would highly recommend these

Amazing quality tea from an avid tea drinker! I use this once a day for a very healthy drink for my wife and I. This Matcha tea is probably one of the best quality ones you can buy. I have used other big name brands and this matches or exceeds other names like Teavana at a fraction of the price! We use this for cooking as well!I would highly recommend this tea if you are in the market!**I received free or discounted product in exchange for providing an unbiased review.

Absolutely amazing product! My wife and I used this all the time in cooking. We use it as butter on toast, butter to start a pan, and so much more. It is so much better for you than butter, and it tastes even better! My wife also took some to use as a beauty product and loves it that way too! it is amazing how a good quality coconut oil works!

Absolutely amazing. We bought this for our 66 pound hound who is a crazy strong puller and after the first use with the gentle leader my wife is able to walk the 2 dogs together without any hassle or concern. The collar itself is easy to use and adjust. Have had no issues with that.

Absolutely terrible!!! I used this iron once and singed my vanity countertop!!! I am a stylist and all other irons I have used I never had this issue. This irons plates will sit flush on whatever surface you place it, and will burn what's beneath it!!! Worst iron I have ever used!!!

This french press is made with top quality materials and its extremely durable so far. I have used it for over a month now daily. I love that I can make a "Real" cup of coffee at work. It has held up so far extremely nicely. It is really easy to clean, makes an amazing cup of coffee, and it really is built well. I would highly recommend this product to anyone in search of a french press. This is the best one I have owned hands down!

These headphones are absolutely amazing in-ear headphones!! These are probably THE most comfortable ones I have ever owned! The whole package is extremely nice, from the box to the carrying case to keep everything together. I use these to go running with all the time and I am so happy with them! They built extremely well and so far have held up to heavy usage.As for the sound aspect I own a pair of Bose QC15's and these are I think better in all ranges. I am not an extreme audiophile, but clarity is important to me and these hit every mark! I would highly recommend these to anyone! Comment below if you have any questions.
I got a trial of this Deodorant from influenster and fell in love with it. I usually use degree but this stuff is awesome. I would highly recommend this product!

This a great price for an extremely comfortable pillow. The pillow more than fills the whole pillow cover and it is very firm. I have only used it for a couple of nights, but there is no fluffing and re-fluffing required in the middle of the night. The price on this pillow is very attractive as well.I will update if the pillow loses is fluff and density, but I hope it doesn't because it is extremely comfortable. I would highly suggest this pillow if you like a firm pillow!
I drop things when I least suspect it so this is well worth the extra $$! I haven't had to use it yet, but I love the peace of mind!
This tablet is great. It is fast, smooth, and very nice looking. I wanted an Android tablet and this was possibly the best one I could find. I still love it and use it all them time!

I bought this in the spring to keep my basement from getting damp. It works extremely well. My basement is chopped up a little bit, but this has enough power to remove the moisture very quickly. It works great and doesn't suck down the power. I think it cost me 10 $ or so to run a month. I would buy this again!
Bought these because I have always had good luck with this brand. These lived up to there expectation! Very fast burn and haven't had a bad one yet.

My wife and I both love this series. We have read all of them. I believe a new book is coming out soon and cannot wait to read it. Her books have a really good story behind them this one included. This is the one that hooked me into the series. The main characters have great back story.I wish they would make a movie out of this series!! (Or an HBO show :)  )

This is a really great blu-ray player with all of the features that are needed. It plays movies quickly and I love how netflix is built into it. It is nice to see that manufacturers are finally including the Wi-Fi without going with their top model. I really liked this player for the price!
My wife said it was OK. She said the story was decent but the main characters acted like children, but besides that it was a decent book. She said she wouldnt read it again, but it is worth one read.
I love that these detectors are 2 in 1. They are simple and are not eye sores on the ceiling. I ended up buying 6 of them for my house and would buy them again if I had to!
I bought this for my wyse terminal running Citrix that is hooked up to my 60 inch TV. It works great! I will buy another if I am looking for a combo again!
I bought this to replace my dead charger. This works great, and the price is much better than the crazy OEM price! I would buy again!
Typical great quality C batteries you would expect from Duracell. I would obviously buy these again if i needed them !

Very fast 16 gb jump drive! This is a very nice 16 gb jump drive that is a rocket. I have owned it for a few months and I still love it. I work on photoshop files on it and play movies on my tv with it.

This is a pretty good book with a great storyline that has characters that evolve through the book. Although the book was a great read there were some editing errors. I also will say the the story was predictable, but all in all it was a good read. For the price now 3.99 its well worth a read!

This is a nice paperwhite case that I bought for my wife. It has a decent amount of protection and it has a nice soft feel to it. She really likes the case and style of it.
I bought this for my wife to put on her new kindle. She loved this book she said it was a great easy read. She read it rather quickly on her new kindle. Good job author!

I understand the WII doesn't really have HD, but my new tv had less SD hookups. I bought this so I could leave the WII plugged in and not have to switch it out when we want to use it. They worked great! Better price than original Nintendo ones and the work the same.

It is a decent book or manual on how to eat clean and live a healthy lifestyle. I originally purchased this book for my wife, and we both followed the diet. We lost some weight and felt much healthier. Overall its a pretty good book.

A boy with Down's Syndrome is found drowned.  Was it an accident?  Did one of the child's parents kill him?  Or is there some other explanation?Inspector Sejer takes hold of this one like a dog with a bone between its teeth, and holds on until what happened finally becomes clear.  This is a far less complicated procedure than in most of his cases, but "less complicated" doesn't mean easy.  The investigation is in large part psychological, as the Inspector peels back the personalities involved like so many onions.  The solution becomes clearer as we move on, but even so I could not put this novel down until I finished it.  As ever, Karen Fossum's writing (and its translation) is real pleasure to read: precise and convincing.  The ending is perhaps a little bit ex machina, but it does add a nice reminder of the unavoidability of desitny.

This biography of Pope Francis explores his stunning worldwide impact, but it also a portrait "warts and all", making it far more interesting than a simpler story would be.  Before reading a biography (particularly a popular biography) one should ask who wrote it.  The answer here is reassuring.  The author, an internationally respected British journalist, has decades of experience covering many issues including religion.  This is is his second book on the Pope.  The first, "Pope Francis: Untying the Knots" came out in 2013, less than six months after the Pope's election. The first eight chapters of this book update the earlier work  (those who have read it, please take note) : the last nine chapters are new material.Vallely begins with the Argentine background of the Pope (then Jorge Bergoglio), through his entry into the Jesuit order, and then to Bergoglio's rapid rise and chequered career in the Jesuit order in Argentina.  Two major issues arise in regard to that.  First, and most widely discussed, Bergoglio was suspected of being involved in the kidnapping of two Jesuits by Argentina's dictatorial government in the 1970's.  Vallely argues convincingly that the accusation was not justified, but does suggest that Bergoglio's relationship with the dictatorship caused him great anguish.  Second, Bergoglio became a divisive figure in the Jesuit order in Argentina, because of his lack of enthusiasm for the stress on social justice that had become a central thrust of the order.  In consequence, he was removed from his office in the order, and did not return to the forefront of religious life until he became Bishop of Buenos Aires in 1992. These two crises, Vallely argues, led to a period of spiritual struggle for Bergoglio, out of which he emerged a changed man.  He has always been noted for humility in external matters, but Vallely believes that he became far less authoritarian and far more socially-oriented.  Very few people really learn from their mistakes: the Pope seems to be one who has.The second part of the book looks at what Francis has accomplished -- and failed to accomplish -- since assuming the Papacy.  Here, Vallely shows that the record is mixed.  When he came to office, the Church faced two great scandals.  Francis has had great success in cleaning up the first of these --  the Vatican's finances and financial institutions, a morass that other Popes have been unable to drain.  He has accomplished much less in dealing with the issue of sexual abuse of children by priests and other religious.  That, and the Pope's less than convincing efforts to reach out to women as a group, are treated by Vallely as major failure. More broadly, Francis' clear intent is to create Church that is more open, more approachable, and more focussed on the poor than the one he inherited.  Here, it is too soon to say whether he has succeeded or failed, but the effort is inspiring.  He is trying to reform the Curia, the Vatican bureaucracy that has become a bastion of self-interest.  He is trying to reflect the fact that most Catholics are no longer European in the leadership of the Church.  He is trying to focus the Church more on mercy, outreach, and help for the poor, and less on doctrine.  This does not, as many liberals would like to think, mean that the Pope is about to change Church teachings on key social issues, but it does mean that he wants to see them approached in a different way -- as occasions of mercy, rather than condemnation.Overall, the Pope is presented as a remarkable person -- not a simple person, but one who has learned from his mistakes, and who is using his extraordinary political gifts to serve a program that is aimed at making Catholicism more embracing, more vibrant, and more focussed on making life better for the poor.  Though I am not a Catholic (I am not even religious) I found this to be an inspiring book: it made my admiration for the Pope seem much more firmly based.

Rate a thriller at five stars?  That's something I almost never do, but this one is different.  To begin with, it's a terrific thriller -- briskly paced, well plotted, with an unusual twist at the end.  The story, the second available in English from this Finnish author, is set in a northern Finnish city: the backdrop, in particular the influence of climate, is vividly realized.  Most of the characters are interesting and highly individualized (if not always highly likable).  The central character is both convincing and appealing.  And the writing/translation is supple and clear.But what gets it that fifth star is something that puts it beyond the usual thriller -- the central theme is right out of today's headlines, and it is treated brilliantly.  That theme is refugee immigration into Europe, and the book gives us a 360 degree view of the issue.  Our heroine is herself a refugee, though highly "Finnicized", her family having fled to Finland during the Balkan wars of the 1990's.  The most obvious suspect is a Pakistani in Finland illegally, while a group of suspects who emerge gradually are members of a Muslim gang.  Some of the native Finns are friendly to immigrants, while others are strongly anti-immigrant.  And neither immigrants nor anti-immigrants are treated as being entirely good or bad, entirely right or wrong, or at all homogenous.  This gave me an inside view of what large-scale Muslim immigration into Europe is like, from the point of view of the immigrants and from the point of view of the native-born.  That's a lot more complexity, and a lot more insight, than Iusually get from a thriller.

This gorgeous book surveys a very specific subgenre of photography -- photographic series based on road trips through America.  It starts off with a short history of the American road, an even shorter history  than I realized.  At the start of the twentieth century, the road system had fallen into disuse (over 90% of intercity roads were unpaved) because of the dominance of trains. But as the auto came into use, the road trip came into being, and almost from the start photography was a key part of the road trip.  The pictures in the early part of the book are fascinating, as is the history of the American road, and the American road trip.The heart of the book, however, is the central section, which shows road trip photographs by 19 highly accomplished photographers.  It tells us a little about each photographer, talks about each road trip, and then shows the pictures.  Some of the photographers are giants in the field: the presentation starts with a group of photographs from Robert Frank's iconic "The Americans", proceeds through Lee Friedlander and Garry Winograd, and moves on to Ryan McGinley.  Some are perhaps less well known -- at least they were to this reader -- but their work is stunning.  Most of the photographers are American, but not not all of them, and a few are women.  Having seen their work in this book, there are several photographers whose work I want to investigate further, especially Alec Soth and Taiyo Onorato+Nico Krebs.And the book is definitely more than the sum of its part.
