I love learning about history and the story that was written was stuff I have not really ever read about so I’m glad that I made this journey. If you love history and want something a bit different. I recommend giving this one a try.Notable Scene:“This Is not the dream of a fool, Murad. It is a window into the future.”“Tell me what it means. Tell me now and tell me quickly.”“A tree such as that can mean only one thing.”“Please go on, good sheikh!”“A tree such as yours can only mean life.”“Murad looked on, bewildered. “Life?”“Yes, dear boy. The girl lives on.”“But the girl in my dream, she is dead.”“Murad,” Sheikh Suca continued, “the girl is certainly not dead. The debt of her household follows her to a faraway land.”“Debt?” Murad’s voice was faint.Holding his beads in his lap, the sheikh pressed his lids down tightly, accessing a world of secrets and spirits beyond. “Your forefathers rescued her household and all its descendants, those living and those yet to be born,” he said with his eyes still sealed. “For this, a debt lingers in the heavens. A time will come when she returns to see it paid.”FTC Advisory: Thomas Dunne/St. Martin’s Press/Macmillan provided me with a copy of The Debt of Tamar. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: An international pop star aka “Justin Bieber” finds love in this fast paced, steamy romance.Opening Sentence: Wasn’t regret a bitch?The Review:Pure Wicked is the story of a “Justin Bieber”-esque pop star who finds love during a terrible moment in his life and career. This story is a novella off of the Wicked Lovers series and also a part of the 1001 Dark Nights. I will say that the romantic scenes are quite steamy but there aren’t really any BDSM elements to this story, for which the Wicked Lovers series seems to be known for. Also, the couple falls for each other hard and fast which means there is kind of a crazy ending.Jesse McCall has had a terrible and tragic night. He decides he needs to hide away from the spotlight for a while because of the seriousness of the situation. He even goes so far as to change his appearance so that no one will recognize him. Jesse stops for dinner in a small Texas town and sees the saddest, most beautiful woman he has ever seen.Bristol Reece has some family issues and welcomes Jamie. *cough* I mean Jesse’s help to get her mind off of the unsettling family event. She has also decided that she is done with relationships. She wants some fun and decides a one night stand is something she needs.Pure Wicked is a one night stand that begins in lies and through passion and intimacy becomes something much, much more. This novel is a heavy dose of Insta-love, so if you don’t like that then you won’t like this read. The events take place in less than a week’s time, the couple actually only spend a weekend together so hence the very fast relationship.Jesse is not really in a good place when the novella begins but he is determined to turn his life drastically around. He sees that he can do that with Bristol. Jesse isn’t exactly good with relationships so the fact that he dives into this relationship with Bristol so fast is sexy but a bit off putting. I just can’t expect a guy like that to change everything about himself even though I really want to believe. Also, in the beginning when he is compared to the Biebs I just couldn’t think of him as sexy for the first half of the story. (Other readers may not have that problem.)Bristol owns a bakery/restaurant in her little hometown where reputation is everything. She can’t be known as a whore or no one will eat there. Old Maid isn’t much better either but she would rather that than anything. And just as she says she is done with relationships she jumps head first into one. Overall, I did like Bristol and how she reacted to Jesse initially lying to her, but her really quick use of the “L” word may turn some readers away.Overall, Pure Wicked is one of those dreamy, quick HEA love stories. As a whole, I really did like how the story came together. The writing was excellent. I have not read any other books in this series but I would like to go back and check out this steamy series.Notable Scene:He glanced around, then cocked his head in thought. “It’s you.”She smiled and shut the door behind them, flipping on the overhead lights. “Yeah?”“Comfortable, happy, unvarnished. I like it.”“Thanks.” He seemed to get her, and that did Bristol’s heart a world of good. Hayden had hated this place. He liked things grander and more formal, not an eclectic grouping of her favorite things. He called antiques “recycled junk.” “But you didn’t come all the way to Lewisville to comment on my décor, right?”“No.” He turned to her, his hands suddenly engulfing her hips, his stare drilling down into her eyes. “I did not.”“So what did you come to do?” she challenged.He gave her a panty-melting grin as he pulled her closer, fitting her flush against his body where she could feel every inch of him. “Make you glad you let me follow you home.”Bristol swallowed and lifted her face to him. “Are you finally going to kiss me?”“Eager?”She gave him a coy shrug. “A little.”“Let’s see if we can make that a lot.” He took her face in his hands.FTC Advisory: Evil Eye Concepts, Inc/InkSlinger PR provided me with a copy of Pure Wicked. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: A dark paranormal “Romeo & Juliet” type romance with action, intrigue and even a murder mystery. There were things that I liked and didn’t like about it but overall it was a good read.Opening Sentence: It was half a degree past freezing as Jillian stumbled across the snow-covered pavement.The Review:Dance with the Devil is the first novel in the Soul’s Harbor Pride series. This paranormal romance series has an intriguing twist on paranormal creatures that I really want to see more of in future books. This book has a dark back story, a sexy romance and action.Dance with the Devil begins with Jillian feeling the supernatural tug that is forcing her to go back home, but before she can do that she must clean up some loose threads. Jillian wants to cover up that fact that she has spent the last couple years working at a bar before she leaves. Her boss, Carrick, won’t let her leave so easily, especially after her big secret is revealed. She’s a lion shapeshifter! Then another bombshell! So is he.Jillian’s father has killed Carrick’s father so the two packs that share Soul’s Harbor Island are in a tizzy. One pack is only accepts pureblood shapeshifters while the other accepts all but is very violent towards its members so it isn’t a very healthy pack. The packs must decide on a new leader and they must go through a mating ritual to do so. But not just the potential leaders have to go through with the ritual, all pack members have to take part in the hope that the two packs will combine into one.My only real complaint about the novel is that I didn’t really care for the whole mating thing being forced on the entire pack. Because to me it seemed like whoever you had sex with during the mating ritual would be your mate whether you liked them or not. Or you’re just forced to have sex with as many people as possible until matching tattoos showed up on you and your mate. Yes, matching tattoos is how you know you are compatible.This novel was quite action packed and then an added murder/mystery is in store while the packs are trying to determine their mates and the future of the packs.Jillian starts off the novel knowing exactly what she wants but when her plans change she has no idea what she wants to do and she has a hard time making decisions. She is willing to forgo her own happiness. For the most part, I did like Jillian I just wish she would have stood up for her feelings a little bit sooner. Jillian was quite badass when it came down to it.Carrick was quite the hottie that knew what he wanted and he definitely wasn’t going to let Jillian forget about him. He was persistent and passionate.I really enjoyed the side characters in this novel. Jillian’s two best friends are hilarious and fun, even in their tension filled moments. I can’t wait to find out what more is in store for them.The one thing I would really like to see more in this series is in the power of the mixed supernatural species. I felt like we didn’t get to see much of the magic side of Jillian after the beginning of the novel. I don’t think we ever got to see it in Carrick. They mention they are stronger than purebloods because of the mixing of species. I especially want to see the cross of lion and vampire.Overall, Dance with the Devil is a decent start to a paranormal romance series. The ending was quite abrupt but I really do want to see what is next for this pack.Notable Scene:Carrick rolled onto his back, staring at the ceiling. “What we have comes once in a lifetime. Why not give it a chance?”She blew out a hard breath. He still didn’t get it. “Maybe I will. I have to weigh the pros and cons.” She held out her hands like the halves of a scale. “My happiness versus the lives of my Pride.”He sat up with a shake of his head. “You’re thinking about it wrong. You need to balance our shot of surviving the Conclave, combined with our happiness, against maintaining the farce that will be the Pride if you choose Lucas.”Her frustration quickly turning to anger, she stared at him. “What are you getting at?”“You choose Lucas and you’re not just turning your back on me, you’re turning your back on our laws. You and Lucas will have to lie to maintain your positions. If the Pride finds out, pure-blood or half-blood, they’ll rebel against you.”FTC Advisory: Samhain Publishing provided me with a copy of Dance with the Devil. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: Steamy and sexy novella about two characters who have an “experienced” past and find something in each other that they just can’t live without.Opening Sentence: “Weddings make me horny.”The Review:Stripped Down by Lorelei James is a steamy, sexy novella for fans of cowboys, rodeos, ranching and country music! But most of all for fans of passionate characters and hot and crazy, inventive sex. This is a novella that is a part of the Wicked Cowboy series and the 1001 Dark Nights compilation.Stripped Down starts off quite naughty and it doesn’t let up. Wynton and Melissa meet up at a wedding. They immediately are attracted to one another and start up a flirty and naughty conversation. They each think this is going to be a one night only hookup so they are flirting hardcore with each other. Wyn and Melissa have both been sexually dry for a few months and are ready to scratch that inch so much so that it turns into a one-upmanship over who has had the more adventurous and crazy sex life.After a family crisis, Wyn needs help on the ranch. He’s already down one brother on honeymoon. Melissa is volunteered into helping because of her rodeo experience. They both weren’t expecting to have this extra time together but they both knew there was something with the intensity they shared.  Wyn is going to make sure Melissa’s time at the ranch is something they never want to stop even after the work is done.Melissa has a secret she is trying to hide. A secret that she hides in the room she is staying in at Wyn’s house. A secret that she hides by not sleeping in Wyn’s room, no matter the connection that they feel towards each other. Ultimately, it is Melissa’s secret that can determine their relationship.Wyn and Melissa are very similar in character. They both the same past sexual experiences which they bond over. They both have a bit of background in rodeo, farming and horses. Although, their pasts are vastly different. Wyn is completely comfortable in who he is. He doesn’t make excuses for his past. He is hot, passionate and intense in his deep feelings towards Melissa.Melissa is fun, spunky and spontaneous at the beginning of the novella. She turns a little more secretive and quiet towards the middle only because she doesn’t want her secret unveiled.As a couple, Wyn and Melissa are very sexual and their banter is funny at times and sometimes uncomfortable. I wasn’t quite sure that I would like them at first but in the end I grew to love how unabashed and free they were in their love lives.Overall, Strapped Down reminds you about how fragile human life can be and the hope of making the best of everything while you can.Notable Scene:Everyone started talking and Wyn leaned down to speak to Melissa privately. “You really okay with this?”“I was thinking to myself earlier that I wished you and I had more time together, and now I’ve got my wish.” She smirked.“What?”“This wasn’t as altruistic of London as you might believe.”He chuckled. “Yes, it is fortunate that they won’t have to miss more than a day or two of their honeymoon, isn’t it? Becausee the ranch matters are handled.”“That and you know she’s been trying to fix us up since she and Sutton got engaged.”That took Wyn by surprise. “Then why is their wedding the first time I met you?”Melissa looked away. “I have no idea.”FTC Advisory: Evil Eye Concepts/Inkslinger PR provided me with a copy of Stripped Down. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: A sun-soaked summer novel chalk-full of fun, heartbreak, friendships, and bitter secrets.Opening Sentence: Just do it.The Review:Years ago, Tali, Luce, Joy, and Zoe were the best of friends at the summer camp Okahatchee. Though the camp ended, the four swore that they wouldn’t fall out of touch. Years later, the bond no longer exists and the memories are bittersweet in the back of their mind. What changed? What made their friendship fall apart? When they all come back to the camp Okahatchee reunion, some for reasons different than others, something strange happens. They’re transported back in time via a magic photo booth, to the summer where it all changed. Is this a chance to do everything over again, and reconcile their friendship? Or will they be trapped in the past forever?If you are looking for a summer book, you found it. It has the same light, fun qualities of kisses and sun-soaked water fights, with a unique element that is entirely its own. It brings in an incredible amount of surprises and secrets are being revealed every other page. Romances weave through a rebuilding friendship, and each girl is forced to admit things about themselves that they’ve avoided. The writing is rich, vivid, and detailed, with each scene in perfect clarity. She juggles four different points of views, and while I was confused at some points of who I was reading from (my fault: should have read the chapter headings more carefully), she does so almost seamlessly.Each character was so different, which is what made their friendship so interesting. Zoe is a tomboy, while Tali is self-conscious and popular. Joy is light and follows her name, but she hides a dark secret that is weighing her down. Finally we have Luce, the responsible one who never steps a toe out of line, or so they think. The complexity of each individual adds so many layers to an already strong storyline. They are realistic and relatable, and all of them finding themselves in the strangest of ways, after being transported back in time via a photo booth. There is snark in this book that made me smile and four different romances that were in sharp contrast.The storyline is sometimes hard to follow, because of the whole jumping into the past thing. For example, Luce’s romance with Andrew has progressed so much in the future, and I was so confused when he started treating her like he didn’t know her. Then I realized that they were back in the time that their romance was just blossoming. Seeing things happen again gives Luce doubts. Is their relationship too safe, too boring? Is her love for him strong enough to withstand more time or will it crumble when she does this all over again? Tali’s romance was hilarious. She kept finding “tow boy”, a hot worker for the camp, in the weirdest ways on her quest to seduce Blake. First he sees her where she’s waiting for Blake in lingerie, then he rescues her from freezing lake water when she falls in kissing Blake.. Their conversations were funny to read. Their “hatred” morphed very very quickly into pure attraction when they both revealed their feelings. Those were my favorite two romances, but I also really enjoyed the diversity of one of the girl’s relationship.Altogether, I enjoyed this book. I first read 40% of it at, get this, a summer camp at UCLA. When I went back home I got distracted and forgot about it, but I returned a couple months later to finish. It’s a decent sized book and the fact that it’s so packed with details made it seem longer, so at times I got slightly bored, but for the most part I found it enjoyable. The writing had a slight lyrical quality to it, and there were plenty of twists and turns that kept me guessing about the inevitable end. When it did come, it was bittersweet, and though I did see part of it coming, it took it a little further and surprised me. For a debut novel with this complexity and this many points of view, I’m very impressed!Notable Scene:“Does it ever make you, well, mad?” Joy asks quietly. “I mean, how unfair it is.”“Hell yeah. It makes me mad all the time. That’s the whole thing about life, though, right?“What is?”“It’s unfair. That you just have to accept things, take whatever you’re dealt and work with what you got. (…) But you get to a point where at least you’re happy for the time you did have.”FTC Advisory: HarperTeen provided me with a copy of Proof of Forever. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: Enhanced soldiers, deadly women, and some little vipers!Opening Sentence: Wyatt Fontenot tied up his airboat, but stood in it in the dark, listening to the familiar sounds of the bayou.The Review:I have read like the first five books, but must have hit a not reading much period in my life because I haven’t read book 6 -10. However, the one thing I liked about this series is while you are missing some information by not reading all them, they are books that can be read out of order or missing some and you don’t feel lost reading them. So no clue if Viper Game picks up after Samurai Game or not but Viper Game does hit the ground running. Wyatt has returned home to his beloved bayou after some trying missions and being wounded. He has also returned with two of his fellow ghostwalkers.But something is up in the bayou, food and clothes are being stolen from locked houses with no signs of break-ins! While trying to figure out of all of this, Wyatt finally stumbles across the woman and child that are hiding in the bayou. Pepper and Ginger are also enhanced but considered very dangerous and were to be exterminated by the Company. This is where it got a little unfamiliar for me, in the first couple of books they finally take down Whitney and it seems like the enhancements and experiments are over.Clearly this is not the case! Wyatt finds out Pepper tried to escape with three girls, but the other two toddlers were caught while they were escaping. The little girls are vipers; their bites are venomous and dangerous. Wyatt and Pepper fall in love while plotting the rescue of the two other girls, which they find out are their biological children.It was easy to see why I initially had liked this series so much when it first came out, not sure why it fell off my radar, most likely I wasn’t paying attention to when the new ones came out and then so much time had passed I just forgot. I am seriously inspired to go back and read them all. This is a solid series with great characters. Plus, the author has really built up the world and background and it just works!Notable Scenes:“A shiver of awareness went through him.”“He knows we know just about everythin’ happenin in the bayou.”“He brought you here, created a reason for escape and a reason for me to come home.”It had taken three little vipers in jeopardy to open his eyes.”FTC Advisory: Jove/Penguin provided me with a copy of Viper Game. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: Hot paranormal read with engaging characters, steamy romance, and action packed adventure! I really enjoyed this and would highly recommend it to all paranormal fans!Opening Sentence: I was never one to be accused of being patient.The Review:Genesis has spent her whole life preparing for her number to be called.  She actually never thought it would be called, but she wanted to be ready if it did.  She was taught over and over again how humans mean nothing to the immortals and the only reason they coexist is because the immortals would die without humans.  Imagine her surprise and fear when she receives her call and realizes that for the rest of her life she will be a slave to the immortals.  Odds are she won’t live all that long because all immortals are monsters right?What she didn’t expect was how very wrong she was about the immortals and how important she is to their survival. She didn’t think she would ever become friends with any of her masters and she was definitely not prepared for Ethan. The hot vampire that makes her feel things she never thought possible. Then there is Cassius the king of the immortals who has marked her as his own and will do anything to make her his.  Which one will she choose and is she truly the one chance for balance to be restored between humans and immortals!Genesis is a strong woman that has terrible self confidence.  Her entire life she has been told how insignificant and ugly she is.  But despite her horrible upbringing she is still a strong amazing person that has a heart of gold.  She is such a sweet person, but she also has a temper. She doesn’t let others push her around and even though she is timid she knows how to hold her own even against a group of immortals.  She grows immensely throughout the story and she was very easy to connect with. I thought that Genesis was an amazing heroine and I really enjoyed reading her story.Ethan was a very intriguing and mysterious man that instantly draws you in.  Of course he is drop dead gorgeous and who doesn’t love a hot vampire! At first he comes across as very cold and unfeeling, but as his story is revealed you can’t help but sympathize with him.  He has been through a lot and has had to deal with much loss and heartache.  His relationship with Genesis is really sweet and sexy.  They have amazing chemistry and an instant connection.  I do wish that their romance had been developed a little bit better, but overall I loved them together.  Ethan is defiantly a swoon worthy man and I enjoyed his character.The Dark Ones is an action-packed, steamy paranormal story! I don’t personally read very many adult books so this was a nice change of pace from my normal reads. From the very first page you are drawn into the dark world that Dyken created and it easily kept me intrigued the entire time.  The pacing was spot on and the plot was interesting.  The characters were engaging and easy to connect with. There is one thing that I can’t quite make up my mind about and that was the romance. It developed very quickly and defiantly had an instalove feel to it. But at the same time it worked with the story line and I don’t think that a more drawn out romance would have.  So I wouldn’t say I loved the romance, but I understood why it was written the way it was. Overall I thought this was a very entertaining read and I am really looking forward to the next book in the series.  I would recommend this to anyone that is a fan of adult paranormal stories!Notable Scene:“You really are a pretty one, aren’t you?” another voice chimed in, this one deep, smooth, soothing… like a stream where the water trickled over the rocks.He was gorgeous.Light green eyes glowed in my direction, beamed and twinkled with each blink, almost like I was staring at stars. His skin was smooth and light, dark brown hair was pulled back into a low ponytail, and he had a leather bomber jacket on.He was the epitome of every girl’s fantasy come to life.FTC Advisory: Rachel Van Dyken/Inkslinger PR provided me with a copy of The Dark Ones.  No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: An ex-archaelogy student on the run from vampires accepts a job from a dragon in exchange for her safety. The dragon didn’t say anything about keeping her safe from anything else though…Opening Sentence: I hate potholes.The Review:Ever since being unjustly blacklisted by the archaelogy world, Owl has taken to stealing antiquities for those who will pay for them. After a couple of bad experiences, Owl has sworn off doing any supernatural jobs. That is, until she’s brought to see Mr. Kurosawa, a dragon who is determined that Owl help him locate and translate an ancient scroll. In return, he swears to get the vampires chasing her off her tail for good. Owl accepts and thus begins what will become the most harrowing experience of her life. You see, Owl’s not the only one after the scroll, and the vampire after it will stop at nothing to get it. Will Owl and her friends be able to find it first? Or will Owl be forced to tell a dragon not used to hearing the word “No” that she failed to find his treasure?This is yet another difficult book for me to rate. At times, it moves very quickly and is hard to put down, but then at other times, there are lulls that seem to last forever. It also often feels like we come into the story partway through. Not much detail is given regarding Owl’s previous supernatural encounters, and yet they shape so much of how she responds to her current situation that it often left me feeling a little lost.Another problem comes with the character of Owl herself. Her voice is very uneven, which makes it hard to really get a lock on who she is as a character. Despite the first person narration, I still am having trouble coming up with words to describe her. She is at times very kickass, and those scenes are such fun to read. It’s not consistent though, which is frustrating. She also has a tendency to just run into danger despite warnings from friends, and this just gets her into more trouble. It gets a little old after a while.The romance also falls a little flat. Rynn and Owl already have a history with each other when the book starts, although it hasn’t progressed into anything more than friendship yet. There’s really no romantic tension though, and with the romance scenes fading to black before getting to the action, it’s hard for any chemistry to form between the two. I just didn’t feel invested in their relationship.On the positive side, I think my favorite part of the book involved Owl’s cat, Captain. The idea of there being a breed of cat that was developed specifically to hunt and poison vampires is very unique. I pretty much loved all the scenes in which Captain appeared. I am a cat person though, so that may have had something to do with it.I know most of this review sounds negative, but I swear I did enjoy myself most of the time. It just always felt like something was missing, so I couldn’t completely lose myself in the events of the book. A lot of these issues could come down to it being a first in a series. I liked the book well enough that I will check out book two when it comes out. I’m hoping that the hints of a good book/series that I saw here will flourish in future installments.Notable Scene:Three long seconds passed, during which I held my breath.“Lady Siyu,” Mr. Kurosawa said. The Kabuki girl produced a red lacquer pen with a very sharp tip.Oh hell no.I went to shove my hand into my pocket, but she was too fast; a blur of red-tipped fingernails snatched my wrist. I yelped as she pricked me with a needle and held my finger until a drop of blood fell on the page. She was strong for such a small woman. Lady Siyu said something in Japanese, and my conditions appeared on the bottom page. Just like that. Then she flipped the pen over and handed it to me. I kept her and Mr. Kurosawa in my sights as I signed. I thought I caught a glimpse of a slit eye as I passed the signed contract back to Lady Siyu. If she was human, I was a dancing unicorn.“How does a dragon get vampires to back off dinner anyways?” I said.Mr. Kurosawa frowned, as if my question was in line with what he’d expect from a four-year-old.I held up my hands. “Just curious. They were pretty pissed off the last time we spoke in Egypt.” Thinking about  my Egyptian run-in with the Paris boys was enough to give me nightmares for a week.“There are courtesies and etiquettes to follow,” Mr. Kurosawa said. “If not, I’ve been known to eat the occasional vampire.”I believed it. Dragons trump vampires in the supernatural food chain. Which only strengthened my conviction that I was completely and utterly out of my mind for even contemplating this job.“So, just so we’re clear, tomorrow I can use my Visa and no one will jump out of an alley and try to kill me?” Oh yeah, vampires were loving the digital era.“I suggest you set yourself up in Vegas to start, but yes. I’ve taken the liberty of having Lady Siyu check you into one of our suites. Your van was retrieved and is in the parkade.”Lady Siyu passed me a receipt for my Winnebago, along with the red dossier. She turned on her spiked heels and motioned for me to follow.Mr. Kurosawa regarded me. Even halfway to a dragon he still looked every inch the rich businessman. “Words of caution, Owl: do not let yourself lose track of Lady Siyu in my private casino. People have a way of getting…lost.”I scrambled; I was not about to get lost in a dragon’s lair-den-whatever you call it. But my business side took over.I glanced back over my shoulder at Mr. Kurosawa before Lady Siyu entered the maze. “How do I contact you?”“It’s all in the dossier.” He got up to leave and had almost disappeared amongst the slot machines, but I couldn’t help myself.“What would have happened if I’d said no?”He flashed his vicious, razor-sharp smile once more. “Those Paris vampires offered an awfully large reward for you. And I eat thieves.”FTC Advisory: Simon & Schuster provided me with a copy of Owl and the Japanese Circus. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: Dragon King has it all from a steamy romance, wonderful writing, action scenes to an amazing cast of characters.Opening Sentence: Grace was screwed.The Review:Dragon King is an absolutely sexy read. The characters are entertaining and the writing sucked me in to the story. I really felt like I was in the highlands of Scotland sitting on the side of the mountain with Grace. I really liked this setting and the dragon’s story. I just want to stop everything and read the rest of this series. I thought this novella was that good. I have never read anything in this series yet but I will. I think this could be read as a standalone because the world is set up and explained in such a way that I didn’t feel like was missing out on anything.Grace is desperate to finish her novel. She has been fighting terrible writer’s block. She does the last thing she can think of and that is to travel to Scotland, the place where her book takes place. She is hoping the atmosphere will help her write. She drives to a location that she thinks is perfect for writing and write she does. It was the perfect option for her troubles.Grace suffers from a weird phobia. She is scared of storms. She is a little worried when she sets out because of the rain but she faces her fear because writing is the number one thing she needs to focus on. As the rain picks up she seeks refuge in a cave as she continuously writes.Arian has just woken up from his dragon sleep. He can sense that his cave has been invaded. He is intrigued by the woman who is sitting at the entrance to his cave. She shouldn’t have been able to see it but he is enraptured by what she is doing. He thinks she is a wonderful storyteller but he needs to find out how she got to his cave. Arian’s cave comes under attack by Dark Fae and he must decide whether Grace knows anything about it.As a novella, the sparks fly pretty fast between Grace and Arian. Once she is aware of Arian she isn’t scared of him. I do think she is a little insane because he is naked when they first meet and she doesn’t really think anything too crazy (at least she doesn’t dwell on it).Arian is a dragon who can magically transform into a human shape. He is drool worthy. Arian follows his intuition when it comes to Grace. He is a little selfish and doesn’t want Grace to leave him so he uses his power to control weather to keep her in his cave. For the most part, Grace is levelheaded. She isn’t freaking out too much about the things she is finding out about Arian and the world that he is from.Dragon King has it all from a steamy romance, wonderful writing, action scenes to an amazing cast of characters. I really enjoyed this novella and I’m already hooked onto the character of Constantine. I really want to know what is going on with the leader of the Dragon Kings. If you like dragons and want to read a series that is well written. I would check out this novella and see if it hooks you like it did me.Notable Scene:“You’re quiet,” Grace said.Arian found himself smiling. He noticed that he had been lightly rubbing her back the entire time. “So are you, lass.”“I’m thinking.”“About?” he urged.She snuggled closer to him. “Don’t laugh.”“I would never,” he responded solemnly because he had a feeling whatever she was about to say was about them.Grace flattened her palm on his chest. “I’ve not been writing it correctly.”“Writing what, exactly?”“Passion. I forgot what it was,” she whispered. “I went off what I saw in movies or read, but I haven’t…experience…it in many years.”He didn’t like thinking about other men being with her, but they were in the past. Where they would remain. “Were they no’ good lovers?”“They were all right, but without passion, it all feels…empty.”FTC Advisory: Evil Eye Concepts, Inc/InkslingerPR provided me with a copy of The Dragon King. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: Erotic novel featuring all kinds of sexual situations, not for the faint of heart.Opening Sentence: His mouth pressed against mine, his tongue squeezing between my lips.The Review:Victoria is 16 year girl caught with the stable boy in Regency era England. Her father decides to send her to a finishing school in Vienna. I am not sure if he meant to send her to that school, but she ends up in Venus finishing school for girls. Almost immediately it becomes clear what they are learning at this school.Victoria is taught the art of pleasing herself, performing fellatio, and basically almost every act of sex you can think of. She takes to these lessons eagerly. Often using her newfound knowledge on the other girls attending the school, and sometimes on the young men kept on hand. After a year or so passes she returns home one summer to find that her father is in dire straits and ultimately kills himself and she tries desperately to save what she can of the estate.Let me start off with the good, if you like erotic sex books than this book is for you. It has something literally for everyone, lesbian, gay, straight, and bi. I mean that seriously. The writing is excellent and the book is vivid. For this being the first erotic novel by the author I felt she did a pretty great job.However, I had some issues; this book isn’t particularly for the faint of heart. The first thing that bothered me was Victoria’s age, of course taking the timeframe into consideration, I know that I am looking at that with a modern eye. She and other teenagers are in graphic sexual situations the entire book. There are depictions of incest, rape and numerous other disturbing incidents within the book. I know I said it was a good book, and it is a good erotic novel, given the context of the book my feelings are probably just my feelings. I was conflicted about the book, on one hand I enjoyed it, and on the other hand those incidents and her age disturbed me quite a bit.You may feel that I didn’t properly address the story except there really isn’t much of a story. It is very much an erotic novel. The plot really is about a young girl’s sexual awakening and her path to running her own establishment.Notable Scenes:“So I remained inside the stuffy house with no one to converse with or entertain me.”“Most evenings we entertained one or another of Bea’s patrons and their friends or guests.”“Natalie waved from the doorway as I began my journey to Vienna and a new life.”FTC Advisory: Sourcebooks/Xcite provided me with a copy of The Education of Victoria. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

Review courtesy of Dark Faerie TalesQuick & Dirty: A marine turned Crow, and Viking Raven and darkness that is coming to devour them all.Opening Sentence: She didn’t know what woke her up.The Review:Kera is a former Marine who is killed and offered a second chance at life. She is then dropped into a house with new sisters, which are a Viking clan called Crows. For the most part they are the complete opposite of Kera and at least one spectacular fight breaks out from Kera’s organizational skills. There are multiple clans serving all of the different Norse gods. The only thing any of the Crows have in common is that they are known for their rage, their hatred and their loyalty to each other.Kera finds out Vig is a Raven, another Viking Clan that serves Odin. Vig was a repeat customer at the coffee shop Kera worked at before her life so drastically changed. Kera also makes the Skuld bring her dog with her, although at the time she doesn’t realize that Brodie has to die too. Brodie quickly becomes the new mascot at the sorority type house Kera finds herself living in, in her new life.There are several POV’s in this book including Chloe and Erin (who is Kera’s new mentor and the Crow she gets into an epic fist fight with.) Chloe is the leader of this particular chapter, apparently there are many all over the world. The first half of the book is really getting to sort of know Kera and her new sisters and her developing relationship with Vig (the blacksmith for the Ravens or weapons master). The second half brings to light that something dark and dangerous is attacking the clans and that one clan alone probably won’t make it against this darkness.I enjoyed the book, although it did drag a little in the beginning. Sometimes it was a little confusing whose point of view it was at the time, but for the most part the author was on it. I feel like I have read a lot of books lately with gods, or Norse gods in them. This one didn’t have them active as of yet but definitely their presence was felt. I did really like the fact that Kera was a former Marine and that she ends up deciding to run a non-profit for rescue dogs that pairs them with veterans.As a former Marine myself there were several parts of the book that made me laugh out loud and I appreciated the author really portraying her in such a positive manner. Overall, I liked it, didn’t quite love or really like it but I enjoyed it and thought it had a lot of interesting concepts and characters. My only issue is that it could be confusing and some of the world building really needed to be fleshed out.Notable Scenes:“He was just an introvert with an aversion to shaving.”“A whistle caught their attention and the Silent looked up… to see the trees filled with Chloe’s sister-Crows.”“They stood straight and ready for battle.”FTC Advisory: Kensington provided me with a copy of The Unleashing. No goody bags, sponsorships, “material connections,” or bribes were exchanged for my review.

I bought this makeup case from Sephora. It was where I first saw it, and the price was $59-$60. I picked this versus a small version of a TARTE eye shadow set is because of its value. I get so much more... so many different shades of eye shadow and blush. It even came with an eye shadow brush and a mascara. As one of the reviewers commented, the eye shadow color is very similar, but they are not identical. I notice a slight different when applied to my eyes, but I also know which color I am applying. Overall, they do look very similar. I am okay with that, because I don't want drastic, flashy, bright, etc... color. I prefer something earth tone, somewhat natural. If you are someone who wants something simple, this is the set for you. If you like a larger variety of color and shades, then this is probably not for you. This eye shadow set is going to last me a long time. I am using a couple rows at a time, so that I don't dirty them all up.As for the quality of TARTE cosmetic, the eye shadow, blush, and mascara are all very easy to apply. It stays on nicely, and stay looking fresh throughout the day. I also love that TARTE is cruelty free, Leaping Bunny certified.

I bought this for my friend who I can't believe don't own a peeler. I like the OXO brand and have good experience with its kitchen utensils. This one has a nice comfortable handle, and it peels potatoes, carrots, etc... nicely.

Can't believe how inexpensive these flats are. They are so comfortable, too. They are even more comfortable than my $100+ Cole Haan flats. I have slightly wider feet, and they don't look wide when they are in these flats. It also covers my toes very well, no toe cleavage. The little rhinestone looking stones in the front can come off easily. One of the stones came off when I got the shoes. I just put the stone back in place and bend the prongs back to tighten the stone in its place. When I look at the stones close up, they look kind of cheap, but in a distance, they don't look too bad. These flats are also light weight. There is little to no arch support. On most flats, the sole/heel part is not that nice. I prefer shoes with heels, like the ones on these flats, of varies height. I am really happy with this pair of flats. I will likely to buy something similar by AK again.

I purchased this at Best Buy, and have it installed by their Geek Squad. The installation doesn't look as simple as taking it out of the box and mount it on the wall. It required putting the pieces together and lining the parts up to go with the TV. As I sat there and watch the Geek Squad installs the mount, I am really glad that I didn't try to do it myself or get one of my guy friends to do it for me. It took quite a bit of time to get everything just right, to include mounting it on the right spot on the wall.After the entire set up was done, I am really happy that I got the full motion mount. I have a 45" TV downstairs with a regular wall mount. I could only tilt down a little bit before the lower edge of the TV hits the wall. for this TV, I went with the full motion, just in case I need to do some serious tilting. Depending on the size of the TV, the degree it can tilt will vary. The arm allows me to pull the TV out, turn the TV to face the left, right, or center, and tilt the TV up and down.The thing that I am not crazy about is that the cables hang right below the TV. When I pull the TV out, the cables come out with the TV. I didn't have the cables fished behind the wall. Because of it, I have cables hanging from the TV to the cable box and to the floor. With the right TV stand, much of it will be hidden.Overall, I really like this mount. I can pull the TV out or push it closer to the wall easily. The tension is good and the TV doesn't need to be leveled again and again every time I move it around. I got a mini-leveler, and I believe it came with the mount and not the TV. It helps check and level the TV, if needed.So far, I am very happy with this purchase.
My cats love catnip! This is the brand that I always get. I also love that there is a little toy that comes in the container. What a surprise!

I have noticed that Calvin Klein bras run a little bit smaller in the cups and chest band than Victoria Secret and other brand bras. Calvin Klein and H&M bras are made about the same size, and I believe they could be tailored to more European or Asian ladies slender built ladies with smaller busts. This bra is customized fit, which means, the padding inside is designed to fit all cup sizes. The entire cup is made of a thicker material, and the side has built in push-up padding. If you are in between sizes, the Calvin Klein bras will probably fit you better. If you are true to size, stick to other brand bras. They are more comfortable than the Victoria Secret PINK bras that I got. The padding is hard, and the advantage is that it will provide a smoother look under a light material top.I got the DUNE color in this bra, and the color turned out much darker tan I thought, Instead of a lighter beige that I was expecting, it is darker than the standard beige or what is displaying on my monitor. This bra will look better in darker skinned ladies.

My vet and friend recommended this brand. My friend said to get the paste, but my vet said to get the treats. Because of their recommendation, I'm assuming that it works.My kitten, Chloe, was sneezing and runny nose, and my friend recommended this. Chloe didn't like the paste, and after her vet appointment,she got some antibiotic for her sneezing and runny nose, and that fixed it.Chloe didn't like the paste. I tried mixing it in the wet food, and she ate some of it. Then I got another kitten, Luna, and she is sneezing without the runny nose. My vet said to get Lysine, and told me to get the treat. She said that the paste doesn't taste good, and the treat is better. I got the treat, and all 3 of my cats ate it - even though, only Luna needs it. I recommend the treat version, not the paste.It's a thick gel, and like some reviewers said, you can't visually see if the container is about to empty. If you use this regularly, it's a good idea to have a backup, or count how many pumps before it empty so that you can gauge when you need to reorder.

My vet and friend recommended this brand. My friend said to get the paste, but my vet said to get the treats. Because of their recommendation, I'm assuming that it works.My kitten, Chloe, was sneezing and runny nose, and my friend recommended this. Chloe didn't like the paste, and after her vet appointment,she got some antibiotic for her sneezing and runny nose, and that fixed it.Chloe didn't like the paste. I tried mixing it in the wet food, and she ate some of it. Then I got another kitten, Luna, and she is sneezing without the runny nose. My vet said to get Lysine, and told me to get the treat. She said that the paste doesn't taste good, and the treat is better. I got the treat, and all 3 of my cats ate it - even though, only Luna needs it. I recommend the treat version, not the paste.It's a thick gel, and like some reviewers said, you can't visually see if the container is about to empty. If you use this regularly, it's a good idea to have a backup, or count how many pumps before it empty so that you can gauge when you need to reorder.

I learned about how disgusting rawhide is, and it is real bad for dogs. My little Rat Terrier mix is too finicky. I just saw these at the local specialty pet store, and was excited to see that this treat has no-hide, humanely raised chicken, and made in the USA. It is healthy for the dogs! It is pricey, and I definitely got what I paid for. My little one loved it. If she likes it, 99% of the dogs out there will LOVE it, because my little one only eats about 5 different types of treats (e.g. Grandma Lucy's Just Liver, Barkworthies Pork Pizzles, Aunt Jeni's Chicken Jerky, Stella and Chewy Freeze-Dried Dinner Patties, and now, this), and won't eat the rest.

Excellent product for the price. I have read many reviews and done so much research, and I picked this bench because I want to put a supersized litterbox in it. It fits the "Petmate Giant Litter Pan" BUT, the litter box covers 1/2 the cat entrance on the side. So, I went with the "Whisker City High-Back Open Cat Pan Item: 36-5216338" that I got at Petsmart. I couldn't find it on Amazon. It's a perfect size! For those with cats that like to pee up high, I recommend this Whisker City litterbox because of its high back.Many of the reviewers expected high quality and perfect product for a $200 piece of furniture. I feel that if you are more realistic and consider the quality of the furniture you'll get for less than $200, this product will most likely meet your expectation. You're not going to get Ethan Allen quality furniture for $200.I am very pleased with this product. I found 1 damage and 1 imperfection in the wood, but I am okay accepting it. Mainly because the damage is in the insider corner of the door near the hinge, and I don't really see it every time I open the door. The imperfection is in the edge if the top of the bench. Even if I were to exchange this bench for another one because of the damage and imperfection, there is a chance that I could get another bench with more issues. For the hassle of returning because it's such a heavy bench and the risk of getting something worst, I'll stick with what I got, and I am happy with it anyway. (see pictures)I wanted a piece that I can assemble, mainly because, I can carry it up 2 flights of stairs 1 or 2 pieces at a time, since I am not strong enough to pick up the box. This furniture has a nice weight, and even on the box, there is a sticker recommending 2 people carrying it. I didn't have any issues assembling it by myself. The only little complication I ran into is when I was screwing the right door onto the bench.I'm right handed, and it is difficult to hold the door up and screw the little tiny screw into the bench. The screw is very tiny, and if you have big hands, see if you can get someone with smaller hands to at least get the screw into the wood so that it will stay in the wood. Trying to screw the screw all the way into the wood was a challenge for me since the wood on the side of the bench moves a little so I have to pull the wood toward me as I screw the screw in, and I have to push real hard with the screwdriver into the screw and pray that I won't strip the screw. To accomplish that, I used the top of my feet to balance and hold the door up, while I used my right hand to hold the wood that the screw is going into from underneath or above the door being balanced on the top of my feet, and used my left hand to push the screw into the wood with the screwdriver as I turn it. It takes some coordination, and fortunately, I am pretty coordinated :-).I followed the instructions, and the instructions are excellent.Some reviews complained about cat urine ruining the wood... ummm... cat urine can ruin A LOT of things. Don't blame the product for it! If your cat likes to pee HIGH up... get a tall or hooded litter box. I don't recommend a hooded litter box, mainly because you'll need to take the whole box out to clean because the hood will need to be removed. I like the Whisker City litter box because it has its 10" high back, and unless you have a supersize cat with long legs, and likely the cat won't even fit into the entrance/exit hole anyway, it should work. I guess your cat could pee on the side of the litter box which is lower. To prevent that, this is what I did, not that my cats does it, but just in case.... I used the 3M Command Hooks and small bidder clips to clip the puppy training pads up. To catch any drip, put another piece of training pad to catch the drip. The one hanging on the interior wall will need to sit over the pad on the base. (see pictures) Hope this helps.I just ordered the "PetFusion SmartGrip Cat Litter Mat. Large" on Amazon. It's 35" by 25". The interior base of the bench is 35" by 19". I'll have an excess 5". I plan on adding more 3M Commander clip to clip the excess up along the interior back wall. The reviews said that it's flexible so that can be easily implemented as I plan. This mat should protect the interior base of the bench.How big is your cat? You might want to consider that before getting this bench. The opening is 7" across and 8" the highest part. I have a 12 lb big boned Himalayan (Himalayans are usually 6-7 lbs), and she made it in fine. Of course, my 2 (2 and 3) month kittens can climb in and out without any issues. From the floor to the bottom of the opening is about 7.5". For real small kittens, you might want to put a block inside and outside the opening to serve as steps for the little one.Even though the doors have holes for light to enter, the interior is still very dark. I am not sure how well cats can see in the door. I also ordered the "Motion Sensing LED, Kuled LED Sensor light". Based on the reviews of many battery operated lights, I feel this one should work best. Main because the interior cabinet is not that bright, and I wouldn't want to blind my cats when they go in. This one sounded it provides just enough lights. It also has motion sensor, and I plan on mounting it inside and above the entrance. I'll update this review when I get it and install it tomorrow.For the divider that comes with the bench. I chose not to use it because it will take up too much space plus I want to use the litter box that I got. To store the divider, I put it under the litterbox and training pads. With all that, i still have plenty of room to clean the litter box while it sits inside the bench.Oh, one more thing, I used binder clip to clip a sheet of the training pads in the front of the litterbox to catch any litter stuck in the little paws as they come out of the box. (see pictures)Please see my pictures to give you an idea. I uploaded the pictures in the order as I discussed above.HIGHLY Recommended!! If I need another one, i would definitely buy it again!

After doing a lot of research, I decided to stay with the Trixie product line because of quality and style. I don't want just any cat tree. I have purchased a $300+ carpeted solid wood cat tree that came assembled, but I couldn't move it upstairs because it was too heavy! I ended up giving it away.I wanted one that I need to assemble so that I can transport a couple of pieces at a time to the room where I want the cat tree. I wanted something that will look nice, and is sturdy. I also wanted one that is big enough to fit my 12 lb Himalayan and my 2 kittens' full grown size.I bought the Trixie Filippo and loved it. It is great for kittens and adult cats with claws. See my review on that tree on Amazon.I wanted 1 in my bedroom for my old lady Himalayan to be able to sleep close to my bed while being away from the kittens since the kittens seem to love her fluffy tail. After more research, I bought this Trixie Emil cat tree because it will fit my 12 lb Himilayan.The Emil comes with little steps for the cat to climb up onto the middle platform and to the bed at the top. The 2 taller steps wiggle a little, and I tightened the screws very tight. I think if the screws were longer, they might be more stable. The 2 short steps are more stable. The rest of the tree is solid. The bed is pretty roomy for my 12 lb Himalayan, and as I am writing this review, my 2 month old kitten is in the bed with my Himalayan :-). The bed will probably just fit up to an 18 lb cat.Here are some assembly issues that I ran into...1- this one is resulted from me not reading the instructions. There are 2 thread rods. One is longer than the other. The shorter of the 2 used to connect the top platform for the bed to the top scratching post, and the longer one is used to connect the bottom of the top scratching post, thread through the middle platform and into the top of the bottom scratching post.2- this one was not my fault. The middle platform has 4 holes: 2 for the steps, 1 for the cylinder tunnel bed, and 1 for the scratching post. I only found 3 holes. I ran through the surface of the platform with my fingers looking for the missing hole, and eventually I felt the missing hole in the wood for the scratching post. The hole wasn't punctured through the material. I used a pair of slender scissors to poke a hole through to the other side, and that corrected the problem.When assembling the tree, the instructions doesn't really tell you the order of the parts to put together asides from recommending that you assemble the tree top down. This is what I recommend.1. Be sure to assemble this tree on a protected surface. Hardwood is not what I would consider protective. The one of thread rods scratched my floor when I was screwing the post onto the platform, and the rod was a tap too long and left a circular indent into the wood.2. There are 2 thread rods that come with the tree, and one is longer than the other. Find the longer of the 2 thread rods and screw the short end into the scratching post3. Thread the rod already screwed into the post through the middle platform starting from the side that doesn't have the ball attached to the other. The hole is located away from the group of 3 holes.4. Screw the other scratching post into the other end of the thread rod.5. Now, lay out all the screws and group them by length. Refer to the diagram on which screw to use.6. Examine the middle platform. You'll note that one side has 3 visible holes and the other with the ball has 4. This is by design. if you are missing a hole with only 2 holes on top and 3 holes on the bottom, then you might have the same issue as I did (see my note #2 above under issues).7. If I remember correctly, use 2 of the medium length screws and screw the posts for the steps into the middle platform into the 2 holes located along the edge of the platform. Note that on the top side of the platform, the hole for the cylinder is not punctured through the material; it is covered underneath. It is only punctured through on the bottom side of the platform. It is the design. The posts should be sitting on the side of the middle platform that doesn't have a ball attached. The longer post goes into the hole closest to the scratching post, and the shorter post goes into the hole next to it. The screws go through from the bottom side of the platform with the ball.8. The remaining hole left near the 2 steps and away from the edge is for the cylinder tunnel bed. Find the shortest screw, thread it through the unfinished exterior end of the cylinder from the inside, and screw it into the middle platform. Not that the cylinder will cover the screw of the longer post. Be sure to tighten the longer post as much as possible before attaching the cylinder to the middle platform. Be sure to turn the opening on the back of the cylinder close to the scratching post so the the front will directly face the front of the tree as much as possibly.To adjust the cylinder after finished installing, it is very easy, so don't worry if the cylinder opening is not facing in the direction you want. To adjust later, you just need to loosing up the screws at the top and bottom of the cylinder. and the cylinder into the position you want.9. Take the base and with the finished side on the partially assembly part of the tree, line the holes for the cylinder and the scratching post, and screw the base into the cylinder and bottom scratching post using the 2 longest screws (check the instructions to make sure I am referencing the right size screws since I am writing this based on memory).10. Then screw in the long and short posts into the holes along the edge of the post. The longer post will be located closest to the scratching post and furthest away from the cylinder. The other hole is for the shorter post.11. Flip the tree around and screw in the tops for the 4 steps.12. screw platform for the bed onto the top of the top scratching post.13. Put the bed and the bed cushion on the bed platform, and put the little round cushion into the bottom of the cylinder tunnel. And you're done! Not so bed.Friendly reminder.... Please check the diagram to verify which screw to used. If you need to adjust the cylinder, you just need to unscrew the 2 screws attaching the cylinder, and make the adjustment.I hope this helps. I got my at bed bath and beyond. With their store coupon 20% for about $120, I got this tree for a lot less than in Amazon. For heavy products, I prefer shopping local, just in case I have an issue and have to exchange a part by ordering a new one and do a switch instead of lugging the whole tree back to the store or shipping it back. If Amazon has a much lower price, I would have taken my chance and go Amazon. I'm addicted to Amazon Prime! :-).

For the price, I was amazed by how stable this cat tree is. The cat tree came with the tools needed to put it together but there is no instructions.From my experience, here are the instructions:1. Screw one of the posts into the Hammock - Look for the end of the post that has a screw attached, and this is the screw that you'll be screwing into the hammock. As for the hammock, look for the side that has the holes. Align the hole in the material with the hole underneath the material in the hammock, and thread the screw in the post into the material and into the hole in the hammock, and turn clockwise to tighten the post into the hammock. Note that eventually, the material on the hammock will turn with the post. Keep turning the post until it is tight.2. Repeat Step 1 with the other post.3. Place the hammock facing down on the floor with the post facing up.4. On the base of the cat tree, the side that is fully covered with material has 2 holes, and this is side the posts will be screwed into. The tree comes with a small bag that contains 2 screws and a square looking ranch (not sure what you call it). These screws are for securing the base to the posts.5. Align the holes in the base with the posts. Place your fingers (2nd and middle finger) between one of the posts and the base with the hole located between your 2 fingers. This will help the screw align into the hole nicely. Thread one of the screws into the hole in the base and into the hole at the bottom of the post. Make sure the screw is lined up in the holes and between your 2 fingers. Slowly turn the screw into the post, and when the post and base starting to squeeze your fingers, stop turning the screw and remove your fingers.6. Repeat Step 5.7. Tighten both screws, one at a time. This will secure the base into the post.When done, the parts in the tree should be secured well that no part should wiggle or turn.My 12 lb Himalayan kind of "just fit". The way the hammock is designed, it will allow larger cats to "spill over" and still be able to sit in it comfortably.

I got this saucer for my Roborovski hamsters. It is so cute to see them run on it, and when the hamster stops running on it, the saucer will continue to spin until it eventually slows down to a complete stop. The reason why I am giving it a 4 star is because between the time the hamster stops running and the saucer comes to a complete stop, one of 2 things can happen:1- the hamster would spin in circles on the saucer until the saucer stops, and it is very entertaining to watch.2- or the hamster would fly off the saucer before the saucer stops spinning. This concerns me, because the hamster could hit something before landing and/or land hard on the floor of the cage. It just doesn't seem safe for my little robos to run on it on a daily basis.My robos seem to like the wheels better.

There is a warning on the label indicating that this gate is for PETS, NOT CHILDREN.Also, when the gate first come out of the package, it appears to be lopsided, and that there is a huge gap that prevents the gate from locking to the frame. This is by design. There is a tag hanging on the gate door informing you of that. Once the gate is tightened and secured between the wall, the gap will close and that the gate will be able to lock.Now that I got those 2 important information out of the way...This gate is so easy to install. I installed it on the staircase, and needed the extra extension panel that it comes with the gate. This gate is all metal except for the piece of wood located on the gate.Many reviewers complained about the plastic piece on the gate broke during shipping. Fortunately for me, that didn't happen.This gate also has a cat door built in, which is nice if you want to keep the dog out and let the cat in/out of the room.The gate also auto-close/auto-lock. Which means, when you release the gate, it will swing back into a close position. It does that sometimes, depending on the force. If I let go of the gate and let it swing back gently, the gate will close, but not always locked. If i were to add a little force when swing the gate back, it could swing back into a lock position. This is the only gate I came across that has this auto-lock feature. It can be nice if you want the gate to close on its own... or irritating, if you want the gate to stay open. I often like to keep the gate open, so I use a bungee cord to keep the gate open. It can easily be done by hooking one end of the bungee cord to the frame of the gate (same side where the swinging part of the gate is attached to the frame), threading the bungee cord through the swinging part of the gate that is attached to the frame, and connecting both ends of the bungee cord together or hooking onto the same area of the frame. Hope this makes sense. :-)If you have a baseboard on the wall where you are installing this gate, you can adjust the bottom to be more narrow than the top, as long as the bottom knobs align on the baseboard perfectly.Overall, I highly recommend this gate. Shop around for a lower price.

Beautiful bedding for a great price. This bedding set comes with the bedskirt, comforter, 3 decorative pillows and 2 shams. I was looking for a comforter with a bedshirt, and didn't expect to end up with a purple color and more (decorative pillows and shams) for this low price.For the price, I didn't expect it to be this nice. The top of the comforter isn't smooth and soft because of the design stitched throughout the comforter. The bottom of the comforter has no design, and the material is so smooth and soft. The weight of the comforter is reasonable, not paper light, closer to a medium weight.I ordered a queen size, and the comforter hangs over the mattress just meeting the top of the bedshirt covering up the flat sheet on the mattress. I have to tug the flat sheet in so that it is not hanging beyond the comforter. The length is of any Queen comforter I own. With the top edge lining the top edge of the mattress, the end drapes over the end of the mattress falling about 1 or so inches short of meeting the top edge of the bedshirt.I don't have extra pillows to fill the shams with, so I took the 2 pillows and stuffed them in the shams. So now, I have 2 shams and 3 decorative pillows, instead of 2 pillows, 2 shams and 3 decorative pillows. It works great since I am not really the pillow person. Since I got it for the guest bedroom that is rarely, almost never used, it looks pretty with all the pillows on the bed.If you are looking for something inexpensive (around $100) and if this is the color and style you are going for, this is the one to get. I do not recommend machine washing it because of the stitching throughout the comforter. I believe the washing instruction is "Dry clean only".The set that I received has a small brown stain on the white fabric of the bedskirt. Since it is tugged between the mattress, I was okay with it. One of the decorative pillow has a dark stain. It looked as though it is wet. I am too lazy to return and reorder, plus I was already setting the bed anyway. I recommend if you are more particular, I recommend inspecting the product thoroughly in case there are flaws.I didn't order this on Amazon, even though it's a great price. I got it from Bed Bath and Beyond online and used a 20% online coupon. I ended up getting it for $100, saving about $10 then if I were to order it on Amazon.

It's the only lip gloss that doesn't make my lips peel. I tried expensive lipsticks and lip gloss, and regardless of the price, they all make my lips peel. To my surprise, this is the only lip gloss that doesn't. I love the Raisin color. It's a color lipstick with lip protection. This is the only lip glass I wear now.

This multi-pack has a variety of flavors that I thought my pets would like. Unfortunately, my finicky dog is not interested, and I'm not surprised since she is very finicky. My cat first licked a little bit for taste at first, but not interested enough to make it a meal. Basically, neither my dog or cat likes it. Very disappointed. They like the dry Epigen 90 canine/feline food, but not this wet food.

I wanted a tiny ring to wear on my middle finger on my left hand. I got it as a gift from my bestfriend's kids, and I love it. It is delicate as expected. The Lotus is soldered onto the ring. This ring is small enough for an average teenager's hand, and I am a grown up. The ring runs small. I ordered a 6 and it fits more like 5.75. Inside, it's stamped 925. I found the same ring on eBay for $20 shipped from California. Definitely search around for a lower price.

I was on vacation last week and ran out of body lotion. I ran to Marshalls to find a bottle of animal-friendly (i.e. not tested on animals) lotion. I came across this bottle, and because I love the smell of lavender, I decided to give it a try. The next morning, after my shower, I applied it on my body. I am surprised by how well this lotion works. It is not watery/runny nor is it thick. It is just the right thickness, not too light and not too heavy. It is a lotion that I can use all year round. It has a real nice smooth feel to it. The fragrance is light, and after applying on my body, I don't smell it anymore. The lavender scent is similar to lavender, but it does not smell like the lavender essential oil (pure lavender oil). I love it so much that I went back to Marshalls today near my house to see if they have another bottle. I found a bottle of Organic Argan Oil, and it has a very light scent. I tried it out, and the consistency is the same as the Lavender one. I am going to stick to using this lotion for a long time. No more searching for the perfect lotion. BTW, Marshalls sells them for $6.99 a bottle. So much cheaper than on Amazon.

This pencil case is very small, you can probably fit 4-5 No2 pencil comfortably, and it is also very soft and flimsy. If you are looking for something more stuff, like canvas, this is not the case for you. The design on the material is very cute, and it is compact/flat, which makes it very easily to slip into any bag without bulkiness. The only thing I don't care for is the interior. I was hoping for a vinyl like interior, but it's not. It has a white, thick, mesh like material. It's not my favorite material, and it made me dislike the case. I'm picky, but I am not going to give it a bad review because of my personal preference. I bought this pencil case on eBay for less than $3.95. There is one left, if you do a search on Elephant Pattern Pencil Case.

These speakers are way too cute. I got them for my laptop, and I am not a big music, video fan, so I am not concerned with the quality of the sound, just want something that will work. I bought Dell speakers to go with my Dell laptop, and they would randomly stop working. Since I am not looking for something with great sound, I got these with very low expectations.First I am very surprised with the design. it is very compact and stylish. It can be compressed for storage, and the sound quality changes when it is expended versus compressed. The speaker works both ways. It like the sound better when it is expanded.Note: I am not a sound expert - As for the sound, I am WOW! It sounds very nice. I don't play it very loud since it is only 2-3 feet in front of me on my desk. I am really surprised by the sound quality - especially for the price and the size. It comes with a 3 year warranty. For the price, design, and the 3 year warranty, and now, with the great sound quality, I highly recommend it.

I bought these for a HUGE Mountaineers fan. He said that they fit nicely and they are comfortable. He wears a size 9, and I got the Men's Large that fits 9-10. He said that the quality is real nice. I like that these slippers are indoor and outdoor. He sometimes likes to mingle with his neighbors outside his house, and they are all Mountaineer Fans. They live in Morgantown, Home of the Mountaineers. He said that all his neighbors are very jealous. ;-) Highly recommend them for big fans. Looking at the pictures he sent me, they remind me of soccer shoes ;-).

I love this litterbox. It is the largest I can find. The local pet stores generally sell this around $25. I can't believe how inexpensive it is on Amazon $17 with Amazon Prime free shipping. The dimension of the area that holds the litter is about 27 x 17. For the 2 little pocket for storage, people often wonder what they are for... the litter scoop! It might also fit a box of litter fresher powder and might fit a small can of Lysol. I use it for the scoop and the other pocket for the bag that I put the dirty litter in while scooping.Unfortunately, this box doesn't come in different color, only the color as pictured. This box fits perfectly in the standard bathtub.Highly recommend it if you have just 1 or multiple cat or a very chubby cat. Very roomy. The quality is great. It is made out of thick hard plastic. It's not flimsy like some of the litter boxes I've seen at the store. It is very well made. This box is big, so please check the measurement and make sure you are okay with its size and have room for it. I would have liked it, instead of the 2 storage areas one the side, make the entire thing for litter, but since I have it in the tub, I like that I can just leave the dirty scoop in there and don't have to find a place for it.

I use litter box and training pads for my cat, and I like the fact that this litter is flushable. I started flushing it at first, and realize it can leave the toilet a little dirty and it is a waste of water. So I started putting it in a bag for disposal. At first, when I first poured the brand new litter in the box, I notice little dust. Then over time, as I scoop the dirty litter out, the litter can crumble over time. Depending on how you scoop it. I would shuffle around, and as I do that, the litter breaks into smaller and smaller pieces. I recommend gently scoop up the dirty litter and don't toss the litter around with the scoop.This litter works great in absorbing urine.

I have 10 Roborovski dwarf hamsters. I purchased similar critter baths at Petsmart for $7.99 (All Things Living Critter Bath). They come in Pink, Orange, Green, and Blue. They look exactly like these without the label/stickers in the front. They are very roomy for dwarf hamsters, and will probably fit a 2-3 of them in there. This bath is made for regular size hamsters, which is great, because it seems like a lot of the accessories for hamsters are often made for dwarf hamsters.

My best friend and her family got me this as a surprise Easter gift. I LOVE IT. It's a little bigger than I had expected, but it is perfect in size. The height of the lotus pendant is 1/2" and the width is 3/4". With the bail, the pendant is 3/4" in height. It is also pretty thick, and has a decent weight. The back is smooth and in the center, there is a stamp. I didn't try very hard to read it, and I assume it's "925". The chain that comes with the pendant is very thin. It can be a good thing, because when worn, the lotus will stand out and the chain is not noticeable. Because it is so thin and appears to be delicate, if you are wearing it often, I recommend switching the chain out for something a little thicker.Overall, I highly recommend it. I have looked at many Sterling Silver Lotus pendants, and this one is unique (with a stem) at the bottom that other don't have the stem.

My little Rat Terrier mix is extremely finicky. She turns down chicken, filet mignon, lamb chops, etc... all human food. She will only eat mini-cucumbers, and prefers the Persian cucumbers. This is one of the 2 treats that she'll eat consistently, every day. The other one is Grandma Lucy's Liver. Not just any brand of liver regardless of price, must be Grandma Lucy's.Let's just say that I am very excited to find this 2nd treat that my little dog will eat. I don't know if you have ever seen this treat in the box? I get this treat from a local specialty pet store, and I have seen dead and live bugs crawling around these treats. What the pet store owner told me is, they always put the box in the freezer for 24 hours before taking them out for sale. Even then, I have taken treats home with bugs still crawling. Pretty gross, but what I can do, when my little one loves this treat....So, what I do is, I take the bag home, then put it in the freezer for 24 or so hours. Then I rinse it under warm water to wash off as much as anything that I can and cannot see. I then unbraided it, and rinse it under warm water again. I then let it air dry on my kitchen counter. Then I put the unbraided treats in a Ziploc bag and stick it in the fridge. When it is ready to serve or before I put it in the fridge, I would take 2 unbraided pieces and cut them in half. It's because my dog is little, and if I don't cut it in 1/2, it would be difficult for her to hold it and eat, because it's too long.I pray that Barkworthie will never stop making these Pork Pizzles. I need them for many more years to come.

Pop your own popcorn!These are cute! You can feed your hamster as it, or you can pop it on the microwave and make popcorn.The popping time is way off with my microwave.The popcorn turned out a little dark on the edges. I have 5 roborovski hamsters and 5 3 week old pups. They are interested in the popcorn but that the kennel.I recommend making popcorn with some human grade kennels. It would be cheaper.

This took 2 weeks to arrive. The seller is in China. I wish Amazon would indicate where the seller is.This little gym is cute. It is very easy to put together. The holes are big enough for dwarf hamsters. I don't think a regular size hamster will fit.

You get what you paid for... please lower your expectations and you will be happier with this product. :-)Since this bookcase requires assembly, with the price being the first clue, this is the second clue that this bookcase is not high quality.The first one I ordered, I received this product in 3 days purchased with Amazon Prime. It arrived a day late but I am OK with that. I like this bookcase so much that I ordered a 2nd one.The first box arrived with a hole on one side but it didn't damaged the product. There are some imperfects (scratches, chipped paint on the edge of the boards) in the wood but they are not obvious. I also turned the wood around during installation so that the perfections are on one side, and I have that side of the bookcase against the wall. During assembly, one of the holes for the screw is a little off, and I managed to hand screw it far enough into the hole so that the screw doesn't stick out.
