There were so many characters that I had a hard time remembering who was who, despite the fact that I'd read the 1st book. I wasn't convinced of the great love between the two characters and couldn't really get a feel for their personalities. This book will appeal to someone who enjoys this type of thing, but I couldn't get into it.I received this book free of charge from Revell Reads in exchange for my honest review.

Summer has an unselfish heart. She quit college to take care of her parents after their accident. Now she's running her grandmother's book store. After breaking up with her boyfriend she heads over to her grandmothers to talk. But Granny has some news of her own. She's dying and she wants Summer to complete a list for her. Up until now Summer has been there for everyone else. Granny hopes that by completing this list, Summer will realize what she wants to do with her life. The first thing on Summer's list is reconnecting with a childhood friend.This was an unusual book. The premise is great. A bucket list to find out what you want to be when you grow up, given by a wise elderly lady. Perfect, right?! But the dialogue was so awkward and stiff. So much of the story was so implausible that it felt wrong. The story was sweet and a tad cheesy. The romance, while very rushed, was nice. There wasn't really much of a plot, just lots of dialogue and descriptions. Overall, my impression was okay, but not great.I received this book free of charge from Litfuse Publicity in exchange for my honest review.

Twenty years ago Deidre went into the witness protection program. She is now living in Deep Haven as Annalise. She's married with three kids and life is perfect. But when her FBI handler, Frank, shows up she knows that her perfect life is about to get very complicated.I always enjoy this author and this book was no exception. The characters are real and authentic. The sense of family and faith is very strong. Each book stands alone, but readers enjoying the series will have a glimpse of characters from previous novels. The plot and several of the conversations between characters really got me thinking. I enjoyed the story, but I also enjoyed the thoughts it brought out. This is a book that I'll keep and re-read in the future.I received this book free of charge from Tyndale in exchange for my honest review.

Millie doesn't mean to get fired - again and again. Her employers just don't understand her nanny methods. But despite her lack of work she refuses to work for Everett Mulberry. He hurt her feelings when he refused her a job earlier and now she won't have anything to do with him. Everett is in desperate need of another nanny after yet another one walked out on him. He is a bachelor that suddenly became the guardian for wild three children and is now willing to beg Millie to work for him. If the two can survive it just might be the best thing that ever happened to them.I started laughing during the first chapter and laughed my way through this entire book. Millie was a hilarious character. I really enjoyed the first book in the series and this one was even better. The plot was well laid out and set the scene for the two main characters. But the children played a huge part in the book as well and were fun to read about. The author also did a great job of setting up the character for the next book in the series that will come out some time next year. I am eagerly waiting to read that one. On a side note - the author had Millie love new words and sprinkled them throughout the book. Since I love unusual words and so this was a fun little addition for me.I received this book free of charge from Book Club Network and Bethany house in exchange for my honest review.

Homicide detective Livy is trying to deal with the death of a teenager that she shot during a robbery. It was justified since he pulled a gun on her, but she still can't seem to overcome the images. Her boss recommends a vacation and Livy heads to Logan Point. But once there she runs into Private Investigator Alex Jennings who is investigating the disappearance of a young girl. The clues all look just like the ones that were there two years ago when Livy's cousin disappeared. Can the two be linked? Livy agrees to help Alex in hopes of finding her cousin.Even though this is the 3rd in the series it can be read as a stand-alone. But based on the writing I would highly recommend reading the first two books. Ms. Bradley is not an author you want to miss. The suspense is well laid out and fits with the plot. The characters are likable or the kind you love to hate. I enjoyed the interaction between the family members and felt the scene was well set for the story. Ms. Bradley might be fairly new to the writing scene, but she's good. I will definitely be reading more of her in the future and would highly recommend her to anyone loving Christian suspense.I received this book free of charge from Revell Reads in exchange for my honest review.

Krista is at the ball stadium spending some quality time with her grandpa. But when a man leaves a backpack in the stands and refuses to go back and get it, she investigates. It's a bomb. She rushes back to alert Officer Dixon, the officer she saw a few minutes earlier. What happens next is unbelievable. Break-ins, kidnapping, and more bombs are just a few of the things now intruding into Krista's life. Her previous experience tells her that she can't trust law enforcement. But Cash Dixon and his team seem to be the exception.The story definitely starts off with a bang (pun intended). And the suspense and drama don't let up. The relationship between Krista and her grandfather is sweet and balances out the tension in the rest of the plot. The characters are likable and give another glimpse into the family relationship the whole team has. I won't give any spoilers, but I like how the two different aspects of the investigation played together and ended out the story. I can't wait for the next book in the series.I received this book free of charge in exchange for my honest review.

Libby has always been just a little bit different. Her parents can't figure her out or keep her under control. So when she ends up pregnant a world of secrets is unleashed on the little family cottage. Years later, Heather, her sister returns to put the cottage on the market and hopefully find out what happened to her family.This book was unique and the style was unlike anything I've read before. It took me several chapters to get engaged with the story and the characters. But once the story got started it was interesting. The characters seemed to fit the typical English stereotypes. The plot jumped back and forth between several points of view. It was mysterious and thought provoking. The story was plot driven so while I didn't feel connected with any of the characters, I liked it. I will definitely check out more by this author.I received this book free of charge from Litfuse Publicity in exchange for my honest review.

Skyler is a hostage negotiator. But she soon realizes that things are completely different from the other side. She's cashing a check at the bank when the infamous Bonnie and Clyde couple storms in and starts pointing their guns. Logan, an FBI agent, is soon on the scene. He's great at his job. But there is one tiny problem - he dumped Skyler to pursue his career two years ago. Skyler and her team of first responders are a close knit group. They all live in the old fire station and are closer than family. They aren't going to be super happy to let him into their group while they solve the bank robbery.The tension starts out immediately with the bank robbery. It doesn't stop until the last few pages as the group of first responders tries to stop the bank robber and the person trying to kill Skyler. The characters were well developed and authentic. Each person stood out on the team and the little side information helps the reader anticipate the next books in the series. I liked the faith elements that were woven into the story with the suspense. The relationship between the two main characters was sweet. This was a great book to start the series and I look forward to reading the next books.I received this book free of charge in exchange for my honest review.

Kylie is THE girl at her local school. She's the mean girl with all of her friends dancing to her every command. And those other weird girls are her to play with and destroy at her will. But when things got out of hand and Kylie is suspended she's forced to retake social studies, spend time with a counselor, and do some community service. She's determined to fake everything so she can get back into cheer leading.I was a little skeptical of how the story would play out. It's the story from the bully's point of view. But the author handled the issues really well. The story brought out reasons, but not excuses, for why a bully might act the way they do. Solutions using the Bible were taught to Kylie in a non-preaching manner that will really help girls in similar situations. The steps to getting rid of bullying can be used on both sides of the issue to bring a resolution. This book would be a huge asset to any classroom or to anyone with a young girl entering her pre-teens. I intend to keep all of the books in the series for my daughter when she gets older.I received this book free of charge from Thomas Nelson in exchange for my honest review.
Cute with a  warm fuzzy longing. I recommend getting a size larger than you think your dog may need to make it easier to get their legs in sleeves.
These run a little small so order a size larger. They are also a lighter weight  sweat shift material
This a ok jacket but not sure the snaps are going to be uncomfortable

Really a nice case & All the accessories are great. Love the sparkle to the case. Really a good bargain. One hint take the hard part of the case. Put the rubber part on first, line up the button side then snap on the hard part of the case on.  Pretty color of purposes
Worked perfectly on my new phone. Room for new apps & some music.

Barely fit my phone was difficult to get on.had to use a thin piece of plastic to get the rubber edge to come out from being tuck under the side. Once on it does make it easier to hold phone. Not the most attractive  but it works after  the long struggle to get it on. This case would be so much better  if it was 1/8 inch larger in width & penthouse

I love these needles. I had one set for 30 years. I gave it to my little neice to teach her how to knit & got a new set for me. Then I started to find a lot of patterns that you need two need sets to work the pattern. So I just bought this set as it was the cheapest way to go. I am so happy I  did this as I am making slipper socks for all for Christmas & the two needle method is faster.

Love these cups for everyday traving or not. I love tweety too. Works well with my Black & Decker single serve travel coffee maker.this holds 2 cups of coffee & that is the same amont the coffee maker makes.
So handy to warm  a slice of pizza or a sandwich or rolls hor muffins. So very nice
My puppy will love this fpr Christmas It is really cute & she will have it fo her living room bed. She has a ladybug for her bed in my bedroom
Nice mouse for a good price to replace my broken mouse

So pretty & pretty both front & back. They are a perfect to go with everything. When I travel I pick one set of earrings & a necklace that goes with everything. That way I do not have to worry if someone might steal my jewellery
Not worth the price or the long wait fot it to come 7 days past the last receive date. Very little scent & after a hour it is completely gone

This took well beyond the last date it was supposed to arrive. I just has a faint orane blossom scent. Not worth the price at all. I put some on a hour ago a lot as it spilled when I opened it. I can no longer smell it at all. I was hopefull I had found a source for orange blossom scent
This is really pretty adjustable ring & i have the matching bracelet. It will be great to wear with evening or cocktale dresses.I guess it might be cute with jeans & a dressy top
This is a really nice brush. I plan on buying more for Christmas stocking gifts plus another for my  purse

Really pretty my little dog was most happy with the little rinstone heart hangin on the front loop. She cannot wait to have it on. I explained she could have it after her bath. She still has got it out of her clothes basket 3 times already.
Really pretty ring. It is low & flat. Perfect to wear with gloves. Also goes well with a pendant and earring set I have. Nice dazzle when I play my guitar
Very nice earrings simple & perfect size

Very pretty with that unusual sparkle. This will go well with many of my outfits. I usually buy jewlry for gifts but this is for me.classy &about half a inch total lenth & the pendant is just a little longer. No chain with it.
My favourite cupcake pans. Decided I needed another pan go parties
Perfect size for toaster oven. Cornbread to stuffed peppers cook with less heat in toaster oven
So handy for quilting & keeping patterns clipped together & hanging pattern directions over my machine to keep them handy
Cool tool. If you fill two Robbins like I do then you can put one on top of spool & one on bottom. I keep thread in clear shoe boxes, with one box for each colour group

Love these clips I am using some of these on a macrame hat rack for my son. Each clip will hold one ball cap. That way his hats are on display & handy to wear. Thinking a jewellery rack to hold sheets little bags of jewlry sets. I am going to need more for quiliting

This is very pretty & I found some Angel wing earrings on Amazon that should go nicely with it. My only complaint is that I needed to sign for it. The idiot mail carrier assumed I was not home because my drapes were closed to block out the heat & then he forgot to deliver it today. I called the post office to find out why it had not been delivered & they made him bring it right away. Yikes not sure what is going on with the post office
Pretty & will be a perfect gift
Very pretty looks great with a back silk heart neckline blouse
About a inch & a quarter. Cute & can be worn on any finger. Nice for a guitar player.
These are about two inches across & flat not as pretty as picture
Pretty & will make a grand gift to make a bracelet & a necklace & earrings
Very pretty especially for a lady who loves green.
I just got this & just put it on my hand. I went back to playing my guitar & my friend pointed out that there is a really pretty sparkle to the stones. I will wear this often when I play for a croud
Very pretty & will go with a necklace I already bought.

These are pretty the gold has a slight pink tone with pink crystals behind the gold rose. The earrings are about a half inch & three quarters of a inch. I really like the simplicity of these. They are a classic design that will never go out of style & is good for any age

This was a exciting & sad. To flight evil of the worst kind  is on the plate of Allison & her soul sisters. You will be happy to see them joined in the fight of their lives. A lovely book with no cliff hangers. A good author

This book was very interesting. It is a mystery that has some amazing twists & turns. But be prepared with a tissue or two as the ending will bring tears to your eyes. Thank you Mr Rain fot a unusual book with no cliff hangers you are a true author. Now I am on to the next book.
Love this  The forest green is a perfect  shade of green & a lovely gift
These are large about a inch for the earrings & a inch & a half. The chain is a wire loop. Did not like that but put a nice rope chain on it instead.

My little dog wanted to put this on right away. She tried to wiggle her head in. The trim is faux leather. I told my dog she can wear this for a Sunday shirt or a party shirt. It is really nice fabric too

I love the Mitchell series.  I love reading about their kids.  I have to be honest and say that Cassie hasn't been my favorite Mitchell kid.  However, that being said, I can understand her problems.  She is not going to listen to her parents about anything.  Kids do that.  They pushed and she pushed harder.  Cassie gets herself into some trouble and doesn't feel as if she can go home again.  Most of the book is about Cassie running off, getting into trouble, and finding her way on the right path.  This is not a sweet storyline.  She gets into some deep stuff.  She finally meets someone who can help her become who she really wants to be.  It just takes a while. I would have loved to have more interaction with the entire Mitchell family, but this book takes place outside of their home states.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

I want to double the five star rating!!! I am left a blubbering mess after knowing that I have finished a journey with a remarkable family.  I started with book one, and five books later I am still in love with this family.  Will finally gets his turn.  Will has always been the sweet one of the bunch, but man who knew what an alpha he would turn out to be with Carmen.  I loved that Lacey included a refresher course on Will's siblings and how they each found love.  Sometimes after having months between books we tend to forget storylines.  This refresher made it easier to connect the dots.  Will and Carmen are about to embark on a no no romance.  Carmen is Will's boss.  Oops!! I felt everything as I read this book.  I felt as if I were inside the room where Will and Carmen were.  Let me tell you, sweet Will is sex on a stick.  He is the total package, who would do anything for his woman.  Even if that anything is losing his job.  I love how he takes control of the situation.  I am a huge Will fan, but he made me swoon with his and Zach's shopping trip.  The angst is low key.  The family atmosphere is off the charts. The ending was breathtaking as we get a short story from Elizabeth's (Mom's) point of view.  I cried happy tears throughout the entire short story.  I can't believe the journey is over with this family.  This is a series that I will keep on my Kindle so that I can reread it anytime I choose.  This book has dual point of view.  No cliffhanger, but you are left with a longing of wanting more from this family.  This book is a part of a series.  Yes, you could read it without having read the others, but I'm going to suggest if you want to really get to know Will that you read the other books first.

While this book is part of a series, I feel that you can read it as a stand alone.  Parts of the book take place while the other books are going on as well.  We met Derek and Carly in the other books.  They are instantly attracted to each other, but it takes a while to get their motors going.  There are a few ah ha moments in this book that answer some questions that I may have had during the other book.  It's for sure that Carly and Derek have angst, but they also set the sheets on fire.  As this book's setting is Australia, and I am American, I had a hard time with some of the language and expressions, but that didn't take away from the book.  I loved it.  No cliffhanger.  The story is mostly from Carly's point of view, but Derek's point of view sneaks in a few times.

Always good to go back to Summer Lake to visit with some great characters. This is a series, but each book can easily be read as a stand alone. This story is about Renee and Gabe. Renee is a down on her luck woman who has a positive attitude. Gabe has it all but is not really happy with how his life is going. They knew each other when they were growing up, but went on to have different paths. I have to say that I liked Gabe much more than I did Renee. She is so stubborn. I just wanted to shake her. I know there will be more books, but I am bothered by what is going on with Pete and Holly. Hopefully, I will get my answers soon. Dual point of view. No cliffhanger.

I got this book as a free book choice.  I had never heard of it.  I had never heard of the author.  But, I really enjoyed myself.  I began to read thinking okay why is this book free?  Will it be one that I have to make myself read?  The answers are simple.  I didn't have to make myself read the book because I just couldn't put it down.  Allison has taken on the roll of "mother" to her dad and two younger sister.  She has put her life on hold in order to be there for them.  Her mother died from cancer just six months ago, and her dad has been in a downward spiral ever since.  It seems that he has lost his business and their home to someone named Trevor.  Trevor is a British billionaire who has no sympathy for people.  Somehow Allison agrees to become his mistress to pay off her father's debts so they can keep their home.  I have to say that Trevor is a pompous jerk most of the book.  You know that he really loves Allison, but man does he do some stupid things to keep her from knowing it.  I felt every emotion that Allison did.  I just fell in love with her character.  She was trying to do it all, but she sacrificed herself in order to get it done.  I loved the quirky cast of characters that were introduced in this story.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger, but we know that Allison's sister is going to have a book about her.  I am a fan!

This series is about a group of friends.  While in each book we get caught up with old couples, you can still read it as a stand alone.  This is the story of Justin and Tessa.  Justin is a psychology professor who is a bit awkward with the ladies.  Tessa is a receptionist who has had a tough life raising her younger brother.  In the other books you know there are sparks flying between the two of them, but nothing comes of it.  Poor Justin is clueless as to how to snag Tessa.  Tessa is doing all she can to get Justin to want to snag her.  This is a fun story that includes love and friendship.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is the second book of a series.  While, I think you would be okay without reading the first one, I would encourage you to read book one in order to get a better feel of the Malloy brothers.  I will warn you that this is not a cute story that have you smiling the entire way through.  It isn't an easy story to read.  Rev, the president of a MC club, has left his brother's wedding to save a fellow member's child.  He finds Annabel in a horrible situation.  He rescues her, and the story begins.  They both share a traumatic past, however, Annabel's tragedy is much more recent than Rev's.  They are both broken.  They need each other to heal.  I cheered for them the entire book.  I felt every emotion that Annabel felt.  You will be kept on the edge of your seat as you know that there will be repercussions of Rev's rescuing of Annabel.  I felt many emotions as I read.  I felt sadness, hopefulness, happiness, fear, anger, etc.  I loved the carnival scene as well as the fawn scene.  It honestly felt as if I were in an action movie.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

Because I have read the two previous books, I know how the story turns out.  I really think (in my opinion) that you should read the other books first.  This story is totally through Jason's point of view.  There are things that we learned in this book that we didn't know in the previous books.  I took a deep breath before I read because I knew that it would be an emotional read.  Every scene made me appreciate Jase even more than I did in the first book.

In reading the acknowledgements, I found that Danny's Main was never supposed to have been written. I sure am glad that it was. Danny and Julie are the backbone that makes this series. Without their guidance, their "kids" would have never made it. Their "kids" have stories of their own. There are 3 books before this one that are about their "kids". This book takes us back to the past to see how Danny and Julie became a couple. These two sweet people suffered blow after blow after blow. They did not have an easy life, but the one thing that they did have was love. Their love was so strong. Where many couples would have given up hope, Danny and Julie grew from these blows. I totally admire this couple. Throughout the book you will see the theme played out by using this quote, "A family didn't have to come with blood, it only had to come with love." This book is about family that doesn't have the perfect life, but love will win out every time. The book ends in the present, and it kind of made me wonder what is next for this group. Dual point of view.

I got this from a freebie book list.  I found a diamond.  The book has a bit of humor, a bit of sadness, and a lot of fun and love.  The title to me means two different things.  I think that the other characters saved Grace while Grace in turn saved them.  Grace is a down on her luck musician.  She is down to her last few dollars.  Chord is a Super Bowl winning Coach of the Lone Stars.  Together they shine.  I loved Chord's kids, and Clementine, the dog, was a jewel.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

Wow! Wow! Wow!  This is the third book in a series, but I do think you could read it without having read the others.  That being said, I will say DON’T read it without reading the others because you will be doing yourself a disservice.  The first two books in the series are about Blake and Liane.  This one is about their son, Carter.  L. L. Collins has this knack of pulling readers in with realistic characters and situations.  These are real people with real problems.  They are human and make mistakes.  But, they love with all they have.  While I read on of her books I feel every thought and every emotion through actions and words.  You will be blessed with reading this book.  The prologue explains Carter’s past.  If you read the other Twisted books then you will know what poor Carter has gone through.  His past has shaped him.  Let me rephrase that, what his “dad” did in his past shaped him.  And, I’m not talking about Blake.  That would be the evil Ronan from the first two books.  Carter is a character who changes throughout the book.  His parents, Julia, and even Julia’s family changes who Carter thinks he is.  Carter has just graduated and covets an internship in Denver.  The first day there he meets the boss’ daughter, Julia.  Whoo!! Hoo!! But, being who he is he fights every emotion.  I. Like. Julia.  She is blunt with Carter making her exactly what he needs.  I’m not sure which Carter I like the best.  Jealous Carter? Sexy Carter? Loving Carter? Mad Carter? Scared Carter?  He has so many facets.  I loved the games that these two played while getting to know each other.  One of my favorite scenes was when Carter was chatting with a little boy named Garrett.  That was precious.  I love the way that L. L. Collins incorporates music within her books.  There is always a playlist at the end to go along with the book.  My favorite quote from the book would be: “Because love not only shows up, it stands up.  This is me, standing up for you.”  I am honored to have read such a great story.  I love Carter, Julia, and Carter’s family.  And, I must say that L. L. Collins made me even begin to like Julia’s family at the end.  I can’t say enough about this book.  I promise that you will enjoy every second.  If you have never read anything by this author before, then you have found a new favorite.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is an amazing book.  We first met Anna and Logan in the Men of Honor series.  Anna experienced a happening that no one should experience.  Logan was there for her.  He loved her.  Then, one awful night changed their lives.  For four years Logan and Anna were apart.  He let her go because he though she'd be better off without him.  He loved her the entire four years they were apart as she loved him too.  What I found interesting is that once they became reunited we find out that neither of them were with anyone else for that four years.  That's how much they loved each other.  The book centers around a bit of mystery and danger.  I loved seeing Jaxson, Sawyer, Cooper, and Cade (our Men of Honor) have such big roles in this book.  My heartstrings were tugged.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is a stand alone book, but is part of a series about the Dare siblings.  This book is about Avery and Grey and their second chance romance.  Grey left Avery in order to seek out a career in music.  He made it big, but now he's ready to return to Miami and Avery.  He wants Avery, and he won't take no for an answer.  He stops at nothing to get her.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

I first met Jasper in another book by M. Leighton.  I just knew that he was a bad@$$.  I knew from M. Leighton's newsletter that he was going to get his own story.  In Cash's story he was known as Jason King.  In Strong Enough he is Jasper King.  This is s suspense/romance story.  I felt as if I were watching an action movie unfold with words.  The prologue gave me chills.  The mysterious tone to the book made me keep reading until I could find the answers that I wanted to know about Jasper.  Jasper is "hired" by Muse to help her find her father.  There are a lot of twists and turns in this book.  There is drama, angst, love, hot sex, sadness, and mystery in this book.  All of my questions about Jasper got answered, but the story will continue with another book. It will be a story with a different couple, but I bet this isn't the last we will hear from Jasper and Muse (or at least I hope it's not).  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger, but there is so much more to the plot of the story to come.

I thought this was a very good book.  There is a lot of angst inside.  Adam and Annalisese are hot for each other, but her dad (unknowingly to her) is in the way.  Adam is a high profile man nicknamed, Mr. Chicago.  Annalisese is a recent college graduate waiting to get a teaching job.  They are hot together even if Adam knows they aren't supposed to be together.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is a different type of book than I am used to reading.  The hero, Zach has lived in the Amazon Rain Forest for 18 years.  Moira has been hired by his Godfather to bring him home.  She has to teach him everything.  He is a quick learner, but the one thing that he is most passionate about is sex.  This book is filled with raw, gritty sex.  There is a storyline in which Zach is trying to fit in to this world.  Moira is so patient.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

I feel like that I have run a marathon.  This book will keep you on your toes.  It will pick you up like a spinning tornado.  I felt love, sadness, happiness, madness, etc.  This is a stand alone book, but you will visit with characters from book 5 in Bayou Stix series.  This book will remind you of the haves and the have nots.  Ty is a blue collar paramedic.  Annabeth is from a family is from old politics.  Her dad is a senator.  She is torn between what she wants to do and what she thinks she should do.  Ty and Annabeth have a secret relationship because she doesn't want the knowledge of said relationship to get out.  I have to admit that I didn't like Annabeth through the first part of the book.  She seemed to look down her nose at Ty.  I didn't think it was possible to dislike a main character from a book that I was reading, but her actions made me do so.  I loved when Ty told her off.  I wanted to slap her silly myself.  Skye Turner takes us on a roller coaster ride with all of the angst leading up to me finally liking Annabeth.  I loved Coralee, Annabeth's best friend.  She kept it real for Annabeth.  I loved Grandma Clarabelle.  She also keeps things real.  I loved Annabeth's sister and Ty's partner, Tifanie.  I also loved Bently, Ty's friend.  He didn't pull punches either.  I loved how characters grew in this book.  They allowed themselves to change.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is a good book, but I only gave it four stars because I got so mad at the female characters in the book.  The book is different in that it focuses on three couples.  Three good friends and three brothers.  Each girl has a great guy, but all they can do is think of reasons as to why they don't need to be in a relationship.  I understood those reasons, but I just wanted to shake them and say look at what is standing in front of you.  Lots of points of view.  No cliffhanger.

OH MY HOLY HOTNESS!!!!! Items you will need before reading: fan, water, husband/boyfriend/lover nearby, all day!!!! This is a wicked way to start a series.  I have been grabbed and pulled in.  Woolf and Callie share a past where their parents were friends.  Actually, he and her brother were best friends.  He fought his attraction to Callie because of his friendship.  He thinks she needs to find a nice "vanilla" man.  You see, Woolf is part owner in a sex fantasy club.  His lifestyle is so different than Callie's.  Hang on a minute, Callie has something to say about that.  She is tired of being the old Callie.  She is back in town after a break up.  WHEW!!! Hot does not even give justice to this book.  I was so thankful for Bridger, Woolf's partner/best friend.  He kept Woolf from doing stupid things.  If you are afraid of reading something sexy, then this book isn't for you.  There were many moments when I needed that fan.  That lifestyle does nothing for me in real life, but man is it hot to read about.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger, but the epilogue will lead you into the next book.  Sawyer Bennett, you gave us another 5 star book.

Welcome back to Hope Falls.  I hope that you have read the other books in this series, but if you haven’t you can still read this one without being lost.  Melanie Shawn does a great job of recounting past couples’ experiences within each of this books.  I think you will fall in love with this quaint town nestled around the Sierra Nevadas.  This book is centered around Adam and Jane.  Adam is a 34 year old hot, genius who is very cynical about relationships.  You will find out why he is cynical later in the book.  Jane is a 30 year old awkward, quiet woman.  She is a very smart herself, and she is looking for that relationship that makes her feel that “zip, zap, zing”.  Adam doesn’t want a relationship, but he can’t get Jane off of his mind.  She seems to be everywhere he is.  It must be fate.  I had to giggle at some of their first interactions.  It was as if something from a comedy was unfolding in front of my eyes.  Poor Jane was left embarrassed at almost every meeting that she and Adam had.  I liked that added humor in the book.  Melanie Shawn has an ability to keep their readers engaged in the story.  They make you want to live with these people and be friends with them.  They are great authors who work together to give you a perfect story.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

I got this as a freebie off Amazon.  While reading the reviews I had my doubts that I would give this a five star rating.  I thought that at best it would be a four star book for me.  I am happy to admit that I was wrong.  This is a book about second chances.  It is a very clean read, and I would recommend this to a teenage girl to read.  Asher and Grace went to high school together.  She is two years younger than him.  They never developed that girlfriend/boyfriend relationship, but you could tell that it was what both wanted.  However, Asher leaves for college promising not to forget Grace.  To me this is so typical of young love.  Of course, they lose touch. and Grace ends up dating Asher's brother.  Two years later Asher returns and the sparks begin to fly again.  There is a lot of unresolved feelings that we go through with these two young people.  Keep in mind that during most of the book they are 18 and 20.  Kids that age are supposed to be reckless and not serious, but these two have a ton of maturity.  There will be a lot of turmoil these two have to go through to find their happily ever after.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

Beautiful. Compelling. Emotional.  Loving.  There are more adjectives that I'm sure give a better and more fitting description, but I just loved this book.  The Southerlands are a family that I have enjoyed reading about.  I will tell you up front that you can probably read the book as a stand alone, but I don't think that you will get the same feeling if you haven't read the other books.  Blake Southerland has been in England building his fortune.  He has an assistant, Samantha, whom he is finding a bit attractive.  She feels the same way.  A family emergency sends Blake back to Virginia.  Needing to finish some business, Samantha travels with Blake.  Blake is from a big, boisterous family.  Samantha is an only child.  She comes off a bit cold, but it is not her intention to be that way.  I can only imagine how intimidated Samantha must have felt meeting Blake's huge family.  I loved the way that Blake defended Samantha when his brother, Adam acted like an @$$ to her.  This was a simple love story without exes and outside influences causing grief or heartache to their relationship.  I love that we as readers just get to watch their story fall into place.  There is a dual point of view.  There is one chapter in which we get John, Blake's dad's point of view.  That just made me happy cry.  Then as I kept reading that happy cry turned into an ugly cry.  I don't want to ruin the story so I will stop there.  No cliffhanger, but we know that Taylor's, Blake's sister, story is next.  From the blurb it sounds a bit more angsty that this one.

If you like a book that is full of suspense and reminds you of a cop drama/ER/reality show then you will enjoy this book.  Adam Trent is a cop working to solve a case that involves vehicle thefts.  Erin is an ER doctor facing the challenges that ER doctors face while dealing with an ex, whom is also a doctor, dealing with a past she wants to keep hidden, and dealing with a tragedy that left her family heartbroken.  Their lives connect one night and both of them will never be the same.  Within the first few pages I was captivated.  I kept reading to find out answers.  Erin does A LOT of running, so she got on my nerves often.  Dual point of view with suspense, action, drama, sex, and love.  No cliffhanger, but there is another Trent boy book coming.

This is the final book about Ayden and Lyric (there are 4).  I felt as if this book was a bit short.  Their story did get a conclusion. All of the questions that were swirling around in the previous books are answered.  I just didn't like this series as well as I did the one about their parents.  There is a bit of a dark aurora around the book.  If you like happy contemporary stories then this book and series probably isn't for you. I still love Lyric's happy go lucky attitude.  She doesn't let stuff keep her down.  Ayden finally has come out of his fears.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger, but there is another book coming about Ayden's sister.

I was given this book in exchange for an honest review.  It was just good to me.  I know that a lot of people will enjoy the books.  There are a lot of friend moments.  What I didn't care for was the dating of two guys.  I just like my romance books about one girl and one guy.  Other people will like that aspect.  I just didn't.  It all works out in the end with Juliette choosing the best guy for her.  Also, there are a lot of characters.  I know that the author explained them at the beginning, but I kept having to go back to see who was who.

Sexy, bad @$$ racer, Leandro has hit rock bottom.  His near life ending wreck has left him afraid to get into a car.  He is on the edge.  He is about to lose his career.  He goes to see a therapist, India.  They are VERY attracted to each other.  India fights the attraction all the way because it's a no no to be involved with a patient.  After a bit of persistence on the part of Leandro India gives in.  There are lots of hurdles that this couple must overcome.  I think what I liked the most about the book is that once they became a couple, they didn't run from each other when problems arose.  They talked about everything.  The book held my interest for one sitting.  I loved it.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.  This is the second book of a series, but it can be read as a stand alone.

his is a second book in a series.  I do think that you should read book one before this, but if you didn't then you will be okay.  We met Jade and Aidan in book one.  Jade is a dancer who has come to be with her two best friends and teach at a dance studio.  She and Aidan met a year ago and have been close friends since.  Aidan wants more.  He really loves Jade, but he can sense that she is scared of something.  That something comes to light in this book and causes Jade to run.  Aidan follows.  The running lands Jade a job as a guest judge on a dance show.  The dance show felt like So You Think You Can Dance.  Matter of fact the characters' names reflect that show. You will fall in love with Aidan as he is so sweet but manly at the same time.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

I really enjoyed this book.  I got it as a free book, but then once I finished I bought book 2.  This is about Mia and Jaxson.  Mia is a ballet dancer who has suffered a career ending injury.  She moves back home to start a dance studio with her two best friends.  Jaxson is a widowed father.  His little girl signs up for Mia's classes and the story goes from there.  There are some intense sex scenes that will wow you.  There are moments of misunderstandings that will cause you to cringe because they reacted instead of thinking.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

The only reason that I bought this book was to get You'll Be Mine by Marie Force.  If it were this book alone, I'd give the book 5 stars.  The others just did nothing for me.You'll Be Mine- I love Cameron, Will, and Fred, the moose.  This is the story of their wedding.  It was beautiful.  I love the Green Mountain series so I loved this part.  The wedding helped complete Cam and Will's story.  I loved how Marie used Fred in the wedding as well.  This book was worth 5 stars.The other books were in my opinion only 3 star reads.  Some will enjoy them, but I just wasn't one of them.

Easy Charm is easy and charming to read.  I am enjoying the Boudreaux family.  Kristen Proby has a way of luring you into this fantastic family world.  She makes you fall in love with the characters and feel as if you are a part of their family.  This book is about Gabby, the youngest Boudreaux, and Rhys, a professional baseball player.  We met both characters in the first book.  You don't have to read the first book in order to understand this one, but I encourage it.  Gabby is the baby of the family raising a son by herself.  Rhys is an injured baseball player needing time to mend from surgery.  They have an instant connection.  This is a sweet story of them learning to love each other.  There are a few spots of misunderstanding along the way, but nothing to make this what I would call angsty.  Had life not interrupted me I could have read this in one sitting.  I can't wait for more of this family.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

There is nothing to hate about this new series.  I am hooked.  Katie Ashley hooked me with the prologue.  I was grabbed and pulled into a world of motorcycle men who aren't exactly on the right side of the law.  Willow will steal your heart in the first few pages.  Deacon is a member of a MC.  He likes women and he lives a life where he is responsible for the MC he is a part of but nothing else.  Enter Willow.  Willow is Deacon's child.  He has no idea what to do with a child.  Alexandra is Willow's kindergarten teacher.  She is worried about Willow, but she doesn't know what she is in for when she goes to visit Willow's home.  Alexandra is nothing like the women that Deacon likes.  She is "white bread".  When they finally give in to the attraction, it's lights out.  There were scenes in the book that made me want to cover my eyes.  Katie Ashley vividly described some of the going's on of the inner workings of a MC. There is a lot of action in this book.  I fell in love with the characters despite their way of life.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger for this story, but we are set up for Rev's story coming soon.  This is a series that will capture you, make you want to do nothing but read, and then leave you breathless when you finish.  Love it.

I happened upon this book as a free book.  Boy am I glad that I did.  I really enjoyed the book.  It isn't very long at all.  You can read it in one sitting.  Embry has been on the run for four years with her best friend, Caleb.  I won't say why for it will ruin the book for you.  She meets Nolan.  Nolan will not be put off by Embry's lack of interest.  He hangs in there.  The book goes between past and present so the reader will understand why Embry is on the run.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is another book in this series that I liked.  I didn't love it, but it was okay.  Travis's story is still my favorite.  This is Taylor's story although we don't get his point of view.  Taylor and Falyn are the main characters in the story.  She has no interest in him, but then she finds out where he is from and uses him to get there. They have a relationship that is based on bantering back and forth.  I like Taylor for most of the book, but then I wanted to slap him.  I'm not a big Falyn fan.  I really didn't care for her throughout most of the book.  There were MAJOR bumps in the road in their relationship.  I wanted to throw my Kindle at the way the story unfolded. Just when you thought the story was going the way you wanted, BAM it turned a different way.  Of course, I kept reading because I wanted to know how this was going to play out.  I wanted to shake both of them for being so stupid.  We only get Falyn's point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is a bit of a different type of book that I have been reading.  Yes, it's romance, but it's so much more.  Renie has lost her grandmother and her mother in a short time span.  She is losing control of her emotions when the rock that she needs walks through the door.  Mitchell is who Renie needs.  They were married and divorced.  They had that young love, but then life got in their way.  She was a bit immature for the relationship and the time that it takes to build a lasting one.  This is a book about their second chance, but it is also about Renie growing as a person.  She has to come to some realizations about herself.  The book takes you back in the past at times.  We see how the love of Renie and Mitchell came to be, and we watch as it blooms again.The author did a great job of character development.  Dual point of view at times.  No cliffhanger.

While I loved book one, this one was just okay for me.  Don't get me wrong, it's a good book with great character development.  I think what I had trouble with is that in order for these characters to grow and learn they had to be apart.  I love Houston and Rory together.  I don't like who Rory was apart from Houston.  I felt that even though she loved Houston she had a hard way of showing it by running off with Liam.  Of course, her running off is the result of miscommunication and some dumb choices by Houston.  There are a lot of twists and turns that you may have never expected to see coming in this book.  Dual point of view with a cliffhanger.

This is part of a series, but I think you could read it as a stand alone.  I read the first book and now this one.  I did feel a bit lost at a few characters, but nothing that would make me not understand at least some of their background.  Barrett is a high powered workaholic lawyer.  Tabitha is a music teacher.  They are attracted to each other but Tabitha's best friend Madison (from book 1) used to date Barrett.  Tabitha doesn't feel as if they should  continue seeing each other.  Tabitha has used sex in the past to fill in for something she is missing.  She never sleeps with the same man twice.  Barrett is going to change that.  I didn't like the way that she treated Barrett.  She was so mean to him.  She didn't know how to be in a relationship.  She ran.  Later we find out why she ran, but still she made me mad.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

Welcome back to Hope Falls!  I love this series.  You know you are reading a wonderful book with a fantastic author team when you just can’t put the book down.  All you want to do is keep reading until you are finished.  Then, you sigh and think to yourself why didn’t I slow down because now what do I read to top that.  Melanie Shawn pulls you into the story.  You feel as if you are a part of the story.  The editing is awesome.  There are no miscues to make you stop and have to read again.  The storyline will keep you interested from start to stop.  Levi owns the local bar in town.  He and Shelby had an encounter at a wedding over a year ago.  He has never forgotten that encounter even though she left without a goodbye.  Shelby comes back to Hope Falls to try to get her life back together.  There are sparks flying everywhere, but both of them are too stubborn to do anything about this lust.  Each have their own reasons, but you just want to shake them and yell, “Get on with it!”.  Even though this book is a part of a series, you could read it as a stand alone.  Other characters reappear, but you can follow the story without knowing their backgrounds.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.  I can’t wait to visit Hope Falls again.  If you haven’t checked out any of this writing team’s other series, do yourself a favor and one click those books.

I am in love with this series.  I think that the books just keep getting better and better.  I laughed, I cried, I got mad, and I felt the loved.  I honestly think I laughed harder in this one that i have in the others.  There were so many scenes that cause me to giggle so much my husband looked over at me.  I loved the scenes where Bella, Allie's best friend, made such a fool out of herself in front of Wren.  Once you read the book, you'll know what I'm talking about.  We have known Wren throughout the entire series.  We met Allie in the last book.  Allie and Wren had a hook up seven years ago that produced a child.  Wren was so drunk that he doesn't remember the deed.  He also gave Allie a fake name.  She finally found him, and she is now demanding answers.  I can't say that I blame her for making Wren grovel a bit.  Their chemistry is off the charts.  I love the relationships that surround Wren and his family.  These dudes are hot, rich, loving, alpha, caring, etc.  They are the total package.  Even though this is part of a series, I feel that you can read this as a stand alone.  However, I don't suggest that you do that.  Each book is worth the read.  You too will be hooked if you give this author a try.  I can't wait until the next one.

Ella Fox got my attention once again with this second book of The Catch series.  This book is about Trace and Darby.  The book takes us back to when Darby was 4 and Trace was 5.  We were shown how awful Trace's grandmother treated he and Tristan.  We also saw how Darby wanted to take away his hurt from the moment they met.  We follow their friendship as the years go.  We know that Darby is totally in love with Trace, but we also see that Trace in his own way loves Darby just as much.  While I know that Trace had a horrible beginning, his using sex to cope just ticked me off.  I felt so sorry for Darby as Trace strings her along.  Yes, I know he deeply loves her, but that is not how to show someone you love them.  Darby is a trooper.  She is strong.  She has to be because a weaker woman would have been broken by Trace's constant yo yo treatment with her heart.  I loved the epilogue.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.  I might suggest to reread Catch My Fall before reading this one.  I read it so long ago that I forgot what happened in that one.  You don't have to read Catch My Fall before this one, but it just helps with characters.

This is the final book in this series.  Although the author tells you in the blurb that you don't have to read them in order, I suggest that you do.  The couples will make more sense if you do.  I think the last two books in the series are the best.  There are not as many editing errors in the last two as there are in the first three.  The story lines I feel are better too.  River is an escort who has been hired by Meadow to make her boss, and man she thinks she's in love with, jealous.  Her boss is a total loser.  River is this alpha male and Meadow knocks him off of his feet.  Meadow got on my nerves as she couldn't see the best thing was right in front of her face.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

I have to give props to the fourth book in this series.  In my opinion, this is by far the best of the bunch.  This is what I wanted the other books to be.  I couldn't put it down.  I was invested in the story from beginning to end.  Yes, there may have been a few (and I mean very few) errors, but those errors didn't deter my reading as they did the books 2 and 3.  The storyline was different for this one as well.  I didn't feel as if I were rereading books 1-3.  Jett is posing as one half of a gay couple.  The problem is that once he gets a look at his client's sister, Ophelia, he falls head over heels.  Now, he has to settle for being her friend.  I love how their friendship grows and flourishes.  There were some humorous parts in here as well.  I love the way that Jett gets the best of Ophelia's boyfriend.  He deserved everything that Jett does to him. Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.  You can read this one without the others.  I suggest this to be put on your list.

This is the third book of this series.  We are basically seeing the same thing in all of the books.  Girl asks for escort.  Girl and escort fall in love.  This is the story of Cato and Katarina.  They had a chance meeting two years ago and now they meet again.  The problem is that Katarina doesn't remember being with Cato.  This is a huge jolt to Cato's manhood.  He is really mean to her at first.  They fall for each other, but she must overcome some things in her past to help her to fall in love again.  There are some spelling, editing, and word usage problems within the book.  Sometimes those errors make for hard reading.  They weren't as bad as in book two, but I still noticed them.  I figure if you are going to pay almost $5 for a book, then the editing must be better.  I feel bad for not giving a better rating, but I must be honest.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

This is the second book of a series.  This book can be read as a stand alone.  Even though the same characters are in each book you won't miss anything by not reading the others.  While I really enjoyed book one, this one seemed to lag a bit for me.  I had a harder time getting in tune with the characters.  There were some typos and even some misused words such as than and then.  I didn't notice that in the first book.  Troy is a professional escort.  He only escorts dates.  He doesn't kiss them or anything else.  Harper and Troy met in book one.  They become friends.  She has him to pretend to be her boyfriend in order to get her parents to leave her alone.  I did like how Harper was honest with Troy about having a hard time accepting his job.  What girlfriend wouldn't be jealous of her man spending time with other women?  I felt as if the relationship that Harper had with her parents was left hanging.  Even though that was a major focal point in the story, we didn't get closure with them.  Troy was a different type of male lead.  He was the one wanting to go slow in the relationship.  He was the one not wanting sex.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.  Bits on angst where you want to throttle both characters.  This just didn't keep my attention as well as the first book.  I would suggest you give it a try as you may really like it.

I enjoyed this book.  I wasn't sure what to expect when I read the blurb about the male lead being an escort, but it turned out wonderful.  Rhett has been hired by Aspen to be her date.  She is wanting to stick it to her ex and his new love.  The relationship builds slowly for Rhett and Aspen as they can only be friends.  They share so much of each other, but both are afraid to take it to the next level.  I love Aspen's strength.  I love Rhett's loving side.  I admire Aspen for not being upset at Rhett's job.  I'm not sure I could be so understanding.  The book has a nice even flow to it.  There is minimal angst.  You will fall in love with Rhett and Aspen.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

If you are looking for a romance book where boy meets girl, boy and girl have problems, boy and girl make up, then this book isn't for you.  This is a book about a couple who are married and have been married for years.  Their sex life has become a bit boring.  This book discusses how they rekindle their sex life.  I found myself being able to relate to Frank and Wendy.  Most people's sex life gets pushed to the rear while raising a family and going about daily life with that family.  One day Frank finds and reads (after he figures out the password) Wendy's Kindle.  He realizes that their sex life has gone cold and he wants to recreate the spark they used to have by using the knowledge he found by reading some of the books on her Kindle.  I loved how Frank loved his wife but lost touch with what they needed as a couple.  This happens in real life.  I think I'll leave this book open on my Kindle and maybe my husband will read it.  The book unfolds over a few days time, but it is well worth the read especially for that person looking to revamp their sex life.  No cliffhanger.  Dual point of view.

I read some of the later Hope Falls books before this one.  This one started it all.  This is the story of Amanda and Justin.  Amanda has loved Justin for years.  The problem is that there is a five year age difference.  Therefore, Justin wouldn't let his feelings through.  He left Hope Falls in order to prevent anything from happening.  He was gone for 10 years.  Now, he is back and Amanda's feelings haven't gone away.  I did get a bit mad at Amanda for pushing him away at first.  I loved the bathroom and spider scene.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.  I love Melanie Shawn and so far there hasn't been a book that I haven't enjoyed by them.

While I totally loved the other books in this series and gave them 5 stars, this one just didn't shout a five star rating to me.  There were parts of the book that I loved and there were parts of the book that to be honest sort of bored me.  Kellie is the only female in this McCallan clan.  She was a bit of a mystery to me.  There were times that I rooted for her and there were times that I wanted to smack her.  She and Tate had an instant chemistry although neither acted upon it.  Tate won my heart with his interactions with his Gram.  I felt there was too much Kellie and her family and not enough Kellie and Tate.  I understand that this is a series about the McCallans, but I wanted more of Kellie and Tate.  There wasn't unnecessary angst between the couple, but the family dynamics will keep your head spinning.  Max, the McCallan who I didn't like in the other books, begins to turn me around with how I see him.  His story is to come, and I feel we will like him once he gets out from under his father's control.  Dual point of view.  No cliffhanger.

I enjoyed Caroline and Reed's story.  I will admit to not liking Caroline early on in the story as she was judging every guy by his bank account.  I realized how she was brought up and how she wanted to be different than she was in her youth, but shaking off guys who didn't have a solid bank account is just bitchy in my opinion.  Once I got to know Caroline I did enjoy her character better.  Reed and Caroline butt heads, but their chemistry is off the charts.  They keep secrets from the other therefore their relationship is rocky.  This is book two of a series, but you can read it as a stand alone.  The characters from book one are in this one, but you lose nothing from the book if you haven't read the first one.  I would have liked Reed's point of view as we only get Caroline's.  No cliffhanger.

This is the conclusion of Cal and Macy's story.  You must read the first two books or you will be lost with what is happening.  We finally learn Macy's secret.  I love Cal.  He is so head over heels for Macy.  I don't like Macy as much as Cal, but she does love him in her own way.  Maybe I don't like her as much because the book was told from Cal's point of view.  Sawyer Bennett delivers a well told story with lots of hot scenes.  No cliffhanger.

This is part of the Men of Honor series.  I have loved this series.  Kayla and Cooper have been present in every book.  This book is a novella that shows us how Cooper and Kayla came to be a couple.  This is just a happy book as we go from present to past and back to the present.  The majority of the book is from Kayla's point of view.  No cliffhanger.  This will leave you with a smile.
Beautiful, rich tone. Easy to blow. The G is a good second harmonica to get after the C. I love my Hohner Special 20 and find this comparable in price, workmanship, and ease of blowing.

What a disappointment! First, the stated dimensions are totally wrong. The website, and even the carton this is shipped in, says it is 27.5 inches wide. But in fact it is 42 inches, which means I ended up having to repack it and send back since it was too wide for the alcove I intended it for.Second, this does not in any way look like leather. It doesn't even look like imitation leather. It is a two-tone mottled plastic material with 2 shades of brown that look like large, blurry polka dots. Really ugly. Fortunately Amazon is wonderful about returns that do not match the web descriptions and this certainly does not. But since so many reviewers said that this looks like leather, I can only surmise that the manufacturer uses different materials at different times, and currently the selection is very unattractive.

I am an artist and have painted a number of murals on various walls of our homes over the years. Recently, we moved into a new apartment and I just didn't have the energy to paint 2 sliding door panels myself so took a chance on this mural. It's beautiful!  First, although very reasonably priced, it is a high quality product, made of a heavy paper stock with a glue sizing on the back. You simply dip a panel in water (I did it in the bathtub) and take it, dripping wet, to the wall (or door) and simply press it on, wiping across it with a lint free towel or soft sponge to remove any air bubbles.As opposed to plastic film, air bubbles are easy to press out with this product. And best of all, there is so much sizing on the back that it is very easy to slide the panel around to straighten it or align it. Consequently, you don't have to do what the directions say which is to draw a plumb line before you begin to make sure you put it up perfectly straight. I just put it up, used a carpenter's level to make sure it was level, sliding it a bit here and there till it was. Super easy. And you don't have to worry about wrinkles. The paper is heavy and forgiving. Wrinkles seem to disappear.Now for the quality of the graphics and the color: it is exactly as shown in the photo. I am using it in a small room, and the soft colors are not intrusive. I actually cut it to mount on 2 sliding closet doors, and that was easy to do. The finish is a very nice matte. I really am extremely impressed with the company and the product, which is designed and manufactured in Canada. It shipped in a heavy tube and arrived in perfect condition. The only thing I question is why the price went from $22 when I bought it a few days ago to $38 today. Is it worth $38? Yes, it really is, but perhaps you should check to see if you can find it cheaper with a different vendor, or even here on Amazon, which often has varying prices.

They almost taste homemade... they really do. And are firm enough to hold up for dunking. The flavor is mild and natural. And the price is amazing. Found them at Publix for under $4 a box, a real bargain!

The website description and photo are very misleading. By placing these very small tealights next to a sign and decorative ornament, they appear to be like small pillar candles, but they are not. They are tiny tealights, and although it says they look like wax, they do not. They look like very cheap plastic. Moreover, the flicker is not realistic, no matter how many reviewers state it is... it is an annoying flicker - the kind that causes migraine headache. Perhaps if these were priced at $5 for the package they might be worth it, but are overpriced at $10-$11.

The advertising is a little misleading. The memory foam layer is only about 1/4 inch thick so is virtually ineffective. The rest of the foam is fairly firm, but since I've just started using it I can't report on how quickly it breaks down or whether it retains its firmness. But I wouldn't buy it again because of the almost non-existent memory foam, and also because the cover is fabric on all sides, which makes it less practical as a cushion that "travels" (such as the ones with one vinyl side) and which can be washed/wiped down easily. Because of the name of the company it might be that this is primarily for a wheelchair seat, in which case the fabric on all sides would be softer than vinyl, but the memory foam should be thicker.

I've been buying "Seat Solution" cushions for about 20 years and this definitely is not up to their past standards. 1) the covering, both the plastic and the fabric, are very thin and of inferior quality;  2) the material is loosely cut and fits poorly; 3) the foam insert is extremely soft and offers little support.After buying perhaps 8 or more of these over the years, would I buy this particular version again, no, I would not.PS: It is telling that the manufacturer no longer puts a label on this version and the company's name is no longer on the box.

Purchased this by mistake. Thought I was ordering the SixThirteen Nourishing lotion similar to the one that came in my initial WEN package. It's nothing like that, but it IS a very nice, lightweight leave-in styling lotion. You only need a pea-size amount if you have short hair, so this bottle lasts a long time. Just distribute it well into your wet hair. No snarls, and it adds a little bit of body. A nice everyday detangler and light conditioner.

I've been taking biotin for years. First, my hairdresser recommended it and then my dermatologist concurred. Initially, I started with 500 mcg, increasing it up to 2,500mcg on my dermatologist's recommendation. I actually found my hair and nails growing much faster on just the 500mcg, but increased it to see if there would be further improvement. The improvement to my nails was amazing. They have always been thin and unattractive. The higher dose of biotin made them grow in thicker, stronger, and unbelievably (at least to me) the nailbed actually lengthened, making my nails far more attractive than they'd ever been in all my 70+ years. Wish I could say it did away with the ridges, but that's not changed. The only effect I've seen on my hair is that it grows much more quickly when I take biotin, and the dosage hasn't seemed as critical as with the nails. But here's the kicker: After taking 2,500 mcg for about 8 months, I started using this Twinlab 600mcg. and have been able to maintain the improvement on that small amount. It's a very small capsule, is made in the US, comes in a glass jar, and is free of corn, sugar, coloring etc. It's a quality product that I really trust and recommend.

I really like this lamp a lot. The light is gentle and it's well made. The main reason I don't give it 5 stars is that there is no timer, which is important when you are resetting your circadian rhythm and want to use it a specific amount of time every morning or evening. Even the little portable LED one at $69 has a timer, so it is possible and should be added to the design. Moreover, the Verilux bulb gives off some heat, which isn't a problem for me but it could be for someone prone to hot flashes or living in a warm clime without A/C. And even though this is not large, it's not an item you can travel with. So bottom line, I've bought both lamps. I use this every morning and love its mellow, gentle light, but also have the little portable LED one for travel.

Maybe these help alleviate a cough. I dislike the taste so much I can't keep them in my mouth long enough to find out. I like the Olbas nasal inhaler so was prepared to like these. Sadly, I cannot stand them. I gave them 2 stars, not 1, assuming they might perhaps work if you can tolerate them.

Whoever invented this toilet scrubber system was brilliant. These pads are a very firm nylon material with disinfecting soap embedded in them. They fit (easily) onto a plastic wand, which sells as part of an introductory package. The wand is very well designed and the pads are easily popped off the wand with a flick of a lever. Your hands stay clean throughout the entire process.These pads clean far better than any brush can for they fit under the rim of the bowl, into the hollowed out area that often gets mildewy and that brushes never seem to get really clean. Yes, it's a bit more costly than a reusable brush, but it cleans better and you don't have to have an ugly toilet brush hanging around the corner of your bathroom. I just wrap the empty handle in a plastic bag and pop it in the cupboard under the bathroom sink where I store the refills. They make a yucky chore easy and practically pleasant.

This is absolutely the best dark chocolate confection ever! I am a chocoholic, specializing in dark chocolate for 70+ years, consuming them in every country imaginable. This small tin contains 2 layers of rich dark chocolate wedges, each of which contains just a dollop of soft caramel. The result is heavenly perfection - not too sweet, lovely contrasting textures of the firm chocolate and melting caramel, and is totally satisfying. And that is what perhaps sets this chocolate aside from all others - eating just one small wedge is totally satisfying. There is no craving to continue on. OK, maybe if you want to indulge, a second one might be in order, but you won't binge on this chocolate - you'll savor.The only caveat is the price. In a Trader Joe's store, the price is about $4 per tin.  Over $8 seems obscene. However, were I not to know the in-store price, I would have to say the quality of this chocolate is worth the outrageous price.
The trailer is so awful I cannot imagine (no I can imagine) exactly what the film is like. It's from 2006 and looks like something circa 1950.

Not only does this book contain all the Van Gogh self portraits, it does so in a good size and with excellent reproductions and text. I'm an artist, and when I want some inspiration I go to this book and just dwell on the brushstrokes. Should be in every artist's library!

Do not confuse these ultrathin pads with the Poise pantiliners. Yes, they look similar, and each has a #2 designation (that is, a second teardrop highlighted to show the absorbency) but these are about twice the thickness of the pantiliners, yet they are still very thin and comfortable. They are a bit costly, but I haven't found anything else on the market that is this thin and this absorbant. Highly recommended!

These liners are the best liners out there. The only reason I rate them 4 and not 5 stars is the ambiguous nature of their labeling. This is a #2 "pantiliner" - not to be confused with the Poise #2 "ultrathin pad". The latter is a bit thicker but still thin and comfortable, and is also available here on Amazon but at a considerably higher price. The other reason for the downgraded score is, as another reviewer has noted, the fact that Poise ships these in a box with the product name all over it. Talk about embarrassment... now the mailman and everyone else in the apartment bldg. know what's going on in my life!

I have allergies; oh do I have allergies! And now I've developed geographic tongue. As a result, everything stings - especially toothpaste. But not this one... it really is mild and gentle, but I still feel like my teeth and breath are clean after brushing with it. I'm happy to finally be done searching for the perfect toothpaste.

Arrowroot is a wonderful product for anyone on a gluten free diet. But it is also a good friend to all cooks who like silky sauces without the heaviness of flour, especially since it mixes easily into either hot or cold liquids. It also is a great friend to people with sensitive skin. I use it as a bath powder, for it is 100% pure, with no preservatives, botanicals, or chemicals, and it is silky smooth. This particular brand is a good price and quality, and comes in a convenient plastic canister. A terrific product!

This little guy will never replace a larger, better roller for calves or thighs, but it's handy to throw in a suitcase. Wish it were more ergonomically designed. The handle is awkward and it takes 2 hands to keep the roller moving along the trajectory you want. The roller part is very hard plastic, not rubbery as it seems to appear in the photo. It's usable, it's OK, but if this is going to be your primary roller, expect to pay at least $15-$25 for a good wooden one or a better, more flexible and ergonomic plastic one.

My favorite cologne is Ralph Lauren Romance Silver, but they stopped production on them and the only ones you can find are old production ones selling on Ebay for $125. I ordered this hoping they would have got the scent the same or somewhat similar, but thats not the case. It smells nothing like Romance Silver, and its nothing i will ever use. Looks like it just became a gift.....for someone i dont like. lolDont order this thinking or hoping it will be similar to Ralph Lauren.

This thing is great. I was mostly using it in the mornings that I woke up too early and wanted some more sleep. I am a stomach/side sleeper and this stayed on fine with me moving all around. It does require a little positioning when you move around though, but I expected that.I just wish they had a better strap. This one seems very fragile and I dont expect it to last long.But in comparison to my other flat eye covers, I like that this doesnt squish or press my eyes. I can even open them in there just fine.And I also tried it on a day my allergies were killing me. Was the only thing that relieved my sinus pressure in my face. Didnt expect it to work that well considering nothing has ever caused relief when I get a sinus headache (not even neti pots or asprin).I recommend

Jackets and shirts are somewhat hit or miss with me when it comes to sizes. I have a medium torse, but am tall and have long arms. So while a medium will fit me in the mid section, the sleeves are usually short. And a large will fit me sleeve wise, but im usually swimming in the torso area.I ordered both a medium and large to see which one fit best and luckily enough, they made the medium with longer arms. So the medium was a perfect fit. Large was way huge.Now....I love buffalo jeans. They are the only jeans I buy. I own some of their shirts too, but I mostly just love their jeans. I expected great quality with this jacket, which I will say, it is pretty sharp. The biggest problem I can get past with this jacket is the noise it makes. It sounds similar to people that cover their couches in plastic protectors. Its absolutely horrible. I even had a friend, for kicks, walk into the other room down the hallway with it and move their arms around and it was sooooo loud I could hear it from down the hall. Too funny.They should have put a decibel reading on the tag.Ive tried many other faux leather jackets and they are 100% quiet. But they were very loose material. This one is very stiff.I really wanted to love the jacket. Its great quality, looks freakin awesome (very motorcycle style jacket), but I have a hard time deciding if the sound it makes is more embarrassing or annoying. Not sure what they were thinking when they made it.

Quiksilver small/med size fitted hats always fit me perfect, and this one was no exception. Although, the colors seem slightly deeper than the picture. Very slightly, but enough for me to notice. I still like the hat a lot though and will keep it.

A little on the large size, but only slightly. I dont like hats too tight anyway. But less headroom above would have been ok. Not a deal breaker at all.From the pictures it looked a little more on the orange red side, but was really hoping it was just red, which it was. A very vibrant red. Exactly what I wanted.

I thought it would be true to the picture, but the blue doesnt seem to be exactly the same. It still looks like the same type of blue, but its more deeper than I expected. Thought it would be more lighter, brighter blue.

These racks are pretty decent, but not without issues.These are not attached, which was what I wanted. But there are issues with not having them attached. One is stability. You have to have these aligned pretty well to get the bar on properly. you dont want to lift heavy with having an awkward starting position. And also ,lifting super heavy will be questionable when reracking the weight. you want to be careful as to not alter the position of the racks, but lets face it, after doing a set of squats to exhaustion, you sometimes dont have the energy or stability to be careful enough to not push these racks out of place. Luckily, I mostly only use these for light in house workouts. I save the heavier lifting for the gym.Another reason I bought these is because I wanted to use the stoppers as a dip station. Although it works fine, the paterial they have on it hurts your hands. So I recommend cutting a PVC pipe to place around it to make it more comfortable.The biggest issue I have with these racks is the method they have for changing the height. The pin that goes in does not stay in too well because it is too short. It kept sliding out of the one side when I was in mid workouts. I ended up having to get a wire tie to strap it in place. Also, the stoppers are not a through and through pin. Its a screw. And you cant adjust the top height of the racks without unscrewing the stoppers, taking out the pin to adjust the height, replacing the pin and then replacing the stoppers with their screws. This is VERY annoying and takes a lot of time to do. I woudlnt recommend having a workout placing with switching back and forth between rack height if using the stoppers.Another notable mentions...if using a lighter bar be cautious. The distributed weight could be an issue. I had the bar go flipping across the room because I had a 25lb plate on the each side and took the one off. Unlike heavier / thicker bars, Ive never had this happen, but also a big deciding factor is how far apart the rack is spaced. Since these are free standing, this could be an issue. So Just keep this in mind.Also, the one stand I received was bent out of whack and I couldnt get the top bar in. I didnt feel like sending it back and waiting for another, so I just got a hammer and pounded it back into shape myself. Not really something Id expect to do considering the price, but whatever. It worked.I cant say that these are the best, but for the space I have and the ability to more easier move these from room too room, they will do.

These things are worlds better than the old school ones you have to fight with to get on.
