These slip on very easily and I can focus more on my sets.The only issue I had initially, was the padding on the one I received was too dense, making it hard to get on the bar. A few times of pushing and pulling it on and off and it slides on much easier. So if you have the same problem, it will clear up after a few uses.

These are thee most comfortable shoes I ever owned. They are very light and very breathable. They almost feel like I am wearing slippers, but offer good protection.They do feel a little tighter on the sides than i prefer, but I have wide feet and have this problem with most shoes.The style of these is also great.I will definitely buy more Merrell sneakers in the future when Im in the market again, based off this shoe.

These stands look great but are really pricey. I own Auralex montior pads and they work just as well and cost less.The biggest gripe I have with these stands, is they ship them in a box with a plastic bag around them. The bag gets stuck to the glue that is placed between the metal sheet and top pad. I thought maybe it was just an issue with the one I was sent, so I ordered another set. 4 total with the same issue. The bag gets stuck to the glue and you can get it all off. Looks ghetto. And for the price you pay, you shouldnt have to see that. Not sure wny they need it in a plastic bag. The box would have been sufficient.

I have this coming out of my LG smart TV since the only output they included on the TV was optical out. Annoying! But doing this was the easiest method to get whatever sound is playing on my TV transported to all my speakers.I have the outputted audio splitting to a Logitech Z5500 and to an RCA converter to my Yamaha amplifier which powers my ceiling speakers.I didnt notice any sound quality lose. Everything seems to sound amazing now that they are all working together.

I expected this tray to be much cheaper. But its actually pretty decent.I am using it with a 3M mount, which is not the best, but is getting the job done.By the way, I am using it in 75 x 75 because of the odd decision they went with to include 2 posts in the 100 position.Would have been better suited to leave those open for additional screws,That being said, I do not have that type of mount and it is still working just fine without it. Probably would be more secure is I had that special type of open hole mount, but I have a light macbook retina and it is holding it just fine with a normal mount.

Theres plenty of reviews, so Ill keep mine short. I initially bought a Soundlink mini 2 and it sounded decent, but was too bass prominent and was not loud enough. I thought this might be louder, and although it was, the overall sound was very flat and weak. I ended up going with the Soundtouch 20 and havent looked back since. Its not much bigger. I dont care for portable enough to sacrifice the night and day difference in sound quality between this and the 20. And the 30 is leagues above both, but way too monsterous. I sent this back and and overly pleased with my Soundtouch 20. :)

I went through a couple dish racks before I arrived at this one. I actually wasn’t expecting to like it at all, but it’s perfectly what I wanted. Not something big and clunky taking up too much counter space, and also wasn’t an eye sore to leave out when not being used. This fits both criteria.It’s also low profile too which is nice. And whereas other standard dish racks might be bigger overall, this one is slightly longer than standard, so it still holds just as much.The only grips I have which aren’t deal breakers are:Odd enough, there are no rubberized feet under the water tray, but there are rubberized feet under the frame. Why they did this is strange because the steel frame fits perfectly in the water tray and there isn’t any room for it to move around anyway. Possibly just to keep the frame from sitting in water I guess. Anyway, this makes the whole rack slide all over the counter. I had to buy some stick on rubberize feet to stick on the bottom of the water tray. Now it stays put.The utensil tray is not attached to the base. This makes it topple over easy when too much is in there. I used small clear wire ties from Walmart to grip it to the frame. Now this also stays put.The water tray needs to be emptied. But I already knew this before I bought. Still would have been nice if it had some sort of self-emptying, as I am always spilling the water all over the place when trying to empty. Doh!Overall, still a great dish rack for a single dude that’s too lazy to fix his broken dish washer. Maybe for 2. Def not for more.

Im using this with my Husky Silent Flow air compressor.I like how the nozzle attached to my tire. It doesn't have to be forcefully pushed on and pulled off like some other compressors Ive owned. The one even ripped the pin right out of my tire and I was stranded. This one is easy. Push the handle down, push the nozzle on the tire and then release the nozzle. Just make sure you push firmly on the tire until you dont hear any air coming out. Otherwise it isnt sealed properly.The only complaint I have is the gauge is not accurate. I have a Slime digital tire gauge reader which is much more accurate. I used it in conjunction with this inflator. Its ok to use the gauge on this inflator to get a general idea where you are at, but get a digital reader if you want to fill more accurately.Also, incase anyone was wondering, I had my compressor set to roughly around 60-70psi when I was filling.

This thing is pretty cool. I redid my kitchen and initially was going to do a white paper bag type flooring, but white is not a great color to try and do a paper flooring with because you cant see any variations as you do with a colored paper, and because the white paper becomes see through once the water and glue is added which makes seeing whatever is underneath (including the other pieces of white paper overlapping which looks like complete poo).That being said, I decided to paint the entire floor white. But that just looked to plain and blah. So I then added faux grout lines using paint pens to simulate a white tile look. But it wasn't even the slightest convincing of being real tile because of the lighting and shading you would see on real tile wasn't there.That being said, I decided to give this thing a try. I repaint over some of the fake tile lines to make them into bigger slats / planks, and then used a variation of a lighter grey paint (very close to off white) with random streaks of a slightly darker grey (to give diversity across the faux planks) and I got to say...it turned out pretty amazing. I was actually surprised.A few things to mention:Since I was painting and graining in planks (one to 2 at a time) I decided not to even use a glaze. I hate mixing glaze and I found it to be very messy and increased the ultimate drying time (not just the 'working' time) substantially when I last used it on my walls. It wasn't necessary since I was painting and rolling in a short amount of time. Saved money and mess by not using it.The rolling action on these isnt the best. I feel like the roller itself is too stiff. I think it would have been easier and more effective if the lines were much more plyable and rubbery tectured. I found myself pulling too much paint off a lot of times and having to repaint and re-roll. My technique developed and it happened less as I went, but it was still happening because it was stiff. Not a huge problem, but made the project take slightly longer.I didnt use the triangle piece at all. I used a straw broom instead. Seemed less manufactured than the tool they provided.The small roller was nice, however, if I started from the one end it would just completely scrap all of the paint off. So I only used it starting at the other end (the rounded parts being at the top). Hard to describe, but you will see what I mean if you get it and try.The handle and roller and be flipped so you can start at different ends. I don't think this was described on the instructions. I just figured it out on my own by mistake, but I didn't flip it back and forth even once I did figure it out. Prob would have made even more variation if I did, but I didn't feel I needed too.A lot of people practice before they start. I don't have patience and just jumped right in. Took me a plank or 2 to get into the groove and I only had to go back and fix the first plank slightly since then. So it wasn't the end of the world to get used too for me. So I wouldn't get overwhelmed about having to practice first, but it would definitely help if you happen to have patience.and lastly, I did this on a vinyl flooring with texture and grooves in it. So it made it very difficult to even get a good action with the roller. This thing is definitely gonna give great results using it on a smoother surface. But it still turned out great in spite of this issue. Wood grain in reality is very diverse. So even messing uo (which I did often) still seems to look natural. What I noticed more than anything is that its more about the combination of paints / colors and layers which can make or break it. I first went too dark of a grey over the white and it looked very fake. starting over with a very light grey with only darker random streaks of grey made it look more realistic.In the end, I think it looks unbelievably like realistic, faux wood panels. And I have to be honest, I really wasnt trying hard as I have tried so many different things already to make the floor look decent and I was at the point I just wanted it done and over with. I know if i really took my time and put a little more effort into painting the wood grain on I could have made it look 10x better. That being said, I wouldn't confuse my floor with real wood. But those fake laminate wood grain panels...sure.I seen a video with a guy using a full on round roller with his hands. I think that would have worked much better then this quarter round grain on a stick method and I would have preferred the one he was using. But like I said, it still turned out great.I will post some before and after pictures when I get a chance.

The case I received wasnt exactly as pictures, but it was close enough. It didnt have the brand name on the back and was slightly different colored, but it still looked good.Definitely wasnt otter box quality, but what do you expect at this price?The rubberized sides kept pulling out of place a little and the overlapping touch screen was annoying so II ended up sending it back.Also, I had a tempered glass screen protector on my phone and it still fit and didnt cause any issues.TouchID seemed to  work ok as well, but not as good as without a case covering it.Visibility is not as great with the extra screen protection on.Unless you expect to get it splashed or wet, Id prob get a separate screen protector on the phone and then cut theirs off.The ports were to small for a charger such as an Amazon lightning cable (which I own).Adds a decent amount of bulk to the overall phone, but im sure your phone will be very protected in this if you decide to go with this case.hope this helps.

I wanted some cheapie clocks to add in my kitchen as some sort of 'world clocks' set up. So i needed a few and didnt want to spend too much on doing it. This 2 pack was perfect, and priced better than buying individually.The only thing I can mention now owning more than one is that some were noisy and some were not. In the end, I couldnt deal with the second hand sound of 3 clocks ticking all at different times, so I just opened the lid and pulled the red second hand off. I can still slightly hear them, but not nearly as annoying when the second hand is on. Sucks because I liked the look of the red second hand, but I hate the sound of ticking clocks more than i can for looks.If you need some cheapy clocks, these were the cheapest Ive seen.Also, I assumed they were 'white' based off the picture but in fact, they are clear. This means you will see the wall color through the rim of the clock. Might not bother most, but I ended up spraying mine silver.I recommend.

I previously owned a pair of Sennheiser BT-130's which had built in Apt-x. For me to take advantage of the improvements I needed an adapter, so I decided to go with this one. Albiet it was a bit pricey whenI bought it ($50), it was a night an day difference in sound quality when pair with the device and the headphones I had at the time.Now, several years later, I own an iPhone 6 and a pair of Sounpeats QY7's which sound amazing! I couldnt wait to try it out figuring if they sounded amazing without even using apt-x, how much better they would sound using this adapter. However, nope to the nope to the nope nope nope. It actually made the sound quality awful when compared to not using it. I'm assuming this is because you throwing an analog connection into the mix instead of pure digital to digital connection. Also the fact that technology is much better and crisp with bluetooth 4.0 nowadays and software enhancements.Also, the wire is very flimsy. I do have any issues with it at the moment, but Id assume it would rip off very easily. And why they decided to go with a non standard USB charging cable is beyond annoying.I cannot recommend this adapter for apt-x / sound improvement purposes. But one thing it is good at is turning an non bluetooth device into a bluetooth device. But definitely not worth paying $50 to do as there are other non apt-x solutions that are much cheaper.

Oddly enough I primarily bought this for a reason you probably wont see listed in any other review. I use it when I am mowing the lawn because I am allergic to grass and no matter how much I try and cover my face with a face mask or my shirt, I feel like I want to die by the time Im through.So I figured I would give this a try, wetting it and wrapping it around my face, hoping that it would also keep me cooled when cutting my lawn in the summer heat. Although it did filter out the shredded grass and pollen from entering my nose and mouth, I cant claim that it stayed cool for very long. At least it didnt feel like it did. I also used it biking and walking out in the sun. It seems to stay cool for a while but not as long as they make it sound.For the grass, it works ok (its hard to keep it wrapped around my face). But primarily for staying cool, I dont know how effective I can consider it to be. Lets just say if I was heading out to the beach, and I forgot this in the house, I dont expect I would be running back inside to grab it.Also, you will probably want to wet and activate the towel outside as it gets messy when you have to violently trash this thing around to get it cooled. Definitely not made to be done indoors.

I wanted to add this to my white and grey themed kitchen.The pictures shown make this stones look monochrome, but in person, they are much more brown looking.Also, the print itself looks very pixelated and unrealistic because of this. Especially when up close.Im sure this would work for most, but considering what I listed above, it did not work for me.

I ordered this light on sale. Ive been searching for a while for a light to hang up under my sink because it is dark.This light seems to light up pretty well, but I ended up using electrical powered lights under my sink, so I decided to use this in my mudroom instead, so I didnt have to always turn the light on for a quick late night snack (where my refrigerator is).3 problems...I wish they didnt make the edges rounded. It really serves no purpose. Why is this a problem....well, I could have just had it sit on top of my fridge on its side. But it wont stay up because the edges are rounded. This causes it to fall right over.which brings me to issue 2...I tried just placing it on a flat surface aiming up. While it does light up the room decently, the light itself is very blinding if you happen to look at it, which made it unavoidable being placed on a table aiming up.Final solution (or so I though) was to give in and use the provided mounting velcro against the wall above my door. Shoot...I figure if this was meant to be hung under a cabinet it should hold better than against a wall....WRONG! The provided velcro and mounting bracket are not strong enough to hold this light. And the bracket itself shouldnt even be called a bracket. It barely grips the light. The groves are not deep enough and it does not snap securely into place. That being said, the brack and velcro both came off within seconds, the unit fell to the ground and the very cheaply made battery door broke. And since they decided to place the battery connector directly on the battery door, this unit no longer works. It will work if you hold the battery door against the batteries, but the door wont stay on itself any longer.The light seems to work pretty well for wat it is. But the bad and cheap design choices they made ruin the light.I like the idea of having a light in my mudroom now, so I will get another one.....but not this brand.

I bought these to utilize with a few pairs of headphones I own.The quality of the tips themself seems good, however, they dont fit my hadphones.Be advised, the inner core of there tips are not very plyable. There is no give to them. Id imagine they would make for a solid, tight fit for any headphones they do fit, but im sure if they used other material inside that was more form fitting and loose it would have worked just the same and fit a much wider variety of earbuds.Dont know why they went this route, but I cant even used them, so I am returning them.BTW...I own many ear buds, but was more specifically planning to use these with my Soundpeats QY7 and Motorola S11's.(They dont fit my Philips Active type headphones either).

I cant really give a full on review of this thing because...well....my power hardly ever goes out. In the 9 years I’ve lived in my house it only went out a handful of times but usually never more than a few minutes (except for hurricane Sandy which lasted 2 days).That being said, today my power went out. My iMac was on running parallels (windows 7) and it was in the middle of doing a Windows update (during the shutdown procedure). The power was out and the APC was still keeping my system running. Then a few minutes later, the power came back one, and for some reason, the APC cycled its power causing it to cut the power supply to my iMac…in the middle of the update!Also, for some reason (not sure if this was directly related to the APC), but when it was feeding power to my iMac, nothing was working (my peripherals…aka keyboard and mouse). It was almost as if it locked up my system. So I couldn’t even force the iMac to end the update and shut down which I was trying to do right before the power came back on.I am very disappointed with this. I might as well not even own the damn thing if this is the way it is going to operate. I bought it specifically to avoid this situation, because the last time this happened (my power went out which I was running windows in parallels) and it completely corrupted my Fusion Drive (fusion drives do not play well with partitions. Keep this in mind if you own a mac and are utilizing boot camp…especially through parallels). I had to completely wipe my drive and reinstall MAC OS and Windows from scratch because the newer iMacs only have USB 3 and Windows 7 doesn’t recognize USB devices during boot. Which means you have absolutely no way to restore windows from the boot menu via a USB flash drive or USB DVD drive (because they are connected to USB 3.Anyway…I was leaving for work when this happened, so I did not have time to restart it and check that it didn’t corrupt my drive again. I really hope it did not because that took me over a month to research how to fix it with the help of Apple.Also, something I did not know until I bought it, but you have to change the battery every 5 years which cost about $50 for a replacement. Plus disposal of your current one.You also have to connect the battery yourself inside the unit as it is shipped with it disconnected. Wasn't hard to do, but its not something that's advertised. It is also very heavy. I owned a smaller one in the past so I was not expected this as well.Other than that, the thing integrates awesome with Mac. No software to install. Just plug it in and it automatically shows up in the settings.But what’s the point if it doesn’t work as expected.

I owned another brand of a similar type product that only came with 3. I loved it, however, the remote was cheaply made and I had to constantly bang it to get it to work.So I was overdue to get a new one and I didn’t want to get the same brand in fear the same issue would happen again.So I decided to go with this one when it was on sale for $20 (It goes on sale pretty often).I really love the fact that they have separate on and off buttons. My other one did not which mean you had to be in the same room to ensure it was actually turning on or off (especially considering the buttons on the remote did not work properly).The only flaws I can mention is:They are not numbered. I had to go through one at a time to figure out which button number went to which outlet, and then number it with a marker. I wish they had them pre numbered, or even better yet, color coded.andThe battery. This is the same type of battery my other unit used as well. Not sure why they don’t just opt for the more standard AAA batteries. I prefer using rechargeable instead of disposable. Plus I will never have these weird batteries just laying around.Other than that, 5 outlets and 2 remotes for 20 bucks! That’s a great deal for this product.Also, the range is pretty decent.I recommend.

I have quite a number of small screw drivers. But I can never carry them around bc they dont have caps and they always poke or stab me.Queue, the Stanley version.You take wach end cap off the enclosure and pop the bits in and then put the caps back over top.Not sure why so many others dont offer this as well. This is the only one Ive found that did.I definitely wouldnt expect to do anything major with this, but its pretty handy for smaller jobs (battery compartments, outlet covers, etc.)The overall size is that of a pen.I recommend this product.

A little pricey, but I like not having paper towels on my counter anymore.I was worried it was going to knock into my trash can ( I keep a smaller sized trash can under my sink and this is where I wanted to hang the paper towels. But it fits perfectly, even with a pretty large sized roll of paper towels.The only problem I have with it is that it sometime moves back and forth when I am trying to get the paper towels off the roll. This is pretty annoying. I have a cabinet that fits it snuggly too.  So I might have to fashion something that will hold it in place better.

I initially ordered a Medium ,but the company sent me large by mistake. They were very helpful and sent out another one, but again...they sent a large. In the end they winded up reimbursing me and told me to keep both larges or they would try and send another Medium.I just decided to keep the Larges even though they don't fit well (too big).I do like the style of the shirt though and would love it if it fit right. The company was mega awesome. I highly recommend them!As for the shirt... I might try and wash and dry them a few times. Maybe they will shrink. Ill update when I do.

The fit is very form fitting and fits nicely out of the package (medium size shirt, and I am 6’1” athletic build).I have yet to actually wear it out so I have not washed it yet. I expect, considering its fit, it will probably not fit too well if it were to shrink anymore, so hopefully that does not happen.One thing to mention is the coloring does not seem to be true to the picture. It is much darker themed that is shown. The blue part looks more deep gray-blue than it does blue.That being said, I still like it, but would have preferred more of a blue coloring.

I was initially going to order the smaller brother (the UCO Clarus) until i seem this one which lasts more than 2 times the amount the smaller one does. But seeing the Clarus first, I assumed the power button was also on the bottom for this light. That is not the case, and I gotta say, where they decided to place the button is annoying.Most of the time when I use this light, I want to use it in flashlight mode. But either way, I have to extend the top part in order to get to the power button. This was a very annoying design choice and my biggest gripe with this light.Also, the light seems to be very focused and overpowering. Yes…it lights the room up well, but I have to put it in a spot where it is not remotely anywhere in my line of vision or else it is overpowering and painful. Even in flashlight mode I get this effect. I was checking a pipe down my basement to see if it was trickle leaking, but the light is so bright that it makes it very hard to see what you’re aiming it on. Think of a picture that is over exposed and that’s the effect you get with this light.It does have a dimmer feature which is nice. But even that I am disappointed in. I sometimes prefer a light for late night bathroom trips instead of turning the bright home overhead lights on. It would have been nice if they included the feature that it ‘resumes’ to the last brightness you had the light set too. The power button automatically brings it back up to 100% no matter what you had it set to when you turned it off. This means for late night bathroom trips, you are going to be blinded before you hold the button down to dim the light.Overall, I would say this is a great emergency light if your power happens to go out considering it has very long battery life and it does lite up an entire room pretty decently. For normal flashlight and everyday use…you might want to look elsewhere.

I bought this Airfloss after first checking out the other electronic flossing devices (water based ones), and decided this one seemed to fit my needs best considering there isnt much involved to get this thing going (no connecting to water lines or filling tanks with water).I also bought this because regular flossing can be a pain sometimes, and even more so because someone mentioned that they felt like 'they just walked out the dentist office after a cleaning' after using this.That being said, I can tell you this thing definitely does not feel as refreshing as when I walk out of my dentist office. Maybe my dentist office is just THAT good. Honestly, my teeth feel more refreshed after using regular floss to be honest.Still, this thing does seem to work and it blasts some mouth wash between your teeth, so that is nice.Overall, I expected more. But I only paid 30 (made an offer on ebay and had some ebay bucks) and it is much faster than regular flossing so I wont complain too much.Things to mention are:This thing can get pretty messy. It blasts a good bit of mouthwash or water into your mouth. I had to keep spitting it out. There is a mode that you can hold the button down and it will spray every second so that you can keep going and do your entire mouth in one shot. I dont think that would be possible unless your swallowing the mouth wash. ha.Upon initial set up, I 'thought I had the attachment fully on. But it wasnt and when I pressed the air shot button it flung it across the room. Made sure you press down hard and hear it snap before using.Also, be careful. There are 3 modes when you turn this thing on. It will either shoot 1 air shot, 2 or 3 depending what you set it too. My first time using it, it 'hiccuped' and shot one, paused, then shot the other 2, and then when i pulled it away from my mouth it shot the 3rd shot.....almost into my eyes. (thank you big nose for the save)You have to take the head off after each use and flush it with water. It doesnt say you have to let it dry out before putting it back on, but I would think it best to do so so no water is left lingering in there building up some fungal funk. That being said, I wish the base had something you could place the attachment on while it dries out.And last but not least, I wish they used some sort of rubber for the part you place against your gum. The plastic is very flimsy and is already misshapped and cracking after 2 uses. Overall, the shap of this part I am referring to is not shaped very well for being meant to be positioned between your teeth on your gumline. And if you dont press it against this area the air will not floss properly.Overall, I still like it and recommend it. But in the end, I still think regular flossing is better and will be needed for some inbetween cleaning session in conjunction with this.

So...I bought this bag a while back, and I'll admit I was one of those dumb people that didn't read 'everything you are getting and not getting' before buying (damn you lightning deals). That being said, I assumed the sand was already in these bags as they would be for most other weighted things you would buy like leg weights, arm weights, etc. Sadly, it is not. So now after months of not using this the weather is finally breaking and its starting to finally get nice out. Nice enough for a day trip to the beach for some free sand MWWAAHAHAHAHAH!!! (sorry, evil scheme is finished).Besides, who's to say when I am exactly filling these bags with 10lbs of sand? Do I need to bring a scale with me to the beach. (I can hear all the chicks running away from it and screaming now).But I figured, let me just check online and see what peoples thought were on filling this with sand on their own, because it looks like it could get messy (sand stuck in the velcro messy). So on Amazon reviews I went and YUP. Tons of people complaining about the sand coming out of the bags. But I knew Amazon reviews wouldn't let me down. Let's keep looking and see what other creative people tried putting in their bags. And dont you know it....there were some pretty great suggestions. Here were a few I found...1) Aquarium sand - It is thicker and wont leak out of the bags! Eureka! Problem....darn its expensive. $10+ for a 5lb bag. That ideas out.2) Landscaping gravel / rocks - Better priced, but the idea of putting something this solid in a bag I will be swinging around with the possibility of dropping on my foot....meh. Might also damage the bag quicker. But still a pretty decent option as you dont have to worry about leaking.3) Rice - This seemingly was the most awesome option I came across. If theres ever an apocalypse, not only can I use the bag to work out. I can eat the bag when Im done! Plus you can buy them in 10lb bags and slide the bag right into the SKLZ bag, leaving it intact ready to consume later. Still though....your talking about $10 per bag bringing the price you paid for this workout bag much higher (but like I said, at least you can consume this at some point. You're not going to consume aquarium sand....unless you're into that kinda thing).When all was said and done....my option in the end was......drum roll please....rat tat tat tat tatttttt....NONE OF THE ABOVE! (You thought it was the rice, dont lie)Just so happens, I have a TKO 20lb weight vest, and 2 10lb leg weights all filled with sand fillers. I rarely use them and they have just been sitting on my in house gym floor like an dust attracting eye sore. They fit perfectly into the bag, no crazy stuffing like other people mention with their 10lb SKLZ bags are filled. And best of all....no more eye sore!Lets face it. You're either going with the free messy option of sand, or going to spend some more on products you cant use in the future to fill the bags with (unless its rice. Emmm), or you can spend about the same (or slightly more...or less depending on what your thinking of filling the bags with) on some other weights you can use for various exercises. Just think of the SKLZ bag as a storage bag for those items.You could get 2 5lb leg weights, 2 5lb arm weights, and a 20lb vest. Or just get a 40lb vest and call it a day.This bag is pretty awesome and I plan to use it a lot now that its finally filled.

I own this bulb and the E27 10W LED RGB Magic Lamp Light Bulb Color Changing Spotlight + Remote Control. I actually prefer the E27 10W LED RGB Magic Lamp Light Bulb Color Changing Spotlight + Remote Control because its SMOOTH mode is much more smooth (slower).This one is too fast for my liking.The remotes work for both bulbs which is nice. But this bulb is not as responsive as the other one I own.Still, this is an awesome bulb that I am using in an accent light in my living room.The only thing I wish is they both dimmed more than their lowest setting. Dim to the lowest setting is still too bright in my opinion.I might try and add a Lutron LED dimmer to the mix to tam these bad boys down.I posted a picture of the lights so you can see how bright they are.The setting was set to SMOOTH, which means, they are at full brightness in the pictures (because you can not DIM the lights when you set it to a color changing mode. You can only DIM when it is set to a constant color.)Also, be aware....if you own any other LED lights like I do (strip lights behind my TV), the remote might alter any other type of LED lights as well. But not in a desirable way. If I press DIM on the remote for this bulb it will change my TV lights to FLASH MODE. Or FADE will change my TV lights to Blue. Its really annoying. Best bet is to set the light to the color or mode you want whilst the other LED lights you might have are turned off. Then turn them on after you change the settings.Hope this helps.

I agree with the other reviews. This is a very nice, stylish wallet. I always seem to wind up loving Fossil wallets. Ive owned many other name brand wallets, and the Fossil one always seem to last the longest, and are equally stylish and practical.The only complain (if I strained hard to point one out) would be that the ID window frame could have been larger to show the entire ID. The framing of it covers some of the edges of the ID. Its also very tight and not as smooth to remove and replace the ID in this window if needed. But not a deal breaker.This wallet was sold out everywhere a few days ago when I was looking. The only one I seen was on Ebay for $50 and I almost bought it....almost. But I couldn't justify spending $50 on a wallet. Luckily Amazon somehow got another one in stock for $25. So I snatched it up.I highly recommend this wallet, or any Fossil wallet for that matter.****UPDATED 2 months later:I still like this wallet, however, the ID window I mentioned earlier being small / tight...well, after owning this wallet for 2 months and not taking my ID out excessively (only when someone needs to see it like at an airport, etc) has caused the seems on the top of this compartment to rip. This being said, it wasnt stitched very well on top part of the ID window. I expect now that it has separated it will only get worse. And they didnt overlap the material on this part either which is why I am assuming it came apart so easily and will also make it difficult to fix.I am still going to use it, but I am a little disappointed. Every wallet I've owned (most of them Fossil) I've owned for years before they started coming apart if at all. This one I only owned for a short time and barely use the ID compartment and it ripped.Im definitely glad I did not pay $50 for this wallet. And if I knew this was a possibility I would have went with a different wallet.I removed one star for this updated review.

Mixed bag of reviews here. Gotta say...some look fake (the good ones. lol)While I seen all the bad reviews about it breaking and being cheap, I decided to give it a try since it was only 2 bucks.I can attest that this bracelet is cheap and I do not expect it to last. That being said, I think I will use a little pre-emptive super glue to keep it from breaking where others have mentioned.The tightening design is annoying and also not portrayed in the picture. Its 2 thin strings with a knot, and you pull to loosen / tighten. Unless you have wrist the size of your biceps, you will have to pull the strings close together, meaning these 2 strings used to tighten the bracelet will be flapping all around. I just twist them up in the mess of other strings so I dont have these 2 long strings hanging down. A clasp of some sort would have been better. Who knows...I might even go to Michaels and get some to install on here.Not the best bracelet choice. I dont expect it to last. But it was cheap, I didnt expect much to begin with, and once its on, it doesn't look to shabby.

Its a lot deeper, darker than the picture shows. Also feels pretty cheap. like it should be worth $5 cheap.I cant say it was really worth the $11, but I bought it as a joke for a friend and got a pretty good laugh about it. So in that respect it was worth it. (inside, had to be there kinda joke)But for $11, if I was seriously buying, I would at least expect a nice box for it to come in. Not a cheap ziplock.The pin itself was a pain to use as well. Especially once you have it on the s*** because you have the twist the clamp to hold it.Also, it comes with a chain incase you want to wear it as a necklace.

Im weird when it comes to cologne. I like how a lot of them smell, but I dont like them when they are sprayed on me. So its rare I find one I can tolerate on me. This is definitely one of them.It smells great! The only problem is as others have mentioned. By far, this colonge wears off FAST! The fastest colonge I ever encountered. It almost seems like its gone after an hour or 2.Im guessing thats why the price is fairly low on this. Because you have to keep spraying it on all day.I wish they made a stronger version and charged more (aka, parfume). I would be willing to pay more to not have to keep re-upping.Hope this helps

I was really taking a chance on this light, as I have an accent light with a large shade around it that lights up via a regular bulb (which shines light through every part of the bulb). This bulb, however, seems to only shine light through the top, which I thought might leave the bottom half of the shade unlit, ruining the style of this floor lamp I own. This is not the case though. Even though there is only light being emitted from the top of the bulb, it seems to have a pretty wide spread. Enough that it is even lighting the bottom of the shade. Not as great as a regular bulb, but worlds better than I expected, and good enough to look freaking amazing! The IR also seems to be very strong, as another thing I was worried about was being able to work the remote even though this bulb was deep in the light behind the shades. But the IR was still being transmitted from across the room, through the shades!!! This made this light a 5 star product for me.I originally had a Lutron lamp dimmer on this light because I had no way to dim it. I never disconnected it when I first tried this bulb and it made a weird buzzing sound when I had it set to the white color. Removing the Lutron dimmer removed the buzz noise. But its not needed anyway because I can not dim the light from the remote.This light is great! I think it is very bright. The colors are very vibrant. The white is pretty bright as well. I think I might order more for around the house since they are better on energy, have a remote, and look amazing. Not to mention LED has longer bulb life than regular bulbs.The only thing I am kicking myself about is not order another one when they had one offered through prime. After I got this and was certain it worked for my needs all the Prime ones were gone, and the only ones left are from China or Hong Kong. Major bummer, as I hate ordering items from there. They take way too long, and I’ve had instances where I haven’t gotten my items at all.I need 2 because my lamp requires 2. One to shine up and one to shine down. But I didnt want to order 2 incase it didnt light up the bottom half of the shade like I described earlier. That being said, I ordered a very similar looking light, but a different brand. I am hoping the same remote will work for both. I dont want to have to use 2 remotes to turn the lamp on. I will report back when I get the second if it works with one remote and list the brand, because they had more of those bulbs shipped from Amazon.***UPDATED 04/03/15As promised, I am updating my review with the use of the secondary bulb I bought (different brand).Although the remotes for both of the different brand bulbs do work for both, they do differ in their modes and response, this one being better in my opinion. The Smooth Fade option on this bulb is much slower and pleasing.Not a total offset. Its just that the other bulb (Elover E27 10W Colorful Remote Control Adjustable RGB LED Light Bulb Lamp) fades faster than this one. And considering the accent light I put these in require 2 bulbs, the colors are constantly on different colors when fading because of the timing difference. Still looks cool though. But Id sometimes prefer them to be fading on the same color at the same time.ALSO...another annoyance for anyone that owns any other types of LED lights (like the strip lights), the remote might do whacky things with those. For me, I have strip lights behind my TV and the remote commands from this remote alter the strip lights. But they are erratic. For instance, if I was to press the DIM button, it will make my TV lights go to FLASH mode. Or if I press FADE on the remote it will make my strip lights turn to BLUE. This is very annoying. If you have any other LED lights in the room, it might be best to set them both to the mode or color you want them on before turning the other set on and vice versa. If they are both on and you start trying to change settings and colors it will get annoying.I posted some pictures of the lights to better show what I have described.

The description on this set is lacking. But I still took a chance because it looks like it would match my current duvet. Although, it does match it nicely, there are a lot of things I did not expect when looking of the misleading picture and description.For one, it doesnt list the thread count. I still dont know what it is as the packaging didnt even list that it was a Queen size set (which I ordered). The description on the packaging itself is lacking. But I can tell you that it doesnt feel like a high thread count. The sheets are just 'ok' when it comes to comfort.2nd thing to keep in mind, is the picture they have shown for this SHEET SET, is not what you are getting. The picture they have posted is for the DUVET SET, which they also sell, but you have to find the correct listing for it.Subtract the duvet, the white style pillow cases and the larger pillows/cases in the back and you are left with a fitted sheet, regular sheet and 2 blue styled queen sized pillow cases (with large buttons on them to hold the pillow in. Some will not like this). I really wanted white styled pillow cases since I already have blue ones that came with my other Duvet set I am using. So this was a bummer.Also, if you notice the fitted sheet on the bed in the picture, you will see that the lines are running vertical. This is not the case. The regular sheet and fitted sheet have horizontal running lines, with the regular sheet have blue themes vertical lines at the top (as shown in the picture).This all being said, it did look nice, didnt cost too much, and I didnt feel like sending them back and ordering something else that I could possibly wind up having the same or different issues with. So I just kept them.I hope this review better describes what you are getting.

I liked the look of this wallet when I first seen it online. Although it does look as is displayed in the picture, the quality wasnt as I expected.Most wallets (when new) are very tight. Even to the point of not being to fit your cards in sometimes. This one feels the opposite. It feels like a wallet you owned for years already. Its very loose in all of the pockets. Most notably, the cash area. Something you cant really tell from the pictures is it is only stitched on 2 ends. The other 2 ends are open. So it sort of opens like a folder slot. I am not a big fan of these types of wallets. They just dont seem secure too me when it comes to storing cash. Especially with this one because it is very loose.Also, it is slightly bigger width wise than Id prefer (aka, wider than a credit card).The only selling point for this would be the RFID feature. But I cannot comment on if that works or not. Im more going towards carrying less cards these days anyway with Apple Pay being accepted more places I go to now.That being said, this wallet just wasnt for me, so I sent it back.

These magnets are awesome. I have several purposes I am using them for. They are very powerful and get the job done. And unlike the thinner 1/16" magnets I ordered and snapped into pieces because they are so thin / fragile, these ones are just the right size for this to not happen.Word of advice though. They ship magnetized together. They are hard to get apart. Best option is to slide them apart. Dont try and pull them apart. You will lose.***UPDATED!Well...I was wrong. These magnets are definitely stronger, however, they also are susceptable to breaking as are every other magnet I have tried so far (- 1 star). The trick is to making sure you dont allow the magnets to be in close range enough to SLAM into each other. Otherwise, they will snap into a tonf of pieces pretty easily. And you though just getting 2 magnets apart is hard...try getting a magnet with a ton of tiny little sharp shattered pieces apart. Eshk!

This chain looks awesome. However, I cannot say it is true to the color shown in the description picture. Hence why I added my own picture so you can see the true colors.I have a very black and silver themed area in my office I thought this would go perfect in. However, the coloring of the chain is more a dull grey and completely covered in a dirt, rust color (the part that is displayed more as black in the photo). Also, this rust or dirt or whatever it is supposed to represent covers more surface area than what is shown. Hardly any grey area shows through on the one I received.If I had to guess, it almost seems like they changed the photo to a greyscale image before posting it. All the deep color parts are very brown.I was a little disappointed because the coloring didnt exactly go with the theme, but they are pretty darn awesome looking in general, so I will just deal with it.

Ill admit, this thing is pretty cool. But I bought this with intentions of lighting up a red themed area in my office. I thought this would be perfect, but I was wrong. The light is barely visible. Especially if it is not shined on anything white. And even still, the red color specifically is very dark in nature. Any ambient light present within a room and you will not see this light, no matter what color it is set too. Its just not that powerful.However, place it in a dark room aimed one a white ceiling and your set.The water effect is gif animation like in natural. There is no variety to the water effects. It could have probably been achieved, but they decided to go with a set motion. So although it does have a water like appearance, the realism is lost with the repeat 2 second motion.Still....this is pretty neat for the cost.But some things I do not like are that you have to cycle through to power off. And I find myself having to look down where the buttons are to find which one to press repeatedly, causing me to be blinded by the LEDs. A remote, or colored buttons instead of white would have made this easier. Or better yet....a dedicated off switch.I do not like that it has a permanent 1 hour shut off feature. If I want to leave on indefinitely for a party or something, I will have to keep turning back on every hour. Annoying.The instructions are lacking. The descriptions on the box are more warnings about batteries themselves. Which it doesn’t even include. And they aren’t written in plain English. You can tell its foreign attempt at English. Still...entertaining to read.And the sound / speaker is just ok. Its a little louder than my iPhone itself, but the problem is, you cannot set the volume to max because it starts affecting the light. You will see it flickering depending on how loud the volume is and what you are playing. You have to lower it to a volume that matches that of the iPhone itself. So its kind of pointless. Especially if you are on battery power.All in all, if you want some cool ceiling effects to fall asleep to, then you might really like this. Although...probably not the best option for sleeping if you want to reach REM.

I would only recommend these magnets for very specific needs. And even still, I wouldnt trust them much as they are very fragile and break very easily.I had 2 sitting not far from each other. They magnetized to each other and snapped into tons of pieces.They are just too small and thin. I got the thicker, larger sized ones and they are more solid. Dont expect them to be snapping anytime soon.

THESE MAGNETS ARE HELLA STRONG! I can barely get them apart when they snap together.I already owned many different sizes and shapes of these rare earth magnets. These are the largest I’ve owned so far and are definitely harder to get apart because they are super strong. This is why they use the plastic separators.I honestly like the circular magnets better. They seem easier to work with and are easier for me to get apart. The box shaped ones always magnetize together too easily.Anyway, for my purposes, these are a little too strong. I will still use them, but my needs require using 2 magnets in close proximity to each other and because these are so strong they keep clasping together. I have this happen with smaller ones as well, but not nearly as bad and they are easier to get apart.But anything too much smaller and you run the risk of them being fragile. I previously bought the thinner and smaller ones. Those break very easily. These however, are pretty solid. I’m not saying they won’t break as well (depending on the force), but you would have a much harder time of having this happen.Id say these are some really awesome magnets, and I highly recommend if you dont plan on using more than one that are in close proximity to each other.***UPDATED!Well...I was wrong. These magnets are definitely stronger, however, they also are susceptable to breaking as are every other magnet I have tried so far. The trick is to making sure you dont allow the magnets to be in close range enough to SLAM into each other. Otherwise, they will snap into a tonf of pieces pretty easily. And you though just getting 2 magnets apart is hard...try getting a magnet with a ton of tiny little sharp shattered pieces apart. Eshk!

Anywhere you see these pants online, they have amazing reviews (Dicks & Nike). I believe they are truly great compression pants that are ruined by a major flaw that I am surprised everyone is failing to mention.I am 6'1", 185lbs, athletic build. I ordered the Medium after reading someone else's review of the same body type and the pants themselves fit perfect. The compression feels proportionate throughout the pant.The main problem with these pants that I can understand why Nike did this is the head, ankle part. The opening for the heel is SO SMALL. And there is a very tight fitted seem around the opening which causes the pants to DIG into your Achilles tendon. Its actually beyond uncomfortable to the point of being painful. As the pants are, you really need to pull them up to get the compression distributed properly to the correct parts of your legs, but doing so makes this seem dig even deeper into your tendon.I have gone all night wearing them (the best time to wear them, when you are sleeping and you body is healing) but its so uncomfortable that it wakes me up. And thats saying a lot because I dont wake up for nothin! Did you ever see Donnie Darko? Even THAT wouldn't wake me up!I can make it about 10 minutes before it becomes unbearable. They should try and make compression pants as comfortable as possible. Not the opposite.  Because lets face it....compression pants in general are already uncomfortable to begin with. When I wake up after aa night of wearing these I have a huge indentation around my entire ankle and its sore for hours.I understand they added this to try and keep the pants situated without riding up your leg. But they could have made the opening bigger. It wouldn't have hurt anyone in this situation. And Im sure there are people out there that have heel that fit like their heel was perfectly made for it, but Im guessing the majority do not. They could have even went with something that was more adjustable..?? I would have even preferred the foot anchor being removed completely, the bottom being super tight, and the addition of a zipper to close after the pants are on (kinda like a scuba suit) than what they decided to go with.These pants are pretty pricey. I would say definitely go to a brick and mortar store and give them a test drive (with underwear on people. dont be funky), and trust me, you will know pretty quickly if the heel will bother you or not. If so you can just return them easily.One thing I did like is that they came in this very nice hard case. I use it to store the pants and some compression sleeves at the moment. But I may wind up using the case to store some of my electronic equipment. Funny enough, I like the case more than the pants.The only reason I didn't return them and go get a pair of compression pants without the foot hook is because I accidentally ordered from somewhere overseas. I didn't realize it because their site automatically came up in US dollars which is rare. So I didn't want to go through the trouble of sending it back. Otherwise, I would have.Who knows...I might even cut a slit in them around the tendon area. But for $150, I dont feel I should have too.

This glue is the worst. I dont know how it has such great reviews. I tried it on magnets, fabric, plastic, rubber...it never held anything. And yes, I let it dry with compression for long periods of time to no avail.The only good thing I can say is its one of the only 'super' glues that didnt dry up after opening the bottle once. But its probably because it has no sticking ability.I have 3 tubes of it. Maybe all three were a bad batch because everyone else seems to love it...Krazy glue all the way for me. I just gotta figure out how to keep the glue from drying after I use it once.

I gotta say, if I bought this to hold my guitar, Id be more inclined to give it a 3 star rating. When a guitar is hanging, all that you are left with is fingers showing. And while they are detailed ...its hard to even notice its a hand that is surrounding the fret board when looking straight on. Add this dark colored wood hand to a dim room, like where I have this installed, and you can barely even notice it at all..Don’t get me wrong. This hand looks awesome and the detail is pretty sick. but it all just gets lost when it is 'doing its job'....holding your guitar.When your guitar is not being held, this thing looks killer. Especially if you have some lighting nearby or above it (fortunately I do).The construction is amazing (although the first one I ordered the index finger was snapped at the base of the finger, only being held together by the inner cushion material). I was also missing the bolt from the package. Possibly a used / returned product..?? I almost didn’t notice the snap, until I was hanging it and touched the finger and it moved. I couldn’t even notice the seam where it was split , so make sure you check yours if you order.Speaking of the inner cushion material, it does look a little weird having this weird shaped black spot on the hand. It's really not that bad on the tree model because its already dark, but I have a red hand as well and its mega noticable. I guess they assumed it would be covered by the guitar, so it didn’t matter. It doesn’t really bother me overall, but would have been nice if they incorporated the cushion better. Possibly better shaped it, or colored to match.That all being said, I ordered 2 (one left and one right hand) and funny enough, I decided to use them to display my Sais/weapons. Hence why I gave it 4 stars. When holding the very slim sais as opposed to my guitar, none of the detail is lost. I can clearly see it is a hand, I can see the detail that it is if wood / tree origin, and the sais aren’t blocking the detail of the inner part of the hand which helps you too see that its.....a hand. I cannot see the amazing detail on the back of the hand because its facing the wall, but it’s better than nothing.Another thing I wish is that they had a Philips head on the inside end of the bolt where the hand screws on. This way it could be installed in the wall easier with a screw gun driving the bolt in first, then twisting the hand on as opposed to having to drill, then put the bolt on the hand first and then twist the hand into the wall. Who knows…maybe this is how the finger got snapped on the first on I received..?? Someone was trying to twist it into the wall with the hand and broke it. Would explain why there was no bolt. They probably just left it in the wall.If I really was going to use it for my guitar, I probably would have returned considering the price. I wouldn’t want to pay $50 for something I can barely tell what it is. This is all the same for all the hands (even the red one I own). All you see is five littel red things poking out around the guitar.Best scenario would be if you were hanging them somewhere you can easily see the sides of them, like on a pillar.Hope this helps.

I gotta say, if I bought this to hold my guitar, Id be more inclined to give it a 3 star rating. The reason is that, most of the realistic detail on the entire hand seems to be on the back of the hand (veins and detail in general). That being said, you are going to hang this on a wall. Meaning, you aren’t going to see the back of the hand. The second most detailed part of the hand is on the inside of the hand / palm. When the guitar is hanging, this will be covered as well. All that you are left with is the fingers showing. and while they are detailed as well...its hard to even notice what the heck is holding the guitar up other than this five little red things surrounding the fret board when looking straight on. Add this to a dim room, like where I have this installed, and you can barely even see five little things poking out.Don’t get me wrong. This hand looks awesome and the detail is pretty sick. but it all just gets lost when it is 'doing its job'....holding your guitar.When your guitar is not being held, this thing looks killer.The construction is amazing (although the first one I ordered the index finger was snapped at the base of the finger, only being held together by the inner cushion material). I was also missing the bolt from the package. Possibly a used / returned product..?? I almost didn’t notice the snap, until I was hanging it and touched the finger and it moved. Couldn’t see the seam where it was split otherwise, so make sure you check yours if you order.Speaking of the inner cushion material, it does look a little weird having this weird shaped black spot on the hand. I guess they assumed it would be covered by the guitar, so it didn’t matter. Doesn’t really bother me, but would have been nice if they incorporated it better. Possibly better shaped, or colored to match.That all being said, I ordered 2 (one left and one right hand) and funny enough, I decided to use them to display my Sais. Hence why I gave it 4 stars. When holding the very slim sais as opposed to my guitar, none of the detail is lost. I can clearly see it is a hand, and the sais aren’t blocking the detail of the inner part of the hand. I still cannot see the amazing detail on the back of the hand because its facing the wall, but it’s better than nothing.Another thing I wish is that they had a Philips head on the inner end of the bolt. This want it could be installed in the wall easier with a screw gun driving the bolt in first, then twisting the hand on as opposed to having to drill, then put the bolt on the hand first and then twist the hand into the wall. Who knows…maybe this is how the finger got snapped on the first on I received..?? Someone was trying to twist it into the wall with the hand and broke it. Would explain why there was no bolt. They probably just left it in the wall.If I really was going to use it for my guitar, I probably would have returned considering the price. I wouldn’t want to pay $40-$50 I can barely tell what it is.Best scenario would be if you were hanging them somewhere you can easily see the sides of them, like on a pillar.Hope this helps.

I went with these anglers because it was priced the same as some others on Amazon that only came with one. This comes with 2, and it’s great if you own a laptop that has USB ports on each side.The only things to mention and why I gave it 3 stars instead of 5 is that its slightly chunky. So, if you have parallel USB ports positioned closely together (like I do on my 2 port USB power block), this will the other ports next to it. Or if you own a slim laptop like a MacBook Pro Retina, then these will be thicker than the laptop itself cause it to be raised. No Bueno for these situations.Overall, its great quality, and works for what I am using it for (attached to a gooseneck LED USB powered light coming out of my rack mount equipment). If you are using something slim and don’t want to block ports, you might need to try an angler that is on a flat 90 degree angle, instead of this one which is L 7 shaped adapters.

I decided to go with this portable LED USB powered light because it had the ability to dim, and it had an on and off button.While, it does work well, it would have been nice if it returned to the brightness you set it at after turning off and on again. You have to set the level each time you turn it on, as it resets to 100%.Also, I’m not too happy with the gooseneck part of it. While it is easily adjustable, it doesn’t seem to allow the light tube portion to easily be 'twisted' as to angle it better where you want it. If you want to accomplish this, you have to try and twist and maneuver the gooseneck part instead, which is not easy. It would have been better if they allowed the tube itself to be slightly twistable as to get the right angle.I assume some people will not have this issue depending on the angle of your USB port and where it is placed, but I am using this in conjunction with a USB 3.0 Vertical Male to Female Adapter Right Angle Adapter because I have this coming out of my rack mount equipment, and this places it on its side at the USB part of it. But its better than it coming straight out of my rack mount and trying to adjust it to an even more awkward angle.Another minor annoyance is where they decided to place the button. As mentioned, the gooseneck is 'easily' adjustable. A little too easy in fact. A slight touch to any part of the light, and you just moved the light out of the position you just spent all that time trying to get in the perfect angle / spot. That being said, even the slight touch you have to do to turn the light on moves the entire light / gooseneck. And pressing it to dim makes it even worse. I wish they used a more stiff type of gooseneck. Id rather initially fight to bend a rough gooseneck into position, than have something that moves so freely you barely want to breath near it.Again, this may not bother you depending what and where you are planning to use it. But my light and purposes require it be in an exact position at an exact angle. Otherwise its either in the way of my other rack equipment and buttons, or its not shining where I need it (aka….directly blazing into my eye balls….ouch)The light is decent for its price and what it does. It's VERY bright. I like that I can take it with me if I have too and it is definitely worlds cheaper in price and way brighter than the standard BNC gooseneck lamps made for rack equipment. Not to mention, where else are you going to use those? Not with your laptop that’s for sure.If you have an portable USB battery pack, like an Anker, you can also use this as a portable flash light or as a reading light.I cant say for sure if other lights out there are better. But this seems to be the one of few that has an on and off button which I also needed. If you don’t need one, then I would say try and find one that has a stronger gooseneck, and is more adjustable at the lamp for angle.The light itself is very bright and lights up my work area great.

I can’t say that I love these flowers, but I like them. I bought them to accent some wild set up I have at my desk. Pretty much everything I’ve added to the mix lights up in some way. What can I say….I am obsessed with things that light up. So I thought these would fit in perfect. And although they fit in very nicely, they do not fit in nicely for the reason I expected / wanted.As others have mentioned, the lights are yellow. When I heard this I preferred it because I needed something that was both purple and yellow in the area I was planning to place these in. The problem is, that the yellow is a very dull yellow. Not the normal incandescent / regular non LED Christmas lights yellow I was thinking. More like a brownish yellow. And when lit, it completely drowns out the purple and white colors of the flowers in a dark setting. They are not bright, as others have also mentioned. Its more of just an atmospheric thing. But in all honestly, I prefer the flowers with the lights off. I was completely shocking to me because I LOVE things that light up. But these look so much better without them on, and the residual lighting from the surrounding lights almost glow off of them when the flower lights are not on.I can’t say I recommend these if you are dead set on the fact that they light up. But if this makes you feel more comfortable, they are great looking fake flowers in general, and set at a pretty decent price when you consider that to buy an arrangement that looks as full as this set at Michaels (without coupons) you are going to spend a lot more than you would on these.Other things to note are:There are 3 main stems total in the package.The stems are somewhat posable. I wouldn’t expect to twist them into circles, but they are very movable.Some pedals fell off when I took them out of the package.One Pedal was completely missing from the arrangement.The flower stems are very long. I wouldn’t expect to put these in a small/standard vase without them looking odd.The flowers are permanently connected together via the wires. They do leave some spacing between them, but don’t expect separate all 3 stems in different locations (unless you are going to sacrifice the lighting feature and cut the cords)The power block is detachable from the wire. I am guessing this is incase you want to route the wire much easier through the bottom of a vase or through any open holes, since the power block is a bit more chunky.All in all, these are decent flowers and I will keep them because they look good, Not because of the lighting aspect. Regular or LED Christmas type lights would have looked better, but oh well.

I originally bought the SUPERNIGHT Infrared Music Controller 20 keys IR Remote Controller Sound Sensor Controller For 5050 3528 5630 RGB LED Strip light Flexible because it was cheaper, and it was just that. Cheap. The response to music and beats was erratic at best. It was very inaccurate.I decided to give this one a try and I can tell you it is MUCH better at sound recognition.There are a few things I did not like about the controller:There aren’t many light modes to choose from. There are only 2 music modes. A flash and strobe (which seems to be a slow fade).The remote range is not that great. I have to get pretty close for it to work.Black wires on the connectors would have been better than white considering the controller itself is black.I wish they had an option for the PULSE music setting to change color. It only seems to pulse 1 selected color of your choice. I would have the option to choose 1 color pulse and a setting to pulse rotate colors.I had my eye set on the much larger white model MUSIC IR controller from another company, but this one comes with the wires you will need, so this one is better. No need to buy, cut, solder anything. Worked fine with my existing 12V adapter that came with my SUPERNIGHT lights. I will say though, it comes pre-wired, and i think they wired it incorrectly because the colors on the remote are not working correctly when selecting a color (press PURPLE, get YELLOW). I will have to rewire it which isn’t a big dealThis is a great quality (metal construction) controller. The sensitivity knob seems a bit weird as it doesn’t seem to change in a way you would expect. It’s hard to explain, but when I was lowering the sensitivity it worked well, but raising it higher made it more erratic, then accurate, then erratic, then accurate....it was kind of random. I find it best to leave it lower, but it responds to music very well no matter what the volume is set to. The other controller I previously had was too picky with volume and placement. If it was up too high it wouldn’t work at all. I even tried muffling the microphone with tape and foam to no avail.Although, the light modes are a bit lacking, I highly recommend spending the extra cash on this MUSIC IR over the other cheaper models because it is more accurate.

This review is mostly for the RED model. I ordered it based off the pictures. However, I wouldn’t say this is a clear representation of the coloring considering all the pictures are taken in bright atmospheres. But let’s be real....it’s a lantern. I don’t know many people that use a lantern with a candle in the day time. It’s meant to be used in dark areas or at night.That being said, the color of the red is very deep red. Almost like a cranberry juice color.I bought it to use in my office since I have many red themed things in there, but the entire lantern looks black considering how dark the red is. Also, I used a tea candle (what is listed as being recommended in the description) in hopes the red would be more apparent, but it didn’t help much. It only emits a small area at the bottom of the lantern. Also, the pictures mostly show the lantern from the back, but it doesn’t show a picture of the lantern from the front with the door closed. The bottom of the front of the lantern is exposed (not red glass). So I could see right through to the inside and see the candle which looked lame. If you plan to buy and hang any of the colored ones, made sure you have the rear facing you or else it looks lame. They should have made the door opening stretch the full length of the lantern.Overall, the lantern seems like good quality, but I might recommend going for the clear model and utilizing some par can light gels to color as desired, lighting with a bright white LED candle.

I bought this in hopes to dim a Brightech LED posable floor lamp, but unfortunately, it did not work (because the light itself is not dimmable).Instead, I decided to use on some VERY bright DODO 10M 100 LED String Christmas Lights after reading a ton of reviews that claim they work well with christmas lights. Although it does work, it does not work well. Possible because the lights themselve have a controller and I have it set to slow fade. It acts sort of erractically when using with the modes. It causes the lights to flicker instead of having a smooth slow fade that is produced without the Lutron connected. Also, if dimmed to much via the Lutron controller, it will eventually just shut off. I then have to raise the Lutron to MAX to get the lights to come on again, and then slowly lower to fade the lights.I find it does not shut off if I do not set the Lutron too low, but it still acts erractically with the flickering. But i honestly like the effect it produces. Not more than the smooth fade produced without the lutron, but I still like it.I also own the NON - LED Lutron dimmer (Credenza model) and it produces the same results with the same lights. So I cant say I recommend this one more over the other for this reason. But they are the same price and this seems to be interchangable between more types of lights so for that reason, I would recommend this one. But I wouldnt expect it to work well on all christmas lights, Especially if the lights have FX modes.

This review is for the MUSIC IR controller. I hate when companies combine products on the same page just to confuse the buyer with the star ratings. Most of the 5 star reviews are for the regular controller. My fault for assuming they were for the MUSIC IR controller. Anyway....onto the review...I have been an audio engineer / DJ for many years and have worked with tons of lighting systems that were controlled by sound in a similar fashion. Some of the lights Ive worked with were connected to relay devices that had an internal mic and would control the lights connected to it automatically based on the sound it was hearing...and to be honest, these systems worked well.This, however, does not seem to work the same way, nor does it work well. It is over-sensitive to volume, regardless of the sensitivity you have set the controller on by pressing the + / - buttons once in a audio setting.Some mention it works best when placed next to a speaker. Im assuming they might be using smaller computer speakers. I am using this controller in my recording studio with my JBL LSR305's and placing the controller next to these kick ass speakers is no bueno. I have moved the controller as far away as I possibly can (the lights were already wired in place before I decided to buy this, so placement was limited), I placed several pieces of electrical tape on the microphone on the controller, and positioned it so that it was somewhat under my desk and behind the speakers, AND STILL, the only way the controller responds accurately is if I have the volume of the music I am playing, under 50%....much lower than I typically listen to music. Even a slight increase over that sweet spot threshold and the lights start going crazy. And anything above 85% volume, and they dont respond at all, just staying idle on one color because its not detecting the music.Shut the music off, and clap my hands....it responds uber accurately, changing instantaneous to each hand clap.This all being said, I could possible rewire my whole lighting setup which would be a nightmare to move this thing far enough away that it will respond accurately to a volume I am more comfortable listening too, but then, I'm pretty much locked in for these lights only responding to that set volume. If I am just doing light listening and want to listen to something lower for background noise with the sound activated on the lights, its not going to work.In comparison to other lighting systems Ive worked with, they were not as sensitive to volume. If anything, it was the opposite. The louder the music was set, the more accurate they would be and the lower it was, the harder it would struggle to change.  I guess what I am trying to say, is that the volume seems to determine the sensitivity level of these lights. Its very strange, and not very pleasing.Overall, the price is nice and I am thankful that they still work with other settings such as fade which I tend to normally leave the lights on in general. But I gotta say, Id rather pay more for something that works more accurately with music. Not something that just changes with music, but not accurately. Maybe its because I used to be a DJ and beats and rhythm are very important to me. If I hear a beat and the light isn't changing until even just .305809358 seconds after that beat I just heard, its throws me off. x that by every beat in the song and its maddening.My  best recommendation is, since this still is a decent product, your best bet is to get some LED light and the MUSIC IR at the same time, before you install the lights and become content with where you already placed the lights. This way you can position the controller, the lights, and the speakers in ideal locations to compensate for the inaccuracies of the sensitivity of the microphone / programming in this controller. If you do that then the controller might be worth it.If you are like me and just ADDING this to a preexisting set up,...use caution and dont have too high hopes....or just try and find a product that is more accurate and has better sound sensitivity adjustments (some have a sensitivity knob on the device itself. this was the same with the DJ lighting I mentioned earlier).OR, if you just want to see lights changing somewhat with the music and dont care too much about how loud or low your music is, as long as its playing, then this would be perfect for you.Btw, I just connected the lights to the existing 12V, 5A power adapter that came with my SUPERNIGHT LED 5050 strip lights and it works fine.Hope all this helps.

If you do that then the controller might be worth it.If you are like me and just ADDING this to a preexisting set up,...use caution and dont have too high hopes....or just try and find a product that is more accurate and has better sound sensitivity adjustments (some have a sensitivity knob on the device itself. this was the same with the DJ lighting I mentioned earlier).OR, if you just want to see lights changing somewhat with the music and dont care too much about how loud or low your music is, as long as its playing, then this would be perfect for you.Btw, I just connected the lights to the existing 12V, 5A power adapter that came with my SUPERNIGHT LED 5050 strip lights and it works fine.Hope all this helps.****UPDATE 3/10/15I couldnt deal with the inaccuracies I explained above, so I winded up getting the HitLights Sound Activated Multicolor Music Controller and it works MUCH better. It is much more responsive to music and isnt as picky with placement or volume. The only thing is that it doesnt offer as many music modes as the SUPERNIGHT MUSIC IR, but whats the point of having more modes if the controller doesnt even respond well to music at all.I recommend spending the extra cash to get the HitLights model.

Up until now, I have been using the Griffin Technology BlueTrip, and it got the job done well enough for playing audio. The problem is that I own a Mazda 3, and the AUX port is located in my center console right next to the lighter jack, which is super conveniently placed, however, this means the microphone on the BlueTrip is also located inside there as well. Whenever I answered calls it defaulted to the BlueTrip microphone and no one could hear me. So I would have to pick up my phone and change it to the iPhone speakerphone. I could not using the BlueTrip for calls at all, nor anything Siri related.Queue...the SoundBotFinally, I can now have the microphone routed outside of the center console. Now people can hear me, Siri can hear me....it’s a much more pleasant world. Don't know how I went so long without it. I also love the transport buttons on the SoundBot. No more reaching for the phone.That being said, it’s not perfect. You can’t actually activate Siri from it at all. The only operation it can do that is call related is dial the last person called by pressing and holding the NEXT button. And the delay for the call is pretty lengthy, and the button press to hang up when you realize the last person you called was you mother in law and need to press that END button takes even longer :oNot sure why they didn’t incorporate Siri functionality in their product. It claims this is the 2015 LATEST MODEL and Siri has been around for years now.
