The self-help advice, while not bad, is very generic and unoriginal. For example, the author suggests that you should write down a list of your goals for your life; really? Ya think so? Gee wiz, I never would have thought of that.The tone of the book also comes off as condescending to anyone who doesn't CONFORM to the "nonconformist" lifestyle that he presents. Can't get much more hypocritical than that. I also couldn't believe it when I read the part about how the author's big personal goal was to travel to every country in the world. That's nice and all, but it totally sounds like something a 7th grader might say if you asked what they want to do with their life. To each his own, I guess.I read books for 2 primary reasons:1. To learn something interesting or valuable, or2. To be entertainedAt 92 pages in, this book was not doing either of those two things for me, so I put it down. I hope someone will find this review helpful.

I wanted a basic compass that was small and light to use for hiking on cloudy days when the sun can't be used as reference. These fit the bill perfectly. They are about the size of a quarter, and are designed to clip onto your watch band, but since I don't wear a watch I'm going to just toss one of these in my pocket, and a backup in my backpack.Getting 12 for such a low price seemed too good to be true, and I figured at least some of them wouldn't work, but surprisingly all 12 work perfectly. There are no air bubbles, and they all point North. On the ones I received, the NSEW letters are a bright green, with the rest of the markings being white, instead of all white like in the product image. The bezel does turn too, it's just a little stiff at first but after you move it a few times it works good.I did buy mine from the seller "Micro-Tools", so if you want exactly what I'm describing here you should buy from them.Also, the way the clip on the back is designed, there is a hole that you could thread some cord through and wear this compass as a lanyard if that's your preference. The product image doesn't show the back so I thought I should mention that.It's great to have a dozen of these. Great to put one in each vehicle emergency bag, and the kids can all carry their own compass when we're hiking. Gre

I am a lifelong Iowa resident, and an avid hiker within the state and elsewhere. Unfortunately, this book is primarily just a partial listing of state parks and preserves, with very brief descriptions, crude maps, and black & white photos.The introduction states that this book was written by a college student who spent a summer hiking in Iowa, and the book does in fact read much like a college research paper. Rather than first hand information about hiking the area, most of the information for each hiking spot is about the geologic history of the region, statistical weather data, and historical names and dates of the area. While that information may be mildly interesting, that does not constitute a hiking guide in my humble opinion. There is nothing in this book that can not be easily found for free with 5 minutes of Google searching. There are no "hidden gems" or anything like that in this book.If you're interested in hiking in Iowa, save your money and get on the Iowa DNR website, or Google the county conservation board websites for the county you're interested in exploring. The information on the web is much better and the maps are MUCH more detailed and useful. Happy hiking.

I liked this book. It is an absolutely terrifying survival story centered around one of the last survivors of a flu epidemic that wiped out most of life on earth. The few that remain, live in a constant state of fear, fighting off looters and murders who travel the countryside spreading terror as they please. But, this is not a typical post-apocalyptic story. The typical reader of zombie apocalypse novels would probably not like this.The writing style was very unique, in that much of the book reads as if it were almost poetry, instead of a novel. But yet, some portions of the book read like classic storytelling. My interpretation of this is that the writer was trying to express the state of mind that the main character was in by changing up the writing style depending on what was happening in the story. When Hig was feeling sad, lonely, or troubled, the writing was very fragmented and poetic. Almost like you had a direct line into Hig's head and were reading exactly what thoughts and emotions were bouncing around in there. At other times in the story, like when there was a struggle or an emergency, the writing style went back to storytelling, like the thoughts in Hig's head paused for the moment and he was acting on pure reflex or adrenaline. Then, near the end of the book when Hig finally started to get his emotions straightened out a bit, the poetic writing style stopped appearing altogether. I'm not sure if this interpretation is what the author intended, but that is what I got from it regardless.This is a diverse book that has suspense, emotion, action, fear, and joy, all in one pretty fascinating story. Highly recommended.

The title was misleading. It should be called, "Complaining About the Woods"I got this book thinking it was about a hiking adventure. What it turned out to be is a seething rant about how the author hates nature and it is all he can stand to simply walk through the woods. I really doubt that much of this book is even true, at least the hiking parts anyway. Clearly the author's knowledge about nature and hiking comes primarily from only reading about it, as his obvious paranoid fear of anything that is outside of city limits shines through in this book. I don't think he could tolerate even an afternoon on the AT, let alone what he claims to have done in this book.This book just reads with a very smug tone, and I really didn't like how he completely insulted and picked apart practically everyone he encountered in the book (not to their face, of course). He also does a lot of stereotyping of Southerners, hikers, small town people, and again, pretty much everyone he encounters. The guy is just a jerk at heart.I just noticed too, that the bear on the cover is a brown bear, which doesn't even live in the area he supposedly hiked. Just another layer to this completely foul smelling rotten onion of a book. What a disappointment.

I've been reading a lot of books in this genre lately, and I found this one to be quite special compared to other books I've read on this topic. Instead of the people struggling to survive the aftermath of a cataclysmic event, as in most post-apocalyptic books I've read, these people are observing the extinction of humans on earth from afar, knowing with absolute certainty that the same fate is in store for them. There are no preparations that can be made to prevent it. The only thing they can do is bide their time for the last few months that they have left.This is a very interesting look at how people can behave and treat each other, and the emotional struggles that they go through while awaiting certain death. That being said, it is obvious how the story ends, but it is the details that happen between when the story starts and when the story ends that make for a very interesting read.This book was written in 1957, and I think this book really gave me an insight in to what the general world view was at that time regarding nuclear holocaust. Even with impending extinction, somehow the society held together, not completely, but for the most part people continued to be decent people all the way to the end. It makes me wonder how the people in today's times would react to such a situation. This was a very thought-provoking book, and I will likely read it again some day.

I really love it when the title of a book is actually true to the content. This book really does contain what I would call "Practical Business Wisdom". This book has a little bit of everything from the classic Dave Ramsey personality. There is some story telling to show lessons learned, and loads of advice on how to manage an organization. There is some great advice on managing people, and he even goes into details about what types of employee benefits work and what what ones don't.He covers it all from hiring and firing, to taxes and accountants, to managing inventory, to buying a building. Dave gives loads of practical tips and advice from all the mistakes made and lessons learned over his business career. And of course, you do it all debt free. Love it.Even if you don't have any employees and are running your business out of a spare room in your basement, this book has practical, helpful information for you. Highly recommended.

I first heard about the author when I heard an interview he did on an entrepreneurship podcast. He sounded like an interesting fellow with an interesting concept, so I bought the book to learn more about the "entrepreneur mindset" that he was talking about in the interview. Unfortunately, this book was many things and interesting was not one of them.First of all, contrary to what some of the other "reviewers" have stated, this is definitely NOT a book about entrepreneurship. There are no business strategies, marketing advice, or anything like that. It is about creating the proper mindset to prepare yourself to succeed in the entrepreneurial world, or any world for that matter. It really is more of a psychology/sociology/philosophy book than anything else.The thing is, while I do agree with many of the viewpoints expressed by the author, the way they are explained is very jumbled, and really has no cohesiveness to it. I have read quite a few books on the topics of philosophy, psychology, ego suppression, etc., and I think that someone who has no prior reading on these topics would find this book very confusing and frustrating to read. For instance, in the chapter about emotions, the book suggests turning off the emotions and focus on the facts before reacting. While I agree that's a good idea, the book provides no suggestions on how to do that, or what steps to take in your daily life to train yourself to do this. These are HEAVY topics here that many people spend their entire lives working on, and glazing over these topics in just a few pages just doesn't cut it. On the topic of philosophy and emotional well being, I would recommend reading something by Krishnmaurti or Tolle instead. These two explain those concepts much more clearly and more in depth.This book also seemed to read like an autobiography, except instead of being written in first person past tense, it was written in third person present tense. This book is obviously his story and observations from his life, but every instance that "I" would normally be used in an autobiography, it was replaced with "You", so it sounds as if he's telling you how things happen for you. It is just bizarre, and it annoyed me through the entire book. Honestly, I think this book would have been much more readable and more interesting if it was actually written as an autobiography where readers could learn from the author's experiences. Instead, this book lays out a constant stream of "You feel like this....", and "You consider this or that..." or, "Other people think this of you..." which just doesn't jive with me.I am a self-made entrepreneur, and neither my path in personal life or my path in business fit within this cookie cutter life path that is laid out in this book. I really don't like writing low rating reviews, and I'm pretty choosy about the books I read so I rarely have to. But, in the spirit of helping people as this book suggests, I've got to put these things out there so buyers can make an educated decision on whether or not they want to bother with this book.

My 4 year old bought this game with his own money he earned from cleaning his room. He watches the Never Land Pirates show quite often and had to have this game. The game is very educational, and he is refining his skills in counting, colors, directions, and critical thinking. This Leapster game is excellent in regard to educational value and fun. 5 stars.

This little bow and arrow set cost less than $4. Knowing that, I think the quality of the toy is right in line with the price paid. Yes, the toy is extremely low quality. The arrows don't even have notches in the ends, so I cut little notches in them so my 4 year old could shoot them. It works fine that way. The bow is very flimsy, and there is no way the thing can shoot the arrows with enough speed to actually stick the suction cup arrows onto anything. But, it has been 3 days now since we got the thing, and it actually hasn't broken yet, which is surprising. With all these negatives about the toy, I can't stress enough that this toy was ONLY $4, so adjust your expectations accordingly. Obviously you are not going to get a high quality toy at this price.

We got these for our 4 year old who is very into cowboy stuff. I was pleasantly surprised and how nice and big these pistols are. They are nearly the size of a real 6 shooter. They are pretty durable too, as my boy has been playing with these frequently since then, and that was over 6 months ago.The belt, badge, and holsters are just OK. They are made of thin plastic and the belt is a little difficult for my boy to put on. The guns are great though, and I know nearly $20 for a couple of plastic guns is a little spendy, but the quality of these toys is MUCH better than other cheaper toys that break after a week. I would definitely recommend this toy for anyone with a little cowboy in the house.

I bought this case for my son's phone, and I must admit that I actually like this one better than the Seidio Surface case that I have on my own phone. This one is a two piece design, which includes a pliable, rubbery layer that you slip over the phone, and then a hard backing that snaps on top of that.This case really is better than the Seidio Surface case because it actually covers the buttons on the top and sides of the phone. This case also feels a bit thicker and more solid. When the case I'm currently using on my phone wears out I'm definitely going to pick one up for myself. I know my son really likes his.

This third volume in the Holding Their Own saga really stepped it up. Some new characters are introduced to the story, and some old characters make a comeback. I really liked how the author switched viewpoints every so often. It was kind of a "take a walk in their shoes" type of story, where you got to see the situation from different people's viewpoints.As in the previous books, Bishop and the other characters in the story are constantly coming up with clever solutions to the problems they face, which I really like. Also, as in the first two books, there is very little political bias in this story. I won't divulge too much of the story, but there are some really heavy political issues with the government in the story, but the author manages to tell the story without joining one side or the other. The book really promotes the "We're all Americans" idea, and I think it is more focused on the philosophy of unifying people rather than dividing them.I was somewhat critical in my review of the second book, but this third book is a significant improvement and I really enjoyed the story. The editing has gotten better too. Looking forward to reading number four.

I liked the first book quite a bit. Yes, the font is weird and there are too many typos to list, but this review is about the story and characters.The first book seemed pretty realistic. The main character was a pretty regular guy who had some military experience, and his reactions to the chaos that was happening around him were what I would consider to be pretty reasonable and smart. He was a regular guy, making some smart and tough choices so he and his wife could survive.In this second book, the main character somehow transformed into an unrealistic super hero. Probably the part that was most ridiculous was when he managed to cling to the underside of a moving truck, wearing a heavy pack, for around an HOUR, and after that he managed to take out an entire heavily armed drug gang single handed, while at the same time rescuing a little girl. There are more amazing feats like this one in the book, but this is the one that struck me the most peculiar.I gave the first book 4 stars, but unfortunately this one only gets 3. I'm starting to notice with these apocalyptic genre books that the quality of the story slips pretty quickly when you start getting into the sequels. I'm going to give book three a read. I've got a feeling a 2 star review is in my future. We'll see.

This stock fit perfectly on my Saiga .223 rifle. I was a bit concerned about how sturdy this stock would be because of how light it was, but after installing it and putting it through some of my own personal "tests", it appears to be pretty darn solid. I'm very happy with it in that regard.Installation is a snap, and it took me about 10 minutes to do. You simply fit the stock into the receiver, drill three little pilot holes with the supplied drill bit, and then install the retainer screws. Don't worry, you are drilling into the new stock, not the gun's receiver. If you ever decide to put the original stock back on, it will be exactly as it was when it came out of the factory. The pistol grip is even easier to install, requiring the insertion of just 1 heavy screw inserted through the bottom of the grip.The bottom of the pistol grip has a little spring loaded trap door, and with the space inside being hollow is it feasible that you could use that little space for storage if you wanted to. While the grip does have ridges milled into it to help make it "grippy", it is still made of hard polymer, which is not really very "grippy" to hold on to. I put on a cheap Hogue Handall slip on rubber grip that I had laying around. Much better.Overall, this is a great addition to an already great rifle and I'm very happy with it.

While this book does contain a lot of useful information on preparedness topics, the way it is written is very hard to read. The writer skips around from topic to topic, without any real recognizable organizational plan. He will be talking about food storage in one paragraph, and then on the next page medical supplies, and then the next page ammunition.The book seems very disorganized in this way, and while reading this I couldn't help but imagine if the writer's home and survival supplies are "organized" in this same fashion. It is very ironic that a book about being prepared and organized has very little organization itself. This book is definitely not geared for people who are new to this subject matter. It uses a lot of terms that will likely be unknown to a person who is new to the subject.Most of the information presented revolves around the premise that you already own a farm or secluded location where you can have animals and agriculture and basically set up your own self sufficient little world. While this is good information to know, if you don't already have a "bug out location" in the boonies, much of the info in this book is not applicable to you. Most of the information in the book assumes a total collapse of society, and there is very little information about dealing with smaller, shorter-term disasters/situations.Much of the book also seems to assume that you have an unlimited budget for these things. If you did even half of the suggestions in this book you would have millions invested in this. In this regard, I do find many of the suggestions in this book pretty unrealistic and unattainable for the average person.Over all, this is a decent book. As the title of my review says, it's just OK.

I am amazed at how the price of desktop computers has dropped over the last several years. I bought this one to replace my 5 year old Dell Inspiron. My old PC has 2GB RAM, and only 60GB hard drive and I paid over $800 for it then. Now, I got this new Dell with 4GB RAM and 1TB hard drive for almost half the price. More computer for less money. Amazing how things change so quickly in the PC world. When I bought this, the price was $348, but it looks like they've raised the price since then. As of this writing the price is $419.This PC works great. Start up is very fast, probably under a minute. It runs very quiet, which I like very much. It does have a vertical style disc drive, which I'm not big fan of, however I rarely use CDs in my computer so it's not a big deal for me. Based on reading other reviews, it seems like that is a deal breaker for some people, so make your decision accordingly. This PC is very compact, standing at just under 11 inches high, 4 inches wide, and 15 inches long. It's really not much bigger than an X box.I read one other reviewer complain about the lack of a DVI port, and this is true. The picture that shows the back of the PC shows a DVI port, and it does not exist on the PC. The description does not say that it has DVI port, but for some reason one of the pictures is incorrect. Just something to be aware of. Personally, I don't care about DVI, as most monitors now days will take DVI, HDMI, and VGA inputs so they will work with any PC. I think most people fall into that category regarding DVI. DVI is going the way of the floppy disk drive.I've also noticed that this PC runs very cool. The outside of the box is not even warm at all. On the back of the PC there are two slots where you can install additional ports if you would like. I have an older Canon camcorder that I like which needs a firewire connection, so I will probably install a firewire card in one of those slots.Windows 8 is something that will take a little getting used to. When I say "a little", I really do mean it. Yes, it's different, but it's still windows, its not like we're learning a new language here. I know lots of people freak out when they encounter change, but to freak out over this little operating system is kinda silly. After about an hour of poking around in Windows 8 I started feeling pretty comfortable with it. I don't like the new start page, but this can be easily bypassed by simply clicking on "Desktop", which takes you into a much more familiar (and logical) way to access your files and programs. In "desktop mode", the interface looks very similar to previous versions of Windows.Overall, this has been a great computer so far. I use it mostly for basic tasks like internet and email, Microsoft office tasks, a little bit of image and video editing, and music. For these purposes this PC works fantastic. I've always had good luck with Dells. In my opinion this PC is an excellent piece of equipment for the money and I would buy it again.

Let's face it, if you've used Microsoft Office in the past then you know pretty much what you're getting with this software. There is nothing revolutionary or life changing about the 2013 version of this software. There are minor tweaks here and there, but nothing to get excited about. It works as it should.But, the biggest difference that I noticed was that this new version is non-transferable between computers, and you can only install it on 1 PC. In past versions, you were able to make one software purchase and outfit your whole household (up to 3 PCs) with Microsoft Office. No more.This 2013 version clearly states that it is only for 1 user, and 1 PC. So, if you have more than one PC in your home, you will need to make multiple purchases of this software. Also, if your computer dies or you decide to replace it with a new one, guess what? Yep, you guessed it, you'll spend another $140 to re-install Office2013 on your new computer.I am a fan of Microsoft Office programs, and I've used them for many years, but this new "non-transferable" policy is an important thing to know when making a buying decision. I hope this review has been helpful.UPDATE 3-19-2013:Microsoft has recently changed its user agreement allowing you to transfer the software to a different computer. If your PC dies or you get a new one, you can transfer the software license to the new computer. While this is a step in the right direction, unfortunately this is just a half-measure. The policy still only allows installation on just 1 PC, contrary to previous versions which allowed installation on up to 3 PCs. Those who have more than one PC will still have to make multiple purchases.

I got these slippers as a Christmas present for my wife. She says they're cute and really likes them. They do appear to have a pretty good amount of padding on the sole, and the inner lining looks very plush and soft. The size is right on. The quality is pretty good, and look like they'll hold up pretty well to daily use. She's been wearing them every day.

There's not too much to say about this part. The retainer nut broke on our Kenmore dishwasher, and this one replaced the broken one with no problems. Just make sure you don't tighten too hard when you put the new one in or you'll be buying another one!Tip: If you've broken the nut off by over tightening, the plastic threads from the nut will likely be stuck inside the hub. To remove that broken piece, take a pair of needle nose pliers, put the tips inside the lumen of the broken piece and open the pliers to exert force outward on the threads. While holding the pliers open, begin to turn the pliers counter clockwise. Keep twisting and the threads should screw right out, making room for your new retainer nut. Good luck!

I wasn't impressed with this helicopter. I got it for my 3 year old son. I expected it to make a lot of annoying sound effects, but what I didn't expect was it's almost complete lack of functionality. The rotors fold up for storage, but when you open them up you can't even spin them. There is so much resistance that you have to manually move the blades, you can't give them a push and watch them spin. My son was very disappointed by this. Additionally, the day after I paid over $30 for this thing on Amazon, I saw this exact helicopter at Walmart for $10. This was a complete waste of money. Boo.

This is an excellent pouch, especially for the price. I bought this to use as a gun cleaning kit to store all of my gun cleaning brushes, tools, and rods. After putting my tools in, there is still plenty of room for a small bottle of solvent and a can of Rem oil. The fabric is heavy duty and so is the zipper. The velcro straps are very rugged and hold well, and should I ever decide to strap this pouch onto my belt or pack, I trust it will stay put. I expect this thing will last for many years. A great buy.

Got this shirt for my father in law because he is into the Breaking Bad series. He loved it. I bought the light gray version, and the shirt is exactly as shown in the photo. On thing to pay attention to when deciding what size to get is that these shirts are already preshrunk, so order what size you really wear. No need to order a size larger to account for shrinkage.

My son loves to shovel the snow, but he struggled with the size and weight of my big shovels so we got him this little kid sized shovel. The shovel appears to be just about as durable as adult size plastic shovel. The day he got it he spent about an hour oustide moving snow around the yard with his new shovel. He loves it. Plus, it's great exercise!

Our 3 year old is completely obsessed with Wild Kratts, and he was thrilled about getting this DVD for Christmas. The show is an excellent show for kids that actually stimulates their mind and they learn things about animals and nature. I love it when my son tells me all about the animal facts he learns from this show. If your child even remotely has an interest in animals or nature, they will love this show.

For less than $25, this is pretty good wine rack. Assembly is required, which is no big deal. It's kind of like putting a really easy puzzle together, and the only tool you need is a phillips screwdriver.I ordered the lighter colored one, and the color is pretty true to the picture. It looks good. After putting together, I noticed that this wine rack was a little bit wobbly on the counter top, but once you put a bottle or two of wine into the rack it sits completely stable and solid. This wine rack is pretty good for the price and I would probably buy it again.

Our 3 year old loves everything to do with cowboys. He has the hat, belt, boots, gun belt, horse, and now this lasso. We never got him a lasso rope because of the obvious risks, but this particular one has a nice little safety feature that makes this much safer for him to play with. The rope has two little velcro tabs attached to the rope that are used to make the lasso loop. While it looks like a real lasso loop, if more than a couple pounds of force are applied to the rope the velcro tabs come loose breaking the lasso loop. We are comfortable with this, and he absolutely loves it.

I realize that a screen protector is just a piece of plastic, but there is one major problem with this particular one. The little round cut out hole for the front button on the Incredible is about twice as large as it needs to be. This creates a "ridge" where dust and lint collects, and eventually the protector will start to lift up at that spot. I will not buy this screen protector again.

There are a few problems with this RC truck, which warrant this low rating. First, the range of the remote control is terrible. If the truck gets any more than 10 feet, yes, only 10 feet, it will be out of range and stop working. Secondly, the levers on the controller are tiny. They only stand about a centimeter tall, which makes them impossible  to actually grab with a thumb and forefinger. You can only use your thumbs, and since the tops of the buttons are slippery plastic, it is difficult to drive the truck without your thumbs constantly slipping off of the buttons. Third, the turn radius of this thing is pathetic. We have a pretty large living room, and there is not enough space for this truck to do a complete circle. This thing looks like it would need at least a 15 foot circle to be able to turn around. For the price paid ($35) you would expect a higher quality RC truck. As my title says, this is pretty crappy.

I got this for my 10 year old who loves to eat smores when we go camping. He likes it, and so do we. It is exactly as pictured, and is actually a little larger than expected. The ceramic "roaster" is made of pretty thick material, so it appears that it will hold up pretty well.About the fuel, don't waste your money buying the ridiculously overpriced little 2.6oz sterno fuel cans that only burn for 45min. I bought a case of 12 of the larger 6 hour fuel cans at Sam's Club for only $12. The larger fuel cans don't fit through the side opening of the s'mores maker, but you just need to lift up the "grill grate" and drop the fuel can in that way.

I got this case for my Saiga AK rifle chambered in .223. In regard to length, the 38 inch version fits my Saiga perfectly with about a half an inch of length to spare. I like a nice snug fit like that so the rifle isn't sliding around inside the case. In regard to height, I do have a scope mounted on my rifle and this case gives plenty of clearance.The padding is actually quite a bit thicker than I expected, which was a nice surprise. The zippers are heavy duty and I expect them to last. The pockets on the side accommodate a 30 round magazine perfectly, and I was pleasantly surprised at how strong the velcro is on the closure flaps. They will definitely stay closed, and I won't have to worry at all about a magazine falling out on its own.The outside shell looks pretty durable, and similar to luggage tags, there is a little clear plastic sleeve where you can insert a tag with your name or logo if you choose to. I probably won't use that feature, but I thought it is worth mentioning. The carry straps look to be good quality and the stitching is reinforce pretty well. One thing I really like is that this case has a shoulder strap. For some reason the strap is not shown in the product photos, but this is a big plus in my book.Overall, this is an excellent case for the money and I would definitely buy again.

There is really no reason for this book to be as long as it its. Not that it is incredibly long, but the whole book could easily be summed up in less than 10 pages. It is very repetitive, and chalked full of filler, explaining the same thing over and over again.Here's my one sentence summary of the book:The typical millionaire owns their own business, is married, drives a used car, lives well below their means, and is very modest with their wealth.The whole point of the book is to explain that the typical millionaire does not live like Donald Trump. I guess it is geared for people who have never thought about that concept before? Other than generating a book to sell, I can't see why it would take so many pages to explain this fact.

I'm a return customer. These are great bags that seal well and hold up well. Labels also stick to these bags very well.Just a word of warning, I want to specify that I always purchase from Amazon seller "Collecting Warehouse", and have gotten great quality every time. I've bought these bags from other Amazon sellers in the past and have gotten low quality bags that look nothing like the pictures. For that reason, I always buy from "Collecting Warehouse" and get exactly what is pictured every time.

I can't stand clipping a light on the book, so I was looking for a light that would attach to the headboard. I wanted something that was bright enough to read clearly in the dark, but is still focused enough that it won't light up the whole room. This little light works perfectly for that.It has two brightness settings, and most of the time I only use the low setting as it provides enough reading light for me. The brighter setting is pretty darn bright, and is pretty impressive from such a small light. The light it emits is not really 100% pure white light. It does have a very slight bluish/purpleish hue to it, but nowhere near the blueness of some of the cheap reading lights I've used in the past.If you are considering clipping this on your headboard, make sure you measure the width of your headboard first. The clip on this light only opens about 1.5 inches wide, and my headboard is about 2 inches wide. To solve this, I simply screwed a small piece of 1/4 inch thick wood to the back side of the headboard so that it sticks up about 1 inch higher than the headboard on my side of the bed. I just clip the light to that. This doesn't damage the finished side of the headboard, so if I ever stop using this light, I can just remove the little piece of wood.I've used this light nightly for the last several months now and have not had to replace the batteries yet. Battery life appears pretty good. Overall, this is THE BEST reading light I've found and if this one ever wears out I will be buying another just like it.

This mouse works great. The buttons and the wheel are nice and smooth and work reliably. It works great on every surface I've tried so far. I like to sit with my laptop in my leather recliner and the mouse works great on the padded leather arm rest of the chair.One thing I like is that the black part on the sides has a sort of "grippy" feeling to it, which makes it very easy to hang on to. It feels rubberized, like you'll find in a lot on non-slip phone cases. I like it.This mouse is very responsive, and starts working immediately when I turn it on. I just leave the little USB plug in my laptop and then turn the mouse on or off whenever I use it.This is a regular sized mouse. I can't stand those teeny mice that a lot of people have. I'm glad the photos had an image of the mouse in someone's hand so you could get an idea of the size. I've had this mouse for a couple of months now, and have zero complaints. Highly recommend.

I wish I would have video taped myself watching this movie to see all the various facial expressions I was exhibiting while I was trying to process what in the heck was going on in this film. There is very little dialogue (almost none), so it leaves a lot to the imagination as to what "One Eye" is really all about. He is a very stoic personality.This movie was boring and difficult to sit through, while at the same time I was intensely intrigued by the rawness and mystery of what was going to happen. Having not read any reviews about the movie before watching it, I had an open mind about the film and was completely surprised by the way it turned out. The movie almost seems like a gritty, intense, and terrible dream.This is not a typical movie, so if you are looking for lots of action or wise cracks then look elsewhere. But, if you want to experience something quite bizarre and a little bit disturbing, check this out.

I've had this Kodak M580 for a couple of years now. I wanted something that took quality pictures, had a good amount of optical zoom, and had a decent amount of features, but not some $500+ camera with a bunch of features that I would never use. This camera fits the bill perfectly.The 8X zoom Schneider lens is really great. It lets you get in nice and close and the auto focus does a really good job when zooming in. You can also change the setting to macro, which will let you take close up pictures of really small things like flowers or other small objects and still pick up the fine details. The LCD screen is big enough to see well, and give a nice clear image when viewing the photos you've taken.I also use this camera to take product photos for my business. The macro feature combined with the the adjustable exposure compensation makes it really easy to take nice and bright, vibrant, close up photos of our products. I barely have to edit the images at all before uploading them to the web. If you sell products on ebay or your own website, this camera works perfect for taking excellent product photos.I didn't bother with the Kodak software that came with it, I just plug it in to my PC and retrieve the pictures just like I would off of a flash drive. I would definitely buy this camera again if the one I have ever lets me down, but so far I've had zero problems and only good things to say. This was a good buy.

I was pretty apprehensive about this movie before I watched it, mainly because it was on subject of dragons. I'm not big on stories about make believe creatures, or wizards, or magic, or any of that Harry Potter type stuff. Surprisingly though, this movie was not like that at all.It takes place in a post-apocalyptic earth, where the human race is dwindling on extinction and the remaining survivors are struggling to endure. The characters played by Christian Bale and Matthew McConaughey are both pretty intriguing, and much of the plot involves the ego battle that goes on between the two.The special effects are done well, and by that I mean that the creators of this movie did not go overboard with special effects. They used CGI with discretion, and the scenes that actually had dragons in them were done pretty tastefully.Ultimately, this is a story about human survival and overcoming the odds in a very troubled world. I liked it, and I will likely be watching this one again in the future.

We use quite a bit of packaging tape and have tried several different brands. Generally, I've found that the really cheap stuff has a lot of memory to it and tends to curl on you while you are trying to stick it where you want it. This Scotch tape comes off the roll with practically zero memory, which makes it very easy to handle. I used to buy this 6 pack at Sam's Club but now the price here on Amazon is actually less than Sam's, and with Amazon Prime I get it delivered for free, which is awesome.Regarding stickiness, I've never experienced anything like that video reviewer with the Kleenex box in their review. They must have gotten a bad batch, or maybe that particular Amazon seller stored their inventory somewhere that wasn't climate controlled and the tape just degraded. This tape is as sticky as can be, and I've never had issues with it not being sticky enough. In fact, if I accidentally stick it somewhere on a box and try to remove the piece of tape, it takes part of the box off with it.This tape gets the job done consistently, which is why I continue to buy it.

I bought this WRT54G router back in 2005. I've had three different desktop computers come and go during that time, and this router has always been a snap to set up each time I got a new computer. I've never really had any problems with it at all, and it works just like it should very consistently.I've done the firmware upgrade through the control panel a few times just to keep the firmware current, although I have not noticed any difference in performance (either good or bad) from any of the upgrades. This thing just works like it is supposed to. We have another desktop PC that uses a linksys wireless adapter to get signal from this router. Since they are both linksys products, linking them together was pretty simple too. We also have two laptops, and iPod touch, and my phone, which can all connect flawlessly.Setting up the wifi security features is pretty straight forward, and since this is a pretty popular model there is a lot of help available online if you're not too computer savvy. I've considered buying a newer wireless router, but I just can't justify spending money on a new router when this 7 year old WRT54G is still going strong and giving me zero problems.Quick Tip: If you want to "boost" your wireless signal, do a google search for "windsurfer antenna". It is a neat (and free) little way to increase the effectiveness of your wifi signal by making little signal deflectors out of paper and aluminum foil. It helps when you have your router on one side of the house and get a weak signal on the other side of the house. It doesn't actually boost your signal, but it just allows you to get the most out of the signal. I did notice a difference when I utilized this tip.

This weather radio is very basic. It is nice that it has the SAME feature which allows you to only receive alerts for your immediate local area, but this weather radio is lacking one very important feature. This weather radio does not have the ability to select which types of alerts you want to be notified of.For example, I live on top of a hill so I definitely do not want to be awakened in the middle of the night for a flash flood alert. I bought this mainly to be alerted of tornado related weather, but this thing goes off for EVERY SINGLE alert that goes out. Moments before I started writing this review, the weather radio went off for a thunderstorm watch, not a warning, a watch.This weather radio works just as it is supposed to, and the alert sounds that come out of this thing will definitely wake up the heaviest of sleepers. But, the inability to change which alerts you want and which alerts you don't want make this weather radio very annoying. I am going to buy the Midland WR300, which has this very important feature.

I use this charger regularly. The best part is that you can charge a battery without having to have the battery in the phone. I have extra batteries, and when my phone battery starts getting low I just take the fresh one off of the charger and put the dead one from the phone back on the charger.The "cradle" part of the charger is ok. Getting the phone to plug into it correctly is kind of a pain sometimes. I think that is mainly due to the design of the charging port on the phone, not the cradle's fault. The charging port on the phone has this little rubber tab that covers it when not in use, and that rubber tab gets in the way when trying to plug the phone into the cradle. Other than that, it works just fine. I have Activesync on my computer, and I just plug my phone into the cradle and my files are automatically synced to my PC.I think the only downside is that this device requires two usb ports. One to provide power to the battery charger on the back, and one to allow data transfer between the phone and the computer. Most computers have lots of usb ports though, so that's not really a big deal but I thought it was worth mentioning.

I've been using the Samsung i760 for a few years now. It is a pocket PC, so it uses a lot more juice than a normal phone. I leave the wifi turned on all day long while I'm working so I can get emails as they arrive. If I were to try this with the standard battery the phone came with, the battery would only last half the day. This extended battery literally does last twice as long as the standard battery.Unless I do an unusual amount of web surfing on my phone, this extended battery will last the entire day and into the evening. Usually around bed time it will notify me that the battery is getting low, but by then I'm ready to plug it in for the night anyway. I have three of these extended batteries. I always have one in the phone, a fresh one in my bag, and the other one on the charger at home.The standard battery works ok if you're only using this device as a phone, but if you're going to be checking email or surfing the web you'll definitely need at least one of these extended batteries. It is about twice as thick as the standard battery and adds a little bit of bulk to the device, but that is to be expected. I highly recommend getting the charging cradle that has a spot on the back where you can charge an extra battery. This way you can charge an extra battery without having the battery installed on the phone. When your phone battery gets low you can just grab the fresh one off of the charger and put the dead one on the charger.One thing to note is that since the extended battery is thicker than the standard, most protective cases for the i760 will not fit anymore because they are designed to fit the phone with the standard battery. There are cases that allow for the extended battery, but just be sure to pay attention to that detail when shopping for a protective case.

I liked The Grapes of Wrath, so I decided to give this Steinbeck novel a whirl. While the book did delve deep into the characters and their personalities, the characters are completely boring and the book was a snooze fest. In fact, several times I found myself reaching for this book when I was having trouble getting to sleep some nights. Worked like a charm.The subject matter is drab, and the characters are less than enchanting. You can tell from near the beginning of the book that this "moral man" (Ethan) is eventually going to decide that succeeding in the world is more important to him than his ethics. Surprise, surprise, another fool sells his soul in the pursuit of wealth.Steinbeck is known for being a master of the English language, and I won't argue with that. The use of words and phrases in this book are obviously brilliant, however, that is ALL this book has going for it. I agree with how one other reviewer described this book as "a silly, tiresome book that is micro-smart, and macro-dumb, dumb, dumb".

Like the title says, this is the BEST gel pen that I've found. You wouldn't think that something as simple as a pen can make much of difference but it really does. Here are the features that make this pen 1000 times better than cheapo ball point pens and worth spending a little extra money.1. Bold, easily readable ink - If you write a word with a ball point pen, and then write a word next to it with this pen, you would immediately notice how much more bold and vibrant the letters are on the page. Much easier to read.2. Smooooooth writing - That's right, this roller ball just glides across the paper. You really don't need a hard surface to write on like you would with a traditional ball point pen.3. Even ink distribution - The ink comes out evenly and uniformly. You will not have any globs of ink on you paper.4. Retraction mechanism - It has a smooth click and works as it should every time. Plus, I feel that a retractable pen is much better than a capped pen because you can just pull it out of your pocket and click it with one hand rather than having to use two hands to remove a cap.5. Comfortable grip - I like that this padded grip is uniformly shaped and not "bulbous" like the Pilot G2. It just makes the pen easier to hold.6. Clear body - The plastic body is clear so you can see how much ink is left.7. Durability - These pens hold up very well. I carry one in my back pocket with my pocket noteboook. I am sitting on this pen constantly throughout the day and have never had one break or come apart. The little clip is flexible enough to easily clip onto whatever you need, but rugged enough that it will not break easily.So, there you have it. The best every day pen in the world. Do yourself a favor and try one. You won't regret it.

We are very happy with these baking dishes. The polka dot pattern looks good, and they are very thick and durable feeling. I was looking around at this brand and noticed that I could get this combo set for about the same price as just one of the dishes individually. I was a little unsure about ordering breakable dishes online, but they arrived intact. We cooked an egg bake in the large rectangular dish for brunch today and it worked great and cleaned up easily. This was a good buy.

The exercise bands in this set are better than what you were expecting - made of very high quality materials, durable yet extremely pliable. I've been using them consistently over the last month and they look exactly the way they do when I opened the package. The design and storage lets me throw it in my purse so I can get my workout in during my lunch break while I'm in my own office. They've help my flexibility too. I can touch my toes now! The bands are clearly labeled and color coded so you know which is more or less difficult. It's fun to experiment with the different combinations. I can do leg and arm all with the same bands. I say go forward with this investment in yourself! Square one has commenced!

Although the genre is a bit of a blend of everything, I just couldn't stop reading about this world of the wild protagonist Yumi. From the get go, you're thrown into the action within tense card game then into a revolution, moving from one adventure to the next. It just doesn't stop. I like it.I can't wait for the next one.

Menghedi is the type of book that makes a huge impression on you as you read it. It beautifully narrates the story of two women who's paths have no semblance of anything that I have ever gone through. It made me feel very fortunate but also so incredibly inspired by the two women's strength and resolve to do what they set out to do.The author allowed both Ma'arinet and Timneet to develop as characters in very sophisticated literary fashion. I was able to tell that the author, Semhar Gebre, was a well-seasoned writer who took the time and invested in developing the story properly. As an avid reader, that is greatly appreciated and something I am always happy to see. The intertwining and culmination of the women's plights was beautifully written and moving, but also unexpected. The originality of Menghedi, Two Women, Two Journeys, One Hope for Freedom just bleeds through the pages. Any reader who appreciates reading outside of their cultural norm will love this book. It taught me a lot and feel much more open to the world around me after reading. Brilliant body of work!

As someone relatively new to the debate between science and religion, I think this was a great impartial ground to get some perspective on both sides. The author was able to succinctly point out contradictions, misunderstandings, and outright absurdity from religious and scientific fundamentalists. Delusions serves well to arm an individual with the understanding to come up with their own understanding of what reality, truth, and existence are.Stanislaw Kapuscinski is a formidable writer who commands the attention of his readers because of his ability to conceptualize rather sophisticated dogmas from religion and science. He is willing and unafraid to challenged those assertions. The more we engage in this type of discussion, the closer we will be able to have steadfast answers to questions that have eluded modern mankind. Delusions, by Stanislaw Kapuscinski is an imperative step in that direction!

First things first, this product is amazing. It's one of my best purchases. I am definitely a repeat customer because I can clearly see differences in my body appearance. Slim Extreme 3d Thermo Active Slimming Serum makes me look way thinner. I did it a few months before my wedding and it made my body look incredible. In a swimsuit or in a tight dress there is clearly a difference. It makes me look more feminine in my silhouette and I'm not as self-conscious as I've always been. I don't know how, but the product gets warm on your skin and you feel that it is working. I use it on my thighs mostly - especially the sides and back of legs. Its works WONDERS. I know many women want to have a sexier body in terms of appearance and size, so the Slim Extreme 3d Active Slimming Serum is definitely the go-to. Get it now!

Show Your Work! is really a novel conceptual idea. The author, Austin Kleon, deserves a world of credit for his ability to weave such profound conceptual ideas into a body of work that really appeals to his audience. He knows his subject matter well, and that is demonstrated page-by-page.I came across this book after reading Creativity, 63 short exercises to a Happier Life by Dr. Andrew M. Goodman. It is another great book in the genre that speaks to the artist/creative types who sometimes need strategies to channel our focus and realign our imaginations. It can be easy to get caught up, but these two books definitely resonate with me and put me back in a good place where I'm able to thrive. I would definitely recommend both Show Your Work! by Austin Kleon as well as Creativity: 63 Short Exercises to a Happier Life by Dr. Andrew M. Goodman. They will be your lifesavers!

This book will help you overcome your inhibitions with regard to people and social situations. It has techniques and strategies to do this effectively and in little to no time. There is no better resource than this one. The author, Marcus Felix, speaks from a perspective of expertise and knowledge. He is talented enough to bring a taboo topic that many people are not comfortable with admitting to the forefront. I would say that the situational solutions part is especially helpful, because it lets you pinpoint the exact moments and conditions under which the social anxiety and shyness reaches a high level.Another great part of the book is that it communicates that many people struggle with this - it is something that you can combat though and get constant improvement. Trustworthy and effective resource for shy people with anxiety to try out if nothing else has worked.

Internet Scam for Beginner is a crash-course in what the better decisions are to make online. It can be a dangerous place where anyone can be taken advantage of, so it's nice there is something out there to turn to. So many people have become victims, so it's important to know what to avoid and the guidelines that will keep your information and money safe. The best advice is how con artists work. Never be to quick to trust everything that you see online, because remember that anyone can say anything on the internet.

Unwell gave me a strong stirring from the moment I began reading. It reads like it comes out of an entirely different time period. To a great extent I felt at times moved and at other times deeply disturbed. Readers have to be ready for a roller coaster of emotions and times where you will sit and question how minor your own troubles seem.The author, Marie Chow, is a talented and unwavering writer. I've never read something so powerful. The book will hit you like a brick wall yet you won't be able to put it down. Unwell simply can not be categorized. However, it still manages to stand out as a game-changing piece of literary fiction. This body of work successfully integrates powerful social commentary, individual decision-making in high-risk circumstances, and cultural commentary in a masterful way. Take heed, and pause, but do not hesitate to read Unwell by Marie Chow.

Practicing Meditation is not something that comes easy for me. However, Wherever You Go, There You Are: Mindfulness Meditation In Everyday Life struck a chord with me early on. From the outset I was drawn to the poetic nature of the book and the way the author seemed to be killing me softly with his words. I immediately felt that this was going to be a life changing experience.I came across this book after reading How to Get Out of this World Alive: The Ultimate Self-Empowerment Handbook (Volume 1) Alain Forget. It is also another book in the genre that introduced me to higher thinking of self. It allowed me to think at a larger scale about my work and how to grasp my career in a way that would bring me fulfillment. Combined with the meditation techniques, I can honesty say that I see and feel in ways that I never thought I was capable of. If you feel something in you that is telling you to reach new mental heights, I would recommend these two books. It will surely be a powerful experience!

Plague of Love is a prime romantic novel that meets all expectations for the genre and then some. I love that there were emotional elements that went beyond just romantic love. There was love about life and death with regard to the illness. There were social dynamics between the powerful and the powerless.I thought the author, Morris Fenris, played on so many ideas in such expert ways. I was very impressed from start to finish. The book stands out in the paranormal fantasy genre, while being an urban classic that is perfect for young adults. I came across Plague of Love after reading Christmas Healing, all part of the Healing the Regime Series. I would recommend readers to check out all of these novels. These are great bodies of work that will make a great impression on readership.

Intimate Conversations is really a novel and unique approach to saving or taking a marriage to a new level. It has so much potential for growth between two people. I was really impressed at how good of an idea this is and it leaves readers eager for more.The author, Bill Syrios, is a very good writer and knows really well how to encourage two people to break down those barriers and open up to each other. The book is broken up into different parts, so it can really last for a long time. Couples can use the book at their own pace, decide which stories and parts are their favorites. This way the book allows for a lot of creative control and personalization. No two people and no couple is going to be the same, so it's good that the book is flexible. So many relationships will grow and be made stronger after engaging in this book, Intimate Conversations for Couples.

Stanislaw Kapuscinski has written a major body of work that is unparalleled in the genre of self-help/motivational. I considered this to be another gem of his writing. It explores complex and sophisticated subject matter about life, death, and the balance between the two. No other writer has ever been able to take such weighty topics and turn it into a master body of work that is aimed at getting readers to think critically about themselves and their place in life.I found this book, Key to Immortality very compelling. Many philosophers and historians shy away or are intimidated by the gospels and the teaching of Jesus Christ. However, the author takes that head on with the gospel of Thomas. No reservations and 100% unapologetic, this book will challenge everything about immortality that you know and have yet to know!

SEO is definitely still uncharted territory for those of us who still live in the real world. The truth is though that there is so much untapped potential and customers that we have to reach online. SEO is the way to reach them, and this book is the way for you to learn how. Reading it gave me so much insight and direction into the concept. It's all about ranking on Google and other search engines. I love how current this book is. As young as underdeveloped as SEO is, this book is already more knowledge-filled than your typical intro book.Reading SEO Fundamentals: An Introductory Course to the World of Search Engine Optimization (The SEO University)will have you right at the top of your online presence game, reaching more people than ever before, and be on the cutting edge of what the next moves in this world are! The author, R.L. Adams is a clear expert, who shares his knowledge generously and plainly!

A Moral Dilemma threw me for a new to say the least. I didn't expect to find so much that resonated with me. I, too, feel for Rebecca so much about living in the wrong generation. But I also felt that her judgments about her friends and others went a little too far. All in all, I laughed many times at the comedic elements, but also felt lots of emotions as the relationship had its share of trouble. There are many fine lines to straddle with this book, and I like that it allows for the discussion about right/wrong.A lot of women can benefit from thinking about this in a truly critical way. Perfect for ladies' book club! I can not fail to mention Isabella Coombs, honestly one of the most intriguing people I have ever met! Please read about this interesting story. It is the perfect humorous romantic novel!

Enigma of the Second Coming is a novel that you have to be mentally prepared for. It challenges conventional frames of mind and forces you to think about time, space, and power in new creative ways. This is a good and unique way to introduce yourself to concepts about metaphysics and theology into a progressive plot that has strong themes about love, family, and relationships.Stan I.S. Law always delivers on thought-provoking books that stand apart in the genre. This time, Enigma of the Second Coming, stands boldly in the science fiction genre as unlike any of the others. John, Hey, and J.J. were all dynamic and compelling characters that developed in dramatic ways and contributed to the story's momentum in valuable ways. I think there is so much more to read in-between the lines of these pages. Not only will I be reading Enigma of the Second Coming a second time, but as I am a fan of his writing, I will also be looking out for more of Law's work!

This is a problem that many of us have, but don't know we suffer from it. Not until we move to a new place or do spring cleaning do we realize how stuck with our possessions we are. Dr. Andrew M. Goodman delivers here a novel book that every single family can benefit from reading and applying to our lives. I think this is a great first step in making even grander changes in our lives for the better.Un-Clutter is exactly what the doctor ordered! You don't have to be a hoarder or a pack rat to benefit from removing the clutter from your life. Personally, I started small using some of the simpler tips in the book and became more confident to make drastic changes. I'm happier for the better. Not only is my home better off, but my mental state is new and fresh. I think my memory has improved, my mood has lightened, and I finally know the exact location of all of my belongings. Un-clutter! 66 Routes to a Freer Life was one of my best book decisions.

A good vitamin C serum is something that many of us are looking for. This one is good because it is honest and open about its ingredients. It takes someone who knows their own skin to care for it properly. If you know anything about skincare, you know that vitamins C and E are absolutely essential. For wrinkles and fine lines, it's really the only thing that works. It's by a credible brand, made in the USA, and in an FDA-certified facility, which makes any customer feel very confident in their product. It works wonders! I'm so tired of buying those over $100 products that claim to have vitamin C and E. I'm finally getting this one for myself!

This wasn't a gruesome bloody murder book; it was a true mystery solve-the-case type of book. It challenges your own intellectual capacity in the psychological sense. Every part of the book gives you another clue and brings you closer to figuring out for yourself who the killer is. In that way, it seems that the author, James Kipling, intended to create an indirectly interactive book.For anyone interested in British detective murder mysteries, The Dart Murders is a great choice. It's well-written and there's a lot of sophisticated banter to keep you on your toes. Discovering the killer was an incredible shock and thrill. I genuinely had a lot of fun reading The Dart Murders.

Science fiction is a genre that surely brings a set of expectations about the creative and, usually, irrational leaps that the author will make. Stan I.S. Law's version of science fictions makes some of those leaps, but somehow they all seem entirely plausible. After reading the Gift of Gamman, I'm entirely convinced that this is our very near future. It's almost as if this journey has already taken place, and by Stan I.S. Law himself, because of the detail-oriented nature of the book, the flow of events, and the way everything culminates into something grander that will move mankind further ahead.I'm still processing a lot of the book, well after finishing, because it was simply so much to take in. I'm very struck by these spectacular characters and their various gifts. Stan I.S. Law, I am looking forward to your continued ownership and raising the bar of the science fiction genre!

My heart goes out to all the others out there who are wrestling with this disease or who are sharing the experience with a loved one who is struggling as well. This is an awful disease, so I'm so glad that there is a resource out there that is honest and wants to provide a comprehensible guide to the disease.The author is absolutely right - Lung Cancer is not just limited to smokers, it affects more people than that. This book has the answers to this devastating mystery. To be from a trusted, M.D. who is well-versed in the subject, has studied it first-hand, and is an undeniable expert, this was the obvious choice to understanding the disease wholly. Dr. Naheed Ali writes from an objective manner, telling the complete truth.I like that it doesn't read like a textbook, but doesn't patronize people who are suffering either. It is detailed and specific, but gives you what you want to know about alleviating symptoms, what makes it more bearable. I just consider this Understanding Lung Cancer: An Introduction for Patients and Caregivers to be indispensable for me and my loved one during this time.

The author, Brett Blumenthal, is really on to something big with this book. It has an incredibly impressive philosophy and tried-and-true approach to improving our lives based on what we want to change. I don't know if I have even been able to keep one "resolution" I have ever made. But small-scale changes is something that anyone can live with! For me, I did stuff like remove condiments from my diet, bike to work once a day, things like that.I did these things in conjunction with reading another book, No Work, No Problem!  Stop working, Start living! by Dr. Andrew M. Goodman and it's made a real improvement in many aspects. It was really a stellar book about how to change the way I approach working a job. I've found lots of independence in a part of my life that I thought I'd always be a slave to. These two books together have put me on a very profound journey where my old self is pretty much unrecognizable. I encourage readers to dive into both - Brett Bluenthal's 52 Small Changes and Dr. Andrew M. Goodman's No Work No Problem!

The camera gives excellent images. Clarity is great and the night vision is fantastic. It's a wide angle camera and the varifocal is very good for getting the angle of view I want. I connected the camera to DVR directly and adjusted the focus and zoom to my satisfaction before hooked it up. No issue with the camera or install. Good for basic CCTV needs, would recommend this for usage at places like yard or any place where you need some finer details.

This book will really appeal to people who are interested in family dynamics. The author found such a great way to engage her readers by using these stellar sister characters. They were so different. They know each other so well. The rivalry between the two is really a long-time coming. It was inevitable that something like a man would threaten to come between them and ultimately test their bond. The main focus though it about Mid and her self-development, empowerment, and coming into herself. I enjoyed reading about her journey.I think the author, Prentice Prefontaine, did a remarkable piece of work. It is well-written, concise, entertaining, and very engaging. It had just enough dialogue to match the descriptions of each character so that we really got a great picture of everyone's image and personality. It would have been nice if it were just a tad longer, but great job!

How to Retire Happy, Wild, and Free by Ernie Zelinski is a very informative and encouraging book about how to make the most of life at a time after you've retired from working. A lot of us have expectations for retirement, but this book will really put things in perspective and provide ideas about how to go about retirement in a wiser way.I was introduced to this book after reading No Work, No Problem!  Stop working, Start living! by Dr. Andrew M. Goodman. His book was extremely forthright and telling about how to take control of your work life and career for yourself. Now, I needed to read further on how to apply that philosophy to retirement. Both of these books are very life-changing and have shown me a wealth of new ideas for how to take on this important life changes and the challenges that come with them. I am very satisfied and on my way with knowledge!

The collection of poems in This Land of Streams: Spiritual, Friendship, Romantic and World Event Poems were deeply moving and inspirational. I felt a power consume me - especially while reading the spiritual poems. It is clear that the author, Maria Johnsen, has lots of experience in writing poetry and has become very skilled with her words.Anyone who is seeking some peace or solace through literature - this is a great way to reach that. The topics covered are extremely dynamic and cover all kinds of relationships between people. Whether friendship, romantic, or spiritual, there is something that you can connect with. It will change the way you view the world. For me the poetry makes me calmer and more appreciative of others in my life. My worldview about the Earth and its people has widened a great deal, and This Land of Streams has contributed in a huge way.

You will be telling all of your friends to read Light and Shadows once you're done with it. I am impressed with the creativity and expert story development by the author, Estela Vazquez Perez. She created characters that were dynamic and were struggling with very real and very specific circumstances. She intertwined them in a way that contributed to a unique plot, one that competes with some of the best books in the genre.In my opinion, the romance genre has suffered for a while, but Light Shadows gets me excited about it all over again. The author takes a lot of expertise from the entertainment industry and seamlessly weaves it into her plot and the character's professional lives. We also get very moral lessons about others who are less fortunate and are going through trying times. Overall I felt Light and Shadows was well-written and balanced literary themes from a host of genres at a remarkable level. Dynamic romance novel, to say the least!

Any related topic that falls under the umbrella of self-help that includes psychology and spirituality is covered in How to Get Out of this World Alive. It's really all-encompassing. You can tell that the authors, Alain Forget and others, speak from a place of real expertise and first-hand knowledge. It's also really impressive how all of their views align very cohesively. At the end you are equipped with the proper background knowledge, an array of choices and views, and the tools to move forward. Each person's journey is different, and I think that's an important aspect of How to Get Out of this World Alive. The one thing that is across the board is that you have to be able to overcome those mental and subconscious obstacles that keep your life static.There is a lot to learn from this book. Before reading, I had a hard time conceptualizing ego, evolution, enlightenment, distancing, and other concepts. How to Get Out of this World Alive made everything so clear to me. Some of it is really sophisticated, and this described things in a way where I could apply it to my own life to identify, target, and act differently than before. Great resource, and extremely well-written piece of non-fiction!

My favorite part about Legendary Detective Where the World Begins was getting really consumed with the setting. The author, Kaye Wagner, brings us to this place of color and bright lights where all kinds of things can happen. I imagined myself in some sort of Mardi Gras-esque event. In fact, it wasn't just the setting, but the characters are described in detail, so we can imagine their mannerisms and expressions in addition to what they are saying.This is a really solid book. It aligns nice between coming-of-age cyberpunk and paranormal dystopian. So any fans of those genres will find Legendary Detective Where the World Begins to be a great match. The collection is always a go-to for me; They've all made great impressions in terms of readership, and this one definitely is a stand-out. I'm really impressed with the ability of the author to create a special society in its own time and space with such depth. Fantastic literature!

The Seeker was an incredibly engaging book because of its incredible creativity. It was absolutely brilliant to write it in the first person. I felt like Jerry was talking directly to me, like he was confiding in me, and I alone would be aware of his struggle.The author, Jerome Gilden invested a lot of time and utilized so much creativity and uniqueness in this story, making it truly one-of-a-kind. I felt like I was reading an entire new genre that had the features of an apocalyptic thriller, while also balancing a coming-of-age war thriller. It was thrilling. There was a great amount of cultural accuracy as well, which I always appreciate in a piece of fiction. All of his friends are really dynamic characters as well. As a whole, I thoroughly enjoyed The Seeker and highly recommend it to anyone interested!

I've never read a book like Chasing Pretty before. It is not cliché at all, the story is so original. Such a high level of interest was maintained throughout it all. Chasing Pretty balanced the story of a teenage girl with complex elements so well. From her peer issues, to her family problems, to her relationship drama, it's all very complicated while being extraordinary and unique. When the magic gets introduced in the storyline, it is very special, and I felt so excited to see what was to come. Ashlyn, who to say the least is suffering from such a bizarre spin on a typical problem, has to go through significant character building and self-realization. There is such a valuable lesson, also.All in all, the multiple plots all came full circle. Chasing Pretty was very enjoyable, and the author, Jennifer Lark, did a superb job with her writing.

The analogy that the author employs for 5 Gears Diet is one-of-a-kind. I think its effective in getting readers to conceptualize weight loss in a whole new way - which leads to unexpected realizations and new perspective. The book is full of useful information, but the best parts is that the author, Diana Artene, always comes back to her most fundamental rules.After you have read it, you leave with those basic understandings. So long as you don't depart from that, you can go about weight loss in a very pragmatic and realistic way. 5 Gears Diet is not a step-by-step, do-this approach. It wants to completely reverse the harm that the food industry has done to us. So many people are missing out on this information. Not only does this book contain the most important aspects of weight loss, but it can save your life, improve your quality of life, and change mindsets. Truly groundbreaking stuff!

A lot of twenty-somethings are experiencing this kind of mental crises. I think a lot of it is because of the changing economy, but there is so much more introspection and questioning of one's place in the world. Everyone's challenges aren't the same though, so I felt that this book, The Existential Millennial Crisis, was great at addressing all the different ways people are questioning themselves. Whether its with love, religion, work, or any other way, people are on self-discovery.The author, Paul Huhn writes very honestly and direct. His strategy for assuring readers that the phenomenon is nothing to be ashamed of, or shy away from is very encouraging. It's enabling this thought process without being grim, which I think is very helpful. This was a solid read. Without hesitation, I would suggest The Existential Millennial Crisis to many people that I know.

Weight Loss by Quitting Sugar and Carb is a very eye-opening book. It will reveal many things to you that you may have known, but really did not know the impact and how embedded it is in our culture. It is good that there is a resource like this one out there that can give us a straightforward account of the harms we are imposing on ourselves.Weight Loss by Quitting Sugar and Carb also gives you rock-solid advice and leads on where to go and what to do once you've been enlightened. When I tried these things for myself I definitely experienced the mood swings and the digestive reactions to the changes in my diet. I am absolutely confident that these things are better for my long-term health. We have to start being serious about these realities because we are really in danger. I don't want to live with any regrets, so I'm glad I found this book to really steer me in the right direction!

One of the great things about this Marvin Clark book was that we were able to get into his mind so intimately. Then when Jocelyn emerges she throws him as well as the reader in for a new awakening. I felt moved by so many of the passages. For me, it really challenged preconceptions about what impact a person can really have on your life. This is way more than a love story, it's about companionship and opening yourself up.Marvin Clark - In Search of Freedom will really exceed all of your expectations and impact you personally in dramatic ways. The author, Stan I.S. Law is truly one-of-a-kind, intelligent, and a master of literature. He has set the bar for what a romance novel has the potential to be.

Legendary Detective in the City of Kings told a set of really exciting stories of Detective Kirin in his many quests. Each one had a high-stakes situation that kept me really captivated throughout its entirety.The author, Kaye Wagner, used very lofty and poetic language that I was so drawn to. It really meshed well with this genre being urban fantasy. It incorporated those elements with that of a solid mystery so well. It's also great that each story was able to draw on more themes as well. It can be difficult to bring all of that into one coherent storyline, so breaking it up like that gives so much to the reader. Legendary Detective in the City of Kings was extremely well-written and I'm pleased to have read it!
