When Lisa needs his help he knows what he must do. Lisa's been through torture with her husband both physically and emotionally.After what Lisa did to Gio will he be able to trust her and believe her innocence?Brilliant series. Can't wait to read the next book in the series.

I've read a few of this authors books but this was my favourite and I'm super excited to see its the start of what looks like a very promising and interesting series.I just love Nikko and Ronnie. Fate brings these two together a year after first meeting. When Ronnie finds herself in jail it's Nikko that comes to her aid. However when she runs Nikko chases her.This is an action packed book. The storyline and characters are brilliant. I highly recommend this fabulous book. Gripping read. Looking forward to reading more of this series.

Oh wow. I'm sitting here in bed with tears rolling down my face after reading this. If you read my reviews you will know that crying from reading is a rarity for me. Yep this author certainly got me with this book.This is the first book I've read by this author and its blown me away. It's got all kinds of everything in it. Laugh out loud moments, great off the chart sex scenes, angsty moments and for me tear jerking moments when I least expected it. We also have two broken characters Luca and Cassie. They both have been broken from different tragedies in their past. However their coping mechanisms are the same- have sex with whoever but don't get involved. When these two get together for a one night stand the rule of no going back for more is more difficult than they thought. Yes there is lots of sex in this book however it's not the main focus. Both have secrets that they can't talk about. They are both afraid to feel or let anyone close to them.Truly brilliant story. I thought the author got me started under false pretences in that I thought this was gonna be a normal run of the mill story. I was so so wrong. The author pulled on my emotions and teased me with angst dotted throughout the story, leaving me in tears towards the end. Brilliant read. Can't recommend this story highly enough.

I loved book one but if possible I loved this book even more. This book was so amazing. Xavier sure knows how to write a wonderful story.This book continues where book one finished so if you've not read book one stop now and read it.Merrick and Jovi are two great characters. I thought they were fantastic together. They love each other so much and bring out the good in one another. Things don't go plain sailing for them but every obstacle makes them stronger.Xavier takes the saying opposites attract to a whole new world. Absolutely brilliant read. I just need book three now- pretty please :)

This is a fabulous read with wonderful characters that I thoroughly enjoyed.This is Merrick and Jovis story. Merrick is a badass but I loved him. He's pure wild and does street racing for a living. Jovi is the complete opposite of him. She's also the daughter of a police commissioner. Adding to her problems her dad is on a mission to catch Merrick and his brothers.Amazing story that captivated me from start to finish.Be warned there is a cliffhanger so get 1-clicking both books... You won't regret it:)

This book has me thinking what kinda warped mind I've got as I literally inhaled this book in one sitting... Maybe with a few little breathers to grab some alcohol lolAs soon as I read the warning I couldn't resist reading it. However it didn't prepare me for the depths of darkness these two authors would take me to. On several occasions while reading this I couldn't believe what I was reading.I couldn't believe how much I wanted to devour this warped intense dark read. Does that make me warped??? Maybe it does lol however I read this as the erotic horror fiction that it is.Have I mentioned the ending? Oh my dayz. Speechless!!!Please read this warning before you 1-click. If you like the dark warped kinda read then give this a go. Be warned its a twisted read that will push your boundaries for the dark side.Looking forward to reading more by these two fantastic authors.

I waited with baited breath for this release. I've known this lovely lady for a while on fb and was so excited for her when she told me she was writing a book. So as you can imagine I squealed with delight when this landed on my kindle.Abby is a tough cookie. No matter what is thrown at her she is strong and brave. On tour as a famous singer her life starts to crumble when she finds her guitarist boyfriend cheating on her. This is the start of a lot of hurtful secrets being revealed. Abby realises over time who she can trust and not trust. As things got heated with Abby and her bodyguard Danny I was shouting at my kindle for them to get a move on and get together.Did I mention Danny is hot? Although it's his job to protect Abby I loved how he will do anything to protect her. He's a hot alpha male.This author has wrote a wonderful story. I thought it was a great balance between the music industry and security. Although not an angsty read I found myself holding my breath on a few occasions. Once I started this I did not want to stop. As addictive as it was I even found myself reading while drying my hair. Yes it's that kinda read.Well done Debra on a brilliant debut novel. Looking forward to reading more in this series.

This is book two in The Bounty Hunters Series about The Marino Brothers. I loved book one Beautiful Bounty but this book just blew me away. I loved it from start to finish.This is Blaze Marinos story. He's a sexy alpha that's oh so hot. Bella is a great strong character. She's on the run after jumping bail. Blaze goes to find Bella and bring her back. Things don't go to plan and Blaze gets more than he bargained for.If your looking for a great romantic suspense then I highly recommend this story. Looking forward to reading book three Beautiful Regret which is Gios story.

I jumped into this book without realising there was a book one. If you followed w my reviews you'll see that on the odd occasion I do this I love it so much that I add previous books to my wish list. This book is no different. Any excuse to read more of Zane.This is Zanes story. Arianna broke his heart. Although Arianna tries so hard to prove her love to Zane can he trust her again?I loved Zane. He's totally hot and can cook. Arianna rubbed me up the wrong way.I thought this was a great read. A story of suspense with some really hot erotic scenes. The twists and turns had me sitting on the edge of my seat. Looking forward to reading more from this author. Loved it.

Make sure you read book one Secrets before you read this story.This is Viktor and Elainas story. Viktor is part of a Mafia family. He stepped down to let his younger brother takeover. He's a dark broody alpha male. However when he's with Elaina we see the softer side to him.Two great characters that I loved. Both Viktor and Elaina think they ain't good enough for the other. I loved the storyline. Brilliant read.

This is a truly beautiful and emotional story. I thought the author did a great job of portraying the characters as real. I loved that the storyline wasn't far fetched, that what happened in the story could easily happen in real life.This is the raw emotional story of Edie, a wife and a mum dealing with depression. I struggled with depression for years so Edies story really touched my heart.I found myself reading this until early one morning. Luckily I didn't have to get up early the next day so I sat up and enjoyed. I found myself smiling and crying along with Edie.If your looking for a beautiful emotional read then I highly recommend this story. Loved it.

I've not read anything by this AUTHOR before. I found this to be a very enjoyable m/m read.Hunters a famous actor who wants to keep his sexuality a secret. There is a mad man going around trying to destroy gays. Macs a reporter sent to interview Hunter. He feels an urge to PROTECT him. Can he?Really good storyline with hot sexy scenes. Ill definitely be reading more of this authors BOOKS. Loved it.

For such A short story this BOOK has A great storyline .One of my pet hates is being told how I'm gonna feel about a story and they get it all wrong. In the synopsis of this book your told it's funny and it's a comedy. Hell yes. Totally agree.Mimi is a fabulous character. She says what she thinks and holds nothing back. Aiden mmmm he's yummy. I'd definitely wanna see him again.Yes of COURSE I'd have loved to read more about these two. However the author didn't leave me hanging or ready to throw my kindle. Great naughty quickie:)

This is another super little read from Harper Miller. The writing is flawless and I LOVED the characters.Tanya has separated from her cheating husband. In a not too honest way she comes across a web site for people with kinky fetishes. Here she starts CHATTING to Kenji. As its a short read I can't really say much more without spoiling it.Give this a CHANCE. I enjoyed it:)P.s. If the ending has you gasping make sure you read the last page!!!!

This is the third book in this series. Make sure you read Unkiss Me and Untouch ME BEFORE YOU start on this book.This is Mason and Hilary's story although with A whoop of joy we do get to read about the other couples we met in previous BOOKS.I'm not gonna go into the storyline as I don't wanna spoil it. I WILL say I read this in one sitting. It's an unputdownable book and my favourite of the series. Saved the best til last. Great roller coaster of emotions the author took me on. Loved it.If your looking for an MC series then I highly recommend this series. Ill definitely be keeping these on my kindle for a re- read.

What a fantastic novella this is. I thoroughly enjoyed it. It's my first read by this AUTHOR but it certainly won't be the last.This is Roccos story. He's a badass guy although we do see a softer side to him. I absolutely loved him. I gotta read Evelyn's story NEXT. I so loved these two characters.As this is a novella I don't want to say much about the storyline. I WILL say the AUTHOR did a great job of portraying these characters as real. The writing is flawless and I loved the storyline.I'm so happy I read this story. I've seen teasers of the Fallen Angel Series that piqued my interest. Reading this will have me topping up my Amazon ACCOUNT and 1-clicking bDefinitely looking forward to reading more from this author. Loved it.

This is part three of this story. Grab the two previous books and read before reading this one.Fiona and Gabes story CONTINUES. We read both sides of the story. I gotta admit I wanted to bang their heads together in this story. Gabe was doing my head in. I wanted to shout at Fiona to just talk to him. Grrr!!What a cliffhanger. Seriously can't believe the author did that to us. Thankfully we won't have to wait too long before we get the NEXT part (I hope).

This is part two of this story. Make sure you read part one first to understand the story.After the ending in book one Fiona is trying to find her feet in her NEW JOB. She's worried about her grandmother and things get pretty hot with the sexy alpha Gabe.As its A quick read I can't say much about the storyline. I really liked it and looking forward to jumping into part three.

This is BOOK one in A series. It's not a standalone.Fiona has so much pressure on her to succeed in this interview. She needs this job. The night before the interview she meets Gabe. He's a billionaire and normally gets what he wants. Why does he want Fiona? She's not his normal type!Great start to this series. I'm really looking forward to reading more. Glad we don't have to wait too long before the NEXTbook is out.

This small canvas bag looks really  good.  The outside feels nice.  The quality looks great and all the stitching is very good and strong.  The belt that goes on it is very sturdy.  I have even carried it without the belt too.  The belt is adjustable and can be done so pretty easy.  The zipper works great and doesn't snag on any material from the inside.  Even though this is a small bag it seems so roomy on the inside.  The snap on the outside pocket holds well and is easy enough to close.  The outside pocket is a really good size.  This is a lightweight and very comfortable bag to carry or wear.  Disclosure:  I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like this Sound Intone folding headset.  For one they are very comfortable on my head and ears since I watched a movie and never had any ear discomfort.  The inside of the head piece has a very soft  silicone material.  The ear pieces can move up or down for a better fit.  These sound really good, crisp and clear.  I never got any distortion and the bass comes through nicely.  The cord is plenty long and the cord looks as if it will last a long time since the outside is braided.  These are really easy told fold up and unfold.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I just love this toiletry bag because of all the space and pockets to put stuff in.  Closed there is a handle to carry the bag.  There is a zippered pocket on the outside and an open one as well.  When opened it leaves a very nice size in the middle.  There is netting like material around the pockets which looks stitched  good.  The outer two compartments have places for make up brushes and a pocket for a longer item.  All of the zippers work with ease.  I'm very happy with this bag and would recommend it.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like this smart shaker.  It's very small and flat.  It fits good in my bed by my pillow and it doesn't bother me.  It was easy enough to charge but once it was done charging it started beeping every so often until unplugged.  It was fairly easy to set up and to use the app.  I just got to the point where my cell phone just wasn't always waking me up and I needed something louder.  I'm very satisfied using this smart shaker because It's loud enough that it wakes me up.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like this camera lens because it helps me with taking much better family pictures.  My camera on my phone is not all that great but with this lens I can see a good improvement in the clarity and it does give a little wider angle.  It was easy to put on my android phone.  It looks well made and sturdy.  The lens seems to be protected well and also has a cover to put on it.  It hasn't done any damage to my phone even though it has a nice strong grip it's like a rubber material so I'm not worried at all.  It's very easy to take it off when it's not needed.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like this argan oil conditioner.  The main reason I like it is that it really has helped me with the itchiness.  Next thing that I really like is that it doesn't really have a smell to it.  I like that because sometimes products just have to much perfume in them for me and are bothersome but not with this one.  This conditioner is really thick and I had to shake it down very good to get it to come out of the bottle.  The nice thing though is It spreads on my hair very well.  It rinses out really easy which I was surprised since it was so thick.  It didn't leave my hair feeling weighed down.  It did leave my hair less frizzy which I love.  It was o.k.  to comb through my hair but  it would have been nicer if it was a bit more easy.  I did keep it in my hair the recommended amount of time before washing it out .  I suppose I could have used more conditioner but then I really wouldn't get many uses out of the bottle.  Keep in mind my hair is to the bottom of my back and very thick and coarse so that may not be the case for everyone.  With the good and not so good I'm for the most part satisfied with this conditioner.  Disclosure:  I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This tire inflator looks very sturdy.  It does have some weight to it.  It has a comfortable handle to carry it.  The gauge is is easy to read.  It also comes with a couple of other adapters for airing up different equipment like  balls and other inflatables.  It has a very decent carrying case to be stored in.  The cord on this is plenty long to reach the tires on my car and is easy to plug in my car lighter area.  I was really pleased with the time that it took to air up my tires.  I also had my car running while using the inflator.  Overall I think this is a good solid machine  that doesn't take up much room in my trunk.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like this flexible tripod with mount because the quality seems really good.  The thing that I like most is the flexible feet because it makes it really easy to put almost anywhere so that I get a good picture.  It's easy enough to put my smartphone in the mount either in the portrait or landscaping positions.  This tripod has really helped me in taking better family pictures since my hand always seems to move a bit but now I don't have to worry about it.  I'm also not worried about putting my phone in the mount because there is nothing to scratch it and it has a good grip.  I would recommend this tripod and I didn't find any cons about it.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This book is a really nice guide to taking the ACT test.  This covers all the subjects needed like English, Math, reading, science reasoning,and writing.  There is even a practice test section for English, Math, Reading and Science.  There is an answer key as well.  The practice test is good because it pinpoints the area that need to be looked over more.  The answer key not only gives the answer it also gives some explanation which is really helpful.  I think that this book was put together well and is easy to read and understand.  I would recommend this book.  Disclosure:  I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really love how easy it is to use this minoxidil foam.  Just two pumps twice a day is what it says to use on the directions.  I think this can will last a good amount of time.  But basically to keep the results it has to be continued which makes sense.  There is a very faint pleasant smell to the foam and then after applying it I don't really smell it.  It dries in a fair amount of time and just looks like wet hair until it dries so it's fine to put in on in the morning before going outside.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These are somewhat comfortable headphones.  My son who is five wears them and really likes them.  I can see they fit him a little bit big and I'm not able to make them fit better since the setting is at the end and won't get any tighter.  They kind of hang low on his ears.  I have been wearing them and for me they fit quite snug.  We received the blue pair of headphones and the star looks cute on them.  It's fairly easy to change the setting for a bigger or smaller fit.  My son did somehow pull off the ear cushions.  I was able to put them back on after removing the black piece of plastic on the earpiece then fitting the cushion back over it and then snapping it back onto the set.  The cushion on the earpiece is not great quality but should be fine for awhile.  The sound quality seems alright but I have to make sure my son turns the sound down so that it's not too loud for his ears.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like the way this jacket fits and the color looks just as the picture in the product ad.  I did order the Khaki color.  I like to wear men's jackets at times and this is one of those that look neutral for me to wear.  I think what I like the most about this jacket is the zipper because after zipping it I can button over it and it hides the zipper.  I think that makes it look better.  It is a nice material that feels good and the stitching is done well.  It is comfortable to wear and moves well with body motion.  I did wash it and it held up alright.  I think the thing I liked the least was after washing it the lining became a bit puffy.  It was fairly easy to iron the jacket.  The jacket is light but gives a bit of warmth for cool days.  My husband likes the jacket as well and likes wearing it when he is out doing errands.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I just love this ceramic flat iron.  It's not very heavy.  It has a really awesome handle that's easy to hold onto.  I have very long hair that goes to the bottom of my back and is very curly, thick and frizzy.  The good thing that I like about this iron is that it gets really hot enough to straighten out my hair.  It usually takes a very long time to do all of my hair but this cut some of the time out of it since I didn't have to hold it on my hair as long.  It left my hair very straight and smooth.  I did use a thermal protector on my hair.  I really like the length of the cord .  This is one of my favorite irons.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This car trunk organizer does have nice size sections to fit the things I have in my trunk. This has been really nice to keep my trunk organized and to keep stuff  from just rolling around in my trunk while driving.  I have been using this nearly a couple of weeks now and it hasn't torn up in anyway and looks good in my trunk. I just love how cute this wristlet clutch is.  The color is like a powder pink.  The outside looks nice and does feel soft.  There is a outside pocket and it has a zipper that works well.  The outside pocket fits my smartphone.  The zipper on the main compartment works good and doesn't get stuck.  The inside has a small zippered pocket to fit the smaller things like some tweezers and things.  Then in the middle something small can fit and then it has the slots for cards. I ordered the chocolate color sheet set and it looks just as lovely and rich with color as in the ad picture. This waterless car shampoo is really nice to have especially  being in an apartment because we can't run a hose and wash it by hand. I really like this product and will continue to use it.  Disclosure :  I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love this case that the dental tools come in.  The zipper works good and doesn't catch and the case is also slim enough to stick in an overnight bag or make up bag. I didn't see a size chart when I ordered these but I  went with the large and they fit great. I like that this garlic press is light weight.  It's comfortable to hold and I don't have to use a lot of force to squeeze it down.  I like that it has hooks at the end so I'm able to hang it. This Holiday wreath is decent quality.  It looks really nice with the snow look to it.  The bow looks o.k. but is kind of basic. This is a cute little egg tray which makes it easy to put out on a table or set inside the fridge. These small one inch mirrors are very easy to work with and have a plain back.  The thickness is just right and the quality seems decent.  The mirrors do clean up nicely and are shiny. Even though these four inch mirrors are for crafts they are made good.  The back of the mirror is plain.  The mirror cleans up nice and shiny. I really like the glass look to this  acrylic shower head.  I did order the round shower head.  It does come with a bit of  teflon tape. I think it comes in a size that's just right. I like that this is more than a month supply.  I've been taking one twice as day with food so this bottle should last me a couple of months.  The capsule is not too big and is easy to swallow. Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like the design of this dash phone holder.  This was really easy to put into my car.  I also like how easy it is to move it as well.  The other thing that I like a lot about this particular car mount is the part that holds my phone, for one it's strong and I like my phone portrait style and my husband likes it in landscape style.  It is lightweight but I feel confident that my phone won't fall when it's in it.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I really like that there are two of both sizes in this set.  I like that because sometimes I'm making more than one thing but want the same size for both dishes so it's good.  The red looks good just as pictured in the ad.  As far as quality I think they are good.  The handle is comfortable.  The end of the spatula has some flexibility and a little firmness.  I like that the spatulas have a hole on the handle so I can hang them on a small hook.  Very simple to clean.  I really like the one piece design so no food gets stuck between pieces.  Disclosure:  I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a nice set of stainless steel straws because it comes with a nice cleaning brush that can get down into the straw so that it's cleaned good.  I also like though that the straws and the brush are dishwaher safe.  These are great to have around the house because my son loves using a straw for his drinks.  I think these are like normal size straws with a perfect bend to them.  They are slim and not big like the smoothie straws.  I really like that I can reuse these because it will save me a lot on straws.  Disclosure:  I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I think the shower curtain looks really pretty.  It is on the thin side.  It didn't have any strong smell when I hung it up.  None of the holes ripped when I put the shower curtain rings on it.  The shower curtain rings that came with it seem to be a plastic.  They were easy to put on the shower curtain and then put around the shower curtain rod.  They are white and match the curtain well but could always be switched out for a different look.  The cons that I found about this shower curtain is that there are no suction cups or magnets to keep it in place so that water doesn't get out in the corners.  Even without those things I really haven't had any problems but it is good for just in case.  The curtain surely does make the bathroom look nice and I'm happy with it as a temporary change in the bathroom.  Disclosure:  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These labels are definitely high quality. They are durable, have a nice matte finish that takes well to printing, and they apply easily to the surface and stay put with the strong adhesive that is on them.  Like the product description says, these are tough labels for tough jobs.The templates supplied on Avery's web site are great. The site is easy to use - choose the design you want, enter the information you want, and then a PDF file is created that you can print to any printer whose drivers accept a PDF file. Really easy.The particular size I have (2" x 4", 10 per letter-sized page) comes in a box of 500 labels. I don't really need that may for purposes of labeling chemicals, but they are excellent for that purpose when using Avery's templates, and the labels themselves are perfect for any non-chemical purpose as well because they are so durable and adhere so well.The labels are just as described on the product page. They're excellent - high quality and useful.

As far as I can tell, this product does what it is intended to do, which is provide a daily quality dosage of Lutein. I don't really notice any improvement with my eyesight but I'll take the word of eye experts who say that Lutein is beneficial for promoting good eye health.Things I like about this particular product are:It is strictly Lutein; that is, it's the only active ingredient so you don't have to buy a product that is combined with a bunch of other things that you may or may not want.It is made in the U.S.A.The container is easy to open and the capsules are easy to swallow. They have a neutral taste.From what I can tell, this seems to be a high quality product. I'm happy to be taking these supplements.

This is a superb book for the person who wants to gain a practical understanding of the principles of electricity and how electronic devices work, which in turn provides the foundation for being able to diagnose and repair those items.If you are looking for a book that gives you a step-by-step quick-fix to a specific device, my recommendation is to look elsewhere. The sections in the book devoted to repairing various categories of electronic devices are predicated on the reader understanding basic electronic concepts, how to apply them, and also having the proper tools.For the person who wants to understand the hows and whys of electronic repairs, Mr. Geier has written an excellent manual, with the chapters arranged in a logical order. He explains the principles, tells you what basic and also optional more advanced equipment you ought to have in your workshop and also provides plenty of tips on how to efficiently use everything.  The first part of the book provides the knowledge base. The second part of the book discusses the workings and how to repair a good variety of common devices that often break down.  If something in your house has broken and you are looking for a book that tells you how to specifically repair this in a cookbook way, this really isn't the right book. This book is more for those who want to understand what they are doing so that the knowledge they gain can be applied across a variety of devices.If you have an interest in electronics as it relates to knowing how common devices and appliances work, and to be prepared to repair them, then this book is an invaluable resource.

This is an attractive and sturdy unit that works like it is supposed to work.  I have both the 10 and 8 outlet models. The differences between the two are (1) the number of outlets, obviously; and the 10 has, whereas the 8 doesn't, (2) LED dimmer controls; and (3) controlled outlets.The controlled outlets are dependent on whether or not the device you have plugged into the Master outlet is drawing power, i.e., turned on. If the device in the Master is on then the controlled outlets are operational and supplying power. This is handy when you have, for example, an audio receiver and want to turn on a subwoofer and a Blu Ray player automatically when the receiver is switched on, and turn them off when the receiver is switched off. What is nice is you don't necessarily have to use the Master outlet feature - it is enabled or disabled via a switch on the power filter.This is the first power filter I've seen/used that has a rotating power outlet strip and I find this to be very convenient. One beef I have, and this is for all power filters in general, is that the outlets are spaced too closely to allow power bricks that many devices use to be plugged into adjacent outlets. Use of these bricks will most always cause you to lose an outlet. That said, there is an outlet on either side of the rotating section into which you can plug a brick and not lose the outlet because of the rotating feature. However, those two side outlets on the 10 outlet model are for a high current and Master plug, respectively, for which I don't think you'd want to plug in a power brick because that would be overkill.I can't say how well this filter protects against power surges or lightning since I haven't experienced any yet and hope I never do. But in all other respects it works like it is supposed to. I've used other APC products in the past and wouldn't hesitate purchasing or recommending that brand because they have always worked well for me and they have excellent quality construction.Units like these, particularly the 10 outlet, would be suitable for a home theater system because of the controlled outlet feature, but I am using them with my computer equipment (and they work fine). The only reason they're not being used with my home theater is because I have more elaborate APC equipment protecting it.

Jade green in color with a somewhat thinner than medium thickness, this combo shampoo and conditioner lathers up and cleans very well.  It also has a pleasant deep and refreshing smell which to me is reminiscent of pine, oil of wintergreen and minty menthol.  So why the three stars?  Because the smell lingers - it leaves the scalp feeling refreshed but it lingers there and on my hands despite trying to rinse very well.  After debating on deducting one versus two stars I took off two because of the staying power of the aroma.Granted, it is a pleasant one but still, I would rather something wash off cleanly and completely regardless of how nice it smells.  Otherwise I'd wear cologne.That said, if you don't mind a pleasant product aroma that lingers, then this is worth trying because it does clean very well.

Note: I received a complimentary sample of this product for review purposes.  I am a strong believer in using quality cables, especially with my audio, home theater and computer equipment.  I don't believe in any of that nonsense about a fancy-schmansy power cable can make your audio system sound better, but I do believe that one needs a durable, properly made cable.These power cables from Cable Matters are of high quality.  They are durable, have a substantial feel to them, yet they are flexible. The jackets are sturdy and resistant to tearing or kinking, and the ends are solidly connected. As another reviewer pointed out, the prongs are strong, too - it is very difficult to bend them by pinching them together like you can with so many stock cords that come with appliances.All in all, these are very well-made cables for a very attractive price.  Use them with confidence; the price also makes it convenient to keep some in reserve, too.

First off, the audio quality leaves something to be desired as it sounds like it was recorded using two mediocre mics on an average reel to reel deck in a garage. No Dolby noise reduction here - there's lots of tape hiss and some sound dropouts here and there. But I'm not deducting any stars because we're not led to expect anything better - the main focus is on capturing Linda Ronstadt in a "live" and somewhat spontaneous situation.What's nice is her vocals are front and center and despite the less than stellar sound quality, it's readily apparent she is an exceptional singer. She's so talented and puts a lot of emotion into the songs - no way is any of this just going through the motions.  The backup band is in the background and for the most part sounds a bit muffled but they put on a good show and if you can concentrate on the music rather than audio quality aspect, it's a really entertaining album that showcases the tremendous talents of Ms. Ronstadt.  I'm glad this performance was preserved for us to enjoy so many years later.

Overall I liked this album.  The arrangements are generally good but they lack the verve and emotional intensity Ms. Nyro put into all of her songs. I thought that was glaringly obvious with the treatment given Save the Country, in which he turned a very fine and serious song into something that sounded light-hearted like he had no idea what the lyrics meant and was singing wearing a Happy Face t-shirt.  Some of the other songs border on that same lack of congruence with the original intent, but on the whole I enjoyed the album because of my admiration of Ms. Nyro's songs and the nice arrangements done on most of them.  You can't beat the original but then that's a high standard few can match. That said, this is a very listenable album.

This is my second George Foreman grill, the first being a much smaller version from several years ago that wound up being donated to Goodwill because it was too darn hard to clean. I like the concept of indoor grilling, though, along with a larger cooking area so I ordered this one.It is indeed large!  It looks like a giant flying saucer with its lid on; the cooking surface is generous and the grill works well. It only cooks one side at a time unlike other versions, however, and I also find that the heat has to be set to at least 4 to do a decent job of grilling and make the grill marks on meats or veggies.It's still not a breeze to clean, however.  The surface makes it easy to wipe clean but if you want to do a more thorough job then you have to remove the temperature control and drip tray, and wash the plate in the sink. It's larger than the average sink so you have to wash sections of it at a time and it is rather cumbersome to do so. That said, the non-stick surface facilitates easy food and grease removal, plus any excess grease has already drained into the drip pan anyway.  The drip pan is easy to wash.It's a healthy way to cook foods and even though it doesn't impart a true grilled taste since no coal or wood is used, it does leave attractive grill marks on the food and drains the fat. I use it indoors for cooking. The stand doesn't seem real sturdy and on top of that the instructions say not to leave it outside so for me it is a hassle wheeling this thing indoors and storing it. That's the reason for deducting a star.Overall, it works well and does what it is supposed to do.

Here's a worthwhile collection of brief but relevant and to the point devotionals, each followed by applicable Bible verses in support. While the author has targeted these writings for women, I find they are just as useful for men - for anyone who has a heart for Jesus, or wants to know more about Him and the Bible.We've all gone through similar situations described by the author and it's comforting to read how she dealt with them through a trust in what God's word as divulged in the Scriptures has to say.  The devotionals themselves are short as are the verses that follow, but the verses offer a good springboard to do further reading from the rest of the Bible chapters they are taken from.Efficient and appropriate - I recommend it!

These socks are great. They don't show at all with the shoes I wear (Clark's and Keds low-cut shoes) but they cover enough of the feet to provide protection and cushioning. They also stay on my foot and don't sink down. The material holds up well, too - no holes, no snags. I wear size 8 men's shoes and bought the small size - socks are very small compared to my feet but stretch to fit just right. Excellent, and I wouldn't hesitate to purchase them again.

I used to watch reruns of this show as a kid and really enjoyed it so out of curiosity I bought this set to see how I felt about it now. Still a great show. Hearing the theme song really brought back memories.The episodes are very intelligently written, and it engages the viewer's brain, unlike so much garbage that is on TV these days. I like how the host comes on at the beginning to discuss some aspect of science.  Episodes are nicely done and don't have to resort to the sort of wild special effects or sensationalism, scandal, violence, etc. that today's show needs in order to hold an ever-decreasing attention span of today's viewer who can barely take their eyes away from their smart phone to do anything else.  I also find it interesting comparing what was considered the latest and greatest technology of the time, and also what they envisioned as future technology, to what we actually have today.Picture quality is as good as you can expect from a show produced so long ago on a small budget. The audio is clear and understandable. Sure, it can't compare to modern picture quality but then it's the content that makes it an excellent show, not the side fluff.  I'm very happy that this series has finally been released on DVD. If you like science fiction, this is well worth purchasing.

This is a simple, yet functional unit geared for emergency use. It has a radio with AM, FM and Weather station bands, a clock, alarm, cell phone charger and flashlight. Clearly it is meant for emergencies and not for everyday use. The features work but there's no luxury here.The radio has decent reception in all bands. It sounds like a transistor radio, with limited audio quality. Someone complained about that and yes it sounds tinny but it isn't meant to be audiophile-quality, its meant to be used when you have no other source for tuning in radio stations. The weather channel is also helpful and not something that normal radios have.  There was another complaint about how you can't scroll through the stations but have to go one by one up or down the band by pressing the + or - button on the radio. That can be annoying but that's what happens with a digital (what this is) versus an analog tuner. One good thing is in an emergency having a digital tuner that goes from station to station might be helpful so that you don't miss anything when searching for whoever is broadcasting.  Reception is aided by the attached antenna.Setting the time and alarms are easy. The instruction pamphlet is basic but written well enough to understand.The flashlight works fine and has a fairly bright light - enough to let you navigate in the dark.Using the crank feature requires a lot of cranking which gets tiring soon but it's better than not being able to self-power the device or to charge a cell phone. We're so used to modern conveniences that we get spoiled easily. This is meant to be used in disasters and emergencies and you have to expect to be inconvenienced during such times.All in all, it does what it is supposed to do.  It is compact and lightweight. It feels sturdy enough for normal use but I wouldn't want to drop it to see if it still works. It's something handy to have around.

In a nutshell, I found this book to be disjointed and rambling, with sentence structure that made it difficult to hold my attention. Yes, there are some good nuggets of wisdom to be found that can help the reader facilitate a creative frame of mind but they are scattered; the book lacks structure.The theme is to think like a 5 year old to unleash your inner creativity but I'd say the only real advantage a 5 year old has in that respect is he hasn't grown old enough to learn how to be inhibited. Or to have let failures create uncertainty and fear of trying something new. On the other hand, there is a wide range of traits, including creativity, among 5 year olds and you can't really generalize to say that they are any better at being creative than adults.The examples given by the author didn't seem particularly relevant to me, either. Galileo is mentioned in one chapter as an example of someone who was a rebel, who went against the current grain of thinking and never gave up in his quest to prove he was correct. That may be true, but what does that really have to do with creativity?  Galileo just happened to be right - what if he was wrong?  Another example is given of how the popular plaything PlayDoh came to be, but that really has nothing to do with creativity either except someone came up with a clever name for what was originally called Rainbow Modeling Compound. But as to what creative factors led to the better name of PlayDoh, there is no real discussion at all.The book is also supposed to have a Biblical foundation but I found the relationship to be rather weak.I'm sorry; I feel the author had good intentions when writing this book but my personal opinion is that it is not a truly helpful aid towards becoming more creative.

I purchased this for very simple use, mainly to measure straighforward distances. That is, I didn't need to compute the height of a tree, or figure the volume of a room, etc., just needed to know how far it was from point A to point B.  For this, the device does an excellent job. Granted, I haven't actually gone back to see how exact the measurements are but I get consistent results from checking the same length multiple times so I am assuming it is pretty accurate.It is simple and easy to use, the instructions are understandable, and the device itself feels solid.  The edge is lined with rubber and has indentations for fingers to make it easy to hold. The laser beam is a bright red - very visible.  It also comes with two handy bubble levels. I am happy with my purchase.

It's nice having a product like this both for helping to keep things organized within a suitcase or larger bag, or for just storing things in a drawer. Although the description said that four different sizes are included, my shipment included four bags but there were two of the medium size.Bag measurements are approximately 18"x13"x3", 15"x10"x3" (I got two of these), and 15"x5"x3".  They're black with gray stripes on the top (like what you see in the picture) and have an Amazon Basics label. There is mesh on both sides of the top and solid cloth-like material in the middle, as well as for the rest of the bag.  Each has a carrying handle and double zippers.My examination tells me its a quality product.  The seams are sturdy and well done, the zipper works smoothly, and it seems very durable. The handles are secure. It would take a great deal of abuse to tear the material or break it; for normal use it should last for a long time.  I like the versatility of the sizes in this set although I am not sure if there was a mistake with mine in getting two of the same size or if the product description is wrong.  I'm  happy to have these - it's a very useful product to have!

This is an excellent, comprehensive concordance for the NIV Bible.  What Strong's does for the KJV, this version does for the NIV.  Every single word in the NIV is indexed/referenced to its location in the Bible.  There is also an index of every Aramaic, Hebrew and Greek word that is used, as well as a cross reference to the Strong's version.  There are also frequency counts of every word, in case you're interested. This is one valuable reference tool that I find extremely useful.I'd like to address a couple of criticisms made by other reviewers. First, they mentioned the print is very small and indeed it is, which I suppose is a tradeoff between smaller print versus a lot more pages and a heavier book. The book is heavy enough and the print is still readable. Some may require a magnifying glass but I'd say most people will be able to read it, albeit with slight inconvenience. Second, some mentioned that you can find the same or more information on the internet and that is true but some prefer the tangible, textural nature of a book.  This one has it all in one place and you can thumb back and forth to find the references/information you need.  I think it depends on how you prefer to do your research.It is indeed a big book but not unwieldy considering you're probably going to use it on your desk most of the time. The pages are on the thin but not fragile or dainty side (i.e., they don't wrinkle easily) and that helps keep the book weight down. And indeed it is comprehensive - it accomplishes what the authors set out to do and is an excellent concordance. If you are the type that likes using books for reference and need an NIV concordance, this is the one to get.

It's nice having microfiber towels that have an attractive pattern and come in a color other than yellow or white - in other words, something that doesn't have an industrial look to it.  These make nice dish towels.  Absorbent, soft, and they leave a streak and lint-free finish on whatever you are drying.The towels also double as a substitute for paper towels when cleaning up spills.They don't shrink when washed. Like any other microfiber cloth, they will cling to other items in the dryer but that's unavoidable.There isn't really much more to say. They do the job and do it well, they look good, and they are good-sized. It's very handy having a 12-pack of them and the price is reasonable.

I am no Tim Allen and hate doing anything having to do with home improvement. But the torture of having a west-facing window in Southern California during hot weather was enough to motivate me to acquire this product and attempt to install it correctly.After having put up the film, I now appreciate the talents of the employees at shops that do automobile window tinting, and also understand why so many DIY window tints look awful. My finished job looks like there are either small cracks in the window or stray spider webs; it definitely is not smooth and there are also air bubbles all over the place. The good part is that the film does work in terms of reducing the heat caused by the afternoon sun. So regardless of how inept my results look, I'm leaving it up there.My particular windows are two 43" H x 21" W panes, one of which slides and there is also a window screen. Because the review sample I received is 60" x 36" I was not able to use one whole sheet of film on a window; I had to cut the film and do two sections on each. The instructions are very clear and easy to understand; I followed them to the letter but my difficulties stemmed from working with a relatively large sheet of film and my not having much of a talent for this sort of work. As much as I kept repositioning the film and trying to use the squeegee to push out the air bubbles, I ended up with some creases and stubborn bubbles that just refused to go away on the large section.  The smaller section was much easier to do and had good results.  I suspect another problem may have been that I didn't spray enough Windex on the window. I did clean it first then sprayed a generous amount before applying the film but I'm thinking I should have kept spraying more and maybe the film wouldn't have creased.The film has a light blue tint that is obvious when compared to the pre-film window but it isn't that dark. Certainly not as dark as it looks before you apply it and it still allows you to see outside very clearly.  The benefits of the heat reduction are well worth putting up with a slightly darker window.The product does work. My advice is to follow the directions to the letter and to work slowly and carefully. That said, I tried to do that and my results don't look all that great so perhaps you also need either more experience than I had with projects like this, or a natural aptitude for them. Four stars because the product works, but I don't think it is as easy peasey as the product description says it is. They make it sound like it's a quick and easy thing to do, which it isn't.

I received this as well as two other products as samples from the manufacturer in exchange for their requested "honest review."  So here it is...The other two products I received, D3 and fish oil, are pretty much universally acknowledged to be beneficial for one's health.  CoQ10 is a dietary supplement which, as far as I can tell, may help improve heart function, improve energy and prevent cancer although the evidence is not conclusive. However, there's also no evidence that taking a dosage of 100 mg like what is in the capsules in this product does any harm.After taking the recommended dosage of one capsule for a while, I have to say I don't really feel any different. Some days I feel more energetic than others or more "on the ball" but I can't correlate this with the taking of these capsules. I'd have to say diet and sleep are as big factors as taking CoQ10.  For that reason I only give it three stars.On the plus side, the product is manufactured in the USA and the manufacturer provides a lot of information about it. The capsules are relatively small and easy to swallow and haven't caused any side effects on me, as far as I can tell. It seems like a high quality product.  I'd say if you are going to take CoQ10 and believe that there are benefits for doing so, then these particular ones are a good choice. It seems like PCNL really cares about their product and the consumer.

I received this lantern as a free sample for review purposes, but this review is my honest opinion.The AYL Starlight is a sturdy, well-made and practical product. It's useful and it works like it is supposed to. It comes with a set of easy to understand directions which are not really necessary as everything is either intuitive or obvious. I'd say putting in the 3 "D" cell batteries is the most difficult part but if you follow the directions you'll be fine.I'm glad I had some D batteries around the house. I'm not used to using them since most of the items I have use "AA" or "AAA" cells or 9V. But I appreciate how the latern uses the more robust D cells to maximize battery life.The light itself is plenty bright.  There is a low, high and strobe setting and they all work very well. Low is still quite bright and the high setting will ensure you can find your way anywhere in the dark. The strobe is also very bright. The casing is strong but not that heavy so it is easy to carry using the built in metal handle. The sides are rubber-lined to protect it from damage. The casing itself is plastic but feels durable - no cheap thin stuff here. If you want to hang it up, turn it upside-down and there's a hook you can use.I am not a camper but am glad to have this for use when our power goes out.  You can remove the translucent shield around the LED lamp for more directed, flashlight-type lighting.  There's even a small LED on top of the power button that blinks so you can find the lantern in the dark. By the way, the power button also feels very solid. You use it to cycle from low to high to strobe then off. It has a satisfying click with each press.I'm pleased with this product. It is well made, thoughtfully designed, and I'd say well worth the price.

I was using a TP-Link Powerline and was curious to see how this Netgear 1200 product compared.First of all, the Netgear Powerline comes nicely and securely packaged, two of the units plus Ethernet cables for each. Setup is very simple - just plug and play. I plugged the Ethernet cable from my router to the source Netgear.  The receiving Netgear was plugged into the Ethernet jack of a PC in the back of the house. It worked right off the bat, no problems.I used speedtest.net to test the Netgear and the TP-Link. The TP-Link averaged between the mid-19 to mid-21 Mbps range. The Netgear averaged between the low-23 to low-24 range. The results were pretty consistent. What wasn't consistent were the latency and jitter results, which were all over the place for both products so I can't draw any meaningful conclusions from that.A subjective comparison between the two by just doing some browsing on the net really didn't seem to reveal any difference. If I didn't know which powerline was in use, I wouldn't reliably be able to tell one was faster than the other. My opinion: the Netgear Powerline is a quality product that works well, and is very easy to setup and use. The units have a nice, solid feel to them and both the electric prongs and Ethernet cables connect securely. Nothing confusing about it!My only beef is the size. It blocks the other outlet on a two-outlet panel.  Netgear has compensated for this by putting a throughput outlet on the front so you can use that, but the problem is if you have it plugged into a tight space, such as behind something that is pushed up next to the wall, you lose the space that is the thickness of the Netgear. While it may not seem like that much, it's noticeable.

Bottom line - this product is primitive compared to a Sonos system.It arrived in a nice box and the construction quality appears to be good. The instruction manual is of the quick start variety but is adequate to get the product up and running. Setup was easy. I have a Galaxy tablet so I downloaded the app for an Android device from the Google Play store which installed quickly and with no problems. Connecting the box was also easy. For streaming you need a pair of speakers and speaker wire. I connected a pair of Hsu HB-1 Mk2 speakers to the Omni A1 using 14 awg speaker wire with banana terminals. If you want more detailed instructions they are available on the product page on Polk's web site.When you initially start up the Omni A1 app, it searches for the system box. It found mine right away, after which I input my wireless password to enable it to connect to my network. Piece of cake. It also asked me to register the product. They entice you to provide more intrusive registration information by offering to extend the warranty for one year plus give you a free upgrade ($15 value) to their DTS Play-Fi HD edition - more on that in a moment.This product is described as enabling you to stream your music wirelessly to existing component speakers anywhere in your home. The music that is included consists of any music files you have on the device that is running the app, music on a media server that you have connected to your network, internet radio, or as of the time of this writing, 6 online music services: Deezer, KKBox, Pandora, QQMusic, Sirius XM or Songza.If you install the DTS Play-Fi app on your PC, that also enables you to stream whatever you choose to play on your PC to your speakers.Also, you can connect a digital source such as a CD player, as well as a turntable to the back of the Omni A1 unit to play source material such as CD's or records, respectively, to whatever speakers are connected to the box.I have a media streamer that I use with my Sonos system so I selected that from my apps menu to stream wirelessly to the Omni A1. It found the streamer just fine and gave me options of selecting by artist, album, genre, etc. That's where this part of the app goes wonky. I selected "artist" by tapping on that category selection and was provided with a list of all the artists with files on the streamer, in alphabetical order. I then selected a particular artist by tapping on it, but instead of going to that artist it presented me with the same list of all artists except in a different section of the alphabet. Tapping on another artist then gave me all of the songs in the streamer for that artist but they were not categorized any further. That is, they were not sorted by album or anything, just a list of songs from which to choose.  Tapping on a song resulted in it playing through the speakers I had connected to the Omni A1 box.How did it sound? Fine. Polk lists the amp as putting out 75 watts per each of the two channels at maximum power. They don't use the more conservative "continuous power" rating that pretty much all quality audio companies use but instead call it "peak power rating."  Still, it was adequate to drive a pair of efficient speakers such as my Hsu's to levels that are loud enough for normal listening. The sound quality was fine.I subscribe to Pandora and tested that out. It worked fine, same as using their web site to add stations and select artists.  I didn't try any of the other music services since I am not a member.Tapping on Internet Radio lets you choose from a huge number of stations. That works fine as well.The app also lets you play music that is stored on the same device as the app. I have a very limited number of music files on my Galaxy so there isn't much choice there, but it works fine, streaming whatever you select to the Omni A1 and the speakers.I then tried the DTS Play-Fi app.  When I initially registered, I did not provide the additional information to do a "full" registration but only enough to register my product. Thus, unless I wanted to go back and provide that info or else pay an additional $15, I did not have access to their HD Edition Upgrade which would enable me to choose where I wanted to stream music if I had more devices in the house, plus get better sound quality. The DTS app installed quickly with no problem on my computer. What it did was commandeer all of the sound that normally would play from the speakers connected to my PC and redirected it to the Omni A1.  Not just music that I chose to play, but every sound such as e-mail notifications and other non-music files. Meanwhile I was unable to play any sounds through my PC speakers, even when I closed the DTS application. I had to uninstall it in order to get sound to play through my PC again.How did the music sound when using the DTS app?  Horrible. It had a pulsating, distorted character and was unlistenable.  Since the DTS upgrade offered better sound quality, I decided to go back and do a full registration in order to get the key code to enter in the software and get my free upgrade. I completed it, received an on screen thank you plus a confirmation/thank you e-mail from Polk but as of this writing, never received the key code. I'll be darned if I am going to spend an extra $15 just to see if their upgraded DTS app gives me any better sound.Here's what I think is good about the Omni A1:  Construction quality seems good. It is easy to set up everything. Sound quality, except for the DTS app, is fine.Here is what I do not like about the Omni A1:The DTS app, at least when I used it (this is the non-upgrade version) results in very poor sound.  I never received the promised upgrade key after going back to do a full registration.  This app also completely takes over the sound on the PC so that you can't listen to anything from your PC speakers. As I mentioned above, even when closing it I could not get the sound back until I uninstalled the program.I felt like being held hostage by having to provide additional, invasive information to do the full registration, which consists of providing education level, type of residence, marital status and household income. All things that marketing people want in order to sell you more stuff.The app gives you a very limited choice of online music streaming services.Making a selection from a media server is a cumbersome and wonky process.The only way to create a playlist, or queue of music in a practical way is to create it from music that is on the device running the app. I tried creating a playlist of songs that were on my media streamer but was unable to do so. I had to choose which song I wanted to listen to in real time and wait for that song to be over before making another selection, otherwise the current song would stop and the new selection would start. The songs that had been played all went to a list in the app, which I could then select and use as a playlist but there is no way to create a list in advance of what you want to listen to unless the music files are on the same device that is running the app.As I mentioned at the beginning of this long long review, I have a Sonos system. It is MILES above the Polk. The Sonos app is much more sophisticated. It has a huge list of online music services to choose from.  If you have a media server, it indexes all of the songs on it and does it properly so that you can confidently select what you want to hear by categories such as album, track, artist, genre, etc. and then you can assemble a playlist or queue from those selections in advance of playing any of the songs. Sonos also has internet radio available. I can also stream music to my system via my PC but using Sonos, it does it the right way. I can assemble a queue/playlist in advance and when I send it, it doesn't shut off the sound on my PC.The whole Polk Omni A1 system is primitive compared to what Sonos offered.And no, I do not work for Sonos, I have nothing to do with them except I have been a satisfied owner of their products for several years. When I was offered the Omni A1 for review as a Vine member, I eagerly selected it based on the glowing descriptions provided by Polk on the product page because I was interested in comparing the two.  Sonos wins hands down, no contest.  I don't know what the current price difference is between the products but it doesn't matter - it is not worth spending the money asked for the Omni-A1 unless you primarily use it to stream music that is located on the same device as where you run the Omni app.  Everything else about it needs some work before it is ready for prime time.

These are very practical gloves. They're thick/sturdy enough for jobs that don't require heavy duty thickly insulated gloves, fit snugly and are thin enough to enable dexterity, have excellent grip and are strong enough for reuse.  While the outside of the gloves is textured to facilitate grips, the inside is smooth, making it easy to put on the hands.  The bright orange color makes them easy to spot if you happen to take them off during a job plus it helps you feel like Spiderman if you admire that superhero.They're so versatile and intelligently designed, I am very happy to have these.  I didn't count to verify there are actually 100 in the box, though. I noticed the product description says there are 100 by weight which makes me wonder how precise the numerical count is. It's such a nice product I'll trust them that it's accurate.

This is a nice, roomy and lightweight carrier that works well. The zipper is smooth and the Velcro handles are easy and quick to use. I like the red and white checked pattern, toolOnly "negative" thing is either it would be good if it could be folded for storage, or the bottom was made stiffer instead of being flexible, for better support of heavier items.  As it is, you can't really fold it up but then the bottom is very flexible so like I said, it is a bit lacking in support.Overall, however, I like this carrier with its simple but efficient design and festive appearance.

When you stop to think about it, the mind is truly an incredible, complex work of art (which is evidenced by your actually being able to stop and think about it). I enjoy reading books about how the brain functions, and was attracted to this one because of the promise of something practical to be gained as well, namely gaining insight into moments of insight, aka the "aha moments."I've had them and I'm sure you've had them.  I've given some thought as to what causes this but for me there seemed to be no real rhyme or reason to when the aha moment popped up. I wanted to read this book to find out.The authors have written a book that's easy to digest, explaining things clearly and providing examples so that it's just as much a pleasure read as it is textbook.  They focus on two main ways of approaching problem solving - analytical and insightful, the latter being from where the aha's arise. Personal, third party and experimental experiences are cited for both types of thinking. Evidence is presented on how the brain functions differently under both of these conditions.Now the big question is, how do you use all of these findings to increase your own aha moments?  For research I give the book 5 stars but for answering that big question, I had to take away a star. They provide some ideas, some conditions that facilitate those sudden bursts of insight, but it is left rather open-ended. I think that's how it has to be, at least at this point in time because there's still no real formula for achieving an aha moment. They offer suggestions to foster these moments but ultimately like it's definition, it just happens. All of a sudden the insight comes to you.Even though the authors document no sure-fire way to generate an aha moment, the research they present is fascinating and easy to understand. Definitely worth your time if you have any interest in how the brain functions.

I find these to be a useful and novel way to store small items. Initially I was worried that their flexible nature would make it difficult to stay upright if some items were stored that leaned over the side, but they're as stable as pretty much anything else except for something made out of lead or heavy glass. Obviously they aren't meant to store real tall and/or heavy things.  For stuff like pens, pencils, remotes and other knickknacks, it's fine.Construction-wise, the stripes on mine lined up very well and you can't tell where the seam is unless you examine it closely.  It's undetectable from a normal distance. The fabric is evenly distributed on both; no bunching up. They lay flat and are nice little storage containers to have around the house.

First off, this is the nicest, most expensive mixing/blending set I've used, and the first all-in-one. No experience with comparable Kitchen-Aid or Cuisinart models so I can't compare it to those.  But from evaluating it on its own merits, plus comparing it to separate mixers and blenders I've used in the past, this set is really nice and something I feel will last a lifetime.It comes in a big, heavy (and rather awkward because of size and weight) box.  Everything is sturdily packed to prevent damage but its all easy to remove. The construction quality is excellent. The motor assembly is robust, the parts fit together precisely and snugly and Kenwood didn't skimp on materials. It seems very heavy-duty to me.The instructions are brief but adequate and as others have pointed out, there are no recipes. I'm no expert chef but I had no trouble figuring out how everything fits together and is supposed to be used. Despite the large box I like how the unit itself fits into a fairly compact space and also like the all-in-one nature of the product.  It takes a little getting used to having the food processor and the blender sit on top of the unit, though.Performance-wise, it works fine and as intended. The motor is quiet with plenty of power. The speed adjustment works fine.  It's a very solid product.  I have a ways to go in terms of making use of everything that comes with it but so far, so good - it does a wonderful job. To me it seems like a well-engineered, well thought out product with great versatility in the way everything is combined into one. It looks impressive, too.

I've watched seven episodes so far and this is one excellent series.  Has my attention the entire time, never a dull moment.  Production values and acting are excellent, as are the riveting story lines. I'm putting in my five star rating here because I want more episodes produced!  Superb.

These taste good but the portions are small - in fact miniscule - and the price is high for what you get.  There's not even an ounce in each individual package. I wouldn't buy them again because of the price versus size.

Note: I received these gloves as a free sample.  I opened the package as soon as I brought it inside, on a cold day, and tried on the gloves. They were cold!  Be aware that they take on the surrounding temperature, unlike cloth mitts that feel warmer.I actually tried them with hot pans the next day after they had been stored in a drawer in our house which thankfully is warmer than the cold outdoors and the gloves were much more pleasant to wear at room temperature.Are they effective when handling hot items?  Indeed they are. Much better than the thick cloth mitts my wife and I were using.  There's no sensation of heat as these gloves do a fine job of insulation.  For that they get 5 stars. I also like how they are waterproof so they don't get all messed up if you get juices or other liquids on them.I have to say they aren't the most attractive gloves, though. My first impression was of the monster that comes out of the sea in one of those old sci-fi movies whose title I can't remember (sort of like the Creature From the Black Lagoon but this one was not exactly the same). The bright orange color is rather garish but it also helps with being able to find them quickly.  Their thickness makes it difficult to handle things with fine motor control (which is the tradeoff you make for having such insulation) and they can be difficult to put on unless your hands are absolutely dry.Overall, however, these gloves do a great job at insulating hands from heat.  The current price is reasonable and I foresee these lasting a long time because they seem really durable.  They're a worthwhile purchase.

This is a gorgeous-looking scale. I love the silver metallic finish as well as the sleek, slim look. Maybe that's an encouragement to keep one's body sleek and slim as well, haha.I compared the results from this scale to one that I've been using for the past several years and found that this one is consistently 2/10 of a pound lower than the other. I can live with that. In fact, I like the reading from this scale better because of that!  As to which one is really correct or if either of them are, that's not a big deal. At least I see the two are very close to each other and what they do help with is to point out any weight gains or losses that take place.The only beef is the battery compartment is a little difficult to open as it doesn't slide that easily. It comes with a couple of Maxell batteries that don't appear to be lithium to me but as long as it works, that's fine.  One nice thing about this scale is it is triggered when you stand on it and you don't have to tap it first or switch anything on.  It just goes on when something is put on it, and then it automatically shuts off a few minutes later.All in all, a nice, attractive scale for a reasonable price. I like it.

This is the second pair of Keds I've purchased in the past few months.  I used to wear white ones in this style back in college (which was many moons ago) and always liked them but for whatever reason I stopped wearing them. Recently I saw someone wearing them and it reminded me of how I used to wear them all the time so I bought a pair.  And I liked the one I got so much I decided to get another pair, in a different color.Keds are Keds. These are comfortable. I bought a size 8, which is my usual size, and it fits as expected.  They are comfortable, look good and great for casual wear.  I don't expect them to last a real long time because they don't seem all that durable. Not that they're cheap or anything, but they aren't a real heavy duty shoe.Mine came with blue and white laces like in the picture.  I was going to put blue on one side and white on the other and my wife insisted that looked stupid so I said "yes dear" and gave in and did the conventional thing of having the same color lace on both shoes.Anyway, I like them, they look good and are comfortable at a reasonable price, hence the 5 stars.

This is a wow piece of hardware. Admittedly it is expensive but the construction quality is first rate, as is the design and engineering. It offers features beyond that of a standard level, and does them all very well.The instructions are clearly written and easy to follow.  Using the level is pretty intuitive but I found it useful to read the instructions. There's a large LCD panel with highly visible readings.  You can determine not only if something is level, but do so to within 1/100 of a degree.  It also provides the option of alternate measurements in pitch (inches per foot, in 1/8 inch increments) or slope percentage. Thus it not only enables you to determine if something is level, but it measures the angle of surfaces that are not level.There's a memory function that allows you to store up to 9 readings.  Other features include being able to measure relative angles, a built-in laser dot pointer that operates up to a distance of 300 feet, enabling you to level large areas.  The tool has a ruler on its surface along with strong magnets along the  bottom, a nice, soft carrying/storage bag, a hanging hole, and a couple of soft/rubberized grip handles built into its body.  There is also a beeper function you can enable that lets you know when something is level (0 degrees), 45 or 90 degrees, or the most recently stored value in memory.  One reviewer noted that his seemed to beep constantly.  I noticed mine beeps a lot but only when it is at the designated angle. I found that upon placing the level on a surface, it takes a moment to finalize the measurement during which time it may go positive or negative from 0 degrees which triggers the beeping each time it does that.Any drawbacks?  The only thing some people may not like is the size (mine is 24") but for those who think it is too large there is a 10" version and for those who think it is too small, there is a 48" version.All in all I'm impressed by what a quality product it is, and also by what you are able to do with this tool.  As I mentioned earlier in this review, it may seem pricey but if you consider its capabilities as well as its construction quality, this is something that will last for years and years.  Just keep replacing the batteries when needed and you'll never need another level.  By the way, I notice they used a pair of Kirkland AAA batteries in mine.  Good choice!

The bottles arrived securely packaged to protect against breakage, padded with dense foam.The glass bottles are of decent quality.  The shaker tops are your average thin plastic variety which are adequate for the job.  The"chrome" tops are actually plastic. They look nice but feel on the thin side and as other reviewers have noted, don't seem to screw very snugly onto the jar.  It seals them adequately but they don't give you that feeling of confidence that it's a snug, solid fit.I didn't try the labels since these jars are for some spice blends I purchased, and thus I made my own labels.

I've used 3-In-One oil for as long as I can remember and have always gotten excellent results. It's a quality product. This new product seems to be no exception.  I used it to lubricate various things around the house, such as the door hinges, and it works beautifully.The reasons for a 4 instead of a 5 star rating: The oil comes out a bit too liberally from the container for my liking. That is, you don't really need to squeeze the bottle for a lot of it to come out.  I guess it is a matter of getting used to it but it does make it somewhat difficult to fine tune the amount of lubrication you use. I would have preferred the "default" flow to be more restricted.Just for information purposes, the oil has a scent.  It's not an unpleasant one but just know that it is scented although that disappears when it dries. It doesn't dry immediately but feels oily to the touch for a little while before drying so be aware it doesn't automatically go on dry.Overall it is an excellent product that does what it is supposed to do.

These towels feel soft, plush and luxurious.  I haven't used them for a long time so I can't comment on their durability but they look and feel like a quality product.  After washing (no fabric softener or dryer sheets used) they still come out nice and soft.I have the green ones. I'd say the color is pretty close to what shows on the product page - not exact, but then each person is going to see a slightly different shade of green depending on his or her monitor.  The color on my monitor is close enough to give me a good idea of what the towels look like in person.The towels are on the pricey side but if you want to pamper yourself with something that has a luxurious feel, these are ones to get.  It's like the difference between walking barefoot on plush, hi-pile carpet versus the office grade industrial version.

This is a very nice collection of articles over the years from the New York Times.  Even though some are quite old, none of them are dated.  There are no wine reviews per se, but just a variety of articles dealing with various aspects of the wine world.  Since they come from the newspaper columns, they're short, to the point and easy to read and digest.Some were more interesting than others and I skipped a few that didn't appeal to me from the get go (mainly ones on non-wine items such as cognac) but on the whole I read nearly all the articles and feel this was a truly worthwhile collection.
