There's lots of wisdom in the book, too, regarding the world of wine reviews, tastings, jargon and what goes on in the winemaking process.Highly recommended.

I found these glasses on closeout at Ross and snapped them up.  They came two in a box.  When I washed them, the stem on one of them broke.  They are really, really fragile which I suppose is why they were on clearance because another box at the store had two glasses with broken stems.  I went to a few other Ross stores in my area looking for more of these and managed to find one more box, but it had only one glass in it.They look just like the picture.  Very tall, thin stem and crystal, and superbly elegant. Upon close examination the quality is not first rate (you can see a very thin seam in the glass and there are also some bubble imperfections in the bottom) but they look so good at a normal distance that I don't care, which is why I give them four stars.  They are gorgeous, but - be very careful as they are very delicate.  Don't even dare putting them in a dishwasher. Plus because of their height they may have trouble fitting in some cabinets, too. They barely fit in mine.

These are nice and sturdy bottles.  I filled one all the way to the top and poured the water into a measuring cup - 8 ounces exactly. So the capacity is based on a complete fill, and not up to the neck like it is with wine bottles.  The cap screws on snugly.  I'm happy with this purchase.The box is prominently labeled "GLASS" and seems solid enough to protect the contents unless someone deliberately abuses it. Inside, each bottle was separated by foam strips.

These are surprisingly good crackers.  I took a chance on them even though I had to buy 12 boxes at once just to try them.  They have a very light taste to them, slightly sweet and slightly nutty.  The little squares are tender but do not break easily and are the perfect size for dipping and parties.

Bee playing cards are some of the best playing cards you can get for general use.  They have a nice finish, are not too slick out of the box, and are very durable.  I got this six-pack to give away to people who play cards but were not familiar with this brand as small tokens of friendship.  All were very pleased with them.

These are a very comfortable and supportive running shoe.  I use them for running on roads/sidewalks and have found them to be very durable.  I have generally run for up to 2 hours in these shoes with issues after several dozen uses.  I have also received numerous compliments on their attractive design, unlike other Pearl Izumis' which are often too bold and brash in their color schemes for many people.  The laces on this particular style have reflective silver thread running through them which, although not a deal breaker, is a pleasant bonus.

This is an all around great entry-level color printer.  It is easy to set up and easy to use.  It only took a few minutes.  The directions were very clear and simple to follow.  Its wireless capabilities have worked flawlessly so far, approximately 50 times altogether using an iPhone and MacBook.  The printer has a nice, well thought out, sleek design.  It fits nicely on a desk corner.  The touch screen menu is a definite plus and prints are a great quality.

This is a delicious treat. It does not use the standard, somewhat chalky or waxy, chocolate sold by Nestle under its own name in the United States.  Instead, the chocolate in these treats is a creamy milk chocolate. You can hardly taste the pistachios, however, they do provide a good crunchy sensation that adds to the experience of eating the chocolate. Each bar is conveniently made so you can break it into four bite size squares. The inner wrapping for each bar is gold foil, which adds a little flair and a touch of class to the overall presentation.

I was shocked at the numerous compliments I got the first day I wore this watch. The gold and silver fit nicely with any light colored clothing and stand out nicely with a black jacket.It feels great on your wrist. Not too sleek and not too bulky. It was very easy to get comfortable with and feels very masculine when you're wearing it. I could easily wear this watch every day.  For the price I don't think it can be beat.

This is a good, basic shampoo but it does not give my hair the lightness that I like, and get, from some other shampoos.  The lightness I get from other shampoos allows my hair to fall naturally into place after lightly combing it.  After using this shampoo my hair does not fall naturally into place and is somewhat stiff.  I do not usually use a conditioner with this shampoo or other shampoos.  I have fine hair and I generally keep it short.

Exquisite is the only way to describe this heavenly chocolate, which I have had before.  The taste is divine and sublime. A Swiss treat that cannot be beat.  The hazelnuts in these bars do not detract from the taste of the chocolate but they do not really add anything to it either.  I would recommend getting just the milk chocolate bars without the hazelnuts as this allows you to savor the smoothness of the chocolate.

Kingdom of Rock picks up where its predecessor, "Freefall" by Magnus Karlsson, left off.  That is to say this is another excellent collaboration of great songs, great musicians, and great guest vocalists that may be even better than the "Freefall" album.  Karlsson takes credit on the album for all of the songwriting, guitars (lead and bass), and keyboards.  Karlsson also takes production credit but the album is mixed and mastered by Jacob Hansen.  Karlsson sings on two tracks.  The other vocalists are the incredible Jorn Lande, who sets the tempo for the album on the opening track, which is also the title track, and which hearkens back to some of his best solo work on "Spirit Black".  The other guest vocalists are Jakob Samuel of the Poodles, Joe Lynn Turner, Tony Martin, David Readman, Rick Altzi, Tony Harnell, Harry Hess, and Rebecca de la Motte.  The songs do not all sound the same but appear to be crafted by Karlsson to utilize the strengths of each of the vocalists, including himself.  Bottom line:  This is a must have album for fans of melodic rock who don't mind a tinge of metal or power metal in the mix.

Burberry Touch is a classic scent.  It has been around for over a decade.  I would generally consider this to be more of a daytime fragrance for use in temperate weather, when it is not particularly hot or cold, say in the upper-60s°F to low-70s°F. It has mixed overtones of spicy and fruity notes.  The opening notes are citrus and floral, the primary mid notes are spice (nutmeg) and cedar, and the low notes are musky (tonka beans) and woody (vetiver).  The floral overtones soften the scent and the citrus overtones give it some sweetness that may not be for everyone but I would consider it to be a fairly good scent overall.

These are very tasty and handy to have around as a snack or meal supplement.  Nevertheless the quality of these bars has gone down in my experience over the last year or so.  A good, or rather unacceptable, percentage of these bars taste very stale and it is almost like eating tree bark.  This problem became more pronounced when the company switched from packaging these bars in aluminum foil to plastic. Previously, you would occasionally get an aluminum foil package that was not sealed properly and the contents would be stale. Now, the frequency of my getting stale bars has at least tripled and there is no indication that the package was not sealed properly, though it is possible there could be a pinhole leak in the package that is not visible to the naked eye.

This is a nice pocket comb that may or may not stand the test of time as it seems a little brittle to keep in your back pocket. The teeth on the comb are shorter than those on the average pocket comb but they seem to perform well in any event.  Overall, a very classy looking and well made product that deserves at least a 4-star rating right out of the box.

I've been an avid user of Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom for a few years now but decided to take this opportunity to try Cyberlink PhotoDirector 7 Ultra. I must say, I'm very impressed. I was a bit worried that I would have to learn a new layout as well as manage a new workflow and that was definitely not the case.PhotoDirector is a perfect mix between Adobe Lightroom and a light version of Photoshop. With tools like the body shaper and background remover, PhotoDirector takes these tasks that used to be a bit of a process in Photoshop and makes them a simple two or three steps.I shoot a lot of action sports as well as portraits so I'm usually bringing a good couple hundred photos into my photo editor at a time. PhotoDirector has the manageability and workflow of multiple photo editing without the monthly cost of an Adobe Lightroom account.If you're looking for a good mix between Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom or a good start out program to learn photo editing, PhotoDirector would likely be a good fit for you.

I liked this album from start to finish the first time I heard it.  Very catchy tunes.  I did not listen to it for awhile and put it into my heavy rotation again for the last two weeks.  During this time I noticed a similarity between this album and The Knack's oeuvre that I did not take much notice of before but it is definitely an undercurrent throughout the entire album.  It also naturally has semblances of The Romantics' body of work as well but I now think the The Knack influence, or at least their type of style and sound, outweighs that of The Romantics.  Either way, if you like The Knack or The Romantics you should like this album.

The music and vocals on this album are technically proficient but it lacks the vibrancy, dynamism, and charm of her first two albums.  I noticed this the first time I heard this album and my view has not changed despite having heard it now dozens of times over the past year.  Why did I keep listening to it?  I really enjoyed her first two albums and I kept hoping I would warm up to the songs on this one and the album would grow on me.  No such luck.  The trio of musicians who backed her on the first two albums are gone.  Her father, Ed Ehrhardt, who contributed many strong, soulful guitar licks on her first two albums is sorely missed.  He's apparently been replaced with Cole Allen, not bad in his own right but his style is different from, and not as singular as, Ed Ehrhardt's.

These dividers are okay.  I purchased them because I liked the idea of an extra tab for a year end summary but for me this would be the only reason to buy them.  I prefer the Avery brand dividers which are currently available at the same price.  The Avery dividers seem to be of a higher quality and more durable.  Also, the color array on the Avery brand is more coherent while the color array on these dividers seems desperately random.

Great basketball shoe.  The Zoom inserts are immediately discernible when you first put them on and walk around in them.  The inside is roomy, especially in the toe box.  The red color really stands out. The only drawback is that the sole seems razor thin, so I worry a little bit about durability, but overall a great shoe.

Excellent bath tissue. Strong. Soft. Dissolves easily in water, so seems safe for septic tanks. Does not seem to have much lint.  Overall, far better than the Quilted Northern bath tissue used previously, which was my preferred brand.

Nice concept.  Poor execution.  This is a nice, rugged looking, weekly planner.  Unfortunately, the cover on the copy I received for review is defective.  It turns out that the cover is made of two pieces of paper glued together.  The top piece of paper of the cover is very thin, about 24lb weight, and looks like it is made out of metal.  Very bold.  The bottom piece is more substantial.  It is made out of plain cardboard stock, of about 100lb weight paper.  The problem is that, as soon as I opened the planner, the top part of the cover started separating from the bottom part of the cover by peeling off at the outer edges.  Just the process of using my thumb to push up the cover caused the top part of the cover to peel back. Before long the entire top portion of the cover will separate altogether from the bottom portion and fall off, leaving me with a tacky cover of plain cardboard stock spattered with innumerable remnants of slightly adhesive glue smears.

This is a well crafted melodic rock album. The first five songs are the best and then there is a bit of a drop off so I do not think it deserves a five-star rating at this point. Nevertheless, I find that the album overall grows on you a little bit after each listen.

This is a very well made jacket.  It fits well and has several well thought out features, such as the lining for the hand pockets.  It's been too hot to really test its ability to ward off cold but I have no reason to believe that it will not function well at least up to freezing temperatures.  It looks nice too which is always a bonus.

This is a good go to manual for those having difficulties using Windows 10.  The color coded sections and color screen shots for each step are quite useful. Sometimes the information, and steps, are pretty basic.  The book is really designed for Windows neophytes not those with some Windows experience but new to Windows 10.  I looked at competing how to manuals and this one seems to be the best.  The only drawback is that the publisher does not seem to offer any way to obtain automatic updates for new programming features put out by Microsoft as Windows 10 evolves.

The overall layout and design of this planner is very well done.  The orange highlights add a gentle flair to the pages without being overbearing or harsh.  There is a double-sided clear pocket page at the back of the planner that is very useful for temporarily storing receipts, tickets, etc.  The cover is very smooth, looks similar to leather, and has a nice faux leather feel to it.  The only drawbacks are from the manufacturing process.  The back cover of my planner had a tiny nub on it.  I thought this was just a piece of adhesive material that got stuck to the planner.  When I removed it, however, it was actually part of the back cover and there is now a small, discolored pit on the back cover.  The other problem is that my planner does not close properly.  You cannot close it using the back cover.  You must close it using the front cover only.  Also, you cannot close it using the front cover all by itself as it gets stuck.  You must first close the pages, front to back, and then you must tug the front cover up and over to close it.  Two steps when one should do; and the second step may eventually end up tearing the cover (but maybe not until after a hundred or more uses) at the stress points where the cover gets pulled up and pushed through the rings.

This first solo album by Fergie Frederiksen is very good.  There are a lot of fine guest musicians, including Ricky Phillips, Bruce Gowdy, Tim Pierce, Jason Schieff, Ron Wikso, and Neal Schon.  (All of these also appear on the eponymous Frederiksen/Phillips album.)  The album contains some outstanding, even quite beautiful songs, including the title song, "Equilibrium" (co-written by Fergie Frederiksen, Jim Peterik, and Ricky Phillips), and "Falling into Place".  But, overall, the album needs more oomph, more vitality.  It is too mellow or soft for me.  It lacks dynamism. It is more of an easy listening album than Fergie's other solo albums and his collaborative efforts with Ricky Phillips and Tommy Denander.  If you liked Toto's Isolation album, which featured Fergie on vocals, than you will probably like this one as well as in some ways it is better than the Toto album as Fergie's vocals are more expressive and upfront here (and he is the lead vocal on every track, unlike on the Isolation album).

Fergie Frederiksen is in fine vocal form here as he sings songs primarily written by Ricky Phillips.  (Phillips is given credit as the sole writer or as a co-writer on all of the songs.  Frederiksen is given credit as a co-writer on four of the songs.  There are eleven songs on the album, which are listed below.)  As a surprise bonus, Giuffria is credited a co-writer of the music, along with Frederiksen/Phillips, on one of the songs. David (Glen) Eiseley is even credited with background vocal on that track. The musicians on the other tracks, including Neal Schon on one track and Deen Castronovo on several others, are well respected and add some flair to the arrangements.The album overall is a pleasant collection of tunes that is more melodic, soulful, and uptempo than Fergie's album with Toto.  For melodic rock aficionados this is a must have.The tracks are: (1) Shot down, (2) Oh Diane, (3) How much longer, (4) Name of love, (5) You must be a liar ('cause you're unbelievable), (6) Baby Blue, (7) Captured, (8) Queen Bee, (9) Hopelessly lost, (10) Do you love her,  and (11) Long way around the world.

These are fairly good sparring/bag gloves.  They hit solid.  They are stiff and tight at first and it takes several good uses to really break them in.  All the padding, wicking material, and inner elastic work better than I thought.  The blue color is nice and bright but I personally prefer the limited edition in black and red.  The gloves provide some protection from injury but I always wrap my hands and wrists no matter what I wear or what I hit.

These are made of a good heavy duty material but do not fit well.  I received these gloves in the size I normally wear but they are hard to put on because they are too small.  The ends of the fingers are slightly pointed instead of rounded so you cannot fit your fingers in all the way to the end; because of this, and because the thickness, and tightness, of the glove decrease dexterity, it is difficult to pick things up with the tips of your fingers.

These are well made gloves for light duty use.  They fit well.  They are a little snug but not so much that dexterity is impaired.  They are thin but not so thin that they tear easily.  They go on and come off quite easily.  The only drawback is that the opening of the glove, which fits around the wrist, is a tad too big, making it loose and easier for things, liquids, etc., to accidentally enter the glove.

This is a well made, very thin, running shirt for cool weather.  The fit is neither too big nor too small.  The length is not too short.  The sleeves on the arms are not too short. The fit under the arms is fine.  The neck size is very spacious.  It is not restrictive at all.  The only down side for some people might be that when you sweat the sweat turns the sweaty portions of the shirt dark, but after drying it returns to its normal color.

This has a great sound for the price.  The speaker looks professional. It comes with a cable so you can hook it up to a laptop or computer that does not have Bluetooth.  What I do not like about the speaker is that it is too difficult to turn on and off.  You have to press the on/off button for three seconds to turn it on.  This is just too long to stand around and push down a button on such a simple device to turn it on.  It turns off with a single, hard press of the on/off button.  This is nice but the on/off button is almost flush with the body of the speaker, making it unnecessarily hard to use.  Also, the device does not turn itself off automatically after a certain period of time.  Battery life, just a few hours, is not optimal for a speaker of this size.  If you are concerned about price but not about size, I would suggest looking at the TDK TREK-360 with is currently heavily discounted to the same price range as this Lenovo speaker but the TDK has four speakers and a sub-woofer. I would consider the TDK TREK-360 to currently be the best value on the market in this price range, i.e., under eighty dollars.

This is a good running tank top that is nice looking but may be a little too thick and too heavy for some, particularly for serious workouts in hot weather.  The special mesh fabric on the sides and back is very airy but on the down side this material is not particularly smooth and just a tad on the rough side.  This roughness could be irritating to some people, especially if they like a tight fit for their tops.  The cut of the top under the arm is also a little high.

These are a good running shoe, very comfortable, and provide plenty of support.  I wear them both for running and casual wear with a pair of jeans.  I have received numerous unsolicited comments from both men and women that they are attractive and/or look comfortable.

This is a classy looking frame that I gave to someone as a gift to frame a poem that I also gave them.  The frame is made for 8.5 x 11 inch standard size paper.  The only hitch is that the borders of the frame take up some of that space so you have to make sure that whatever you want people to see is within the display area.  Also, this frame will not stand alone and does not contain an easel.  It is made to put on a wall.

These pills come in a softgel form.  They are easy to take and easy to digest.  The pills include both lutein, 40 mg, and zeaxanthin, 1,600 mcg.  The product is naturally made.  No synthetics.  And it is non-genetically modified.  The package contains several warnings on use, including that you should not take it if you are allergic to daisy-like flowers.  I started taking this supplement originally in a lower dosage, 40 mg and 800 mcg, to see if I suffered any adverse effects.  So far, so good, so I am now trying this higher dosage.  And again, so far, so good.  The ingredients in these pills are supposed to support general eye health.  (I think studies have shown that normal eyes retain 20 mg of lutein and 800 mcg of zeaxanthin but I do not know how often they are used up and need to be replenished.) There is some evidence, though apparently nothing definitive yet, that your eyes need these supplements to help prevent macular degeneration, a disease which usually occurs in people in their mid-sixties.  But by the time you get this disease it is realistically too late to take these supplements.  As there seems to be no harm in taking these supplements and they may actually do some good, I take them regularly.

This is a very well constructed connector.  The cable is very supple and flexible, making it easier to manipulate.  The cables on other brands I have tried were not very flexible at all, making them harder to use.  I also like the rounded top corners on the USB plug in.  I never thought this would make a difference until I got this one.  It just looks cleaner and sleeker than other brands which have squared corners.  The overall utility of this item was also a pleasant surprise.  This worked fine on both my iPhone and iPad with no issues, including connecting both to a Windows computer.  I have had other brands which, for unknown but annoying reasons, turned out to incompatible with a Windows computer.  (E.g., Do you trust this computer?  Clicked on, Yes. Connection nonetheless failed.  Do you trust this computer. Clicked again on, Yes. Connection failed again. Do you trust this computer? Clicked yet again on, Yes.  Connection failed yet again.  Do you trust this computer? Yes, but not this cable which then went into the trash.)

Forty years on and still rockin' strong!  This is Motorhead's 22nd studio album.  And this year marks the band's 40th year.  This is the reason, I guess, for the four XXXXs on the cover.  The cover also looks like some kind of war medal, maybe it represents the Medal of Valor for Mean and Lean Rock'n'Roll.  Anyway, this album is pretty similar to the last five studio albums, i.e., since Inferno, in that Cameron Webb produced this one and the last five.  And the major players are the same, Lemmy, Phil, and Mikkey, as they have been for the last 20 years.  In other words, the album does not disappoint.  A major surprise is the last cut, Sympathy with the Devil, which I thought would be sub-par but Mikkey Dee does some incredible drumming that kicks this song up a notch.  Phil's guitar work on this track is outstanding as well. The whole album is a pleasant surprise.

Excellent hair dryer.  Dries hair more quickly than most hair dryers.  Convenient in that it has three heat settings and two speed settings. It also includes interchangeable nozzles that are very useful and convenient for styling and straightening.  It includes a conditioning ring that you thread onto the dryer.  The conditioning ring contains oils that are apparently designed to be released as micro-conditioners to keep your hair conditioned as you dry it, i.e., to reduce dryness and frizziness.  Use of the conditioning ring, however, did not seem to make any noticeable difference.  The hair dryer by itself is pretty well designed and leaves hair shiny and sleek, with no breakage.  If you do use the conditioning ring then the oils will eventually run out and it will need to be replaced.  Replacement is recommended every three months.  I could not find any replacements for sale, perhaps because this is still a fairly new product and the replacements are just not yet on the market. Another convenience is that the back of the dryer pops off for easy cleaning of the filter.  Overall, a well designed product.

This space heater is very attractive and very well designed.  It heats a small room without effort and without a lot of noise.  Although it is marketed as a nursery heater, its many safety features are geared toward inquisitive toddlers not infants.  Moreover, it is not just for children.  It is a good all-around small heater that can be used in any room.  Like any space heater, I would be cautious in leaving it on in the high setting unattended for any significant period.

These are a truly delicious granola bar.  They are easy to eat while on the go:  They are neither too soft nor too hard; and, unlike other granola bars I have tried, these do not fall apart while you are eating them.  They are also quite filling.

I thought the design on these Post-its might be too bright or too bold but I took a chance and got them anyway.  I was pleasantly surprised to find the design is subtle, in the background, and does not interfere with writing anything on these notes.  These Post-its are a cut above the ordinary and add a bit of pizzazz to your work and your desk.
These are well made and a good value but I personally do not care for the second row of tabs to stick out more than the first row.  I find this completely unnecessary and goofy (i.e., dorky) looking.

These are very nice binder pockets.  I use them in standard size 8.5 x 11 notebooks as I think the 8.5 x 11 size binder pockets are a bit of overkill as I just need something to hold a couple of pens and pencils, a few business cards, and maybe some tape flags, depending.  I ordered several of these more than once.  Each time every one of them had that mysterious, vaguely offensive, smell to it that is so commonplace these days on vinyl products.  I solved this by spraying some cologne on a napkin and sealing the napkin inside the pocket.  This got rid of most of the smell, at least on the inside, and replaced it somewhat with the smell of the cologne. Only time will tell if the original smell from the factory will go away on its own.

Wow.  Great, quiet office vacuum.  My prior experience with using commercial vacuum cleaners is that they were loud and heavy.  This Hoover model is surprisingly light and not that loud compared to other models and brands I have used.  It has two speeds, high and low.  It defaults to low.  With just average use on office carpets I found no need to use the high speed.  The low speed had plenty of suction even though it wasn't that loud.  (I tend to mistakenly associate loudness with suction power in vacuums.)  My only misgiving is that it has no headlight.  It also has no attachments but that is not really an issue for me as I would only be using this to give a good vacuuming to high traffic areas.  The sample I receive for test purposes only came with one bag so you should get some replacement bags at the same time you get the vacuum.  Another good feature is that the extension cord that comes with the unit is not built into it but attaches to the rear so if  the cord gets worn out for any reason, or if you want to use a longer one, you can easily replace the original cord with a standard, preferably heavy duty, extension cord.

Dwight Yoakam is a great artist but there are no songs on this album that you cannot get elsewhere.  The first track, The Loco-Motion, is on Dwight's Used Records album. The other two songs, Population Me and No Such Thing, are on his album entitled Population: Me.  I think this EP was initially released after the Population: Me album and before the Dwight's Used Records album and likely served as a promo to sell both of those albums.  In any event, I would suggest just getting the entire Population: Me album rather than this EP.

These are a good value if you can get them for a few dollars each.  They are a basic binder so they are not extremely durable and the edges can crack open if you are not careful.  Nevertheless, I still prefer them to those of other manufacturers at the same price point.  The yellow color is not very bright but is a bit on the pale side, but that is what I wanted so I was not disappointed.
These are very tasty mini crackers.  They have a light buttery taste even though they are veggie crackers.  The only drawback for me is that, being mini, they are a little small.
These are delicious creme cookies.  They have a light coconut flavor that is neither underwhelming nor sickly sweet.

This bluetooth speaker is a great value.  I tested it in someone's studio apartment, which although a studio is large-sized for a studio.  The sound projected quite nicely and easily filled the room/apartment.  I found the sound to be better than either of the two small JBL bluetooth speakers I have but not as good as the two Denon Envaya (mini and original) bluetooth speakers that I own.  The separate portable charger that is included is a great idea and very convenient.  The only drawbacks, which almost pull the rating back to less than 4.5 stars, are that your phone has to be relatively close to the device for it to work and the speakerphone does not work well unless you are less than two feet from the device.

The legs on these shorts flare out a bit at the ends so they are wider than the rest of the leg.  They waist also runs about an inch smaller than the same size in two other models of Champion shorts that I own.  Other than that the printed pattern blue version that I got are pretty well made.

I like the stenographer style of these pads.  This way you can write on any page, front or back, from almost any angle, with either hand.  the paper is also well made, comes in a soothing color, and does not reflect glare, making it easy to read what you have written on it, especially if you write with a pencil.  Overall, a very well made and classy small note pad.

These soap bars give off a delicious vanilla scent.  So be prepared when you first get a package of these in the mail.  Other than the great scent, they are just like other Olay ultra moisture bars that come in different fragrances.

This is a beautiful and gracious napkin box.  It makes a great gift.  It does come with a small batch of matching napkins but the replacement napkins by Lenox are expensive and finding replacement napkins by anyone else in the right size is not always easy.

I own a Kniper bolt 71 12 200 cutter  that is very similar in size and cutting strength to this H.K. Porter model, 08090SMC.  Both the Kniper and the H.K. Porter models appear to be well made.  I did some comparison testing between the two and the Kniper model does cut more smoothly and cleanly.  For only three dollars more at the time of this review, the Kniper is well worth the extra expense compared to the H.K. Porter model. I do find the release latch somewhat easier to use on the H.K. Porter than on the Kniper.  But the opening spring on the H.K. Porter is weak and I have to push the device open manually with the handles to get the jaws wide enough to do anything.  This would quite irritating if you were using the H.K. Porter model for more than a few quick cuts per use.  The Kniper model claims to be made in Germany while the H.K. Porter model is made in China.  German quality is generally superior to Chinese quality for comparable products.  Also, the Kniper product comes with a lifetime guarantee so that shows some confidence by the manufacturer in the quality of their products, which are highly regarded in any event.

This has a good, light orange taste.  There is no unpleasant aftertaste but it does leave an orange flavor in your mouth with just a hint of sweetness.  Contains the usual Red Bull energy blend ingredients. Overall, a good zero calorie energy drink.

These are fairly hot.  They have jalapeños and other spicy ingredients.  They are not too hot for me but many people may be surprised at the heat they generate.  If you are looking for a mild black pepper flavored popcorn I highly recommend Skinny Pop Black Pepper popcorn.
These are quite tasty and have an excellent, extra crunchy texture.  Everyone I shared them with liked them as well.

This is a nice running singlet.  It is very lightweight and fits well.  My only complaint is that on the green version sweat transforms the nice bright green color into a very dark green hue. This is not a big problem for me as the sweat is just coming from my neck onto the chest area but it might be of some concern to others who may get sweaty in other areas.

These are outstanding running shoes.  The fit is somewhat small but overall is excellent.  The orange colors may seem super bright in but I have received several compliments on their looks and apparent comfort.  It is too bad Pearl Izumi stopped making this model as they perform very well.

This is an incredible bargain in the MP3 format. I already own all 3 CDs that make up this collection and each one is superb in its own right.  I do think one stands out above the rest but all of them are still great.  The extra tracks for each album also make this a must buy for anyone interested in this type of music.

This is an excellent headlamp, especially for the price.  I own several de.power flashlights in addition to this headlamp.  All are well made, competitively priced, and perform at or above expectations.
Not a bad popcorn but its taste is a little bland for me.  The popcorn is also somewhat dry.  I like Skinny Pop, Original, much better.

Classic Nelson album.  Nice production.  Great harmonies.  Excellent musicianship.  Well thought out songs. Favorite songs are the first, third, and eleventh tracks:  Hello Everybody, Invincible, and Bad for You.  If you like the style of previous Nelson albums, with the possible exception of "Because We Can" which has a countryesque feel to it, you will enjoy this album as well.  Only song I did not care for at first was the last track, Leave the Light On for Me, as it does not really fit with the rest of the songs but it's growing on me and will likely be a concert favorite.

Nice door lock. Nickel satin finish looks classy.  Easy to install.  Requires only a Phillips screwdriver if the door and door frame already have standard cutouts or you are replacing an existing door.  (Two sets of easy to understand instructions are included, one for doors with pre-existing cutouts and one for making the cutouts if you need them.)  Also no trouble lining up the screws while installing the second knob as you just basically snap the second knob in place.  This feature alone is quite a time and frustration saver.  Easy to use both entering and exiting if the door is not locked.  The lock itself is not secure.  There is no key for the lock.  The lock can be easily disabled if you are outside the door with a small coin or almost anything that you can fit into the groove where the keyhole would ordinarily be located.  The door is meant to be installed on doors that swing into a room.  Otherwise, you could get locked into the room if the door swings out but since you can easily override the lock that is not an insurmountable problem for most people.  The door knobs are a little bigger than standard size knobs.  This is probably to help implement the push pull feature.

This is an excellent shipping tape, superior to many other brands I have used in the past.  As soon as I got this tape I put it to the test to  securely box several items I happened to need to return.  The width of the tape is very useful.  It does eliminate the need to use a double row of tape in most instances.  (I confess that I sometimes overtape my packages but better too much tape than not enough.)  The dispenser that comes with the tape is also very easy to use.  I would not consider this to be a universal tape for all shipping purposes as it is not reinforced but for basic shipping this is a great tape to use.

I got this to lug my HP 17.3 inch laptop around in.  I was previously using a Case Logic briefcase like bag for the same purpose.  I prefer using the briefcase style bag whenever I have to transport my large laptop.  The backpack looks a little hipper than the brief bag but the brief bag is sturdier.  The handle on the backpack is just too slight for its intended use.  A sturdier, more robust handle is needed to comfortably carry around a 17.3 inch laptop with all its accoutrements.  The same thing is true for the backpack straps.  They are not quite sturdy enough for me and do not provide sufficient support when the backpack is fully loaded.  Moreover, there is no small outside pocket to stuff those little things into that you might need in a hurry but don't want to get lost inside the backpack.  Finally, I thought the lime green color accents looked fine online but when I received the backpack I did not care for this coloring at all.  For me the color is too weak, too washed out, too childish.  Cautionary note:  If you do get the briefcase style bag it also has some flaws.  The handle on it seems too weak as well but it certainly far superior to the one on this backpack.  In addition, the clips on the shoulder strap for the brief bag are made of hard, brittle plastic and in my experience these inevitable fail, usually sooner rather than later.  I purchased a Klein shoulder strap separately, which has much better padding and metal clips.  This shoulder strap has worked well for a couple of years now without any problems.

These are well-made shipping labels.  I use them for returns.  They print easily and clearly.  The only problem is that the box they come is not sturdy enough to hold the weight of all the sheets of labels in the box.  My box arrived torn in two places and the sticker on the reclosable flap was also torn off and the flap damaged.  (The shipping box was not damaged.)  This means I either spend several minutes repairing the box so everything does not fall out when I pick it up or I get another box to put the labels in.  I chose to use an empty letterhead box I just happened to have available.

This is an absolutely fascinating book on how business works, although a more accurate title would be: How Businesses Work In Today's Global Marketplace.  This is because there is a lot more information than just the nuts and bolts of how a business works.  There are also many explanations and examples of how, in today's world, factors outside what one would normally consider the parameters of a business affect and impact that business.  This includes the role of social, environmental, and other concerns that a company must often take into account in today's marketplace.  Factors that were pretty much non-existent in many respects just 20 years ago. A real eye-opener for the novitiate.

I really like this trimmer.  It is just what I needed.  I use it to edge trim some ivy and this trims it in no time.  It is not too heavy, 10 pounds or less, to lug around for the 5-10 minutes it takes to get this done.  The battery does not seem to last much longer than two uses without needing a recharge, so it is not ideal for any big jobs that might take over about a half hour to complete.  It has a variable speed trigger, which takes a little getting used to, and naturally the faster the machine operates (i.e., the more power you use) the faster the battery drains.  It has a self-feeding line -- awesome! -- and the handle is adjustable, and easily so.  This sure beats dragging a gas-powered trimmer around or fiddling with a cumbersome electrical cord. This does require a little assembly when you first get it but it is quite easy, only requires a standard no. 2 Phillips screwdriver, and takes just a couple of minutes.  (There is also a Black and Decker string trimmer assembly video on YouTube if you do need help.)

This is a rather good outing by FM (U.K.).  The first four tracks are new (with track number one an instrumental), followed by six live songs, and ending with an extended remix of one of the new tracks.  Steve Overland (an original member) is on lead vocals, and if you know his track record you know he is not likely to disappoint.

The hype for this album is true: It really is a melodic rock masterpiece. I would not go so far yet as name it an instant classic but I do not see how anyone who enjoyed the first Kiske - Somerville collaborative effort would not enjoy this one as well. The vocal artistry of these two singers is amazing.  I was skeptical when the first album came out, not knowing what to expect but trusting that it could not be that bad considering who was involved, Kiske, Sommerville, Sinner, Karlsson, and my trust was rewarded and my skepticism vanished upon my first listen.  This time around I knew what to expect and was not disappointed. Enjoy.
